### /DEMOS/ ##################################################################

### /DEMOS/0-9 ###############################################################

/DEMOS/0-9/128_Byte_Blues_BASIC.sid
COMMENT: "When I first had a look at the 512b/1k Tiny SID compo, I thought it'd
         be a great way to get back into doing some assembly language on the
         C=64 (which I haven't done for a long time). I spent a fair amount of
         time thinking of the best way to reduce the size and decided that one
         of the best ways would be to really challenge myself and to squeeze
         some music out of 128 bytes just for fun.
         I really wanted to feature the nature of the C=64, so I thought about
         several ways to best store the note and instrument data. After a few
         sketches, I found that I seemed to be wasting a lot of space trying to
         store both the note and duration data, so I decided that the best way
         would be to derive the notes and durations directly from the C=64
         memory and just index into a basic blues scale and generate some
         music. It took a bit of playing around with techniques, but I found
         that utilizing individual bits to step up or down within the scale
         generated the most musical results. Somewhat of a 1-bit DPCM technique
         except for successive music notes in a scale instead of successive
         samples. So, the code basically cycles through the bits which are
         displayed in the screen memory and uses them to generate the notes.
         The note duration is set by combining the jiffy clock and the cursor
         countdown to give some flex to the tempo. I found that staying in one
         note sequence was boring, so I made it step through two blues scales.
         I tried to squeeze out more space by removing the low byte of the
         frequency but found that it either made the music too out of tune or
         too high in pitch. I also attempted to add a second voice, but ran out
         of space. I really liked the idea of adding something to watch while
         it's playing, so the colours change as it is reading through the bytes
         of screen memory. Rolling the bits of screen memory had the additional
         benefit that the bytes would return to their original form after
         passing over them eight times when the sequence repeats. Since the
         tempo is partially derived from the cursor blink, it is possible to
         change the tempo while moving the cursor. The sequence of notes can
         also be modified by typing in the upper portion of the screen.
         It should sound fine on any C=64 (NTSC/PAL), SID (6581/8580) or good
         emulator (VICE, PowerPC etc..). I've had great fun working on this
         piece and hope others have fun listening and playing around with it as
         well." (Freaky DNA)

/DEMOS/0-9/3LUX_Intro.sid
  TITLE: iamback [from the Amiga SoundTracker module]
 ARTIST: Morten Henriksen (Sky)

/DEMOS/0-9/3_Oversample.sid

 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel

         added and with voice 1 largely muted.

### /DEMOS/Commodore #########################################################

/DEMOS/Commodore/
COMMENT: This directory contains demotunes from the original 1982 Commodore
         demo disk. The first tunes on the C64!

/DEMOS/Commodore/C_Prog_Ref_Guide_example_02_BASIC.sid
COMMENT: This tune takes 33 seconds to start, just like the corresponding
         BASIC program. The tune was later used in the infamous game
         Stroker 64, playing at double speed.

/DEMOS/Commodore/C_Prog_Ref_Guide_example_05_BASIC.sid
  TITLE: The Entertainer
 ARTIST: Scott Joplin

(#1)
  TITLE: In Dulci Jubilo
 ARTIST: Traditional
(#2)
  TITLE: One Horse Open Sleigh
 ARTIST: James Lord Pierpont
(#3)
  TITLE: Stille Nacht! Heilige Nacht!
 ARTIST: Joseph Mohr (lyrics), Franz Xaver Gruber (music)
COMMENT: A Christmas song also known as "Silent Night".
(#4)
  TITLE: Rudolph The Red Nosed Reindeer
 ARTIST: Johnny Marks
(#5)
  TITLE: Gloria in Excelsis Deo
 ARTIST: French Carol
COMMENT: Also known as "Angels We Have Heard on High".
(#6)
  TITLE: Frosty The Snowman
 ARTIST: Steve Nelson and Walter E. "Jack" Rollins
(#7)
  TITLE: Two-Part Invention No. 13, in A minor (BWV 784)
 ARTIST: Johann Sebastian Bach

/DEMOS/S-Z/Tristar_Intro.sid
  TITLE: <?> [from the Amiga crack intro to Tetris/Tristar]
 ARTIST: Michael A. Volz (MCP of Tristar)
COMMENT: "This song was made by a friend of mine in 1989. He was an Amiga guy
         and only had borrowed my C64 for a few days. As he only could compose
         in SoundTracker on Amiga, on C64 he used Chris Hülsbeck's Sound Monitor
         (actually there wasn't much else to compose with back then AFAIR). His
         handle was E.C.D., real name Markus Jentsch." (Thunderblade)

/GAMES/A-F/Catalypse.sid
COMMENT: Andrea Carboni, the programmer of the game, said in an interview: "I
         never met Michael Tschoegl, who was contacted by Genias directly. The
         first music disk was completely broken when it arrived, so I recovered
         all that I could (almost) hear and composed the full tunes from the
         beginning. When I got the second disk, I realised that the tunes I
         modified, were not composed for the game parts I used them in.
         Moreover, they told me that my compositions were a lot better than
         his!!! Only the final track, the one that plays during the end titles
         (tune #6), remained untouched. Furthermore, I didn't write about this
         on the title screen, since actually the basic sound was created by
         Michael anyway." (info comes from an interview at www.retrogaming.it)
(#1)
COMMENT: Almost the same as /GAMES/M-R/Neverending_Story_II.sid, Tune #2.
(#3)
  TITLE: Necronom Intro [from the Amiga game]
 ARTIST: Michael Tschögl
(#4)
COMMENT: Composed by Andrea Pompili. He said in an interview: "The groove in
         the ingame tune was composed by me, and it's based upon a short piece
         I used to play during the introduction of my band."
(#5)
  TITLE: Necronom Main [from the Amiga game]
 ARTIST: Michael Tschögl
(#6)
  TITLE: Necronom Ingame-2 [from the Amiga game] (0:50-1:36)
 ARTIST: Michael Tschögl

/GAMES/A-F/Catalypse_speech.sid
COMMENT: The speech says: "Earth, a desolate land witness of an epic battle.
         Alone against death, your Varkan fighter is braving the nightmare.
         The legend is in your hands.". the voice belongs to Andrea Pompili.

         this music. The music is from the arcade game.

/GAMES/M-R/Manic_Miner.sid
COMMENT: "It was me who created the music for Manic Miner on the C64 - being a
         well known tune I simple popped down to the local music shop and
         bought the sheet music and from there it was a doddle. You may notice
         that there are 4 different versions of the same tune. This was because
         we couldn't decide whether to create a 'clean' version of the tune or
         an auto of tune version to more closely copy the Spectrum version.
         We opted for a selection!" (Chris Lancaster)
(#1)
  TITLE: An der schönen blauen Donau (Blue Danube)
 ARTIST: Johann Strauß
(#2)
  TITLE: In the Hall of the Mountain King [from Peer Gynt]
 ARTIST: Edvard Grieg

         thought was a traditional folksong.

/GAMES/S-Z/Saucer_Attack.sid
  TITLE: God Save the King/Queen (The National Anthem of the U.K.)
 ARTIST: Traditional
COMMENT: This song is known as "America" (or "My Country 'Tis Of Thee") in the
         USA, which has the same melody as "God Save the ..." but with different
         lyrics.  This explains why the tune is used when the UFO in the game
         intro attacks Washington, D.C.

COMMENT: This anthem is traditional and possibly one of the most known national

         ranging from the 1740s to the present day.

 ARTIST: Unknown
COMMENT: The origins of this song are unknown, documents date back to 1761
         where the song appears as "La Marcha Granadera" (March of the
         Grenadiers), already then with the mention "unknown author".

### /MUSICIANS/0-9/20CC/Paul_Falco ###########################################

/MUSICIANS/0-9/20CC/Paul_Falco/Dutch_Breeze_Mix-E-Load.sid
  TITLE: Canon in D major
 ARTIST: Johann Pachelbel
COMMENT: This rip plays a random selection of drums, bass, fx and lead
         which are selected in the demo.
         The randomness starts after the 0:16 mark.
         "It was Falco Paul's idea to base this on Johann Pachelbel's
         Canon" (DeeKay)

/MUSICIANS/0-9/20CC/Paul_Falco/Lambada.sid
  TITLE: Lambada
 ARTIST: Kaoma

/MUSICIANS/0-9/20CC/Paul_Falco/Spijkerhoek_3.sid

/MUSICIANS/0-9/20CC/van_Santen_Edwin/Vlindertjes.sid
COMMENT: This is a remix of /MUSICIANS/M/Mueller_Markus/Coco_Intro.sid
         In a demo by Edwin van Santen, which he released about two years after
         Coco Intro was made popular in the Papillion's crack intro, he claims
         that he in fact composed the music. This demo contained a new version
         of the tune (this sid). He explains how he had made the music two
         years earlier on some composer like Soundmonitor or something similar.
         While at a copyparty, someone supposedly stole his music disk which
         had the tune on it. This was his only copy of the tune. About two
         months later, the tune appeared on a Papillions' intro and no credit
         was given to van Santen. See /MUSICIANS/M/Mueller_Markus/Coco_Intro.sid
         for more details.
  TITLE: Coco Intro
 ARTIST: Markus Müller

         computers such as the Sinclair Spectrum and Amstrad CPC.

         game was chosen instead (I was unaware that he was even in the frame).
         I would have had to convert this to the BBC if it had been chosen.
         Quite proud of this musically." (Chris Abbott)

### /MUSICIANS/A/Ace64 #######################################################

/MUSICIANS/A/Ace64/
COMMENT: Ace64, an Italian C64 user, had composed tons of SID tunes during the
         "golden days", but never released them.  Luca/FIRE was able to
         obtain all of Ace64's tunes from the disks that stood the test of
         time.

/MUSICIANS/A/Ace64/Capitan_Harlock.sid
  TITLE: Capitan Harlock
 ARTIST: L. Albertelli - V. Tempera, performed by La Banda dei Bucanieri
COMMENT: This song is the Italian title song for the Japanese cartoon series
         "Uchu Kaizoku Captain Harlock" (translated from Japanese: "Space
         Pirate Captain Harlock").

/MUSICIANS/A/Ace64/Daitarn_III.sid
  TITLE: Daitarn III
 ARTIST: L. Albertelli - V. Tempera, performed by I Micronauti
COMMENT: This song is the Italian title song for the Japanese cartoon series
         "Muteki Kojin Daiturn 3" (translated from Japanese: "Daiturn 3 the
         Invincible Steel Man").

/MUSICIANS/A/Ace64/Dragons_Lair_II_Level_1.sid
  TITLE: Dragon's Lair II, Tune #2
 ARTIST: Rob Hubbard

/MUSICIANS/A/Ace64/Fhey_Area.sid
  TITLE: <?> [from the SEGA MegaCD game Seireishin Seiki Fhey Area]
 ARTIST: Motoi Sakuraba

/MUSICIANS/A/Ace64/Fur_Elise.sid
  TITLE: Für Elise
 ARTIST: Ludwig van Beethoven

/MUSICIANS/A/Ace64/Goldrake.sid
  TITLE: Goldrake
 ARTIST: L. Albertelli - V. Tempera - M. Luca, performed by Michel Tadini
COMMENT: This song is the Italian title song for the Japanese cartoon series
         "Ufo Robot Grendizer", known in Italy as "Atlas UFO robot Goldrake".

/MUSICIANS/A/Ace64/Harlock_BGM.sid
  TITLE: Overture - A Boundless Expanse of Space-Water
 ARTIST: Seiji Yokoyama
COMMENT: This song is a BGM from the Japanese cartoon series
         "Uchu Kaizoku Captain Harlock" (translated from Japanese: "Space
         Pirate Captain Harlock").

/MUSICIANS/A/Ace64/Material_Girl.sid
  TITLE: Material Girl [from Like a Virgin]
 ARTIST: Madonna

/MUSICIANS/A/Ace64/Mompracem.sid
  TITLE: Mompracem
 ARTIST: Oliver Onions
COMMENT: From the Italian TV serial "Sandokan".

/MUSICIANS/A/Ace64/Rendez_Vous_4.sid
  TITLE: Fourth Rendez-Vous [from Rendez-Vous]
 ARTIST: Jean Michel Jarre

/MUSICIANS/A/Ace64/Sentinel.sid
  TITLE: Sentinel [from Tubular Bells II]

COMMENT: Composed in 1995, released in 1997.

/MUSICIANS/A/Agemixer/Audio_Man_in-game_tune_2.sid
COMMENT: This is the original version of the tune. The version from "Royal
         Arte" demo has a specific playroutine and sounds a little different.
         Composed around 1995-1999, released in 2001.

/MUSICIANS/A/Agemixer/Audio_Man_the_end.sid
COMMENT: Composed in 1995, released in 2003.

/MUSICIANS/A/Agemixer/Azmagutah_6581.sid
COMMENT: Agemixer made two versions of this tune, so that the tune would sound
         exactly the same if the right SID chip was used.
         This is the 6581 SID chip version.

/MUSICIANS/A/Agemixer/Azmagutah_8580.sid
COMMENT: Agemixer made two versions of this tune, so that the tune would sound
         exactly the same if the right SID chip was used.
         This is the 8580 SID chip version.

/MUSICIANS/A/Agemixer/Breath_of_Fire.sid
COMMENT: The demo "Album of the Year", in which this tune was first released,
         mistitled the tune "Birth of Fire" by accident.

COMMENT: "Another ugly test tune. Someone told me he likes a JCH style and
         JCH does great tunes, so why shouldn't I try the JCH style? The only
         purpose of this tune is to show the capabilities of the Megasound
         music editor." (AY)

  TITLE: Kemiaa

COMMENT: "'Kummatti' was actually a dark, tedious and little part of the town

         sarcasm..." (AY)

 ARTIST: FPI Project

/MUSICIANS/A/Agemixer/Lion_King.sid

 ARTIST: Carmen Twillie
COMMENT: There are two versions of this song used in the movie, one by
         Elton John and the other by Twillie.  Agemixer is covering
         Twillie's version which is heard at the start of the movie.

         category).

/MUSICIANS/A/Agemixer/National_Park_jonga_mix.sid
COMMENT: "This is one theme of our jonga live music show at Kaustinen Folk
         music festival.  The persons playing were:
         Petri Ala-Louesniemi: Hungarian Moon harp with Jonga reverb
         Anton Bruhin: Moon harps, jews harp
         Ari Yliaho: telescope digeridoo
         Unknown band visitor: talking drum". (AY)

COMMENT: This sid has won the Core 2001 music competition.

/MUSICIANS/A/Agemixer/Patakakkonen.sid
  TITLE: Finnish Whistler
 ARTIST: Roger Whittaker
COMMENT: "A Finnish cooking show on TV, originally an old Finnish folk song
         whistled by many a chef. The original tune is a legend itself... The
         tune was made just for fun while I was talking with Janne Suni
         (Tempest/Damage) on the phone. We laughed on the floor for this
         comical melody while composing it... Sorry, no recipes here! (Later on
         the tune was released with Snacks #1 infofile.)" (AY)

### /MUSICIANS/A/Akadem ######################################################

/MUSICIANS/A/Akadem/Brahms.sid
  TITLE: Hungarian Dance No. 5 in F# minor: Allegro - Vivace
 ARTIST: Johannes Brahms
COMMENT: The most famous of Brahms' Hungarian Dances, was actually based on the
         'csárdás' by Béla Kéler titled "Bártfai emlék" which Brahms mistakenly
         thought was a traditional folksong.

### /MUSICIANS/A/Almered_Per #################################################

/MUSICIANS/A/Almered_Per/
COMMENT: Comments by Per Almered are denoted (PA).

/MUSICIANS/A/Almered_Per/DDND_Short.sid
COMMENT: Based on one of Per's XM modules, "Death does not discriminate".

/MUSICIANS/A/Almered_Per/Fatale.sid
  TITLE: Fatale [from the Atari FST module]
 ARTIST: Per Almered
COMMENT: Conversion of his own tune: "I couldn't resist the challenge of
         converting an 8-channel mod to a 3-channel C64 song. Can you blame me?
         (Oh, you can? Well, but, I... [ouch!])" (PA)

/MUSICIANS/A/Almered_Per/Hemingway.sid
COMMENT: "Finally getting to grips with JCH's editor and the way it handles
         arpeggios, I put together this little tune. As Tomas Danko JR (one of
         the many deservedly legendary C64 musicians I've had the pleasure of
         talking to) pointed out: 'It's 'Rock me Amadeus!'. 8-)" (PA)

/MUSICIANS/A/Almered_Per/Nothing_Compares_2_U.sid
  TITLE: Nothing Compares 2 U
 ARTIST: Sinéad O'Connor
COMMENT: "Not much to say about this one, really, except it's supposed to sound
         this way, really. Used as some sort of joke in the "note-file" for
         Talk." (PA)

/MUSICIANS/A/Almered_Per/Sub.sid
COMMENT: "Just for fun, I put together 3 or 4 small songs for a computer game,
         but they were never used in the final release. I liked one of the
         songs so much I thought it deserved a C64 rendition. The filtered bass
         and hihats came as a nice surprise when I finally got around to
         listening to it outside of the C64-emulator. 8-)" (PA)

/MUSICIANS/A/Almered_Per/Telephone_Call.sid
  TITLE: The Telephone Call [from Electric Cafe]
 ARTIST: Kraftwerk
COMMENT: "After weeks of searching, I finally found a C64 music editor that I
         liked. This Kraftwerk cover is the first song I finished in it. I had
         lots of fun [NOT!] doing those silly phone-beeps." (PA)

/MUSICIANS/A/Almered_Per/Under_Norrskenet.sid
  TITLE: Under Norrskenet [from Nordman]
 ARTIST: Nordman
COMMENT: "Here's another cover, this time of Swedish group Nordman's song
         'Under norrskenet'. I competed with it at Hype '97, and it placed
         third, which is ok, considering all the other entries were xm's or
         mod's." (PA)

/MUSICIANS/A/Almered_Per/Van_Gogh.sid
COMMENT: "This is the song used in Talk, my first (and probably, but not
         hopefully) last C64-demo. It's written to fit into the demo, although
         some of the synchronized effects originally intended never fit into
         the memory of the C64... 8-(" (PA)

### /MUSICIANS/A/Amadeus_Attic ###############################################

/MUSICIANS/A/Amadeus_Attic/Amigos.sid

  TITLE: Future Generation
 ARTIST: Laserdance

 ARTIST: Bronski Beat

 ARTIST: Lipps Inc.

  TITLE: Dom w dolinie mgiel [from E=mc2]
 ARTIST: Marek Bilinski

  TITLE: Visitors
 ARTIST: Koto

/MUSICIANS/A/Amadeus_Attic/Trance_Mix.sid
  TITLE: Living on Video [from Living on Video] (0:00-1:37)
 ARTIST: Trans-X

/MUSICIANS/A/Amadeus_Attic/Ucieczka_z_Tropiku_1.sid
  TITLE: Ucieczka z tropiku [from Ucieczka Do Tropiku]
 ARTIST: Marek Bilinski
COMMENT: The title translates from Polish as "Escape from the tropic zone".
         Marek Bilinski was some kind of a Polish J.M.Jarre, and had a string
         of instrumental hits back in the 80's.

/MUSICIANS/A/Amadeus_Attic/Ucieczka_z_Tropiku_2.sid
  TITLE: Ucieczka z tropiku [from Ucieczka Do Tropiku]
 ARTIST: Marek Bilinski
COMMENT: The title translates from Polish as "Escape from the tropic zone".
         Marek Bilinski was some kind of a Polish J.M.Jarre, and had a string
         of instrumental hits back in the 80's.

/MUSICIANS/A/Amadeus_Attic/Visitors.sid
  TITLE: Visitors
 ARTIST: Koto
COMMENT: Heavily remixed.

### /MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John ###################################################

/MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/
COMMENT: John Ames' own comments are denoted (JA).

/MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/Basket_Case.sid
  TITLE: Basket Case [from Dookie]
 ARTIST: Green Day

/MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/Castle_of_Zokor_Step_Carefully.sid
COMMENT: "Another song from the game I'm designing, 'Castle of Zokor.' This is
         the background music for the second floor of the castle." (JA)

/MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/Chrono_Trigger-Battle.sid
  TITLE: Battle 1 [from the SNES game Chrono Trigger]
 ARTIST: Yasunori Mitsuda
COMMENT: "Chrono Trigger, in my opinion, ties with GoldenSun for Best
          RPG of all time. One of the largest reasons is the music. This
          is my version of the battle theme from Chrono Trigger.
          Unfortunately, I had to cut out the drum track from part of
          the song to make room for the marimba part. (It wouldn't have
          worked to mix them, the drum track is too intense.) Oh well,
          the rest of the song turned out nice." (JA)

/MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/Chrono_Trigger-Battle_2.sid
  TITLE: Battle 2 [from the SNES game Chrono Trigger]
 ARTIST: Yasunori Mitsuda
COMMENT: "This is a battle theme from the Chrono Trigger Demo that never made
         it into the final game. Pity, too." (JA)

/MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/Crystal_Cities.sid
COMMENT: "A SID version of the soundtrack from a PC game, 'Crystal Cities.'"
         (JA)
(#1)
  TITLE: Title Theme [from the PC game Crystal Cities]
 ARTIST: ZZFreak
(#2)
  TITLE: Ship Theme [from the PC game Crystal Cities]
 ARTIST: ZZFreak
(#3)
  TITLE: City Theme [from the PC game Crystal Cities]
 ARTIST: ZZFreak
(#4)
  TITLE: Dungeon Theme [from the PC game Crystal Cities]
 ARTIST: ZZFreak

/MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/Demon_Stomp.sid
COMMENT: This tune was created for a "C64 Fantasy Shooter" by John Ames. See
         Glacier_Dance.sid, Magma_Rumble.sid, Mountain_Climber.sid,
         Necromancers_Crypt.sid, Odell_Mermaid.sid, Transmigrator.sid, and
         Xenarthus.sid for more tunes created for this project.
         "This project never really got off the ground, but I did do most of
         the soundtrack for it. Maybe I'll pick it up again at some point, but
         until then, here it is." (JA)
         "This was the final boss theme. It's all right, but not a very good
         final boss theme." (JA)

/MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/Final_Fantasy-Battle_Medley.sid
COMMENT: "A back-to-back playing of the battle themes from Final Fantasy 1-6,
         plus the individual themes." (JA)
(#1)
COMMENT: Battle Medley (from Final Fantasy 1-6).
(#2)
  TITLE: Battle Theme [from the NES game Final Fantasy]
 ARTIST: Nobuo Uematsu

 ARTIST: Nobuo Uematsu

  TITLE: Battle Theme [from the SNES game Final Fantasy VI]

         This is the overworld map theme from Final Fantasy IV. (or II in the
         US.)" (JA)

  TITLE: Battle with Gilgamesh [from the SNES game Final Fantasy V]
 ARTIST: Nobuo Uematsu

/MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/Glacier_Dance.sid
COMMENT: "Oh my God do I love how this song turned out. And yes, it's in 12/8,
         I'm weird like that." (JA)
         See /MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/Demon_Stomp.sid for more comments on this.

/MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/Jill_of_the_Jungle.sid
COMMENT: "This is the (almost) complete soundtrack from Epic Megagames' great
         puzzle/action game 'Jill of the Jungle.' It has some of my favorite
         OPL3 music in it, so naturally I did a SID mix. The one song missing
         is "It," the ending theme. This is because the timing was so totally
         screwed up that I couldn't make head or tail of it. Oh well. BTW, the
         song names here are the filenames minus the .ddt extension. P.S. If
         anyone wants to attempt a C=64 port of Jill (not outside the realm of
         possibility, in my opinion,) feel free to use this. The sample channel
         could be used for playing the game sounds." (JA)
(#1)
  TITLE: Funky [from the PC game Jill of the Jungle]
 ARTIST: Dan Froelich
(#2)
  TITLE: Dan [from the PC game Jill of the Jungle]
 ARTIST: Dan Froelich
(#3)
  TITLE: Spiders [from the PC game Jill of the Jungle]
 ARTIST: Dan Froelich
(#4)
  TITLE: Stealth [from the PC game Jill of the Jungle]
 ARTIST: Dan Froelich
(#5)
  TITLE: Zeppelin [from the PC game Jill of the Jungle]
 ARTIST: Dan Froelich
(#6)
  TITLE: Ominous [from the PC game Jill of the Jungle]
 ARTIST: Dan Froelich
(#7)
  TITLE: Jupiter [from the PC game Jill of the Jungle]
 ARTIST: Dan Froelich
(#8)
  TITLE: Seven [from the PC game Jill of the Jungle]
 ARTIST: Dan Froelich

/MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/Legend_of_Zelda-Dungeon.sid
  TITLE: Dungeon Theme [from the NES game Legend of Zelda]
 ARTIST: Koji Kondo
COMMENT: "The dungeon theme from Nintendo's 'Legend of Zelda.'" (JA)

/MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/Lithium.sid
  TITLE: Lithium [from Nevermind]
 ARTIST: Nirvana
COMMENT: "Another Nirvana song, at least sort of. It's a SID conversion of an
         Amiga MOD that I found of "Lithium." However, the MOD is pretty lame
         compared to the actual song. But anyway, here it is." (JA)

/MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/MM2-Flashman_Stage.sid
  TITLE: Flashman stage [from the NES game Mega Man II]
 ARTIST: Manami Matsumae (Chanchacorin), Yoshihiro Sakaguchi (Yuukichan's Papa)
COMMENT: "All the versions I've heard have been crystalline bells and synths,
         and I would think to myself, "AAAGGHH!!! This is SUPPOSED to be a
         tenor sax and electric guitar, idiots!" So that's what I attempted
         here." (JA)

/MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/MM2-Heatman_Stage.sid
  TITLE: Heatman stage [from the NES game Mega Man II]
 ARTIST: Manami Matsumae (Chanchacorin), Yoshihiro Sakaguchi (Yuukichan's Papa)

/MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/MM7-Bass_Theme.sid
  TITLE: Bass's theme [from the SNES game Mega Man VII]
 ARTIST: Capcom Sound Team

/MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/MMX-Storm_Eagle.sid
  TITLE: Storm Eagle's stage [from the SNES game Mega Man X]
 ARTIST: Capcom Sound Team
COMMENT: "I LOVE this song. Sorry about the crummy approximation of a
         guitar, this was my first SID, and anyway, I like it like this." (JA)

/MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/Magma_Rumble.sid
COMMENT: "An abortive attempt to be Heat Man's music from Megaman 2. Still,
         it's all right, I guess." (JA)
         See /MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/Demon_Stomp.sid for more comments on this.

/MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/Maniac_Mansion.sid
  TITLE: Maniac Mansion, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Chris Grigg & David Lawrence
COMMENT: Based on the Nintendo NES' version of the theme.
         "Okay, this one is more than just another remix of the Maniac Mansion
         theme song; it's the song from the Nintendo version, which had WAY
         better music. The Nintendo theme song actually had a melody (imagine
         that!), so I did this one instead." (JA)

/MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/Megaman_X-Select.sid
COMMENT: "The two "stage select screen" songs from Capcom's Mega Man X. The
         first is the normal Stage Select, the second is the one played after
         you defeat all 8 Mavericks." (JA)
(#1)
  TITLE: Stage Select (normal) [from the game Mega Man X]
 ARTIST: Capcom Sound Team
(#2)
  TITLE: Stage Select (Sigma's Fortress) [from the game Mega Man X]
 ARTIST: Capcom Sound Team

/MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/Megaman_X-Zero.sid
  TITLE: Zero's Rescue [from the game Mega Man X]
 ARTIST: Capcom Sound Team

/MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/Megaman_X3-Gravity_Beetle.sid
  TITLE: Gravity Beetle [from the game Mega Man X3]
 ARTIST: Toshihiko Horiyama

/MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/Megaman_X5-Select.sid
  TITLE: Stage Select (Sigma's Fortress)
 ARTIST: Akemi Kimura
COMMENT: "This is the "Sigma's Fortress" stage select music from Capcom's
         Mega Man X5." (JA)

/MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/MicroMan_gameplay.sid
  TITLE: micro1.m02 [from the PC game The Adventures of MicroMan]
 ARTIST: Cotichelli
COMMENT: "This is the in-game song from the Windows game 'Microman.' I did a
         SID remix of this, since it is one of my favorite MIDI songs. It
         worked out well, except that in a couple places I had to remove some
         extra tracks due to lack of channels." (JA)

/MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/Moon_Patrol.sid
  TITLE: Moon Patrol [from the arcade game]
 ARTIST: Ichiro Takagi
COMMENT: "This is the ingame music from Moon Patrol, which happens to be my
          favorite arcade game. It's a great song, but the Atarisoft's C64
          version was BAD, and the only other SID author who took a stab at
          it was Jesper Olsen. (Some guy did the Atari version, but that
          sucked compared to the arcade/64 version.) So I made my own remix.
          I added some other parts to it, basically with a nicer drum track
          and another voice added onto the bassline. Actually, this started
          out as a Protracker MOD, but I just HAD to do a SID version of
          this." (JA)

/MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/Mountain_Climber.sid
COMMENT: "See if you can guess which popular rock band this is nakedly ripped
         off from!" (JA)
         See /MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/Demon_Stomp.sid for more comments on this.

/MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/Myst-The_Myst_Book.sid
  TITLE: <?>
 ARTIST: Robyn Miller
COMMENT: "This is from Cyan Software's game 'Myst.' It is the music that plays
         as you watch the fly-in on the Myst book's linking panel." (JA)

/MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/Necromancers_Crypt.sid
COMMENT: "I like the atmosphere, I really really like the atmosphere." (JA)
         See /MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/Demon_Stomp.sid for more comments on this.

/MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/Odell_Mermaid.sid
COMMENT: "Yes, I was actually planning an Odell Down Under type game by this
         title at one point. Then it got repurposed here." (JA)
         See /MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/Demon_Stomp.sid for more comments on this.

/MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/Pokemon-Elite_Four.sid
  TITLE: Pokemon Gym [from the GB games Pokemon Red/Blue/Yellow/Green]
 ARTIST: Junichi Masuda
COMMENT: "The Elite Four/Gym theme from Pokemon (all versions.) I'm not
          really into Pokemon (I kinda like it,) but it has really nice
          music. This is one of the best themes in the game." (JA)

/MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/SMB-Water_song.sid
  TITLE: Water Theme [from the NES game Super Mario Bros.]
 ARTIST: Koji Kondo
COMMENT: "I always imagined this one with a bouncy bass and an accordion, so
         here it is." (JA)

/MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/Smells_Like_Teen_Spirit.sid
  TITLE: Smells Like Teen Spirit [from Nevermind]
 ARTIST: Nirvana
COMMENT: "I really like Nirvana's musical style, but I was very unimpressed
         with the SID mixes of their songs that I found. So I SID-mixed 'Smells
         Like Teen Spirit.' (JA)

/MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/Super_Mario_Bros.sid
COMMENT: "This will eventually be a complete SID soundtrack for Nintendo
          Super Mario Bros., but as of yet the only complete songs are the
          main game theme and the underground theme. I plan to do another
          version where I will remix them in full SID glory instead of
          having them sound like Nintendo music!" (JA)
(#1)
  TITLE: Overworld BGM [from the NES game Super Mario Bros.]
 ARTIST: Koji Kondo
(#2)
  TITLE: Underground BGM [from the NES game Super Mario Bros.]
 ARTIST: Koji Kondo

 ARTIST: Nirvana
COMMENT: This is part of a multi-SID tune.

/MUSICIANS/A/Ames_John/Weirdness.sid
COMMENT: "A collection of three songs from Greg Janson's excellent comedy game,
         'Weirdness.' All of these were, to the best of my knowledge, written
         by Greg himself, although one of the other songs in the game came from
         Sonic the Hedgehog." (JA)

  TITLE: Weirdness - Title Screen
 ARTIST: Greg Janson
(#2)
  TITLE: Weirdness - Jace's House
 ARTIST: Greg Janson
(#3)
  TITLE: Weirdness - Roylock Puzzle
 ARTIST: Greg Janson

COMMENT: "It's the boss battle theme from Castle of Zokor, a game I'm
         working on. The game is for PC, but I felt like doing a C64 version of
         this song." (JA)

### /MUSICIANS/A/Artlace #####################################################

/MUSICIANS/A/Artlace/
COMMENT: Comments by Artlace (Artúr Bujdosó) are denoted (AB).

/MUSICIANS/A/Artlace/Bended.sid
COMMENT: "This tune was composed to test one of my players only.
          Actually, it's nothing more than having fun in the editor." (AB)

/MUSICIANS/A/Artlace/Cyberdox.sid
COMMENT: "This is one of those so-called long-and-boring tunes, inspired
          by such classics as Thomas Detert and Markus Schneider. They
          gave the style, I added the boredom." (AB)

/MUSICIANS/A/Artlace/Tron_Mix.sid
COMMENT: "This tune was made after hearing a music of a tron-like game on
          Amiga. Its name wasn't 'Tron' but the idea was similar." (AB)

/MUSICIANS/A/Artlace/True_Faith.sid
  TITLE: True Faith [from Substance 1987]
 ARTIST: New Order

/MUSICIANS/A/Artlace/Visitors.sid
  TITLE: Visitors
 ARTIST: Koto

### /MUSICIANS/A/Ashrilyn ####################################################

/MUSICIANS/A/Ashrilyn/
COMMENT: Ashrilyn's (Justin Blase) own comments are denoted (JB).

/MUSICIANS/A/Ashrilyn/Awexome_Cross_Remix.sid
  TITLE: Awexome Cross
 ARTIST: Jonathan Howe
COMMENT: "A remix I made of the gameplay music from the Homestar Runner game
         'Awexome Cross'" (JB).

/MUSICIANS/A/Ashrilyn/Ice_Space.sid
COMMENT: "I don't quite consider this done, but I never went back to finish
         it." (JB)

/MUSICIANS/A/Ashrilyn/Metroid_Brinstar_Remix.sid
  TITLE: Metroid Brinstar (alternate instruments) [from Famicom Disk System game Metroid]
 ARTIST: Hirokazu Tanaka (Hip)

/MUSICIANS/A/Ashrilyn/Metroid_Brinstar_Remix_alt.sid
  TITLE: Metroid Brinstar (alternate instruments) [from Famicom Disk System game Metroid]
 ARTIST: Hirokazu Tanaka (Hip)

/MUSICIANS/A/Ashrilyn/Ninja.sid
COMMENT: "I composed the original song in Psycle, with a kind of old-school
         game sound to it, and made this remix later. I composed the original
         for the South Park Studios game 'Cripple Fight'." (JB)

/MUSICIANS/A/Ashrilyn/Shapeshifter.sid
  TITLE: Shapeshifter [from the Impulse Tracker module]
 ARTIST: Justin Blase (Ashrilyn)
COMMENT: "I originally composed in Impulse Tracker format, using samples of
         Commodore 64 music. I later made this version." (JB)

/MUSICIANS/A/Ass_It/Birthdaysong.sid
  TITLE: Malbrouk s'en va-t-en guerre (0:00-0:42)
 ARTIST: Traditional
COMMENT: An Arab tune that was brought to Europe during the crusades and
         became popular during the french revolution, ever sinced spawned
         many songs, including "For He's a Jolly Good Fellow".

/MUSICIANS/A/Ass_It/Blue_Light.sid

  TITLE: Malbrouk s'en va-t-en guerre (0:00-0:41)
 ARTIST: Traditional
COMMENT: An Arab tune that was brought to Europe during the crusades and
         became popular during the French revolution, ever sinced spawned
         many songs, including "For He's a Jolly Good Fellow".
         Also used in game "Oracle II" (C) 1994 Art Project Studios.

/MUSICIANS/A/Audial_Arts/Pasch_Ronny/Wave_Goodbye.sid
COMMENT: Although the start is very similar to /MUSICIANS/L/Laxity/Alibi.sid,
         neither composer was aware of each other's tune when composing theirs.
         "if you listen to both tunes you can hear that it's not the same.
         Besides that I made mine before his. I remember hearing his tune and
         thought, wow.. similar sound AND start of the melody even... freaky...
         (his is better though! hehe)" (RP)

### /MUSICIANS/A/Audial_Arts/Peters_Patrick ##################################

/MUSICIANS/A/Audial_Arts/Peters_Patrick/Dirty_Cash.sid
  TITLE: Dirty Cash
 ARTIST: Adventures of Stevie V

/MUSICIANS/A/Audial_Arts/Peters_Patrick/Holiday.sid
  TITLE: Holiday [from Madonna]
 ARTIST: Madonna

/MUSICIANS/A/Audial_Arts/Peters_Patrick/Illusion.sid
  TITLE: Future Composer 3, Tune #3
 ARTIST: Patrick Peters (Softmaster)

/MUSICIANS/A/Audial_Arts/Peters_Patrick/Imshi.sid
COMMENT: The game credited the music to Patrick Peters and Spherical Noises.
         Spherical Noises are Gerard Hultink and Elton de Hoog. Although Yavuz
         Sükür made one subtune, he wasn't credited in the game.
(#1)
 AUTHOR: Gerard Hultink
(#2)
 AUTHOR: Patrick Peters
  TITLE: Get Out Your Lazy Bed
 ARTIST: Matt Bianco
(#3)
 AUTHOR: Patrick Peters
(#4)
 AUTHOR: Patrick Peters
(#5)
 AUTHOR: Patrick Peters
(#6)
 AUTHOR: Patrick Peters
(#7)
 AUTHOR: Yavuz Sükür
(#8)
 AUTHOR: Gerard Hultink
(#9)
 AUTHOR: Elton de Hoog

/MUSICIANS/A/Audial_Arts/Peters_Patrick/Lambada.sid
  TITLE: Lambada
 ARTIST: Kaoma
COMMENT: "I can tell you that the Lambada tune, used in our demo's/openings are
         from me. At that time I hadn't any player and I didn't want to spend
         too much time in making one. I ripped the 20CC player by analyzing the
         code in assembler. Then I programmed the codeblocks myself to get the
         Lambada tune right. I laughed when 20CC found out that their player
         was used and Falco Paul or Edwin van Santen hadn't made that tune
         earlier!!! They accused me of ripping routines etc. etc. Well.. they
         were right, I never claimed that it was my player but I merged my
         Lambada tune blocks via assembler into their old music blocks (I
         overwrote it). The funniest thing was that the Lambada tune from me
         was very populair at that time. When 20CC heard it they made their own
         Lambada tune, hehehehe..." (Patrick Peters)

/MUSICIANS/A/Audial_Arts/Peters_Patrick/Lessons_in_Love.sid
  TITLE: Lessons In Love [from Running in The Family]
 ARTIST: Level 42

/MUSICIANS/A/Audial_Arts/Peters_Patrick/Peters_Patrick_02.sid
  TITLE: I Go to Rio [from Taught By Experts]
 ARTIST: Peter Allen

/MUSICIANS/A/Audial_Arts/Peters_Patrick/Reign_of_Pain_part_5.sid

### /MUSICIANS/B/ ############################################################

### /MUSICIANS/B/BOGG ########################################################

/MUSICIANS/B/BOGG/
COMMENT: "BOGG is a variation on my surname MARSH, which in the dictionary
         means Flooded Land, Bog, Swamp and such like. I just added another G
         to make Bogg! I think my brother might have been called Boggy at
         school too." (BOGG)

/MUSICIANS/B/BOGG/Axel_F.sid
  TITLE: Axel F [from the movie Beverly Hills Cop]
 ARTIST: Harold Faltermeyer

/MUSICIANS/B/BOGG/Bach_Allegro.sid

         Pearl. More Pearl tunes can be found in /MUSICIANS/P/Patfield_Kent/

/MUSICIANS/B/Bakewell_Dwayne/Call_of_Ktulu.sid
COMMENT: "This shortened C64 version comes is a cover of album 'Apocalyptica
         plays Metallica', not the Metallica original. The 1st Metallica part
         by DJB, 2nd part comes from me. Apocalyptica wouldn't sue me for this,
         hehe ;)" (Agemixer)
(#1)
  TITLE: The Call of Ktulu [from Ride the Lightning]
 ARTIST: Metallica
COMMENT: This uses the default filter set.
(#2)
  TITLE: The Call of Ktulu [from Ride the Lightning]
 ARTIST: Metallica
COMMENT: This uses a filter set designed for the 8580 SID chip.
(#3)
  TITLE: The Call of Ktulu [from Ride the Lightning]
 ARTIST: Metallica
COMMENT: This uses a filter set for the old 6581 SID chips (R1-R3.)

### /MUSICIANS/B/Bakker_Nantco ###############################################

/MUSICIANS/B/Bakker_Nantco/
COMMENT: Sadly, Nantco Bakker passed away in 2011 at the age of 43.

/MUSICIANS/B/Bakker_Nantco/Avenge_Ltd.sid
  TITLE: Lang zal hij leven (0:06-0:21)
 ARTIST: Traditional
COMMENT: Famously known as the Swedish birthday song "Ja må han leva" and the
         Dutch birthday song "Lang zal hij leven".
  TITLE: Zij leven hoog (0:21-0:56)
 ARTIST: <?>
COMMENT: This is a Dutch birthday song.
  TITLE: Happy Birthday (0:56-1:25)
 ARTIST: Mildred J. Hill

  TITLE: Axel F [from the movie Beverly Hills Cop]
 ARTIST: Harold Faltermeyer

### /MUSICIANS/B/Bayliss_Richard #############################################

/MUSICIANS/B/Bayliss_Richard/
COMMENT: Comments from Richard Bayliss are denoted (RB).

/MUSICIANS/B/Bayliss_Richard/2000_Kung-Fu_Maniacs_unused.sid
COMMENT: "I rewritten the instruments in DMC V5.0+ from scratch specially for
         this game. However the bad news was that the tune didn't suit the game
         whatsoever, because the theme was more too serious. So I decided to
         work on a ninja style and more fun tune to suit the game.So rather
         than put this into the wastebin, I have decided to share the
         ninjaesque dance tune with you all instead. There are 2 main tunes
         and 1 jingle in which you can listen to and enjoy. :o)" (RB)

/MUSICIANS/B/Bayliss_Richard/Ala_Gal_Remake.sid
  TITLE: Demonic - Part 1, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Neil Baldwin (Demon)
COMMENT: Covers the version in /MUSICIANS/D/Deenen_Charles/Ala_Gal.sid

/MUSICIANS/B/Bayliss_Richard/Album_of_Sound_Effects.sid
COMMENT: "I wanted to do some experimenting with making weird sounds. Could
         this be the first ever Garage/Bassline tune to have hit the Commodore
         64? I'm not really impressed with this, whichI made today, feels
         unfinished and it's another tune for the scrapheap maybe. It's really
         a job for the real experts :o)" (RB)

/MUSICIANS/B/Bayliss_Richard/Alone_in_Bed.sid
COMMENT: "A compo tune I released at the Bronx 7D3 party. This is a sort of
         disco style of tune, using the similar bass lead and drums like the
         ones I used for Drinking Bud Light" (RB)

/MUSICIANS/B/Bayliss_Richard/Amazon_Tales.sid
(#1)

         This sound track is a trance style tune, inspired by the Trance
         Sector loading tune. I tried to immitate some of the instruments that
         were used in Goat Tracker, in DMC V5.0+, but the result turned out

  TITLE: Fear [from Future Generation]
 ARTIST: Laserdance
COMMENT: The title of the tune is referring to SID:
         /MUSICIANS/D/Detert_Thomas/Blue_Angel_69.sid which covers the same tune.
         "A tune, which is inspired by the title theme tune to the C64 version
         of Blue Angel by Magic Bytes software, but with some improvisation which
         I added to the tune. I don't feel all that comfortable using Goat
         Tracker to make new sounds, because it is more difficult to get the
         pulse rate and vibrato right. Although this tune sounds cool, the
         instruments for the main lead sound rather bad." (RB)

         for the Silesia 2008 party event, but I had some very bad news that

         compo entries had unfortunately  got corrupt due to a power cut before
         the event. Later on, in early 2009 I decided to improve this tune a
         little and use it for the disk menu of The Last Amazon Trilogy by
         Psytronik Software. Some of the instruments sort of sound familiar to
         the ones used in Midnight Resistance for the C64 by Ocean Software."

COMMENT: "Once upon a time on a Tuesday, I had a really bad day at work. Until
         at the end of the working day, I felt rather stressed, so I decided to
         dig out the DMC V5.0+ and compose something to make me feel better.
         Did it make me feel better? Yes, it sure did. This tune never actually
         got released, apart from on a TND intro. This is the usual traditional
         Richard Bayliss dance/disco style of tune, which some people would
         love or hate." (RB)

/MUSICIANS/B/Bayliss_Richard/That_Annoying_Ring_Tone.sid
COMMENT: "A ding-a-ding-a-ding ... oh, what? Yes, that sure was an annoying ring
         tone. So I dedicated this song to that. This tune was released at the
         Primary Star party of 2006 and it made 3rd place, which I was quite
         happy with. It is one of those type of summer happy hard-core tunes,
         but done on a Commodore 64 :o)" (RB)

/MUSICIANS/B/Bayliss_Richard/This_Way_to_X2008.sid
COMMENT: "A nice disco style tune, with better instruments for a change. I was
         dead impressed with the quality of this nice piece of music. This song
         was originally entered for the X-2008 music compo, but I was
         unfortunate to not have been able to enter this tune into the compo,
         as the organizers disallowed email music submissions this time round.
         Probably because of the amount of music entries they received. They
         did enter my demo, Crazy Fish into the compo. The music later got used
         as the tape loading music for the Mayhem in Monsterland music mix.
         Glad I found some use for this nice piece of music. I feel that this
         tune is probably one of my best efforts so far," (RB)

/MUSICIANS/B/Bayliss_Richard/Three_Points_to_Go.sid
COMMENT: "Nice happy style disco tune, with a sort of different kind of style
         added to it. I'm not too sure whether or not this tune actually entered
         a C64 related competition. Sounds a really nice tune anyway. Enjoy it!"
         (RB)

 ARTIST: Dion and the Belmonts

/MUSICIANS/B/Bayliss_Richard/War_Across_the_Galaxy.sid
COMMENT: "A space atmospheric disco/dance/trance style of tune, done for the
         Oxyron party, but for some reason, as well as the Oxyron Party, this
         tune got released at the KBIT party as well. Seems to be the case
         where I clicked on the wrong link and emailed it to the wrong place,
         then afterwards did a fixed disk and resent it through the correct
         address. Later on in the year, this great piece of music got used as
         the loading music for Escape from Arth, when I was mastering the tape
         for the game." (RB)

/MUSICIANS/B/Bayliss_Richard/Wasting_Rastertime.sid
  TITLE: Seven Days and One Week
 ARTIST: B.B.E.
COMMENT: "A trance style tune which I came up with as my latest weapon for the
         Forever 5 party. The beginning of the song may sort of familiar.
         You'll be thinking that this track could be a BBE cover (Seven Days
         and One Weekend), but it is actually not. This track is one of my
         very own compositions, which I hoped would do really well at the
         party. It came 5th Place, which was pretty good :)" (RB)

COMMENT: Despite the game crediting the music to both Wally Beben & Ian
         Crabtree, none of Ian's music is in the game. Although Ian did write
         music for this game, it was pulled "at the 11th hour." (Info from Ian
         Crabtree.) For the unused tunes by Ian see
         /MUSICIANS/C/Crabtree_Ian/Crabby_Music_Demo_3.sid.
         The NTSC version of the game is published as "Summer Challenge".

### /MUSICIANS/B/Biasillo_Gary ###############################################

/MUSICIANS/B/Biasillo_Gary/
COMMENT: Gary Biasillo's own comments are denoted (GB).

/MUSICIANS/B/Biasillo_Gary/Joe_Blade.sid
COMMENT: "I was thrown into the deep end with this. I had three weeks to
         produce the music and sound effects for the C64, Spectrum, and
         Amstrad versions, which included time to write a music driver for the
         C64. It was a good learning experience but I wish I had more time to
         work on the tunes as most of my efforts went into writing the software.
         I remember listening to the music form The Last Ninja and Wizball at
         that time, trying to figure out how they created the sounds so I could
         write my music driver. Martin Galway later told me how he created the
         high pitched wooden block 'pop' sound, which was achieved by running
         the driver at 240Hz." (GB)

/MUSICIANS/B/Biasillo_Gary/Slayer.sid
COMMENT: "I programmed and produced the music and sound effects for this game
         which was the first for the company I set up with my friend Mike
         Williams called Imperial Software. I had learned a lot of techniques
         from the talented guys at Ocean and put them to work in this game.
         32 sprite multiplexing, near full-screen colour scrolling, and sampled
         sounds." (GB)
(#1)
  TITLE: Blind Youth [from Reproduction]
 ARTIST: Human League

/MUSICIANS/B/Biasillo_Gary/Steel.sid
COMMENT: "I programmed and produced the music for this title." (GB)

/MUSICIANS/B/Biasillo_Gary/Target_Renegade.sid
COMMENT: "I produced the music and sound effects for the C64, Spectrum 128k,
         and Amstrad versions. Jonathan Dunn handled the 48k Spectrum version
         which was a completely different set of tunes. I really enjoyed
         working on this. Paulie Hughes wrote a new C64 driver as Martin had
         just left Ocean, and nobody could understand how to use his driver."
         (GB)

         /MUSICIANS/B/Bjerregaard_Johannes/Subway_Vigilante.sid
         Only the bugged Street_Cred_Boxing.sid "player doesn't do the vibrato
         thing" (JB).

/MUSICIANS/B/Bjerregaard_Johannes/Thunderforce.sid
COMMENT: "I wrote most of Thunderforce together with my highschool friend Peter
         Uhd Jespsen. The game was originally written for the Danish company
         called Keleline. Peter was a big fan of Depeche Mode and had most of
         their records. Therefore we wanted to get some tunes from DM in the
         game. Keleline wrote to DM and first got a yes, but then the group
         decided no. At least that was the story we were told, but I think,
         that the director of the company cheated us. Somewhere out there is a
         small demo, which have the five tunes in it."
         (Info from Eric Christensen). The tunes in question can be found in
         /MUSICIANS/B/Bjerregaard_Johannes/Depeche_Mode_Songs.sid

/MUSICIANS/B/Bjerregaard_Johannes/When_Will_I_Be_Famous.sid
  TITLE: When Will I Be Famous? [from Push]
 ARTIST: Bros

/MUSICIANS/B/Bjerregaard_Johannes/Zoom.sid
(#1)
  TITLE: Super Freak [from Street Songs]
 ARTIST: Rick James
(#3)
  TITLE: Pop Goes the Weasel
 ARTIST: Traditional
(#4)
  TITLE: An die Freude [from Symphony No. 9 in D minor, Op. 125 "Choral"]
 ARTIST: Ludwig van Beethoven

         and Kristian Røstøen.

/MUSICIANS/B/Blues_Muz/Gallefoss_Glenn/Acid_Jazz.sid
  TITLE: Acidjazzed Evening [from the Amiga MOD module]
 ARTIST: Janne Suni (Tempest)
COMMENT: American producer and hip hop artist Timbaland (Timothy Z. Mosley)
         allegedly plagiarized parts of GRG's version of 'Acidjazzed Evening'
         for use in the song "Do It" on the 2006 album Loose by Nelly Furtado.
         This eventually led to a large controversy where lawyers for both GRG
         and Janne Suni became involved.

  TITLE: Wiggen
 ARTIST: Rupert Wigg

/MUSICIANS/B/Blues_Muz/Gallefoss_Glenn/Ode_to_Bugg.sid
  TITLE: Mystified [from the Amiga MOD module]
 ARTIST: Jogeir Liljedahl
COMMENT: Prior to public release, GRG believed this tune was originally done on
         the Amiga by Liljedahl. According to GRG, when fellow countryman Geir
         Tjelta heard the SID, Tjelta informed GRG that he thought the original
         was actually done by Bug (Stein Erik Giske) rather than Liljedahl.
         Tjelta also informed GRG that Bug passed away in 1992 thus giving GRG
         inspiration to rename the tune before releasing publicly. Unfortunately
         Tjelta's credit information was incorrect, however Tjelta does not
         recall giving GRG incorrect credits perhaps suggesting there was a
         miscommunication between the two. Another theory is that there may
         have been confusion between Jogeir's "Mystified" and one of Bug's
         tunes named "Slider" where the first few notes are similar but indeed
         the two tunes are very different. Reflecting back, Jogeir Liljedahl, a
         friend and group member of the late Bug, adds the following: "When it
         comes to Mystified, it's 100% my original tune. I haven't even thought
         about the similarities to Bug's Slider tune, but the 5-6 first notes
         of the song are similar to Mystified. But it's a completely different
         song of course. Either me or Bug noticed that back then, and Bug was
         a huge fan of Mystified, since he was among the first to hear the song
         (along with Olav Rasmus Vorren aka Shorty)."

/MUSICIANS/B/Blues_Muz/Gallefoss_Glenn/Oldie.sid

 ARTIST: Inner City

         All comments by Kjell are denoted (KN).

   NAME: I Havets Vold
COMMENT: "'I Havets Vold' is a story about a sailboat and a duckling, two
         worlds but both are on the sea, the sailboat enjoys a trip at sea in
         the great weather while the duckling is drifting on the waves without
         any idea about a sailboat, which are coming closer and closer all the
         time, with no idea about a duckling, and the result is fatal. The
         sailboat runs over the duckling and leaving it behind, dead,
         continuing its travel." (KN)

/MUSICIANS/B/Blues_Muz/Nordboe_Kjell/Last_Flight.sid
COMMENT: "'Last Flight' is the song about a person which is taking drugs. It
         is a sad story for both the family to the user, and the user itself,
         which later in the song dies, it's the user's last flight. The family
         which stands back with their dead son or daughter is so unhappy and
         sad that they don't know anything anymore. They're feeling a huge
         emptyness inside, they only wish their child back again, staying
         alive. But that will never happen... The last few minutes when the
         child was alive, it dreamed about a sky of marvelous and wonderful
         things flying all around. The longer it lasted the longer away this
         person was to all real things we know here on earth. This child, so
         young, has left the world. Not alive anymore. Doesn't exist, only the
         body left for the family to bury and their memories to keep. Why do
         some want to legalize it?" (KN)

(#26)
   NAME: The Beginning

COMMENT: "Written by Frode Nordbø. He's not a member of Blues Muz' or SHAPE.
         He makes music on the Amiga." (KN)

/MUSICIANS/B/Blues_Muz/Nordboe_Kjell/Surrounded.sid
COMMENT: "'Surrounded' is a song about a hunted man which realize that his
         last minutes has come and he will now die very soon, the enemy are
         circle in and you watch their faces, they haven't discovered you yet
         but they will every second now and afterwards you watch your own
         funeral, from another place." (KN)

/MUSICIANS/B/Blues_Muz/Nordboe_Kjell/Sweet_Like_Sugar.sid
COMMENT: "Dedicated to Geir." (KN)

/MUSICIANS/B/Blues_Muz/Nordboe_Kjell/That_Sign.sid
  TITLE: Classical
 ARTIST: Kjell Nordbø

/MUSICIANS/B/Blues_Muz/Nordboe_Kjell/Two_Truths.sid
COMMENT: "The God gives, The Evil takes." (KN)

/MUSICIANS/B/Blues_Muz/Nordboe_Kjell/Use_My_Fire.sid
COMMENT: "'Use My Fire' is a song which is about a human which ain't included
         in anything to the community, like;  have no job, doesn't have any
         relationship with other people, and this human got so much willing,
         but nobody cares. Use My Fire! is all what this person is begging
         for, to get a chance to show that he or she doesn't want to die, but
         live, like all others, which got money and a place, family and
         friends. It's a song about losers which want to make the steps out of
         nowhere and into the better... Does anybody care for them?" (KN)

/MUSICIANS/B/Blues_Muz/Nordboe_Kjell/X-Factor.sid
COMMENT: One of four tunes pasted together to form Blues Muz's Herning 93,
         their music competition entry for The Party 1993.

  TITLE: Malbrouk s'en va-t-en guerre
 ARTIST: Traditional
COMMENT: An Arab tune that was brought to Europe during the crusades and
         became popular during the french revolution, ever sinced spawned
         many songs, including "For He's a Jolly Good Fellow".

### /MUSICIANS/B/Boogaloo ####################################################

/MUSICIANS/B/Boogaloo/Amorada.sid
  TITLE: Brasileirinho
 ARTIST: Waldir Azevedo

  TITLE: Flight of the Bumblebee [from opera The Tale of Tsar Saltan]
 ARTIST: Nikolai Rimsky-Korsakov

  TITLE: Test Drive 2: The Duel (remix)
 ARTIST: Kris Hatlelid

/MUSICIANS/B/Boogaloo/Snake_Fighter.sid
COMMENT: All those weird references to snakes (eg the HZ demo "Snake or Die")
         comes from strange Horizon rituals. At the HZ party in Vårby 1989 the
         HZ members were not only dressed in training suits with HZ logotypes,
         they also brought rubber snakes bought from the closest toy store,
         which they used to whip visitors and each other with. (Spank! Spank!)

### /MUSICIANS/B/Booker ######################################################

/MUSICIANS/B/Booker/
COMMENT: All comments by Marcin Kubica (Booker) himself are denoted (MK).

/MUSICIANS/B/Booker/Attah_1.sid
COMMENT: "'Attah' naming supposed to indicate converted tunes, or covers if you
         preffer. Most likely I wanted to release a collection of them. I'm not
         sure why I got this weird naming idea. Anyways, currently it's utterly
         hard for me to recall the original authors and names. They all were
         originally released on Amiga." (MK)

/MUSICIANS/B/Booker/Attah_2.sid
COMMENT: See /MUSICIANS/B/Booker/Attah_1.sid for more info

/MUSICIANS/B/Booker/Attah_5.sid
  TITLE: Daydreams2 [from the Amiga MOD module]
 ARTIST: Volker Tripp (Jester)
COMMENT: See /MUSICIANS/B/Booker/Attah_1.sid for more info

/MUSICIANS/B/Booker/Attah_6.sid
  TITLE: Cos niesamowitego [from the Amiga MOD module]
 ARTIST: Andrzej Dragan (Dreamer of Flying Cows)
COMMENT: See /MUSICIANS/B/Booker/Attah_1.sid for more info

/MUSICIANS/B/Booker/Attah_7.sid
COMMENT: See /MUSICIANS/B/Booker/Attah_1.sid for more info

/MUSICIANS/B/Booker/Benefactor_Level_1.sid
  TITLE: Benefactor 3 [from the Amiga game]
 ARTIST: Olof Gustafsson

/MUSICIANS/B/Booker/Classic_Mix.sid
  TITLE: Toccata [from Toccata and Fugue in D Minor (BWV 565)]
 ARTIST: Johann Sebastian Bach

/MUSICIANS/B/Booker/Crack_the_Eggshell.sid
  TITLE: Crack The Eggshell [from the Amiga MOD module]
 ARTIST: Volker Tripp (Jester)

/MUSICIANS/B/Booker/Cream.sid
  TITLE: Cream [from the Amiga MOD module]
 ARTIST: Richard Frick (T-Bozz)

/MUSICIANS/B/Booker/Cyberide_v2.sid
  TITLE: Looking 4 Love [from the amiga MOD module]
 ARTIST: Wojciech Panufnik (Snoopy)
COMMENT: Covers portions of Snoopy's module

/MUSICIANS/B/Booker/Dope.sid
COMMENT: "This is actually a remix of various Amiga modules.
         I can recall the work of XTD and Jester. Having a look on the info
         part inside the the tune I realized we aparently must have followed
         the legal situation in Poland of those years, where actually you could
         legally buy pirated copies of commercial records! Why is that? Well,
         the info says (C)1994 Caution, (C)1995 Amorphis but actually the tune
         doesn't belong to any of these groups, right? It is a mix of
         originally someone's else work. The (C) sign there is merely just an
         indication of what groups released, or used this tune. It was meant
         firstly to be used in 1994 in a Caution production but used only in
         1995 in the music collection by our group Amorphis." (MK)

/MUSICIANS/B/Booker/Drunk_Cat.sid
  TITLE: Drunk Cat [from the Amiga MOD module]
 ARTIST: Adam Skorupa (Scorpik)

/MUSICIANS/B/Booker/Elysium.sid
  TITLE: Elysium [from the Amiga MOD module]
 ARTIST: Volker Tripp (Jester)

/MUSICIANS/B/Booker/Hajpa_Hajpa.sid
  TITLE: Hyper Hyper
 ARTIST: Scooter

/MUSICIANS/B/Booker/Jazzo.sid
  TITLE: Livin'insanity [from the Amiga MOD module]
 ARTIST: Frédéric Motte (Moby)

/MUSICIANS/B/Booker/My_Glamrous_Life.sid
  TITLE: My Glamorous Life [from the Amiga MOD module]
 ARTIST: Volker Tripp (Jester)

/MUSICIANS/B/Booker/Palles_Theme_2.sid
  TITLE: Palle's Theme 2 [from the Amiga MOD module]
 ARTIST: Volker Tripp (Jester)

/MUSICIANS/B/Booker/Popyjava_Pyjakoof.sid
COMMENT: "The work on this tune has been started in ca. 1995 following
         inspiration with The Sims 1 (PC) soundtrack, then was left over
         collecting the dust. The title means 'Libation of the drinkers'" (MK)

/MUSICIANS/B/Booker/Reksio.sid
  TITLE: Title Theme [from the cartoon series Reksio] (0:00-0:24)
 ARTIST: Zenon Kowalowski
COMMENT: Title theme from a Polish cartoon series.

         theft-copy spread by FAC. Perhaps because it was really 'published' by
         a cracker, Magic Bytes decided to let the game 'sit' for a while, then
         releasing it under a different name in 1990 (whose new name was Cyber
         World).

### /MUSICIANS/B/Brennan_Neil ################################################

/MUSICIANS/B/Brennan_Neil/
COMMENT: All of these tunes have been confirmed by Brennan to be his.
         The HVSC team via their sources have checked all the original credits
         and found that most of the tunes that were supposedly done by Greg
         Holland were in fact made by Neil Brennan. For most of the games Greg
         Holland was the graphic artist rather than the composer. The HVSC Crew
         also has confirmation of this fact from a senior employee of Beam
         Software, who was on Melbourne House's main programming team at the
         time. Brennan's own comments are denoted (NB).
         "The only musician I knew at Melbourne House pre-me (I think I started
         in 1983) was Adrian Pertout. A guy named Gavin Anderson (I think) came
         after me, but I lost contact with that company fairly quickly, so I'm
         a pretty poor source of information." (NB)

/MUSICIANS/B/Brennan_Neil/Asterix_and_the_Magic_Cauldron.sid
COMMENT: "Song 3 is a classical piece, song 4 might be too" (NB)
(#1)
  TITLE: Asterix Movie Theme
 ARTIST: Gerard Calvi & Vladimir Cosma
(#3)
  TITLE: Slavonic Dance Number 7 [from Slovanské Tance, Op. 46]
 ARTIST: Antonín Dvorák

/MUSICIANS/B/Brennan_Neil/Bazooka_Bill.sid
COMMENT: "A personal favorite, musically anyway" (NB)

/MUSICIANS/B/Brennan_Neil/Bop_n_Rumble.sid
COMMENT: The game was also released under the name "Street Hassle". "Not my
         finest hour." (NB)

/MUSICIANS/B/Brennan_Neil/Castle_of_Terror.sid
(#7)
  TITLE: Prelude No. 20 in C minor (0:00-0:06)
 ARTIST: Frédéric François Chopin
COMMENT: Similar, but not identical to Chopin in the final chords.

/MUSICIANS/B/Brennan_Neil/Fist_II-The_Legend_Continues.sid
COMMENT: "I played song 2 in a band for a while." (NB)

/MUSICIANS/B/Brennan_Neil/Fist_plus.sid
(#2)
  TITLE: Fist II - The Legend Continues, Tune #2
 ARTIST: Neil Brennan

/MUSICIANS/B/Brennan_Neil/Grand_Larceny.sid
COMMENT: "Song #1's baseline sounds like an Alice Cooper song to me." (NB)

/MUSICIANS/B/Brennan_Neil/Hobbit.sid
(#2)
  TITLE: March of Triumph [from Aida]
 ARTIST: Giuseppe Verdi
(#3)
  TITLE: Beep Beep
 ARTIST: The Playmates
(#5)
COMMENT: This tune was later used in the game "Fist II: The Legend Continues".

/MUSICIANS/B/Brennan_Neil/Inspector_Gadget_Demo.sid
  TITLE: Inspector Gadget title [from the cartoon series]
 ARTIST: Shuki Levy

/MUSICIANS/B/Brennan_Neil/Mugsys_Revenge.sid
COMMENT: "I'm pretty blurry on this one.  I think song #1 is mine, but I don't
         remember doing songs #2 and #3 at all. It's possible that someone took
         over from me, when I left Melbourne House and added the last 2 songs."
         (NB)

/MUSICIANS/B/Brennan_Neil/Rock_n_Wrestle.sid
COMMENT: "Mine. Blah." (NB)

/MUSICIANS/B/Brennan_Neil/Samurai_Warrior.sid
COMMENT: "A big favorite.  'Usagi Yojimbo' was a comic book about a samurai
         rabbit." (NB)

/MUSICIANS/B/Brennan_Neil/Sherlock.sid
COMMENT: "Mine!  Song #2 is the best piano piece I think I wrote for
         Melbourne House, and I still play it for personal enjoyment." (NB)

/MUSICIANS/B/Brennan_Neil/Starion.sid
(#1)
  TITLE: Ride of the Valkyries
 ARTIST: Richard Wagner
(#2)
  TITLE: Ride of the Valkyries
 ARTIST: Richard Wagner
COMMENT: "Ride of the Valyries (Wagner) over the Dr. Who bassline.
          It seemed like a good idea at the time..." (NB)

/MUSICIANS/B/Brennan_Neil/Super_Pac-Man.sid
COMMENT: Covers the arcade.
         "it was a direct copy of the arcade music,
          so no credit should ever be assigned to me." (NB)

/MUSICIANS/B/Brennan_Neil/Way_of_the_Exploding_Fist.sid
(#2)
  TITLE: Dance of the Yao People
 ARTIST: Liu Tieshan and Mao Yüan
COMMENT: Composed in 1950, "Dance of the Yao People" combined folk melodies
         and rhythms of the Yao people from the Yunan province, southwestern
         China. Information comes from the liner notes for "Phases of the
         Moon", a 1981 compact disk published by CBS Records.
         "Fred Milgrom (founder of MH) gave me heaps of latitude, for which I
         can only be grateful. I actually studied Chinese and Japanese
         recordings and instruments for some of these pieces, absurdly serious
         as that may sound." (NB)

/MUSICIANS/B/Brennan_Neil/Zim_Sala_Bim.sid
COMMENT: "Definitely mine, though I don't remember it particularly well." (NB)
         The volume of this SID is low just as it plays on the C64.

COMMENT: This game was also released as "The Sword and The Rose", (C) 1991
         Codemasters. The tune is a spoof of Mark Cooksey's Ghosts 'n' Goblins
         theme.

         Don Diekneite.

  TITLE: plant [from the Amiga game Miami Chase]
 ARTIST: Jimmy Fredriksson (Firefox)

/MUSICIANS/B/Brimble_Allister/Wild_West_Seymour.sid
COMMENT: "Yes at that time I was trying to copy all the great C64 musicians.
         The drum sound was taken from Rob Hubbards music and the other
         instruments were delibarately similar to David Whittakers stuff which
         I really liked." (AB)
(#2)
  TITLE: Dragnet Theme [from the television series]
 ARTIST: Miklós Rózsa & Walter Schumann

### /MUSICIANS/B/Brooke_Jason ################################################

/MUSICIANS/B/Brooke_Jason/Andy_Capp-The_Game.sid
  TITLE: New World Symphony (Theme)
 ARTIST: Antonín Dvorák
COMMENT: This music was used in British TV commercials for Hovis bread in the
         late 70s and throughout the 80s.  It was set in the Yorkshire dales
         and featured stereotypical men wearing flat caps, hence the reason it
         is used as the music for this game!

 ARTIST: Cadaver

/MUSICIANS/C/Cadaver/Darkening.sid
COMMENT: This tune won both the jury and audience voting of the www.c64.sk
         SID Compo 7.
(#1)
COMMENT: "This is the version that was fixed for real C64s after the compo.
         The snare sound of the original one is quite silent on a real 6581.
         Due to differences with how high cutoff is handled, this one
         doesn't sound quite right on emulation." (LÖ)
(#2)
COMMENT: "This is the original compo version, but the snare is quite silent
         on a real 6581. Due to differences with how high cutoff is handled,
         this one is still better sounding on emulation." (LÖ)

         later converted to Ninjatracker for lower CPU and memory usage, but
         unfortunately a slight bit of sound quality had to be sacrificed for
         that. The tunes in this SID are in original GoatTracker format and
         sound richer compared to the gametunes." (LÖ)
(#1)
COMMENT: Same tune as /MUSICIANS/C/Cadaver/Metal_Warrior_4.sid, Tune #1.
(#2)

/MUSICIANS/C/Cadaver/Metal_Warrior_Unused_Music.sid
(#1)
COMMENT: "Loading music. Wasn't used because I got some random lock-up problems
         with the IRQ-loader I was using, and the final game used the slow
         KERNAL loading routines :-)" (LÖ)
(#2)
COMMENT: "Cutscene music. This was replaced because I felt this one was too
         raw-sounding." (LÖ)
(#3)
COMMENT: "First version of endsequence music. Divided into orchestral (victory
         cutscene) and heavy metal (rolling credits) part, but was replaced in
         favour of a simpler melodic tune." (LÖ)

/MUSICIANS/C/Cadaver/On_a_Sanction_from_CIA.sid
COMMENT: "The term 'sanction' refers to the meaning 'an assignment to kill'
         used in Robert Ludlum novels" (LÖ)

### /MUSICIANS/C/Cannon_Matthew ##############################################

/MUSICIANS/C/Cannon_Matthew/
COMMENT: Comments by Matthew Cannon are denoted (MC).

/MUSICIANS/C/Cannon_Matthew/Liverpool_FC.sid
COMMENT: "These songs were meant for the Liverpool game that turned into
         Adidas Soccer. Matt Cannon composed all the tunes intended for the
         Ocean based Liverpool game and its two sections.
         These are the original sent tunes from Matt" (Frank Gasking).
(#1)
COMMENT: Same as /MUSICIANS/C/Cannon_Matthew/Adidas_Football.sid, Tune #2.

/MUSICIANS/C/Cannon_Matthew/Loader.sid
  TITLE: Super Loader
 ARTIST: Matthew Cannon
COMMENT: It's an enhanced version of his own "Super Loader" tune.
         See /MUSICIANS/C/Cannon_Matthew/Super_Loader.sid

/MUSICIANS/C/Cannon_Matthew/Operation_Thunderbolt.sid
(#2)
  TITLE: <?> [from the arcade game Operation Thunderbolt]
 ARTIST: Shizuo Aizawa (Splatter. A/Zuntata)

/MUSICIANS/C/Cannon_Matthew/Parallax_Rip-Off.sid
  TITLE: Parallax, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Martin Galway
COMMENT: "I attempted to get the new music driver to sound like
          Martin Galway. I discovered that Martin was doing arpeggios
          differently - over 2 octaves, not 1. So I wrote the end section
          of Parallax on the new music driver, to demonstrate!" (MC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Cannon_Matthew/Rambo_remix.sid
  TITLE: Rambo: First Blood Part II, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Martin Galway
COMMENT: "Someone at Ocean finally managed to dig out Martin's
          old music driver. It had the Rambo loading music. I
          tried to compose using the driver, but couldn't understand
          how it worked. The furthest I got was to "remix" the Rambo
          loading tune!" (MC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Cannon_Matthew/Super_Loader.sid
  TITLE: Can You Read My Mind? [from Superman movie score] (0:00-0:58)
 ARTIST: John Williams

### /MUSICIANS/C/Chiummo_Aldo ################################################

/MUSICIANS/C/Chiummo_Aldo/
COMMENT: Aldo Chiummo's own comments are denoted (AC).

/MUSICIANS/C/Chiummo_Aldo/Cnottes_Nights.sid
  TITLE: La tua realtà
 ARTIST: Mongra
COMMENT: "The tune was later rearranged and played with real instruments
         (guitars, bass guitar and drums); lyrics were added and it became a
         song of "Mongra"'s (the band I play in) called "La tua realtà " ("Your
         Reality")." (AC)

### /MUSICIANS/C/Chotaire ####################################################

 ARTIST: Eric Idle
COMMENT: From Monty Python's movie, which was banned from UK television release
         until 1994.

/MUSICIANS/C/Chotaire/Blue_Mountains.sid
  TITLE: When the Chariot Comes
 ARTIST: Traditional Negro Spiritual

/MUSICIANS/C/Chotaire/Hit_the_Shit.sid
  TITLE: Magazine Intro Tune
 ARTIST: Reyn Ouwehand
COMMENT: Covers /MUSICIANS/O/Ouwehand_Reyn/Magazine_Intro_Tune.sid

/MUSICIANS/C/Chotaire/Legoland_3_Theme.sid
COMMENT: Remix of /MUSICIANS/R/Red_Devil/Legoland_3_tune_1.sid

/MUSICIANS/C/Chotaire/Megamix.sid
  TITLE: Blip the Blop (1:03-2:03)
 ARTIST: Marc (Chotaire)

/MUSICIANS/C/Chotaire/Positive.sid
COMMENT: "[...] But now let me tell something about this music. It was composed
         and tracked within  hours on january, 23rd. This is a kind of jazz
         tune, it's not my style ya know, but I felt like doing a tune like
         this because lots a people like it. Therefore I added sum of my music
         style to the tune, that's why it sounds a bit techno like.. Try to
         enjoy this tune with a stereo, you'll like it I guess.. By the way
         remember that all C128 computers have a different filter set on their
         sid chips,so the music sounds a bit different than on normal C64
         computers, you'll hear the difference on the bass, the filters doesn't
         open theirselves so much on C128! But who the fuck cares, this music
         runs on all computers, that's what counts! [...]"
         (Taken from a note added to the tune "Positive" by Chotaire himself)

/MUSICIANS/C/Chotaire/Rhythm_is_a_Dancer.sid
  TITLE: Rhythm is a Dancer [from The Power]
 ARTIST: Snap

/MUSICIANS/C/Chotaire/Technology.sid
  TITLE: Our Darkness [from Beehive]
 ARTIST: Anne Clark

/MUSICIANS/C/Chotaire/Technology_2.sid
  TITLE: Our Darkness [from Beehive]
 ARTIST: Anne Clark

/MUSICIANS/C/Chotaire/What_Is_Love.sid
  TITLE: What is Love
 ARTIST: Haddaway

### /MUSICIANS/C/Clarke_Peter ################################################

/MUSICIANS/C/Clarke_Peter/
COMMENT: Peter Clarke's own comments are denoted (PC).

/MUSICIANS/C/Clarke_Peter/Bubble_Bobble.sid
COMMENT: "This was a great arcade game and I knew I needed to produce a really
         great set of faithful soundtracks to go with it. It was the hardest
         work I did on a C64 project and the most satisfying outcome with the
         Zzap!64 review of it." (PC)
         All tunes are covers of the arcade version
(#3)
  TITLE: Flight of the Bumblebee [from opera The Tale of Tsar Saltan]
 ARTIST: Nikolai Rimsky-Korsakov
COMMENT: An original composition inspired by it.

/MUSICIANS/C/Clarke_Peter/Double_Take.sid
COMMENT: "We've sorta covered this one elsewhere, but... This tune came out of
         an experiment with me trying to find a melody that would fit as many
         chords as possible and discovering that there's a limit. The melody
         works with five chords pretty much throughout." (PC)
(#1)
  TITLE: Mission of Mercy
 ARTIST: Peter Clarke

/MUSICIANS/C/Clarke_Peter/Head_Over_Heels.sid
COMMENT: "Written in-house at Ocean. I'd been messing with the Bach piece for a
         while before HoH and it just seemed right for it." (PC)
(#1)
  TITLE: Piano Sonata in C (KV 545)
 ARTIST: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
(#2)
  TITLE: Sailor's Hornpipe
 ARTIST: Traditional
(#3)
  TITLE: Any Old Iron
 ARTIST: Traditional
COMMENT: This is the ending riff from the song.
(#4)
  TITLE: Birthday Fanfare
 ARTIST: Traditional
(#6)
  TITLE: Greensleeves
 ARTIST: Unknown
(#7)
  TITLE: How Much is That Doggie in the Window
 ARTIST: Bob Merrill
(#8)
  TITLE: When Johnny Comes Marching Home Again
 ARTIST: Traditional, Patrick Gilmore (lyrics)
COMMENT: This bit sounds like the end of the chorus in WJCMHA.
(#9)
  TITLE: Dragnet Theme [from the television series]
 ARTIST: Miklós Rózsa & Walter Schumann
(#10)
  TITLE: An der schönen blauen Donau (Blue Danube)
 ARTIST: Johann Strauß
(#11)
  TITLE: When Johnny Comes Marching Home Again
 ARTIST: Traditional, Patrick Gilmore (lyrics)
(#12)
  TITLE: Sabre Wulf, Tune #3
 ARTIST: Greg Duddle <?>

/MUSICIANS/C/Clarke_Peter/Mission_of_Mercy.sid
COMMENT: Also used in the game "Double Take" from Ocean.

/MUSICIANS/C/Clarke_Peter/Mystery_of_the_Nile.sid
(#2)
  TITLE: The Hootchy Kootchy Dance
 ARTIST: Sol Bloom

/MUSICIANS/C/Clarke_Peter/Ocean_Loader_3.sid
COMMENT: "I wanted to trick the listeners with this. Start with the old,
         familiar Galway opening bars and then 'Cry Havoc! And let slip the
         dogs of war!' :) Written in secret just in case it failed, at home,
         and then presented as a finished work." (PC)
         According to Paul Hughes, Peter named it "Ocean Dries Up".

/MUSICIANS/C/Clarke_Peter/Repton_3.sid
COMMENT: "My first ever pair of tunes for a game. I wrote the in-game tune at
         home and then triumphantly turned up at Paulies' house to be told we
         needed two tunes. Oops! I wrote the title screen tune in about three
         hours flat in his bedroom." (PC)
(#2)
  TITLE: Repton 3 [from the BBC Model B game]
 ARTIST: Paul Hughes & Peter Clarke

/MUSICIANS/C/Clarke_Peter/Scooby_Doo.sid
COMMENT: "It's a common misconception that Mark Cooksey did the music -
         actually Mark did the sound effects, whilst Peter Clarke composed the
         music. The reason I know this is because I wrote the music player for
         it. The story goes that myself and Pete where hired to do the music
         for £600. When we delivered they turned around and said, ahh yes but
         we've had to pay £200 to get the sound effects done so here's
         £400)..." (Comment by Paul Hughes)
(#1)
 AUTHOR: Peter Clarke
  TITLE: Scooby-Doo, Where Are You! [from the cartoon series] (0:00)
 ARTIST: David Mook & Ben Raliegh
  TITLE: Mysterioso Pizzicato (aka The Villain's Theme) (1:17-1:31)
 ARTIST: Jens Bodewalt Lampe
(#2)
 AUTHOR: Mark Cooksey
(#3)
 AUTHOR: Mark Cooksey
(#4)
 AUTHOR: Mark Cooksey
(#5)
 AUTHOR: Mark Cooksey
(#6)
 AUTHOR: Mark Cooksey
(#7)
 AUTHOR: Mark Cooksey
(#8)
 AUTHOR: Mark Cooksey

/MUSICIANS/C/Clarke_Peter/Tai-Pan_disk_version.sid
COMMENT: "I quite like composing to a strict brief and this was one of those
         projects where I felt the oriental feel was essential. It was the
         first time I went and talked in detail to the story-boarders and then
         included some sound fx in the music track; the ship creaking, the
         ship's bell, etc. This kind of sound mix is now absolutely commonplace
         in modern games. In fact, what goes into a soundtrack nowadays, we
         could only dream about back in the 80's. But, this was an early, basic
         attempt to get some atmosphere into the game." (PC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Clarke_Peter/Tai-Pan_tape_version.sid
COMMENT: "I quite like composing to a strict brief and this was one of those
         projects where I felt the oriental feel was essential. It was the
         first time I went and talked in detail to the story-boarders and then
         included some sound fx in the music track; the ship creaking, the
         ship's bell, etc. This kind of sound mix is now absolutely commonplace
         in modern games. In fact, what goes into a soundtrack nowadays, we
         could only dream about back in the 80's. But, this was an early, basic
         attempt to get some atmosphere into the game." (PC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Clarke_Peter/Top_Duck.sid
(#9)
  TITLE: Old McDonald Had A Farm
 ARTIST: Traditional

### /MUSICIANS/C/Clements_Mark ###############################################

/MUSICIANS/C/Clements_Mark/Heatseeker_version_1.sid
COMMENT: This was meant to be the music used in Thalamus' 'Heatseeker', however
         the programmer Paul O'Malley didn't give Mark enough memory to play
         with and so the music was unused. Mark states that this music suits
         the game better.

/MUSICIANS/C/Clements_Mark/Heatseeker_version_2.sid
COMMENT: A second attempt of the music for Thalamus' 'Heatseeker', however the
         programmer Paul O'Malley didn't give Mark enough memory to play with
         and so the music was unused.

 ARTIST: Matt Gray
