### /MUSICIANS/C/Cooksey_Mark ################################################

/MUSICIANS/C/Cooksey_Mark/
COMMENT: Mark Cooksey's own comments are denoted (MC).

/MUSICIANS/C/Cooksey_Mark/1942.sid
COMMENT: "This Elite game involved flying a plane around and bombing stuff. I
         think it was based on an overhead view. Version 1 of the music has the
         633 Squadron theme for tune 1 but for copyright reasons I had to redo
         the music using an original tune. This tune was not as good as the
         633 tune but I probably had the minimum time to come up with
         something." (MC)
(#1)
  TITLE: 633 Squadron [from the movie]
 ARTIST: Ron Goodwin
(#2)
  TITLE: Nostalgy
 ARTIST: Paul de Senneville & Olivier Toussaint

/MUSICIANS/C/Cooksey_Mark/1942_v2.sid
COMMENT: Although an arcade conversion, none of this music is either converted
         or influenced by the original. See comment for
         /MUSICIANS/C/Cooksey_Mark/1942.sid
(#2)
  TITLE: Nostalgy
 ARTIST: Paul de Senneville & Olivier Toussaint

/MUSICIANS/C/Cooksey_Mark/911_Tiger_Shark.sid
  TITLE: Popcorn [from Music To Moog By]
 ARTIST: Gershon Kingsley

/MUSICIANS/C/Cooksey_Mark/A_Question_of_Sport.sid
  TITLE: A Question of Sport [from the TV series]
 ARTIST: <?>
COMMENT: The theme tune to the BBC TV sports quiz show, which the game is based
         on.

/MUSICIANS/C/Cooksey_Mark/Airwolf.sid
  TITLE: Airwolf Theme [from the TV series]
 ARTIST: Sylvester Levay
COMMENT: "When I was interviewed by Brian Wilcox at Elite for a job they sent
         me home with a little task to prove that I had some computer and
         progamming skills. The task was to make the Oric Atmos computer I had
         at home play the theme tune to Airwolf. Over the weekend I managed to
         get the tune playing using a very simple assembler that I had written
         in basic. As a result I got the job at Elite and the first thing they
         had me doing was programming the Airwolf tune on the C64 as they were
         doing a game based on the TV show. After this I found myself doing
         music all the time and that is how I got started." (MC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Cooksey_Mark/Airwolf_II.sid
COMMENT: Heavily inspired by Harold Faltermeyer's Axel F.
         "This is a rather peculiar tune, I can't remember anything about this
         game really, must be based on a helicopter (but not necessarily so
         knowing elite). The tune sounds vaguely Egyptian or Arabic." (MC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Cooksey_Mark/Battle_Island.sid
COMMENT: "I never saw this game, I received a phone call and was asked to do
         the music. I had a feeling though that the game might be a bit like
         Commando so I did a tune that was kind of inspired by Rob Hubbard's
         music for that game. Of course it's nowhere near as good as maestro
         Rob's tune but it's certainly not the worst tune I ever did." (MC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Cooksey_Mark/Battle_Ships.sid
COMMENT: "This game was based on the well known board game. Tune 2 is a weird
         victory ditty that was composed by my brother. Tune 3 I think is the
         highscore music and tune 4 is the ingame music, just a 2 channel
         ambient track which left 1 channel for sfx. Tune 5 seems to be corrupt
         and out of sync for some reason but was meant to be used for action
         parts of the game." (MC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Cooksey_Mark/Bomb_Jack.sid
COMMENT: Does not cover the arcade version.
         "Bombjack 1 was based on the old coin op machine.
         The title tune is a Jean-Michel Jarre cover. We used to copy tunes
         like this all the time in the early days, I think the legislation at
         the time didn't cover computer based music, that situation didn't last
         very long though and we then needed to do original compositions
         (supposedly). Only tune 2 is from the original arcade machine.
         I seem to remember that in the original version of the music I used
         Lady Madonna by the Beatles." (MC)
(#1)
  TITLE: Magnetic Fields, Part 2 [from Magnetic Fields]
 ARTIST: Jean Michel Jarre
(#5)
  TITLE: Badinerie [from Orchestral Suite No. 2 in B minor (BWV 1067)]
 ARTIST: Johann Sebastian Bach

/MUSICIANS/C/Cooksey_Mark/Bomb_Jack_II.sid
COMMENT: "Bombjack 2 may have started out life as Thundar-cats, certainly the
         1st tune is copied from the original tune of the cartoon series." (MC)
(#1)
  TITLE: Thundercats [from the cartoon series]
 ARTIST: Bernard Hoffer
(#2)
  TITLE: Thundercats [from the cartoon series]
 ARTIST: Bernard Hoffer

/MUSICIANS/C/Cooksey_Mark/Cataball.sid
COMMENT: Cataball was also released under the name "Hoppin' Mad", (C) 1988 by
         Elite.

/MUSICIANS/C/Cooksey_Mark/Commando_86.sid
  TITLE: Tubular Bells, Part 1 [from Tubular Bells] (0:00-0:23)
 ARTIST: Mike Oldfield
  TITLE: The Battle [from Journey to the Centre of the Earth] (0:43-1:48)
 ARTIST: Rick Wakeman
COMMENT: This music was also used in the game Duet, which is basically the same
         as Commando'86 but with the first 23 seconds removed, probably due to
         copyright infringement.
         "Again I can't remember anything about this game really, the tune
         however is a hotch potch of covered tunes including Tubular Bells." (MC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Cooksey_Mark/Ghosts_n_Goblins.sid
COMMENT: "Without doubt the game which is most closely associated with me.
         The highscore tune (1) is a copy from the original arcade machine.
         However, having listened to the in game tune which was a complicated
         harpsichord tune using lots of channels, I decided to compose my own
         ghostly tune. Again the tune is not completely original using elements
         from several sources including Chopin and other bizarre sources (my
         mom's old organ vinyl records from the 70's). I'm still mystified
         about why I went for that strange percussion but it seems to work
         somehow." (MC)
(#1)
  TITLE: Hiscore [from the arcade game Ghosts'n Goblins]
 ARTIST: Ayako Mori
COMMENT: Converted from the arcade version. It was inspired by Chopin.
(#2)
  TITLE: Prelude, Op. 28, No. 20 (0:00-0:08)
 ARTIST: Frédéric François Chopin
  TITLE: Dangerous Dreams [from Wunderlich Pops 3] (0:30)
 ARTIST: Klaus Wunderlich

/MUSICIANS/C/Cooksey_Mark/Great_Gurianos.sid
COMMENT: Not covers of the arcade version, but certainly inspired by it.

/MUSICIANS/C/Cooksey_Mark/Gremlins_2-The_New_Batch.sid
COMMENT: "I remember this project very well because most of Elite went down to
         the 20th Cent Fox HQ in London. We had a private pre-release screening
         of Gremlins II in their mini cinema, kitted out with surround sound.
         The computer press were invited and Steve Wilcox gave a talk before
         the film was screened. After wards we went to a Thai restaurant but
         being a potatoes & gravy man I passed on the food and hot footed it
         home. Worryingly, listening to the music I'm not 100% sure if I did it
         or not. I think I did cause certain elements sound like my music but
         the highscore tune (No 6) sounds far too good. Perhaps by 1990 I had
         improved the music player routine and decided to do a good job for
         this game." (MC)
(#1)
  TITLE: Gremlins Credits [from the movie Gremlins 2]
 ARTIST: Jerry Goldsmith
(#2)
  TITLE: Gremlins Credits [from the movie Gremlins 2]
 ARTIST: Jerry Goldsmith
(#3)
  TITLE: Gizmo Theme Song [from the movie Gremlins 2]
 ARTIST: Jerry Goldsmith
(#4)
  TITLE: <?> [from the movie Gremlins 2]
 ARTIST: Jerry Goldsmith
(#5)
  TITLE: Gremlins Credits [from the movie Gremlins 2]
 ARTIST: Jerry Goldsmith

/MUSICIANS/C/Cooksey_Mark/Jackal.sid
COMMENT: "This music was, for once an actual conversion from the arcade
         machine. I liked the original tunes and decided I could do a
         reasonable conversion of them. [...] I seem to remember I didn't get
         paid for this because the dev company went bust and all the products
         were bought by somebody else." (MC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Cooksey_Mark/Live_and_Let_Die.sid
(#1)
  TITLE: James Bond Theme [from the James Bond series of movies]
 ARTIST: Monty Norman
COMMENT: Freestyle cover, based on the original.
(#2)
  TITLE: James Bond Theme [from the James Bond series of movies]
 ARTIST: Monty Norman
COMMENT: Freestyle cover, based on the original.
(#14)
COMMENT: A few notes from the James Bond Theme.

/MUSICIANS/C/Cooksey_Mark/Paperboy.sid
COMMENT: "We had this coin op in the office at Elite and we spent many an hour
         'researching' it. The music however used many channels and didn't have
         a particularly catchy theme so I did an original composition. The tune
         is a bit on the weird side but I thought that it went quite well with
         the fairly slow pace of the cycling round the streets bit of the game.
         On the coin op there were a number of speech samples and some of these
         were put into the Amiga version of the game which did have the
         original music." (MC)
(#1)
  TITLE: Main Theme [from the arcade game Paper Boy]
 ARTIST: Hal Canon
COMMENT: This is the same as tune #2, but played at three times the tempo.
         It might be influenced by the arcade version.
(#2)
  TITLE: Main Theme [from the arcade game Paper Boy]
 ARTIST: Hal Canon
COMMENT: It might be influenced by the arcade version.
(#3)
  TITLE: Training Course [from the arcade game Paper Boy]
 ARTIST: Hal Canon
COMMENT: It might be influenced by the arcade version.

/MUSICIANS/C/Cooksey_Mark/Pirates_in_Hyperspace.sid
COMMENT: "This was a game that was done on a shoestring. I think the developers
         only got about £500 as a result I was paid about £50." (MC)
(#2)
  TITLE: Battlestar Galactica [from the TV series] (2:18-2:29)
 ARTIST: Stu Phillips & Glen A. Larson
  TITLE: Battlestar Galactica [from the TV series] (2:37-2:48)
 ARTIST: Stu Phillips & Glen A. Larson

/MUSICIANS/C/Cooksey_Mark/Ramparts.sid
COMMENT: "The 2nd tune in this file has a Ghost n Goblin type of start then
         goes into a Tubular Bells type bit, then finally goes into a sort of
         pop meets the 16th century type theme. Tune 3, the win ditty sounds
         much like one of the Bombjack ditties! I must have felt a bit lazy on
         that day. Tune 1 is the highscore tune and I have done a full version
         of this on keyboard etc. The people who developed this game had a
         pokey little room on the upper story of a computer store in Walsall
         before they moved into more spacious offices. I can't remember much
         about them, but the head bloke's first name may have been Sean, wonder
         where he is now?" (MC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Cooksey_Mark/Salamander.sid
COMMENT: All tunes cover the arcade version.
         The NTSC version of the game is published as "Lifeforce".
(#1)
  TITLE: The Power of Anger [from the arcade game Salamander]
 ARTIST: Yoshiaki Hatano & Miki Higashino / Konami Kukeiha Club
(#2)
  TITLE: Fly High [from the arcade game Salamander]
 ARTIST: Yoshiaki Hatano & Miki Higashino / Konami Kukeiha Club

 ARTIST: Yoshiaki Hatano & Miki Higashino / Konami Kukeiha Club

/MUSICIANS/C/Cooksey_Mark/Scare_Bear.sid
COMMENT: "Haven't got a clue what this game is about, I can barely (no pun
         intended) remember doing the tune and the file is included just as a
         curio." (MC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Cooksey_Mark/Space_Academy.sid
(#2)
COMMENT: Covers military funeral theme?

/MUSICIANS/C/Cooksey_Mark/Space_Harrier.sid
COMMENT: All tunes but tune #4 are based on the arcade version.
         "I used to love playing this arcade machine when we had got it at the
         offices at Elite, those Easter Island type stone heads that flew
         towards you were especially effective. The original in game tune had
         got a memorable melody so I decided to stick to it. The middle section
         of my version may be original though, the tune plays a little faster
         than on the arcade machine. This was due to the fact that my routine
         didn't contain a fractional timer at that point. Speeds were
         determined by the shortest note length which could be 1,2,3 or 4 etc.
         The speed differences were thus 100%, 50,33% etc. with no in between
         values. The rest of the tunes in the set are original compositions I
         think, maybe tune 2 was close to the arcade version." (MC)
(#1)
  TITLE: Main Theme [from the arcade game Space Harrier]
 ARTIST: Hiroshi Miyauchi (Hiro/SEGA Sound Team)
(#2)
  TITLE: Squilla [from the arcade game Space Harrier]
 ARTIST: Hiroshi Miyauchi (Hiro/SEGA Sound Team)
(#4)
  TITLE: Prelude No. 2 in C minor [from Well-tempered Clavier I (BWV 847)]
 ARTIST: Johann Sebastian Bach

/MUSICIANS/C/Cooksey_Mark/Starforce_Nova.sid
(#2)
  TITLE: I Feel Love [from I Remember Yesterday]
 ARTIST: Donna Summer

/MUSICIANS/C/Cooksey_Mark/Storm_Warrior.sid
COMMENT: "This is one of my favourite sets of compositions with low pass filter
         use, which depending on what version of the C64 you had sounded
         correct or otherwise the filtered channel sounded very woolly.
         Tune 1 has a kind of John Carpenter feel, tune 2 is a Bach influenced
         piece, tune 3 is a very echoey menacing tune. Tune 4 is an action type
         tune, tune 5 is a durge, tune 6 is game over, tune 7 is a dancey
         highscore tune and tune 8 is another ingame tune." (MC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Cooksey_Mark/WWF_European_Rampage_Tour.sid
COMMENT: "The developer of this game was a company called Arc Developments.
         I think this may have been their only C64 project but I did do other
         work for them on other games systems. The plan was to do rock music
         for this game but it ended up sounding a little weak and slow.
         This was probably the last C64 music I did before I moved on to other
         platforms such as the original gameboy and SNES etc. The person who
         used to pay the cheques out at Arc used to make me jump through hoops
         to get my money, he was just taking the p*ss and sometimes I couldn't
         help but laugh." (MC)
(#1)
  TITLE: Real American (Hulk Hogan's Theme)
 ARTIST: Jim Johnston
(#2)
  TITLE: Land of Hope and Glory [from Pomp and Circumstance March No. 1]
 ARTIST: Edward Elgar (music), A.C. Benson (lyrics)
COMMENT: Used as Macho Man Randy Savage's Theme.

COMMENT: See /MUSICIANS/H/Hubbard_Rob/Warhawk.sid for more information.

         Chlebec) are denoted (RC).

/MUSICIANS/C/CreaMD/I_Am_in_Love.sid
COMMENT: "I composed it when I was in love with a girl called Galina. She had
         short dark brown hair, blue eyes and a beautiful face. At least I
         thought so. She was self-confident, charismatic, not this tell me what
         I should do and I will do it master type. I loved her but still didn't
         know what she really thought. She left the university and didn't reply
         on my letters. Maybe when I'm older I'll write some memoirs and I will
         write the full story then." (RC)

/MUSICIANS/C/CreaMD/Inexplicable_Obsession_by_Vengeance.sid
  TITLE: Vengeance
 ARTIST: Jay Derrett
COMMENT: Covers /MUSICIANS/D/Derrett_Jay/Vengeance.sid

### /MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/ ###############################################

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/
COMMENT: Comments by Owen Crowley are denoted (OC).
         "The majority of my famous tunes were composed under the "CRD" and
         "Conrad" scener handles. From the beginning of 2014, my handle changed
         to my real name, Owen." (OC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/242.sid
  TITLE: 242 [from the Amiga demo]
 ARTIST: Papa Smurf
COMMENT: "A C64 SID remake of the famous Amiga demo "242", originally requested
         by Vedos/svenonacid. Due to the delay of the demo it was orignally
         planned for, as well as lack of inspiration for new music, this tune
         was submitted in the music compeition at X'2010 demoparty, reaching
         8th place out of 24 music entries." (OC)

COMMENT: "Unfortunately there were various complaints about these songs not
         being the orignal Bomberman tunes. I only ever played 'Dynablaster'
         on the Amiga before and was not sure whether it was the original tune
         or not.  Also, I had a tight deadline to get the tunes finished for
         the game." (OC)

         Chips'" (OC)

         "Originally this tune lasted over 5 minutes in its early stage of
         development. But due to the compo's time restriction I had to chop it
         down a fair bit - where I accidentally forgot to keep a back up of the
         original." (OC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/I_Love_the_Cube_tune_1.sid
  TITLE: Title [from the amiga game Cube-X] (0:00-0:35)
 ARTIST: André Warschun
COMMENT: Covered only on the first 35 seconds, rest is original composition.
         "Cube-X was one of my favourite puzzle games on the Amiga.  When
         members in Samar Productions (Mr.Wegi and Isildur) asked me to write
         music for a demo named "I Love The Cube", I thought it would be fun
         to include the similar melodies at the beginning. ;)" (OC)

  TITLE: Me Is Back
 ARTIST: Joachim Wijnhoven
COMMENT: "A co-operation with Yogibear/Protovision. Joachim wrote the original
         song with Re-Noise and then asked me to make a 2SID version of it."
         (OC)

 ARTIST: Martijn Schutten

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Maniac_Mansion.sid
(#1)
  TITLE: Maniac Mansion, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Chris Grigg & David Lawrence

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Midnight_Cruise_2SID.sid
COMMENT: Won first place at the Silesia Party 2 2SID music competition.
         "Shamefully, this was written at the time when SID emulation was not
         at its best. There is a cymbal-crash sound that I expected to play
         with a phase-shifting effect, not knowing at the time that you need to
         set the waveforms to $91-$9f and then do a hard-restart with $09 on
         the next frame. Due to this lack of knowledge, this can't be heard
         when played on a real C64 (with 2 SID chips) or on recent versions of
         Vice. A pity, as I don't have the source module any more. :(" (OC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/NEH_Promotion_Soundtrack_2SID.sid
COMMENT: "James (Heavy Stylus), project leader of Retro Gamer CD (RGCD),
         contacted me sometime in mid-2011, asking if I could produce some SID
         music/sounds for a promotion video of Enthusi/Onslaught's C64 game
         'Not Even Human', as I was the person who wrote the music for the game
         back in 2008. He sent me a video of the Promotion clip and I began
         syncing sounds with it, using the Stereo version of Goat-Tracker. This
         was the result and he seemed very pleased with it. The promotion video
         is available on Youtube, or the RGCD website itself." (OC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Pokemonitor.sid
  TITLE: Pokemon Theme [from the cartoon series]
 ARTIST: T. Loeffler & J. Siegler

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Psychopunks_of_Uproar.sid
COMMENT: Made in 2012, released in 2014.

### /MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Old_Tunes ######################################

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Old_Tunes/
COMMENT: "These were old tunes I composed between 1997-1999, when I was only a
         child. In those days, I didn't have access to the internet and was
         stuck with really old music tools like Electrosound, RoMuzak, and
         Future Composer V4.0. I also tried out other editors such as
         RockMonitor, Sound-Tracker '64 (the 1988 version by Mechanix), and
         Pro-Drum (Dutch USA Team) - but I never made any final tunes with
         those. All in all, this was my first learning curves of making music
         on the C64." (OC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Old_Tunes/Axel_F.sid
  TITLE: Axel F [from the movie Beverly Hills Cop] (0:00-1:31)
 ARTIST: Harold Faltermeyer
  TITLE: Mega Apocalypse, Tune #1 (1:32-2:17)
 ARTIST: Rob Hubbard
  TITLE: Axel F [from the movie Beverly Hills Cop] (2:18)
 ARTIST: Harold Faltermeyer

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Old_Tunes/B_I_Sound.sid
COMMENT: "Have no idea where B.I came from, and it has nothing to do with
         bisexual (I was only a child then.) :P" (OC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Old_Tunes/B_and_B_Muzak.sid
COMMENT: "Have no idea where B&B came from, although it is not related to Bed
         & Breakfast (maybe I composed the tune while I was in bed and having
         breakfast ?!?  I just can't remember :P" (OC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Old_Tunes/Express_Zak.sid
COMMENT: "For some bizzare reason, the compiled tune ended up being really
         large in memory!" (OC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Old_Tunes/Getting_Late.sid
COMMENT: "The last tune I wrote during the 1990s (and possibly the best one in
         my opinion), before returning to C64 music making in 2004 when I
         finally got access to the internet. ;)" (OC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Old_Tunes/JCHs_Ending.sid
  TITLE: <?> [from the Amiga MOD module]
 ARTIST: Morten Hansen (ICE of Channel42)
COMMENT: Based on /MUSICIANS/J/JCH/Ending.sid

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Old_Tunes/Little_Sound.sid
COMMENT: "This is an extremely loose cover of 'Living on Video', mainly the
         bass sounded similar" (OC)

  TITLE: Scout, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel
COMMENT: "This is basically the exact same as the original tune, except some
         instruments were slightly modified.  Very lame, I know! :)" (OC)

  TITLE: Brainless (0:00-0:30)

         DRAX/Vibrants." (OC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Old_Tunes/Pams_Tune.sid
  TITLE: Für Elise (0:00-0:29)
 ARTIST: Ludwig van Beethoven
  TITLE: The Entertainer (0:30-0:52)
 ARTIST: Scott Joplin
COMMENT: "This was originally composed by my sister (Pamela), when we were both
         playing around with Electrosound in those days. She wrote the actual
         lead where I completed it with drum and bass instruments.
         Theoretically, this was the first C64 tune I ever wrote, and certainly
         the last thing my sister ever did on a Commodore 64. ;)" (OC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Old_Tunes/Sounds_Like_Wolf.sid
COMMENT: "A re-write of Jonathan Dunn's Operation Wolf theme in Romuzak editor,
         with a twist of my own work." (OC)

### /MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Worktunes ######################################

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Worktunes/
COMMENT: "These were worktunes I composed between 2004 and 2009 and most of
         them are unfinished or very short tunes." (OC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Worktunes/ACDC_Rulez.sid
  TITLE: Back in Black [from Back in Black]
 ARTIST: AC/DC
COMMENT: "A tribute to one of my all-time-favourite metal bands!" (OC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Worktunes/Airwolf.sid
  TITLE: Airwolf Theme [from the TV series]
 ARTIST: Sylvester Levay

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Worktunes/Airwolf_Old_Version.sid
  TITLE: Airwolf Theme [from the TV series]
 ARTIST: Sylvester Levay

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Worktunes/Another_Test_Tune.sid
COMMENT: "This was another test song I made with my own music player which
         used zero-page addresses.  The song is inspired from that famous
         "American boxer training in Russia" track from Rocky IV. ;)" (OC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Worktunes/Badger_Mushroom_Snake.sid
  TITLE: Badgers [from the flash video at www.weebls-stuff.com]
 ARTIST: Weebl
COMMENT: "This pathetic tune was to see if I could do some vocal sounds via
         filters. I wanted to see if the tune could say: 'Badger Badger Badger
         Mushroom Mushroom Snaaaake!...etc'. Unfortunately is wasn't a success.
         :P  However, the song itself is a tribute to the well known 'Badgers'
         video made by Weebl (http://www.weebls-stuff.com/toons/badgers/)" (OC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Worktunes/Barbarian_2.sid
  TITLE: Barbarian II, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Richard Joseph

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Worktunes/Blue_Monday.sid
  TITLE: Blue Monday
 ARTIST: New Order
COMMENT: "This was my very first tune on the C64 from my return to making C64
         music. It was composed in Sadotracker, one of the first music tools I
         tried out before officially moving onto Goat-Tracker. The tune is
         unfinished, so it will go out of sync after a while." (OC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Worktunes/Breath.sid
  TITLE: Every Breath You Take [from Synchronicity]
 ARTIST: The Police

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Worktunes/Cultromix.sid
  TITLE: Cultronic (part 1)
 ARTIST: Jörgen Andersson (Joe)
COMMENT: "I liked the original by Joe/Rizing a lot, so I did a re-make for fun."
         (OC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Worktunes/Dark_Drive.sid
COMMENT: "This tune is unfinished." (OC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Worktunes/Dialects_Remake.sid
  TITLE: Dialects
 ARTIST: Glenn Rune Gallefoss
COMMENT: "I liked the original by GRG a lot, so I did a re-make for fun."
         (OC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Worktunes/Digi-Freak.sid
  TITLE: Danger Freak, Tune #9 (0:02-0:48)
 ARTIST: Chris Hülsbeck
  TITLE: Danger Freak, Tune #2/#6 (0:50-1:36)
 ARTIST: Chris Hülsbeck
COMMENT: "This was the second time I used my digi player routine with a tune.
         The tune on its own was composed be me in NinjaTracker." (OC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Worktunes/Digi_Test.sid
  TITLE: Sixpack of Cola
 ARTIST: Marc van den Bovenkamp (No-XS)
COMMENT: "This was the first time I used my digi player routine with a tune.
         The tune used for the test is 'Sixpack of Cola' by No-XS, excluding
         the filters.  Here's a fun fact:  Some of the drum samples come from
         the intro sequence of "Blood Money" on the Amiga." (OC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Worktunes/DraXMas.sid
  TITLE: Tears of Christmas [from the XM module]
 ARTIST: Thomas Mogensen (DRAX)
COMMENT: "A couple things about this tune. First, it was written in my own
         music player which used zero page addresses only. Secondly, I thought
         of the tune name by this method: DRAX  +  XM  +  Christmas  =
         DraXMas" (OC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Worktunes/Fucnk.sid
COMMENT: "The score of this tune was similarily injected into another tune
         called "Rushed Zak", which I publicly released. "Fucnk", however,
         keeps the original version. Personally, I wish I released this
         version instead. :|" (OC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Worktunes/GhostTrackers_Remix.sid
  TITLE: GhostTrackers
 ARTIST: Hein Holt
COMMENT: "First of all, this tune is copyright (C) 2005 by Hein Holt, who wrote
         the original concept of this song.  When I first started using Goat
         Tracker 2, this was one of the example songs and I had a go twiddling
         the song to my own liking. However this version of the tune WAS NOT by
         any means released under my name, due to the concequences of using
         someone else's work.  This was just a song I had a go modifying a bit
         while I was learning to use Goat Tracker. There was no attempt of
         stealing behind this whatsoever." (OC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Worktunes/Halloween.sid
  TITLE: Halloween [from the movie]
 ARTIST: John Carpenter
COMMENT: "This was initially composed in 2004 on the FIRST version of
         GoatTracker, but was migrated onto GT version 2 in 2005." (OC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Worktunes/How_Funkee.sid
COMMENT: "This tune is the same as 'My Funky C64!' except it is faster and has
         some slight alterations." (OC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Worktunes/Illuminate.sid
COMMENT: "An older version of the tune used for Richard Bayliss' demo: Swinging
         in 2007." (OC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Worktunes/Lamer_Gamers.sid
COMMENT: "An earlier version of the title tune in "Bomberman C64" which, in all
         honesty, is my preferred version. :P" (OC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Worktunes/Loading.sid
COMMENT: "This tune would have been used for a loading screen. But since there
         are so many demos which don't need loading screens anymore, I decided
         to leave it." (OC)

 ARTIST: Jeroen Soede

         except it has instruments designed for 3x speed and less pattern
         data." (OC)
         See /MUSICIANS/S/SoedeSoft/Soede_Jeroen/Magic_Funk.sid

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Worktunes/Supaplex.sid
  TITLE: Supaplex [from the PC game]
 ARTIST: David Whittaker
COMMENT: "One of my all-time favourite Boulderdash-like puzzles games on the
         Amiga and PC.  Potentially, I was going to add digi drums to the tune,
         which is why there are no drum instruments playing, as well as being
         designed to play on a 6581 SID chip." (OC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Worktunes/Unstoppable.sid
COMMENT: "This tune is unfinished." (OC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Worktunes/XO.sid
  TITLE: XO [from the Impulse Tracker module]
 ARTIST: Kamil Wolnikowski (Jammer)
COMMENT: "I came across a PC game called "XO", written by Raf/Vulture Design.
         The simple but nice music module was composed by Jammer, one of my
         favourite C64 composers.  I decided to make a C64 SID version of this
         tune for the fun of it.  I also remember being nervous to release it
         in the case that Jammer would discover it and get pissed off at me
         for stealing his melodies :D, but it turns out it never happened. ;)"
         (OC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowley_Owen/Worktunes/X_T_C.sid
COMMENT: "X.T.C is my short term of saying 'ecstacy' where ecstacy was used by
         a lot of clubbers who were into rave/techno, hense the genre to this
         awful tune." (OC)

/MUSICIANS/C/Crowther_Antony/Zig_Zag.sid
COMMENT: Together with Michael Winterberg, Antony Crowther pioneered the art of
         multiple-X players. Zigzag, released in 1987, is one of the very first
         examples of a 4X routine, updating sound parameters 200 times a
         second.

### /MUSICIANS/C/Cube ########################################################

/MUSICIANS/C/Cube/
COMMENT: !Cube (Toni Lönnberg) own comments are denoted (TL).

/MUSICIANS/C/Cube/Angel_Project.sid
COMMENT: "4th in the olschool music competition at Assembly 2000." (TL)

/MUSICIANS/C/Cube/Glide.sid
COMMENT: "2nd in the oldschool music competition at Assembly 2007." (TL)

/MUSICIANS/C/Cube/Martinology.sid
COMMENT: "4th in the C64 music competition at Assembly'99. A tribute to the
         legend Martin Galway. I tried to use similar sounds to his and tried
         to imitate the overall style of his tunes but it didn't come out as
         good as I had hoped." (TL)

/MUSICIANS/C/Cube/Modulation.sid
  TITLE: Pajaro [from the Atari ST demo Synergy Megademo]
 ARTIST: Joris DeMan (Scavenger of Synergy)

/MUSICIANS/C/Cube/Molecules.sid
COMMENT: Won first place at the Assembly 2001 oldschool music competition.
         "A tribute to Scavenger/Synergy, probably the best composer on the
         Atari ST. The tune has a similar chord progression to Scavenger's tune
         Pajaro and a similar motif to the one in his tune used in the TCC93
         Invitation Intro." (TL)

/MUSICIANS/C/Cube/Oldskool.sid
  TITLE: TCC3 Invitation Intro (Atari ST)
 ARTIST: Joris DeMan (Scavenger of Synergy)
COMMENT: "2nd in the C64 music competition at Assembly'97. My first ever tune
         using the SID chip." (TL)

/MUSICIANS/C/Cyberbrain/Hardware_Accelerated_Samples.sid
  TITLE: My Humps [from Monkey Business] (0:00-2:24)
 ARTIST: The Black Eyed Peas
  TITLE: My Humps [from Monkey Business] (3:02)

 ARTIST: Traditional
COMMENT: This anthem is traditional and possibly one of the most known national
         anthems in the world. Each verse was written at a different time,
         ranging from the 1740s to the present day.

/MUSICIANS/D/DRAX/Harald_Haardtand.sid
(#1)
COMMENT: This was planned to be the title tune, but was left unused, the game
         actually uses /MUSICIANS/D/DRAX/Funk.sid

/MUSICIANS/D/DRAX/Hermetic.sid
COMMENT: "This is the music for the game which was originally titled "Perplex".
         In the beginning DRAX did the soundtrack for the game while I made
         the sfx. At some time during the production of the music, DRAX thought
         he could use some help and I agreed to do some of the music. While the
         music and sfx was done in 1990, the game was put on ice by the
         Austrian guys as they became tired of it. Some years later they
         revived the project, finished it, and sold it to a German software
         house under the new name, "Hermetic"". (JCH)
(#1)
   NAME: Intro
 AUTHOR: Thomas Mogensen (DRAX)
(#2)
   NAME: Title Screen
 AUTHOR: Thomas Mogensen (DRAX)
(#3)
   NAME: Get Ready
 AUTHOR: Jens-Christian Huus (JCH)
(#4)
   NAME: Game Over
 AUTHOR: Jens-Christian Huus (JCH)
(#5)
   NAME: In-game 1
 AUTHOR: Thomas Mogensen (DRAX)
(#6)
   NAME: End of Level Monster 1
 AUTHOR: Thomas Mogensen (DRAX)
(#7)
   NAME: In-game 2
 AUTHOR: Thomas Mogensen (DRAX)
(#8)
   NAME: End of Level Monster 2
 AUTHOR: Thomas Mogensen (DRAX)
(#9)
   NAME: In-game 3
 AUTHOR: Thomas Mogensen (DRAX)
(#10)
   NAME: End of Level Monster 3
 AUTHOR: Thomas Mogensen (DRAX)
(#11)
   NAME: In-game 4
 AUTHOR: Jens-Christian Huus (JCH)
(#12)
   NAME: End of Level Monster 4
 AUTHOR: Jens-Christian Huus (JCH)
(#13)
   NAME: End Sequence
 AUTHOR: Thomas Mogensen (DRAX)

### /MUSICIANS/D/DRAX/Worktunes ##############################################

/MUSICIANS/D/DRAX/Worktunes/
COMMENT: DRAX has given us permission to release his worktunes in HVSC. Any
         tunes that he has given a name, we have named to fall in line with
         HVSC standards. Any tune which he named 'Worktune' we have preserved
         the original file name, which was DRAX hammering the C64 keyboard at
         random to choose a name.

/MUSICIANS/D/DRAX/Worktunes/Abracadabra.sid
  TITLE: Abracadabra
 ARTIST: The Steve Miller Band

/MUSICIANS/D/DRAX/Worktunes/Adam_Gilmore.sid
  TITLE: Jocky Wilson's Darts Compendium, Tune #11
 ARTIST: Adam Gilmore
COMMENT: Covers /MUSICIANS/G/Gilmore_Adam/Jocky_Wilsons_Darts_Compendium.sid

  TITLE: Gremlins [from the movie]
 ARTIST: Jerry Goldsmith

         Q: Is it Ben or Benn?
         A: "Ben is my real name....Benn was a nick from Compu-Net days - the
         double letter was all the rage...Ratt, Bogg etc. etc." (BD)

/MUSICIANS/D/Daglish_Ben/Last_Ninja.sid
COMMENT: "I got the phone call from Mark [Cale] asking me to write some level
         tunes - I wrote the music, went down there [to System 3] to meet
         Archer Maclean (? I think it was Arch that put the driver in.....),
         got offered Mark Cale's slightly-dodgy-import-status left-hand-drive
         BMW, said "no thanks, I'll have the cash please" and that was that."
         (BD)
         Q: How was Anthony Lees to work with?
         A: "Only met the guy once - on that one day - he said 'hi' - I said
         'hi' - that was about it." (BD)
         The titles of the individual tunes found below are based on as they
         appear in the game.
(#1)
   NAME: The Wilderness (loader)
 AUTHOR: Anthony Lees
(#2)
   NAME: Palace Gardens (loader)
 AUTHOR: Anthony Lees
COMMENT: "I did six tunes for LN, the first of which was the one involving the
         creepy jungle music (....which was and still is my favourite) - the
         inspiration is hard to nail down, but it was probably the film
         'Apocalypse Now' - very dense, troubled and scary moods were evoked."
         (Comment from Anthony Lees)
(#3)
   NAME: The Wastelands (loader)
 AUTHOR: Ben Daglish
(#4)
   NAME: The Palace (loader)
 AUTHOR: Anthony Lees
(#5)
   NAME: The Inner Sanctum (loader)
 AUTHOR: Anthony Lees
COMMENT: Interesting comment in this binary: "DONE BY ANTHONY LEES FOR SYSTEM 3
         ON 5/4/87...EAT YER HEART OUT GALWAY!".
(#6)
   NAME: The Wastelands
 AUTHOR: Ben Daglish
(#7)
   NAME: The Wilderness
 AUTHOR: Ben Daglish
(#8)
   NAME: Palace Gardens
 AUTHOR: Ben Daglish
(#9)
   NAME: The Dungeons
 AUTHOR: Anthony Lees
(#10)
   NAME: The Palace
 AUTHOR: Anthony Lees
(#11)
   NAME: The Dungeons (loader)
 AUTHOR: Ben Daglish
COMMENT: This is also the tune for "The Inner Sanctum".

   NAME: Rainbow-Dragon
COMMENT: A slightly remixed version of a tune "which I'd written a little while
         before, I think, for a game demo that was sent to whatever Gremlin was
         called before it was Gremlin - they had a little SW house over the
         'Just Micro' shop..." (BD) It was possibly meant to be a tune for the
         game Rainbow Dragon, later released by Firebird, and it was never
         used.

COMMENT: "I sadly never managed to get this tune packed without flaws, so
         until I found a solution you have to listen to this more or less
         hollow sounding version of the tune. It took part in sidcompo03 and
         ended up beeing voted for the 9th place in the jury-voting and 10th
         in the public voting. Trivial fun: the title is actually an anagram
         (like more of my other songtitles)." (RE)

         sitting and how some carpenters passed me back and forth while they
         were fixing something in the apartment. :)" (TD)

/MUSICIANS/D/Danko_Tomas/Shock_Magazine.sid
  TITLE: Rubicon, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel
COMMENT: "They wanted a title-theme for Shock Magazine, and gave me the first
         issue. There was a song in there, and I had no clue what it really
         was but thought it captured the feel of the entire magazine. So I
         simply made a cover of it, Danko style. I never had any hangups about
         having to do it all, music is all about sharing and developing ideas
         together in order to reach higher grounds. The chords aren't
         identical to Jeroen's version, in fact we had a little thing over
         that at a party in Oslo back in '94 or so. We hung over a keyboard
         and I played the chords my style, and he went like 'No! It's like
         THIS!' and I said 'Well, I want it THIS way!'. *grin* One of the guys
         at the party leaned over to me and whispered that he in fact
         preferred my version of the track. *smirk* Jeroen superimposed a sus2
         chord throughout the progression until it folds back to the tonic,
         where the sus2 becomes a m7. It's a nice move, one that I personally
         use quite a lot myself. But this time around I expanded the
         progression to plain chords following the bassline.
         After I had done the tune I found out that it was from Rubicon, but
         to me it doesn't matter.
         Later on I made a remix of it, called it Schizomix, with weird
         sounds. Because Rubicon had been a double-speed song, or something
         similar, I wanted to make weird and similar sounds but in a single-
         speed player. And that's all it was, a messed up version of my first
         cover so to speak." (TD)

/MUSICIANS/D/Danko_Tomas/Shock_Magazine_Schizomix.sid
  TITLE: Rubicon, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel
COMMENT: See comment for /MUSICIANS/D/Danko_Tomas/Shock_Magazine.sid

/MUSICIANS/D/Danko_Tomas/Smooth_Criminal.sid
  TITLE: Smooth Criminal [from Bad]
 ARTIST: Michael Jackson

/MUSICIANS/D/Danko_Tomas/Spectre_of_Ice.sid
  TITLE: <?> [from the Amiga MOD module]
 ARTIST: Tomas Danko

/MUSICIANS/D/Danko_Tomas/Tre_Pepparkaksgubbar.sid
  TITLE: Tre pepparkaksgubbar
 ARTIST: Alice Tegnér
COMMENT: Swedish Christmas-tune.

  TITLE: White Christmas
 ARTIST: Irving Berlin

/MUSICIANS/D/Deek/Crimson.sid
COMMENT: "This one is for TDM. Quite a few musical type people (JCH etc.) that
         I send to every decade or so have liked this one (or what there is of
         it so far!). Personally I'm finding that it's a bit on the boring
         side, sooooo I'm going to start it from scratch on newplayer 15 so I
         have better control over the vibrato and stuff. It's gonna be quite a
         long 'un." (RR)

/MUSICIANS/D/Deek/Dead_Tunes.sid
COMMENT: "This is the GAME OVER jingle for the game Doug is working on." (RR)

/MUSICIANS/D/Deek/Demo_Tune_9.sid

COMMENT: Different version of /MUSICIANS/D/Deek/Horizons.sid

/MUSICIANS/D/Deek/Extreme.sid
COMMENT: This is possibly the original set of tunes of sound effects that were
         to be used in Digital Integration's game 'Extreme' but other music by
         Sonic Graffiti was used in the finished game.

  TITLE: Title [from the Spectrum game Trantor - The Last Stormtrooper]

         S.E.S./Genesis Project, found only in Delux Driver 4.4.

/MUSICIANS/D/Deek/Funkish.sid
COMMENT: "This also needs a LOOOOOTTTTAAA work! The sounds are pretty awful
         (just have a listen to that bass-drum), but I'll fix 'em next time I
         do some work on the tune. The bassline isn't bad, but that crap bass
         patch doesn't do it much justice... I think this'll be good when I
         finish it (IF! IIIFF!!)" (RR)

/MUSICIANS/D/Deek/Infinity.sid
COMMENT: Used in the game "Escape from Colditz", (C) 1993 Digital Magic
         Software. "This was knocked up in 2 hours on a Sunday evening when
         Doug said he needed a bit of music urgently for his demo (I should
         have known he was lying!). The demo is on this disk titled summat
         like ROTATIONAL. I think the music is quite nice." (RR)

         AARRGHHH!!!!" (RR)

         toon. Also ignore the working name (that goes for all the tunes!)."

         the 'Hubbard Thalamus ring-mod sound'." (CD)

/MUSICIANS/D/Deenen_Charles/Koekoek.sid
  TITLE: Gökvalsen (The Cuckoo Waltz)
 ARTIST: Emanuel Jonasson
COMMENT: This is a very famous Swedish waltz from 1918.

/MUSICIANS/D/Deenen_Charles/Lord_of_the_Rings.sid
COMMENT: The corresponding game for this music was never released for the
         Commodore 64 due to Interplay deciding to shift the game to newer
         platforms in 1990. Deenen's C64 efforts weren't in vain, however, as
         he was able to reuse much of the music and began a new phase of his
         career. In a 2006 posting, Deenen's reflects: "If I hadn't done the
         C64 Lord of the Rings stuff I wouldn't have gotten my first
         'full-time' job in the US. I'd probably be struggling in Holland now
         trying to make it as a programmer or music guy."
(#1)
  TITLE: Main title [from Flesh and Blood movie soundtrack]
 ARTIST: Basil Poledouris

/MUSICIANS/D/Deenen_Charles/Mantalos.sid
COMMENT: Tunes 1,2, and 4 are also used in the game "Inner Space" (C) 1989 CRL.
(#1)
   NAME: Slow Princey title tune
  TITLE: She's Always In My Hair
 ARTIST: Prince
(#2)
   NAME: Get ready
(#3)
   NAME: Game over
COMMENT: Inspired by the movie-soundtrack of "Rambo: First Blood Part III".

   NAME: Game Completed

### /MUSICIANS/D/Deenen_Charles/Worktunes ####################################

/MUSICIANS/D/Deenen_Charles/Worktunes/220_Volt_Classic.sid
COMMENT: Test tune made around 1986-89, found and released in 2012.

/MUSICIANS/D/Deenen_Charles/Worktunes/Bobs_Full_House.sid
COMMENT: Made in 1988, source found and released to the public in 2014.
         Probably made for the game with the same name but never used.
         See /MUSICIANS/W/Williams_Tony/Bobs_Full_House.sid.

/MUSICIANS/D/Deenen_Charles/Worktunes/China.sid
  TITLE: The Long March [from China]
 ARTIST: Vangelis
COMMENT: Test tune made around 1986-89, found and released in 2012.

/MUSICIANS/D/Deenen_Charles/Worktunes/Just_Made_It.sid
COMMENT: Shorter edit of /MUSICIANS/D/Deenen_Charles/Outmanouvered.sid, Tune #1,
         with added digidrums.

/MUSICIANS/D/Deenen_Charles/Worktunes/Last_Ninja_2.sid
COMMENT: Test tune made around 1988-89, found and released in 2012.

/MUSICIANS/D/Deenen_Charles/Worktunes/Rambo_2.sid
COMMENT: This is a worktune found in Charles Deenen workdisks, made in 1988.
         "This was made for fun. I do recall a bit of a "too strong"
         inspiritation from a Rambo soundtrack. Something that was done in like
         an hour or so, probably to test out a new pulse-width routine, hence
         why it sounds so unpolished and unfinished." (CD)

/MUSICIANS/D/Detert_Thomas/Gordian_Tomb.sid
COMMENT: The original release has a protection which overlaps a fraction of
         the music data, causing dirty sounds in subtune #1 (most notably, the
         bass). The game was also released without protection and with correct
         data, which is present in this rip.
         "After we got the contract [for Gordian Tomb] with a good value of
         money, we discussed how to divide it to the people. This was a mess.
         We at least lost some days of programming. Michael [Detert] was
         menacing with a dropout if Thomas didn't compose the music. So I
         thought ok, we are a team and I am busy with programming - why not?
         But then we couldn't unite about the amount of money. Thomas should
         get the twice of a normal level for a salary. If I had been a better
         businessman these days I had done everything by myself, but at least
         we had a great time and a lot of fun. And the teamwork was always
         accurate. Finally Thomas had known that the salary was overdrawn and
         he repaid every dollar with the longest music ever [32:06 minutes] on
         commodore 64." (Info from Markus Schneider).

  TITLE: Green Beret, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Martin Galway

/MUSICIANS/D/Detert_Thomas/Power.sid
(#1)
  TITLE: Super Freak [from Street Songs]
 ARTIST: Rick James
COMMENT: MC Hammer used the original tune as the main rhythm for "U Can't
         Touch This!"
         While the the Amiga versions of Demonware's games The Power and Ooops
         Up had digitracks of the Snap songs, Detert was instructed NOT to do a
         cover of The Power by Snap for this soundtrack, obviously the guys at
         Snap meanwhile changed their minds about their agreement with
         Demonware.
         The C64 version of Ooops Up was never finished, early soundtrack
         versions done by Rodney Balai did feature a cover of the Snap song
         though. (see /MUSICIANS/A/Audial_Arts/Balai_Rodney/Ooops_Up.sid)

/MUSICIANS/D/Detert_Thomas/Pussy_Slapper.sid
COMMENT: Same as /MUSICIANS/I/Invisible/Sex_Games_Preview_tune_4.sid but in a
         different key. In the original the lead voice falls out of sync when
         it loops. This rip has been fixed to loop correctly.

/MUSICIANS/D/Detert_Thomas/Quadrant.sid
(#1)
COMMENT: Originally was meant to be the Title Picture tune for EON.

/MUSICIANS/D/Devilock/Shit_Happens_tune_5.sid
  TITLE: Die Biene Maja [from the cartoon series]
 ARTIST: Karel Svoboda, sung by Karel Gott
COMMENT: A revisited version of /MUSICIANS/D/Devilock/Biene_Maja.sid
         "I did the Biene_Maja.sid once ago just for fun. I think it was one of
         my first tunes! After that Greenfrog of Cyberpunx and I got the idea
         to make the part in "Shit happens" with the bees being shot, so I did
         the version of the Biene Maja tune where there are these cheesy sound
         fx inside from the bees falling down. :-) This version of the tune
         also gets out of sync, but that is how it was supposed to do: as
         stupid as possible. :-D" (Peter Siekmann)

COMMENT: Borrows a huge amount of this tune.

### /MUSICIANS/D/Dunn_David ##################################################

/MUSICIANS/D/Dunn_David/Chiller.sid
(#2)
  TITLE: Thriller [from Thriller]
 ARTIST: Rod Temperton, performed by Michael Jackson
COMMENT: This music is from Mastertronic's original release of Chiller.
         However, the ingame music (tune #2) was too close to Michael Jackson's
         'Thriller' for comfort, and so Mastertronic would not be sued, they
         withdrew the game and re-released it with a different non-offending
         tune #2. This is in /MUSICIANS/D/Dunn_David/Chiller_v2.sid
         (Comment by Warren Pilkington and Jason Mackenzie (Kenz))

/MUSICIANS/D/Dunn_David/Chiller_v2.sid
COMMENT: See comment for /MUSICIANS/D/Dunn_David/Chiller.sid

/MUSICIANS/D/Dunn_David/Daley_Thompsons_Decathlon.sid
COMMENT: Also see /MUSICIANS/G/Galway_Martin/Daley_Thompsons_Decathlon_loader.sid.
(#3)
  TITLE: 20th Century Fox Fanfare
 ARTIST: Alfred Newman
COMMENT: This version has been used by 20th Century Fox since 1954.

### /MUSICIANS/D\ ############################################################

### /MUSICIANS/E/ ############################################################

### /MUSICIANS/E/ELA #########################################################

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/
COMMENT: Comments by ELA himself are denoted (ELA). ELA is short for
         "Eric L. Ardem".

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Amnesia.sid
COMMENT: "found this on a disk somewhere, it sounds like my typical tunes but I
         cannot remember making it. Editor=FutureComposer" (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Babar_Elefanten.sid
COMMENT: "Toying with filters and harmonies. Editor=SoundMonitor" (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Bjelleklang.sid
COMMENT: "I don't know why I called it Bjelleklang.. it's not an X-mas song :-)
         Almost sure I used Rockmonitor2 here." (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Carl_I_Hagen.sid
COMMENT: "A short tune made with FutureComposer II from Beastie Boys. It has a
         strange break in the middle thats quite fun. The name of the tune is
         given because it was first thing I thought of when I saved it. I'm not
         a supporter of the politician Carl I. Hagen. Editor=FC" (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Choir_inspired_stuff.sid
COMMENT: "I had made this tune first on a editor from Panoramic that didnt make
         executable code (the only bugged version). Thats why it was then
         copied into an editor that Megastyle gave me instead. Its a somewhat
         choir-like tune (I play piano for a local choir)" (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Cirkus_Death.sid
COMMENT: "It's a rotten tune, with lots of bass/filter and no melody. Someone
         actually used this tune in a demo (to my amazement). Editor=FC" (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Competition_Tune.sid
COMMENT: "A quite long tune from me for once. Swedish & Norwegian magazine
         "Dator" had a C64-music-compo. This was my contribution. I like it but
         it lacks melodies. There are several different sounding sections in it
         because I stuffed in 4 other unfinished tunes into it. Editor=FC"
         (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Complete_solo.sid
COMMENT: "Made with the Finnish Gold FC. The start has something but the ending
         is... bah!" (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Concluded_Errors.sid
COMMENT: "The Errors had told Zaphod/Antimon that they wanted some music from
         me to use in demos but never used the ones I gave them. Again a lack
         of melody makes the tune a bit uninteresting. The bass&drums use is so
         typical me (master of repeatcodes) Editor=FC" (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Crap.sid
COMMENT: "a not so great tune.... Editor=Soundmonitor" (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Da_Di_Da.sid
COMMENT: "Psycho opening, then over to the more typical fast basslines
         Editor=Soundmonitor" (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Desperate.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Megastyle's editor. I had Quit Cosine, and then got word
         from Megastyle that they wanted me as a member making tons of
         intro/demo-tunes. I got their editor but they never used ANY of my
         music. Their player was based on JB/MON's Stormlord tunes. I decided
         to join my local friends in the Norway/Finland/Germany-based group
         Antimon instead. Most of my music had been used by them anyway. This
         is like most of my tunes in in C-minor and rather sad sounding. I put
         a lot of work into this one (and not quitting early like usually do).
         I used this tune in a demopart with an atom-plotter (Antimon is an
         atom ya know). Editor=Megastyle-editor" (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/ELAs_First.sid
COMMENT: "I had just got hold of Rockmonitor2 in 1987 and slowly tried out what
         it had. This tune still contains lots of music from the default-tune
         and probably all the default sounds as it took months before I learned
         how to make my own sounds. It has no drumsamples here either because
         that took a while to learn too. I converted it to Soundmonitor to save
         space (it didnt need the sample data anyway)" (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/En_annen_gang_Some_other_time.sid
COMMENT: "Made in SoundMonitor when in a local group MG-2 (very unknown) I had
         no idea how to make good sounds then and you can hear it on this one.
         Before I got Soundmonitor I'd only made tunes in RockmonitorII." (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Filter_bass.sid
COMMENT: "Very nice bass. I was toying much with filters at the time. Made in
         SoundMonitor as a member of Suppliers. The Suppliers wanted tunes that
         took less raster but it took a long time before I got hold of
         FutureComposer." (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Finnish_tune.sid
COMMENT: "Sx of Antimon sent me the notesheet to this tune convert to C64.
         Originally its by a band from Finland. I've never heard the original
         tune. Editor=FC" (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Flesk.sid
COMMENT: "This sounds weird, but drives on & on. It's a mix of two tunes I'd
         made. This tune were never used in demos but to my amazement it got
         airtime on the 6581 SID radioshow. I met the show-host Hardhat on IRC
         one day not knowing who he was. He told me knew my music and
         especially liked "Flesk". Later I understood that he'd played it on
         radio (a radioshow in Sacramento that only played sid-tunes).
         Editor=Megastyle-editor" (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Frantic_2.sid
COMMENT: "Considered my best by several others. There never was a Frantic1. The
         tune was used a few times by Antimon. I wanted to make it much longer
         but gave up :-) Editor=FC" (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Frantic_3.sid
COMMENT: "A nice intro tune. I used it in my "Goodbye Suppliers"-demo.
         Editor=FC" (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Gal_Maate.sid
COMMENT: "Filter mayhem, quite nice sounding with lots of atmosphere.
         Editor=Soundmonitor" (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Gledelig_Oh_Joy.sid
COMMENT: "Based on an old tune I had in a band. Its darn cheerful and feels
         better with the band.... Editor=RM2" (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Go_Gadget_Go.sid
COMMENT: "The worlds most intense sid-tune. Editor=FutureComposer" (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Haba_2.sid
COMMENT: "Tune #2 of 3 for a game. Editor=Soundmonitor" (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Haba_3.sid
COMMENT: "Tune #3 of 3 for a game. Editor=Soundmonitor" (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Hans_Inge_Tune.sid
  TITLE: Han som formådde
 ARTIST: Hans Inge Fagervik
COMMENT: "A choirsong-transfer. An early hit and used a lot. This is the tune
         most people remember me for. I learned this song at a christian school
         where I sang in the shool choir and copied the notesheet. The song is
         so short that I had to transpose it several times along to make it
         last. Editor=FC" (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Intro_Bug.sid
COMMENT: "My first Soundmonitor-tune. I made a few bars of music and then just
         shuffled and transposed them around to make a long tune." (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Introtune.sid
COMMENT: "a very early FC-tune that I actually used in an intro.
         Editor=FutureComposer" (ELA)

         came with the default-tune in Rockmonitor 2." (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Nobodys_Igle.sid

         Suppliers. It's a really rotten tune hehe and yet another sick title.
         Editor=FC" (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Nokkkk.sid
COMMENT: "A personal favourite because theres so much happening.
         Editor=Soundmonitor" (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Poltergeistiiiiiii.sid
COMMENT: "A late soundmonitor tune - the drums are sounding a bit better.
         Editor=Soundmonitor" (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Rec.sid
COMMENT: "Yet again, atmosphere with some extra punch from the digi-drums.
         Thats what I never managed to make in Futurecomposer and later
         editors. Editor=RM2 or 3.. not sure" (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Redivivo.sid
COMMENT: Me and a friend just tried to make a tune in rockmon2 but it sounds
         like we're both drunk or worse. Editor=RM2" (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Running_in_the_woods.sid
COMMENT: "Short test-tune! It works quite well. The name comes from a comment
         by Henning Rokling's brother. When he heard Henning's "Game_example"/
         tune#1 he said: "It's as if you are running in the woods!". When I
         made it Zaphod/Antimon was sitting in a corner of the room reading
         magazines and mumbling "that sounds good", "don't do that", "that's
         better". Co-credits to Zap :-) Editor=FC" (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Rythmic_5er.sid
COMMENT: "This has a weird count, kind of 5 bars instead of 4. It's not 5/4,
         but... something else... A nice slap bass in the last sequence. I like
         it because it sounds different but it builds up too slowly. Editor=FC"
         (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Sang.sid
COMMENT: "Editor=RM2" (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Sec_Gallup.sid
COMMENT: "Lots of bass riffs and little melody. A double-voice bass near the
         end sounds quite cool (IMHO). Antimon used this in an example for a
         musicrip-frontend. Editor=FC" (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/SingAlongSong.sid
COMMENT: "Quite nice (considering I made it). Future composer was the tool as
         usual." (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/SkrotLeif.sid
COMMENT: "A strange tune. Works somehow. Often the compact bass'n'drums saves
         my tunes. Editor=FC" (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Smattfrids_Hevn.sid
COMMENT: "Editor=RM2" (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Stoff_Deboot.sid
COMMENT: "One of the reasons I got to join The Suppliers (who were quite big
         back then) was this tune. It was first made with Rockmonitor II (which
         was what they liked), but it took way too much raster to be useable in
         a demo so I made this one in FutureComposer. It was never used
         (something I got used to later). I still think the original sounds
         better. The title has nothing to do with drugs btw. It's just some
         words that fell into my head when I typed the savename." (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Summer_88.sid
COMMENT: "This is a remake of an old tune I made on a borrowed synth a few
         years later. It starts off with the chords and then the rythm and
         intensity comes later. Then it transposes to get even more intensity.
         One of my personal favorites. Used in the end-part of my "Goodbye
         Suppliers"-demo. Editor=FC" (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Tune_4.sid
COMMENT: "A simple intro tune. Used in a part in the "Goodbye Suppliers"-demo.
         Editor=FC" (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Very_Ode_Yeah.sid
COMMENT: "A weird setup with 2-voice arpeggios. Freak out! The last one I ever
         made with FutureComposer." (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/Wooom.sid
COMMENT: "more filter and arpeggio toying, but no melody. Editor=Soundmonitor"
         (ELA)

/MUSICIANS/E/ELA/noname.sid
COMMENT: "This was 1 of 3 tunes made for some local friends that wanted to make
         a game. They chose this one but only because it was longest :-)" (ELA)

### /MUSICIANS/F/Fanta #######################################################

/MUSICIANS/F/Fanta/
COMMENT: All comments by Alexander Rotzsch (Fanta) himself are denoted (AR).
         "I've also done some co-op tunes with The Syndrom, and you'll find
         those in his directory in HVSC." (AR)

/MUSICIANS/F/Fanta/3DEH.sid
  TITLE: Lightforce
 ARTIST: Rob Hubbard
COMMENT: Based on /MUSICIANS/H/Hubbard_Rob/Lightforce.sid

/MUSICIANS/F/Fanta/4Kunden.sid
COMMENT: "And again a 4K 1st place at Mekka Symposium 2001." (AR)

/MUSICIANS/F/Fanta/A_German_Touch.sid
(#1)
  TITLE: Deutschlandlied (German National Anthem)
 ARTIST: Franz Joseph Haydn (music), A. H. Hoffmann von Fallersleben (lyrics)

/MUSICIANS/F/Fanta/A_Soapbox_Opera.sid
COMMENT: This SID won the Breakpoint 2004 music competition.

/MUSICIANS/F/Fanta/All_You_Know_Is_Wrong.sid
COMMENT: "The stoned indish guy is singing:
         All you know is wrong, bipp bapp bipp bapp,
         so take a hit of my bong, bipp bapp bipp bapp.
         All you know is wrong, bipp bapp bipp bapp,
         and the proof is this song, bipp bapp bipp bapp." (AR)

/MUSICIANS/F/Fanta/Aquanori.sid
COMMENT: "Got 4th place at X 2001." (AR)

/MUSICIANS/F/Fanta/Bemme_Mit_Brot.sid
COMMENT: "The demo (One-Der) got 2nd place at The Party 1997. Drax asked me
         once what "Bemme" means and believe me, it wasn't easy to explain the
         sense of this title, because it's saxon (Hi Happymaker, diese Elite
         Kunden wissn ooch nüscht, nur?). The correct translation is bread
         slice with bread. :-)" (AR)

/MUSICIANS/F/Fanta/Bombs_Over_Dresden.sid
COMMENT: This tune won the shared first place at the Sidcompo V online music
         competition.

/MUSICIANS/F/Fanta/Brummkreisel.sid
  TITLE: Pop Goes the Weasel (1:24-1:32)
 ARTIST: Traditional
COMMENT: "Originally made for Respect/Fuse. The Syndrom thought it was too
         funny for such a serious demo, haha! So I gave it to Acidchild for his
         notes. Every scener had a Brummkreisel but Acidchild two! :-))" (AR)

/MUSICIANS/F/Fanta/Bundy_Theme_Tune.sid
  TITLE: Love and Marriage [from Songs for Swingin']
 ARTIST: Frank Sinatra
COMMENT: Based on the cover used in the TV series "Married with Children".

COMMENT: "The demo (One-Der) got 2nd place at The Party 1997." (AR)

  TITLE: Psalm77
 ARTIST: David Nevue

/MUSICIANS/F/Fanta/Demodisk.sid
COMMENT: "I sent this to AEG for the Turrican 3 endpart - 1 week before it got
         released. ;) So finally it ended up in a slightly different version
         in Demode/Chorus." (AR)

/MUSICIANS/F/Fanta/Demodump.sid
COMMENT: "Clarence wanted a 15 sec. tune which he could siddump. I did a very
         silly one, so he could switch the voices on/off to make it longer.
         The demoversion takes only 2-3 rasterlines and so it sounds. My first
         tune without balls. It *hurts* Clarence! :D" (AR)

 ARTIST: Anders E. Hansen (Laxity of Kefrens)

/MUSICIANS/F/Fanta/Drop_the_Girl.sid
COMMENT: "D-Tract left the scene for his girlfriend and so he had some
         worktunes left. I liked this one and finished it by assembling the
         subtunes and adding some small things like instruments or a melody
         part in the end. The main job was done by him." (AR)

/MUSICIANS/F/Fanta/Emergency_Brake.sid
COMMENT: "Cool story about The Tribute 1994. The Oxyron guys (who I joined
         later) came into the room asking "How much time have we left till the
         deadline? 30 hours? Ok, we make a demo!" and started. They asked for
         msx and gfx and this was the tune I had left at that time. Well..."
         (AR)

         that tune for more info.

/MUSICIANS/F/Fanta/Munich_98_3_FM.sid
  TITLE: Everybody Everybody [from Dreamland]
 ARTIST: Black Box
COMMENT: This tune competed in the C64.sk Compo #7 in 2007, but was disqualified
         because cover tunes weren't allowed. A reworked version of this tune
         was later entered into the C64.sk Cover Compo #1. That tune can be
         found as /MUSICIANS/F/Fanta/Everybody_Everybody.sid in the HVSC.

COMMENT: The title is just opposite to
         /MUSICIANS/D/DRAX/Natural_Cause_of_Death.sid. Both tunes appeared in
         Sid Compo IV but this one was submitted later.

/MUSICIANS/F/Fanta/Orimar_Dna_Sirhc.sid
COMMENT: "The demo (One-Der) got 2nd place at The Party 1997. The title is
         'Chris and Ramiro' spelt backwards and the music is influenced by
         their (Chris Hülsbeck and Ramiro Vaca's) style. The composition itself
         is by me. A very popular tune. ;-))" (AR)

/MUSICIANS/F/Fanta/Plush2K.sid
COMMENT: "Krill wanted me to do an atmospheric old school tune for +h2K. And so
         I did, as his wishes are always my command! It turned out quite nice,
         one of my best tunes I think. I hate Crest for stealing us the first
         place at Mekka Symposium 2000! ;-)" (AR)

/MUSICIANS/F/Fanta/Plush4K.sid
COMMENT: "This 4K shorty got 1st place at Mekka Symposium 2000." (AR)

/MUSICIANS/F/Fanta/Policeman.sid
COMMENT: "Compotune for Gravity 1997. I still don't know which place it
         achieved. The last part of the tune was originally an example music by
         me for The Syndrom's SYNC Player released in the german magazine
         64'er. I couldn't let it stay there alone..." (AR)

/MUSICIANS/F/Fanta/Pop_Inside.sid
COMMENT: "I made this originally for Clarence' Demode where it is used in the
         intro. As I ran out of time for a compomusic at the great X 2004 I
         used it also there. This was a good decision in the end (2nd place),
         seeing Jeroen Tel and Reyn Ouwehand swinging to it. :) And not to
         forget Deekay, CBA (jump!) and others making me proud by dancing to
         it. These are memories I won't forget... I got many very good
         reactions from Rambones, Booker, Teroen Jel (you know who you are ;)
         and others. Let's see if I can top this one day..." (AR)

  TITLE: Always On My Mind (0:00)
 ARTIST: Brenda Lee
COMMENT: Performed by various artist, including Elvis.
  TITLE: ALF Theme [from the TV series] (2:56)
 ARTIST: Tom Kramer & Alf Clausen
  TITLE: Dallas Theme [from the TV series] (3:27)
 ARTIST: Jerrold Immel
  TITLE: Prelude [from Te Deum] (3:57-4:28)
 ARTIST: Marc-Antoine Charpentier
COMMENT: The Eurovision fanfare.
  TITLE: When the Saints Go Marching In (4:44)
 ARTIST: American Traditional
COMMENT: Often referred to as "The Saints". The song is a slight modification
         of "When the Saints are Marching In" by Katharine Purvis (lyrics) and
         James Milton Black (music). This version is probably based on the most
         famous performance of the song by Louis Armstrong.
  TITLE: Jänis istui maassa (4:59)
 ARTIST: Traditional, lyrics by Alli Nissinen
COMMENT: Finnish children's song, English title unknown

  TITLE: Phantoms of the Asteroid, Tune #1

COMMENT: A version of /MUSICIANS/F/Feekzoid/Phantoms_of_the_Asteroid_Remix.sid
         that doesn't contain the intro. It was made specifically for PlaySID,
         that doesn't handle the white noise in the intro too well.

/MUSICIANS/F/Feekzoid/Word.sid
  TITLE: Olympic [from ex:el]
 ARTIST: 808 State
COMMENT: 808 State wrote a special version of "Olympic" to be used as the title
         theme for the UK TV show "The Word" and this is what the SID covers.

/MUSICIANS/F/Feekzoid/Xanadu.sid
COMMENT: Similar melody to /MUSICIANS/F/Feekzoid/Nice_Feekzak.sid

/MUSICIANS/F/Feekzoid/Xmas_Chortles_x-rated_version.sid
  TITLE: Another One Bites the Dust [from The Game] (2:06-2:18)
 ARTIST: Queen
COMMENT: This is just the first part of Queen's music.
         This one voice digi tune is a companion to the bizarre movie "Xmas
         Chortles" featuring Jason Mackenzie (Kenz) and friends in really manic
         scenes and behaviour, including setting fire to a Spectrum, re-making
         a Pepsi ad, lots of playing C64 Games and strange footage. The voice
         of Kenz is heard in the "Xmas Chortles" and "Merry Christmas" samples.
         According to Feekzoid, this tune was never supposed to be released.

### /MUSICIANS/F/Feil_Georg ##################################################

/MUSICIANS/F/Feil_Georg/
COMMENT: All comments by Georg Feil are denoted by (GF).

/MUSICIANS/F/Feil_Georg/A_Spaceman_Came_Travelling.sid
  TITLE: A Spaceman Came Travelling [from Spanish Train and Other Stories]
 ARTIST: Chris de Burgh

/MUSICIANS/F/Feil_Georg/Bach_G_minor.sid
  TITLE: Wachet auf, ruft uns die Stimme (BWV 645)
 ARTIST: Johann Sebastian Bach

/MUSICIANS/F/Feil_Georg/Hogans_Heroes.sid
  TITLE: Hogan's Heroes March [from the TV series Hogan's Heroes]
 ARTIST: Jerry Fielding

/MUSICIANS/F/Feil_Georg/Nobodys_Diary.sid
  TITLE: Nobody's Diary [from You and Me Both]
 ARTIST: Yazoo

/MUSICIANS/F/Feil_Georg/On_Broadway.sid
  TITLE: On Broadway
 ARTIST: Barry Mann, Cynthia Weil, Jerry Leiber and Mike Stoller

/MUSICIANS/F/Feil_Georg/Synth_Sample.sid
COMMENT: "I wrote it around '84 or '85 as a demo for my music editor called
         'Synth'. I was going to University of Waterloo at the time and just
         gave it to a friend of mine... didn't even bother to put my name on
         the thing. Anyway it soon started cropping up all over the place.
         I never made any sequels with music, although there was something with
         annoying sound effects done in the same style as Synth Sample that I
         posted in the beginning of 1994. So any music you see that looks like
         a sequel or has graphics added was done by someone else.
         Anyway the computer bust of 85/86(?) hit and Synth was never marketed.
         I had been negotiating with a software company but they went out of
         business. By that time I was working on a new version of Synth that
         was a sequencer program for Midi instruments (called MSS), and had
         joined my first band. I've been in a couple other bands since then,
         the last one was called SugarPush and we came close to getting signed
         (but then broke up [...]). So I guess you can credit that little
         program with launching my musical career..." (GF)
(#1)
  TITLE: Stationary Ark
 ARTIST: John Mills-Cockell <?>
COMMENT: "Theme from Stationary Ark, a nature show on PBS. [...] It appears on
         Synth Sample as interpreted by a friend of mine. I didn't know what it
         was myself until I happened to see Stationary Ark one time. This song
         does not play properly on some C-64's where the SID chip filter is
         calibrated differently." (GF)
(#2)
  TITLE: Saturdays in Silesia [from Cold War Night Life]
 ARTIST: Rational Youth
COMMENT: "A fluffy pop song I taped off the radio. Seemed simple enough to
         render on the C-64." (GF)
         Also used in the game "Shocker", (C) 1987 Systems Editoriale.
(#3)
  TITLE: Spiral [from Spiral]
 ARTIST: Vangelis
(#4)
  TITLE: Tubular Bells, Part 1 [from Tubular Bells]
 ARTIST: Mike Oldfield
COMMENT: A little free-hand adaptation.
         "I just thought this was ultra cool. Used as the music to The
         Exorcist, unfortunately." (GF)
(#5)
  TITLE: Magic Shadows, closing theme
 ARTIST: Harry Forbes
COMMENT: "Magic Shadows was a half-hour movie show on TV Ontario, sort of the
         Canadian equivalent of PBS. They'd show old movies in half-hour
         installments. I have no idea if there's an album. I taped it off the
         TV." (GF)
(#6)
  TITLE: Funeral Music for Queen Mary
 ARTIST: Henry Purcell
(#7)
  TITLE: Oxygene 2 [from Oxygene]
 ARTIST: Jean Michel Jarre
(#8)
  TITLE: Canon in D major
 ARTIST: Johann Pachelbel
COMMENT: "This is a very popular classical hit. I transcribed the notes from a
         Transactor or Compute! article (this is the only Synth Sample piece
         not transcribed by ear)." (GF)
(#9)
  TITLE: Enola Gay [from Organisation]
 ARTIST: George Andrew McCluskey, performed by Orchestral Manoeuvres in the Dark (OMD)

COMMENT: "[...] It's an arcade conversion... or lets say it started like an
         arcade conversion! What happened was, I started converting the
         titletune, and it just developed, slipped out of my grip and became
         something, what was very different from what I had in mind, at the
         beginning. Quite messy!" (TF)
         Covers the arcade version by Fujita Harumi, except tune #1 and #10.

         That has been fixed in this rip.

COMMENT: The arcade version does not have any music, so all compositions are
         originals by Matt.  Tunes #4-#6 are covers of the arcade sound fx by
         Brad Fuller.

COMMENT: Matt's remix of his own music for the sequel to Manchester United.

/MUSICIANS/F/Furniss_Matt/Passing_Shot.sid
COMMENT: Ben Daglish has confirmed to us that despite the music routine being
         similar to his, he did not compose this SID.
(#1)
  TITLE: Advance Australia Fair (Australian National Anthem)
 ARTIST: Peter Dodds McCormick
(#2)
  TITLE: God Save the King/Queen (The National Anthem of the U.K.)
 ARTIST: Traditional
COMMENT: This anthem is traditional and possibly one of the most known national
         anthems in the world. Each verse was written at a different time,
         ranging from the 1740s to the present day.
(#3)
  TITLE: The Star Spangled Banner (National Anthem of the U.S.A.)
 ARTIST: Sir Francis Scott Key (lyrics), John Stafford Smith (music)
(#4)
  TITLE: La Marseillaise (French National Anthem)
 ARTIST: Claude Joseph Rouget de Lisle
(#5)
  TITLE: Press Start [from the arcade game Passing Shot]
 ARTIST: <?>

 ARTIST: Welsh Traditional
  TITLE: One Horse Open Sleigh (0:36)
 ARTIST: James Lord Pierpont
