### /MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz ################################################

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/
COMMENT: "Many people change their scene name once or twice in their life.  I
         decided to be different, and change my real name instead. "(JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/63_speed_music_1.sid
COMMENT: "Ray kept saying "Make more mutispeed music", so I did.  Actully, it
         only runs channel #1 at 63x, the other two channels run at 9x, but oh
         well :).  And it's too short... I very quickly got annoyed with the
         unresponsiveness of the editor when trying to play sounds at this
         rate.  But I *do* like working with the sounds at these sort of update
         rates, so I'm working on a player which takes a smaller amount of
         raster time than TFX to use for such music. (That said, one of PCH's
         TFX songs (supposedly) runs a channel at 72x, but that's just too
         insane to dicuss :)." (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Archnial.sid
COMMENT: "The title of this song comes from my friend Jenn's AIM screenname,
         whom I love dearly (in a completly plutonic way, for the record).
         She doesn't understand the 'c64 thing'. I always wanted to be able to
         write funk tunes like Drax, and later Mitch&Dane, do, and despite it
         coming almost dead last in the c64.sk sid competition, I think I
         succeeded somewhat.  I actually like a lot of the harmonic work in
         this song, as did my sister, who yelled at me after she first heard it
         for being able to pull it off! Of course, most people disagreed with
         her accusation of me pulling it off." (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Archnial_Triangle.sid
COMMENT: "Someone on c64.sk made the statement that to do well, you need to
         make songs which only use the triangle wave.  So I did, and I think it
         sounds a lot like something you'd hear on a NES.  I actually prefer
         this version myself." (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Blood_Starlight_Rain.sid
   NAME: Blood, Starlight, Rain Like Tears.
COMMENT: "Sitting in a backpackers hostel in sydney, get a call from my
         parents, I can't come home, they've rented out my room. I've been here
         for 5 weeks now, but only finally got a laptop this day. I was feeling
         incredibly dark, having spent the last week in bed ill, I really
         wanted to go home, or failing that, I wanted someone to take a few
         minutes out of their day to see if I was still alive (okay, so I was
         feeling kind of melodramatic, lol),  This girl promised to hang out
         with me, and then cancelled or forgot every time for weeks straight,
         and I was stupid (read: thinking with my heart instead of my head)
         and didn't want to acknowlage that she was ignoring me...  I was
         losing my mind, and this music represents that.
         The full verse is "Blood, Starlight, Rain like tears, Drink from
         this, and let go the years".  I don't know who penned those words, but
         I dropped the latter half from the title because I promised said girl
         that I would.
         This music was made on an emulator (vice 1.8, and of course I had
         resid turned on :-p).  It was also one of my bigger expermients with
         filters synced from different channels to the one they're targetting.
         If it works at all on a real C64, I'd consider myself very lucky, lol,
         because I didn't have access to one at the time." (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Chase_That_Feeling.sid
  TITLE: The Most Beautiful Girl in the World [from The Gold Experience]
 ARTIST: Prince

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Colors.sid
COMMENT: "I sat down to create an ending music for the WOW demo 'Evolution',
         with this text that I'd just written in my mind, and eight hours
         later, I had most of this.  It isn't (deliberatly) covering anything,
         the resemblence to some other music is just a coincidence :).
         Ironically, this is one of my happiest musics, and yet at the time I
         made it, I was depressed and suicidal.  Life is full of contrasts, I
         guess that's what makes it special.
         Well, that and Ray finally fixing the restart bug in TFX :-p." (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Drymouth.sid
  TITLE: Title [from the Gameboy Color game Drymouth]
 ARTIST: Jake Kaufman (virt)
COMMENT: "A freeware game for the GBC, the game itself sucks, but the music
         from it is great.  This is a fairly loose cover, done about a year
         after I last heard the music in question, and the last third is
         completly made up because I couldn't remember at all what came next,
         but oh well. Lots of people seemed to like this music, and that's
         probably because someone else, who has talent, wrote it ^_^." (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Drymouth_alternate.sid
  TITLE: Title [from the Gameboy Color game Drymouth]
 ARTIST: Jake Kaufman (virt)
COMMENT: "See the entry for Drymouth.  I couldn't decided between these two
         versions, so I released them both." (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Eternal_Reprise.sid
COMMENT: "This is a remake of Eternal Skies, but with better instruments and
         the stupid part at the start removed." (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Eternal_Skies.sid
COMMENT: "This was inspired by a song named "Eternal" by Evanescence.  It was
         originally going to be a cover of said song, however that went awry
         within the first 10 seconds or so :).  The second half is mostly an
         experiment in what happens when you mix diffrent types of Ringmod and
         Sync effects, which I like the sound of.  Sidplay1 hates it. It was
         originally intended to sound quite different from this, because the
         original sketch for it required a dyanmic wave table, but I got fed up
         waiting for that, and finished it as is." (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Evolution.sid
COMMENT: "I try, I fly, I lie, I cry, I die.  My mis-understood epic.  Everyone
         except for Ray hated this :).  It started out as soundmon clone music
         (intended for the WOW demo of the same name), an evolution in music,
         you know, the idea being that I've also got future composer type music
         (see TFX == future composer), and the other guys were going to do
         modern music blah blah watever, I forget the details.  Anyhow, around
         2 minutes after I sat down at the editor, it instead became something
         else (I hate it when that happens :-p), which basically amounts to an
         attempt to place what was goes through my mind at the time into sid
         form... the evolution of my soul.  I achieved that, I think, which is
         probably why almost no-one else understands it.  I personally like
         this music better than any other which I have ever made, however my
         emotional attachment to it makes me biased." (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Exuding_Titleness.sid
  TITLE: Exuding Titleness [from the Scream Tracker 3 module]
 ARTIST: Andrew Sega (Necros)
COMMENT: "PG Gave me a copy of this on a CD when I was in the Czech Republic
         during 2000, and I instantly fell in love with it, and as soon as I
         arrived home to my C64, this cover of it was the first thing I did.
         It was done in kind of a hurry, as I had other things on my mind, and
         so it could be significantly better than it is, but it's still not
         terrible, overall." (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Fields_of_Innocence.sid
  TITLE: Fields of Innocence [from Origin]
 ARTIST: Evanescence
COMMENT: "Only a partial cover... initially I set out to do a full cover of
         this, however in the end I only covered the the lead and background
         melodies (a few bars each), and then did my own music around that.
         Kind of a waste, really, because the original is much better than I
         could ever hope to achieve, but it's not bad compared to all of my
         others, even if it is completly pale and lame compared to the
         original. Jazzcat mislabled this "Fields of Hades" when it was used in
         an issue of Vandalism News, but we still love him anyhow :-p." (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Fishmagic_6581.sid
COMMENT: "In another world, I am known as Fish.  Felt like doing a cutesy
         little tune one day.  This is it.  It's not terribly good, in
         retrospect. The later sections continue my love affair with ring
         modulation.  It's too short, it's too lame, it's too cheesy, and I was
         too tired to care. It relies kind of heavily on the semantics of a
         6581 filter in places... on an 8580, some things just don't sound
         quite right :(.
         Anthony Bisset, from Digiradi/DSP Audio remixed this and layed vocals
         over it." (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Fishmagic_8580.sid
COMMENT: "In another world, I am known as Fish.  Felt like doing a cutesy
         little tune one day.  This is it.  It's not terribly good, in
         retrospect. The later sections continue my love affair with ring
         modulation.  It's too short, it's too lame, it's too cheesy, and I was
         too tired to care. It relies kind of heavily on the semantics of a
         6581 filter in places... on an 8580, some things just don't sound
         quite right :(.
         Anthony Bisset, from Digiradi/DSP Audio remixed this and layed vocals
         over it." (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Follower_v1.sid
  TITLE: The Follower [from the Impulse Tracker module]
 ARTIST: Jaymz Julian (A Life in Hell)
COMMENT: "This was the first thing I did in Sid Duzz It, and the only one
         which I actully released (I also did a cover of Elwood's "Fall From
         Sky" in it, after hearing The Alien's version, which was missing my
         favorite part of the module, but it was lost to a bad disk :(, and a
         cover of a PC music I did called 'Midi Drums', which a few people had,
         but I don't, and I'm betting that it's dissapered from everyone else's
         disks too.  But that's another story...).  This version has no pulse
         width modulation on the bass notes, which makes the drums sound
         harder. Anyhow, I stopped using that editor/player, because I found
         it far too limiting." (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Follower_v2.sid
  TITLE: The Follower [from the Impulse Tracker module]
 ARTIST: Jaymz Julian (A Life in Hell)
COMMENT: "See the comment for v1.  This version has pulse width modulation on
         the bass notes, which makes the drums sound softer/fuzzier, but the
         bass sounds nicer.  I couldn't/can't decide which I prefer :). I think
         I might re-do this song in TFX one day." (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Forever.sid
COMMENT: "This was inspired by the music from the PC demo 'Forever' by Acme.  I
         don't recall who did that music, but this doesn't actully sound much
         at all like it... but you should listen to that music if you can find
         it, because it's really good.  There is another story that goes with
         this music, which explains the in binary message, which starts, as
         all good stories does, 'Well, there was this girl...' :).  Her name
         was Sonja, and she didn't.
         But she was leaning over my shoulder when I was packing this tune, and
         is the only girlfriend I've had who has even tollerated, let alone
         understood, my C64 obsession.  As a birthday surprise for me, she made
         a C64 music.  It was surprisingly good for a first ever sid piece!
         One day, it may see the light of day, but today is not that day." (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Game_Over_view_1.sid
COMMENT: "This was the music from the first ever Game Over(view), and was
         written for it the day before it was released (at the start of 2004).
         It was an attempt to do a song in the same style as Detert's Game On
         11/93, and although it didn't quite turn out that way, I like how it
         ended up." (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Green_Hill.sid
  TITLE: You Can Do Anything (Toot Toot Sonic Warr.) [from the GG game Sonic 2]
 ARTIST: Masafumi Ogata
COMMENT: "I beat this game in a couple of hours when it first came out, but
         always loved the music, and this tune in particular.  Fast forward to
         mid 2000, and I'm sitting in a backpackers hostel in Prague with my
         gamegear, and I have no alarm clock and a 9am flight to catch, with my
         girlfriend (who I hadn't seen for 5 months) is waiting on the other
         end of it.  So hence I can't really go to sleep (I'd die if I missed
         said flight :-p), but hey, I have a gamegear with this game, and so I
         play until Green Hill zone, and then listen to this music for 7 hours
         straight, at which point I finally ran out of spare lives and
         continues.
         Fast forward to June/July 2001, and I've got some weird illness where
         I can't stand up or hold down food (never did work out what the was,
         heh), and my girlfriend runs away to america because the idea that
         for once in her life she has to be an adult is to damned hard to deal
         with (Hey, Gundam Wing Hentai is much more fun), and I havn't slept
         for 2 weeks or eaten in 4 weeks (not an exaggeration), which has had
         the predictable effects on my mind.  Crawl over to my C64, load TFX,
         bury myself of memories of that night in Prague and happy fun music!
         Only digital love is eternal." (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Green_Hill_Reprise.sid
  TITLE: Green Hill Zone [from the SMS game Sonic the Hedgehog 2]
 ARTIST: <?>

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Happy_Happy_Joy_Joy.sid
COMMENT: "Despite my first C64 music being made in 1988, this is probably the
         first one I did which wasn't complete and utter crap (Well, maybe this
         and "Not so JCH based", but it was done on a bad emulator and breaks
         on a real C64, it turns out ^_^.  Maybe one day I'll remake it and
         release it, because the ideas in it were good, just bad implentation
         as is the usual thing with me :).  It wasn't until later that year
         the the message penetrated my brain that, if you want to make an
         okay music, you need to spend more than an hour on it ;).  If I was
         running WOW, I would have kicked me out for being completly lame ;).
         But hey, I learned my lesson (sort of....)" (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Internal_29_Intro.sid
  TITLE: Act 5: The Flight on a Stork [from the NES game The Smurfs]
 ARTIST: Alberto Jose Gonzalez
COMMENT: "This is loosely based on something that I heard once on a NES.  What,
         however, I knew not, at the time." (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Internalise.sid
COMMENT: "This was inspired by what I remembered of Ash Hogg's Spellcast title
         music, however it turns out that even the part I thought I'd stolen
         (the background lead that plays at the start) bears not much
         resemblence to it.  Go figure.  This is another music, like evolution,
         which is really a reflection of my psyche at the time, however this
         one didn't get the negative reaction which evolution did :).  People
         did tell me that it's too short, however, and they're right.  But cest
         la vie.
         A shame that I couldn't make a really big and fearsome snare,
         though..." (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Jazz_Crackers.sid
COMMENT: "The C64 and PC versions of this music were developed simeltanously
         during 1997.  The C64 was finished first, however.  The lead
         instruments in this rely heavily on an 8580 style filter (or some
         later 6581 filters, iirc, but I forget now).  Despite finishing dead
         last in the compo I entered it in (Assembly '98), I still like this.
         (As a side note, I'm really very good at finishing dead last in compos
         :-p)" (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Lifes_a_Show.sid
  TITLE: Life's a show [from Buffy the Vampire Slayer: Once More with Feeling]
 ARTIST: <?>
COMMENT: "Beware of bunnies!  This is only a partial cover, as I got bored
         with it." (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Lost_Vikings.sid
  TITLE: <?> [from the game "The Lost Vikings"]
 ARTIST: Charles Deenen
COMMENT: "This is a partial cover of the introduction/candyland music from
         the lost vikings, but I got a bit bored with it, so I added a bunch
         of harmonies to the lead to make it more interesting.  I still love
         the original music from that game, and so when I got the GBA version,
         I just had to do this." (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Midi_Drums.sid
  TITLE: Midi Drums [from the midi module]
 ARTIST: Jaymz Julian
COMMENT: "This is the second attempt I made to do this song on the C64, and was
         in fact the song that TFX table variables were created for.  I
         originally tried to do this in sid duzz it in early 1999, but the
         number of arpeggio commands required for the places where there is
         two leads in one channel, and the blips in the drum/bass channel,
         overwelmed that editor.  So I tried in JCH v20g4, where I had managed
         to succed with Sunset Spirals, due to the ability it has to change the
         wavetable from within a song, but this too was not to be, due to the
         limitations of the editor.  So, I started writing a new editor, which
         was specifically designed to handle this situation, by splitting each
         channel into six virtual channels, and using special rules to modulate
         them together.  But this took up a lot of ram and raster time, indeed
         it too so much ram in the editor that I could only store five patterns
         at a time, so this was not to be either.  So Ray introduced me to TFX,
         and I asked him about changing the wave table from within the song,
         but he wouldn't have this, because it would confuse people, but he
         suggested a viable alternative, which is to support variables in the
         wave table, and promised to add this feature asap.  That was January
         2001, but he was too busy to implement them for the next two and a
         half years.  So I started bugging him to just give me the source and
         the bits to build it, and in November 2003,  he did.  So, I put my
         money where my mouth was, and added that feature (and a bunch of
         others which I had been wanting for a long time), and I was _finally_
         able to do a version of this that I happy with.  To anyone else but
         me, this is just another mediocre game tune, but for me it was an
         achievement." (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Pacmania.sid
  TITLE: Block Town [from the arcade game Pac-Mania]
 ARTIST: Yoshito Tomuro
COMMENT: "Anyone who played the arcade game much knows that Ben's cover of it
         was a bit crap (I'd blame a lack of channels on the C64 for harmonies,
         but his amiga version is just as crap), and everyone else's C64 covers
         seem to cover his crap version, not the arcade version.  So, my
         version is crap too, but I think it has the nice harmonies in the
         second half, at least, and I think is a little less crap than his :)."
         (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Purple_Sky.sid
  TITLE: Purple Sky II [from the Scream Tracker 3 module]
 ARTIST: Jonne Valtonen (Purple Motion of Future Crew)
COMMENT: "After Sunset Sprirals, I was once again fed up with JCH's editor, and
         wanted something better.  Ray had suggested to me using TFX several
         times before, and I finally got some documentation for it, and so now
         was the time to use it.  I had the S3M of this kicking around, and so
         I covered it to learn the editor.  The instruments suck... I never was
         good at making percussion, and unfortunantly there isn't any good ones
         around made in TFX to rip.  I also had basically zero understanding of
         how the wave tables worked when I did this, and as a result there are
         some very stupid things in there which sound terrible ;).  This
         probably should never have been released, but people liked it for
         reasons that I don't understand.
         As it turned out, the instruments sounded so crap partially because
         Ray's player was horrifically bugged, at the time.  I recompiled it
         against a later player, and it sounds a LOT better." (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Rasterman.sid
  TITLE: Flop Magazine 41 [from the Atari XL/XE music]
 ARTIST: Radek Sterba (Raster)
COMMENT: "So, TFX 2.9 still wasn't here, but I wanted to cover this 4 channel
         music from the atari, so what I did, is set the player to 1 frame per
         row, and then enter all of the arpeggios by hand.  I'm surprised it
         didn't make the file much larger than it is.  It was a pain in the
         ass, but I'm quite pleased with the result." (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Rekonstruct.sid
COMMENT: "This song is made up entirely of patterns from Fishmagic, but played
         a different tempo's and in a differnet order.  It was originally
         intended to be used in a demo with fishmagic, so I was going for that
         similar but different effect, and I think it worked very well.  But,
         ironically, I was never happy enough with the original fishmagic, or
         how the demo was turning out, so I gave this to Jazzcat for an issue
         of Vandalism News, for which it was much more suitable anyhow. I love
         this sort of song, why don't people do more of them?" (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Slanted.sid
  TITLE: <?>
 ARTIST: Harri Kivisto (Eterman)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Slanted_2SID.sid
  TITLE: <?>
 ARTIST: Harri Kivisto (Eterman)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Sonic_Dreams.sid
COMMENT: "This was my entry for the 2004 SidWine competition, and it did
         fantasitcally badly, despite being what I consider to be probably the
         best demoscene style song that I've done on the C64.  I actually spent
         a lot of time on this song, and I was quite proud of how it turned out
         when it was finished.  It makes extensive use of the TFX wave table
         variables to try and squeeze two melody lines into a single channel,
         and the NoPulse command to control pulse width modulation reset more
         finely.
         The song is dedicated to a group I used to be a part of, Sonic Dreams,
         which is another story." (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Sunset_Spirals.sid
  TITLE: Sunset Spirals [from the Impulse Tracker module]
 ARTIST: Jaymz Julian (A Life in Hell)
COMMENT: "This is, musically, probably the best thing that I have ever done on
         the C64.  Ironically, all of my C64 friends complained that it was off
         key, etc, and all of my PC friends love this version.  Yet I had
         exactly the opposite reaction to the original version (c64 guys tended
         to like it, pc guys tended to complain that it was off key.).  For the
         record, except for one or two notes, because I ran out of arpeggios (I
         do that a lot... there are two or three other musics which got
         scrapped half way through because I ran out of arpeggios.  Thankfully,
         we've come up with a solution to this in the new version of TFX :)),
         the notes are NOT off key, and I don't care what you all think :-p.
         Said PC guys decided to take ownership of this song, and wanted me to
         create more like it, but I havn't had the motivation to actully
         finish any of them. (There are many, many, many stories that I could
         tell about the digiradi guys, but that's for another day, but the
         credit of the music to "Coder" is a part of that insanity.  They were
         great times)." (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/TFX_Equals_Future_Composer.sid
COMMENT: "Who could forget the 50 trillion intro tunes made in FC during the
         late 80's and early 90's?  You know you love them... of course, I
         completly fucked it up by not using the traditional filterbass that
         everyone used/uses so that I could have a filterlead, but eh,
         do you really care that it's not genuine FC style?" (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/This_is_Coder.sid
COMMENT: "This is the second thing that I did for Digiradi, after sunset. It
         obviously didn't work as well as sunset did, but I think it has a
         certain charm to it, myself." (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/This_is_Jaymz.sid
  TITLE: This is Coder
 ARTIST: Jaymz Julian (Coder)
COMMENT: "The same notes as This is Coder, but with a different sound.  I did
         another remix of this, with drums and related things, but I love the
         "pure" sound that this one has." (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/This_is_Jaymz_2_0.sid
  TITLE: This is Coder
 ARTIST: Jaymz Julian (Coder)
COMMENT: "This is a remix version that I did to take advantage of the new table
         variables, and I think large parts of it work well." (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Tim_Got_High.sid
COMMENT: "The Tim in question is Tim Bray, who does an act "Casionova", where
         he shows off 80's home keyboards, and other chip instruments,
         including a commodore 64 with a guitar strap attached.  Loscha and I
         were at one of his gigs, and he was tanking really badly (indeed, we
         could remember more of the words to his songs than he could!).  This
         was mostly because, we think, he was completly off the planet.  So, we
         came back to my place, after the gig, and I was showing off the new
         version of TFX, and we wrote the bass/chord/drum line (which is all
         one channel) to demonstrate some of the new features.  The file needed
         a name, and so we just typed in "Tim got high", and the name stuck.
         This song also has a lot of ring modulation (Joxstrap/WOW said too
         much :-p), which I love as always." (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Winters_Dream.sid
  TITLE: Winter's Dream [from the Impulse Tracker module]
 ARTIST: Andrew Sega (Necros)
COMMENT: "Back when I was writing music on the PC for 16 hours a day, every
         day, this was the demo song included with one of the many "this is the
         last release really!" releases of impulse tracker.  I'd actually
         wanted to make a C64 version of this for a long time, but it took me
         until now to really work out how to do it to my liking.
         Throwing that piece of junk away to concentrate on C64 music was the
         best descision I ever made.  I never was very good at it, anyhow."
         (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/Yawlag_Xard_Hcj.sid
COMMENT: "This is the only released music made in the modified version of JCH's
         player that I was hacking up during 1999 (I had all of my stuff
         stolen, including the only copy of the player sources etc).  I
         originally wanted to create Galway style tune, but changed my mind
         half way and thought I'd make a Drax style music instead, and then put
         a JCH style lead on it.  Read the title backwards, and it will all
         make sense. This was also the first music of mine that I know of to be
         used in someone else's production (of course *I* use my own music, but
         well, it's crap, so no-one else does), which was a graphic collection
         by someone in Sonic Dreams (Rat I think).  Those guys were great fun,
         and some of them actully liked my music, which was a nice change, but
         goddamn the organisation of that group turned into a clusterfuck :-p,
         But it was all fun at the end of the day." (JJ)

/MUSICIANS/J/Julian_Jaymz/cdagame_s3m.sid
  TITLE: cdagame [from the ScreamTracker S3M module]
 ARTIST: Dan Grandpre (Basehead)

### /MUSICIANS/J/Juzdie ######################################################

/MUSICIANS/J/Juzdie/
COMMENT: Jussi Hannula (Juzdie) is Antti Hannula's brother.

/MUSICIANS/J/Juzdie/In_Your_Dreams.sid
COMMENT: "My first SID ever. Participated in proxy 1886 Party oldskool music
         competition and came 6th there. I expected people to vote it higher,
         because it was the only song made with C64 in the whole competition.
         This song was done on 8580 and I didn't realise to turn off the
         filters on channel 1, so if you're listening this with 6581rev1 then
         don't panic if the channel 1 sounds strange" (Jussi Hannula)

/MUSICIANS/K/KB/Low_Frequency.sid
COMMENT: "As one of our members had coded a demo part which sucked such an
         amount of time that it was impossible to have a music routine running
         every frame, I was forced to compose a zak which ran at a speed of
         25Hz instead of 50. Pity-ful, this part was never released but it was
         a nice experiment how to cope with all these drum fx when you can't
         really use waveform tables." (KB)

### /MUSICIANS/K/Kasmo\ ######################################################

### /MUSICIANS/K/Kawasaki_Ryo ################################################

/MUSICIANS/K/Kawasaki_Ryo/
COMMENT: Ryo Kawasaki's own comments are denoted (RK).
         "When the first time Commodore 64 computer hit the market in 1984, I
         rushed to buy it by paying $600 at some electronic store on 45th
         street in Manhattan. It was 8-bit with only 64KB of memory. Then I
         spent two years to write these four programs as well as unpublished
         Midi-Workstation (8-track real-time Midi recorder) all by machine
         code using SuperMon without assembler so that it runs fast and leave
         enough memory for music data. Each of these programs was sold for
         $49.95 in retail stores furnished with handsome package came with
         5-inch floppy disk and manual. In 15 years, now we can buy 1GHz PC
         for the same price as I bought my first C64. And I wonder what kind
         of computer we can buy 15 years from now by paying $600?" (RK)

COMMENT: "Satellite Station was created & recorded in 1983 and used as one of
         demo songs with Rhythm Rocker." (RK)

 ARTIST: Bomb the Bass

 ARTIST: Cappella

  TITLE: Move On Baby [from U Got 2 Know]
 ARTIST: Cappella

  TITLE: Move On Baby [from U Got 2 Know]
 ARTIST: Cappella

/MUSICIANS/K/Khugiani_Naveed/Cappella_3.sid
  TITLE: Move On Baby [from U Got 2 Know]
 ARTIST: Cappella

/MUSICIANS/K/Khugiani_Naveed/Channels.sid
COMMENT: "This demonstrates the output of my 1bit Step-predicted ADPCM encoder
         which is an improvement over the previous (which has multiple
         prediction and more accurate block analysis. Furthermore sequencing
         has been added which allow many sample loops to be repeated while
         decoded in realtime." (NK)
  TITLE: Darkstar
 ARTIST: Paul Hardcastle

/MUSICIANS/K/Khugiani_Naveed/Digital_Fantasies_loader.sid
  TITLE: Nineteen
 ARTIST: Paul Hardcastle

/MUSICIANS/K/Khugiani_Naveed/Ebony_and_Ivory.sid
  TITLE: Ebony and Ivory
 ARTIST: Paul McCartney & Stevie Wonder

/MUSICIANS/K/Khugiani_Naveed/Erasure_1.sid
  TITLE: Am I Right? [from Chorus]
 ARTIST: Erasure

/MUSICIANS/K/Khugiani_Naveed/FRODIGI.sid
COMMENT: "This demonstrates a new method of playing back digitized samples.
         It demonstrates the output of my new audio encoder that produces
         output that is able to be decoded on the C64 using only a few raster
         lines per frame. It uses the free running SID oscillators on the C64's
         SID chip in 3 channels and a master volume to recreate the audio.
         Mainly suited for speech, but can also work on other sources. This
         demonstration packs a few minutes of audio into less than 47k and
         running in a C64 made in the early 80's with only 1MHz processor." (NK)
  TITLE: Boing Boom Tschak [from Electric Cafe] (0:00)
 ARTIST: Kraftwerk
  TITLE: Tell It to My Heart (1:15)
 ARTIST: Taylor Dayne
  TITLE: Im Nin'Alu [from Yemenite Songs] (2:03)
 ARTIST: Ofra Haza
  TITLE: Tom's Diner [from Solitude Standing] (2:43)
 ARTIST: Suzanne Vega
  TITLE: Set You Free (3:25)
 ARTIST: N-Trance

/MUSICIANS/K/Khugiani_Naveed/FRODIGI_2.sid
  TITLE: Like A Virgin [from Like a Virgin]
 ARTIST: Madonna
COMMENT: See comment for /MUSICIANS/K/Khugiani_Naveed/FRODIGI.sid

/MUSICIANS/K/Khugiani_Naveed/FRODIGI_3.sid
  TITLE: Better [from Paul Hardcastle]
 ARTIST: Paul Hardcastle
COMMENT: See comment for /MUSICIANS/K/Khugiani_Naveed/FRODIGI.sid

/MUSICIANS/K/Khugiani_Naveed/FRODIGI_4_tune_1.sid
  TITLE: Respectable [from FLM] (0:00)
 ARTIST: Mel & Kim
  TITLE: I Like to Move It [from Move It!] (0:23)
 ARTIST: Reel 2 Real

### /MUSICIANS/K/Kiss_Konrad #################################################

/MUSICIANS/K/Kiss_Konrad/Babysitter.sid
COMMENT: As indicated by its title, this tune covers children songs that were
         popular in Hungary in the late '80s.
  TITLE: Theme of Mouse on Mars [from the cartoon series] (0:13-0:39)
 ARTIST: <?>
  TITLE: Puff, The Magic Dragon (0:41-1:06)
 ARTIST: Peter, Paul & Mary
COMMENT: This song was covered by a Hungarian folk band called "100 Folk
         Celsius" with Hungarian lyrics and became a popular tune amongst
         children there.
  TITLE: Theme to "A Mézga család kalandjai" (1:07-1:36)
 ARTIST: Tamás Deák
COMMENT: Title theme of the Hungarian cartoon series "Adventures of the Mézga
         family", which became a popular cartoon series all over Eastern
         Europe in its time.
  TITLE: Micimackó (1:40-2:36)
 ARTIST: Zsuzsa Koncz & Illés
COMMENT: A Hungarian song about how Winnie, the Pooh (Micimackó in Hungarian)
         feels cold in the winter snowfall.

/MUSICIANS/K/Kiss_Konrad/Coopzak.sid
  TITLE: Czardas (0:38-0:58)
 ARTIST: Vittorio Monti
  TITLE: Dallas Theme [from the TV series] (0:59-1:08)
 ARTIST: Jerrold Immel
  TITLE: El Bimbo (1:09-1:23)
 ARTIST: Georgie Dann
  TITLE: Czardas (2:31-2:53)
 ARTIST: Vittorio Monti

/MUSICIANS/K/Kiss_Konrad/Deepspace_Travel.sid

 ARTIST: Jonne Valtonen (Purple Motion of Future Crew)
COMMENT: The chord melody is as in one part in the original.

/MUSICIANS/K/Kiss_Konrad/Falu_Mix.sid
COMMENT: The word "Falu" in the title means "village" in Hungarian as
         these songs are folk songs and drinking songs usually sang at rural
         weddings.

/MUSICIANS/K/Klaewer_Oliver/Soul_Crystal.sid
COMMENT: All tunes cover the Amiga version (MED format). The Amiga version uses
         one more tune "Richard's Toccata", which isn't used in the C64 version
         (the tune "Former Glory" is played once more instead).
         The C64 version of the game has an option to toggle between "old SID"
         and "new SID", the only difference being that selecting the "new SID"
         disables the filter. This rip has the filter enabled.

 ARTIST: Chris Link

 ARTIST: Chris Link

  TITLE: Hi Ho Silver
 ARTIST: Jim Diamond
COMMENT: Used as the theme for the U.K. TV series Boon.

/MUSICIANS/L/Leitch_Barry/Hillstreet.sid
  TITLE: Hill Street Blues theme [from the TV series]
 ARTIST: Mike Post

/MUSICIANS/L/Leitch_Barry/I_C_U_P_S.sid
  TITLE: Hoodoo Voodoo
 ARTIST: Graham Marsh (BOGG)
COMMENT: "Icups - my first published work... I had written the tune as a demo,
         and I had been trading with Bogg for a few years, and I had re-written
         his tune just to see how I would have taken his initial idea and run
         with it myself. Anyways, I had sent disks with a load of tunes on to
         all the major software companies at the time. Firebird contacted me,
         they wanted to use Icups. I told them at the time that it was kind of
         a rip off of Bogg's Detergent, but they were quite happy to offer to
         buy it. They offered me 150 pounds, and then when someone pointed out
         again to them that it was based on Bogg's tune, they gave him half the
         money too which I was quite happy with." (BL)

/MUSICIANS/L/Leitch_Barry/If_I_Was.sid
  TITLE: If I Was [from Answers To Nothing]
 ARTIST: Midge Ure

/MUSICIANS/L/Leitch_Barry/Impossamole.sid
  TITLE: Monty on the Run, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Rob Hubbard
COMMENT: Due to a bug in the game code, when the game switched from the title
         screen to the high score table, it placed forty or so incorrect bytes
         into the music routine, making the theme tune bug and play one of the
         voices at the wrong pitch. Leitch has confirmed that this rip is
         bug-free.

/MUSICIANS/L/Leitch_Barry/Just_Call_Me_Ben.sid
COMMENT: "Just trying to sound like Ben Daglish." (BL)

/MUSICIANS/L/Leitch_Barry/Live_to_Tell.sid
  TITLE: Live to Tell [from True Blue]
 ARTIST: Madonna
COMMENT: "Tone of the MILLIONS of demos we produced leading up to the ICUPS
         purchase, I was spewing out 3 or more tunes a day at this point, so
         what if it doesn't sound like the original, I DIDNT have a copy of the
         original to listen to, I didnt know what it sounds like,.. I don't even
         like Madonna... Can u tell ?" (BL)

/MUSICIANS/L/Leitch_Barry/Living_OK.sid
  TITLE: That's Livin' Alright [from the TV series Auf Wiedersehen Pet]
 ARTIST: Joe Fagin

/MUSICIANS/L/Leitch_Barry/Marauder.sid
COMMENT: "Written while I was still living in Scotland, Robert Magowan wrote
         the game and Mark Kelly took all the credit, got the good job and
         moved to California... Cant blame him really :) I think this was the
         first time I'd done anything on the 64 that was vaguely acceptable."
         (BL)
         Only tunes #1-3 are used in the game. #4-6 are taken from Barry's
         workdisks.

/MUSICIANS/L/Leitch_Barry/Miami_Vice.sid
  TITLE: Miami Vice Theme [from the TV series]
 ARTIST: Jan Hammer

/MUSICIANS/L/Leitch_Barry/Mindsmear.sid
COMMENT: "Written for the ZZap 64 Mindsmear April Fools Day competition. I got
         2nd prize... Years later I met up with the Zzap reviewers who had made
         the decision as to who won.. The reason the other guy won was because
         he'd written like 20 tunes and sent them all in so they let him win
         for doing so much work, but they all agreed mine was better ! :)
         HAHAHAH I've waited 11 years to tell that story!" (BL) ("the other
         guy" = Anthony Lees)

/MUSICIANS/L/Leitch_Barry/Money_for_Nothing.sid
  TITLE: Money for Nothing [from Brothers In Arms]
 ARTIST: Dire Straits

(#1)
  TITLE: Postman Pat [from the TV series]
 ARTIST: Bryan Daly
COMMENT: Interestingly, Alternative used exactly the same music for 'Postman
         Pat 2' as well.
         "The Highlight of my career... Actually there was one point where the
         top 3 titles in the UK had my music in them.. Silkworm was one,
         Postman Pat was another, and I'm damned if I can remember what the 3rd
         was... probably Emlyn Hughes Soccer on re-release." (BL)

  TITLE: What a Wonderful World
 ARTIST: Sam Cooke
COMMENT: It's called "Shrink to Fit" because it was featured in a famous Jeans
         advert, which is why there is the police siren at the beginning (the
         advert featured a police car at the beginning). (Info from Chris
         Abbott)

/MUSICIANS/L/Leitch_Barry/Silkworm.sid
  TITLE: Ingame [from the arcade game Silk Worm]
 ARTIST: <?>
COMMENT: Almost all copies of the game had a bug in the tape loader routine
         which would mean the music corrupts itself around the 1:20 mark. This
         version is now bug free.
         Not a cover of the arcade original, but definitely inspired by it.

/MUSICIANS/L/Leitch_Barry/Sophistry_war.sid
COMMENT: The tunes in this SID were meant to be for the game Sophistry,
         programmed by Mark Kelly of the team Aracnum Developments (whom Barry
         was also a member of at the time). According to Mark Kelly, the game
         was to be published by Hewson but due to licencing disagreements with
         Firebird (Sophistry being similar to Firebird's Zolyx) the game was
         cancelled.

/MUSICIANS/L/Leitch_Barry/Space_Crusade.sid
COMMENT: "C64 Version of the Amiga title tune." (BL)

/MUSICIANS/L/Leitch_Barry/Tenko.sid
  TITLE: Tenko Theme [from the TV series]
 ARTIST: James Harpham
COMMENT: "No it wasnae me, someone else must have written my name... LOL
         OK, OK it was me..  I did the music in about 20 minutes and my mate
         drew the picture in even less time, TADA, instant Commodore 64 demo...
         Fame fortune and a life of torture ahead of u for churning out shite
         like that.. The out of tune pings were our way of saying "Yeah this is
         shit, but we did it"... which is more than can be said for others..."
         (BL)

 ARTIST: Prince

/MUSICIANS/L/Leitch_Barry/Xenophobe.sid
COMMENT: "I got the one of the highest ratings I've ever got for this.. Zzap
         64 gave me 96% for it.. one of the others was Impossamole on the NEC.
         I have a copy of that somewhere but havent had the chance to try out
         the emulator." (BL)
(#1)
COMMENT: The digitized voice is actually Barry Leitch himself. The original
         Xenophobe theme, was written and 4 Amiga networked using 16 channels
         and was originally included as a tape in the package of the game. The
         original music features the speech of Neil Young, who is now the head
         of Origin, which could not be used in the C64 version of the game for
         legal reasons.
(#11)
COMMENT: "I used a lot of filters in the loading tune [...]" (BL)

### /MUSICIANS/L/Lft #########################################################

/MUSICIANS/L/Lft/
COMMENT: Lft's (Linus Akesson) own comments are denoted (LA)

/MUSICIANS/L/Lft/A_Chipful_of_Love_for_You.sid
COMMENT: Won first place at the Gubbdata 2013 music competition.

/MUSICIANS/L/Lft/Allt_under_himmelens_faeste.sid
  TITLE: Allt under himmelens fäste
 ARTIST: Visa Röster
COMMENT: "At a concert where Visa Röster interpreted both SID tunes and Swedish
         folk songs, my girlfriend and I bought a couple of CDs, and found a
         little gem called Allt under himmelens fäste that we both instantly
         liked. It's a very sad song with a simple melody, supported by a
         solemn yet rhythmical accompaniment written by Mahoney. If you're a
         SID composer, you know that when you get a song stuck on your mind,
         it inevitably ends up as a SID tune. =) In this case, I've tried to
         stick to Mahoney's arrangement as far as possible." (LA)

/MUSICIANS/L/Lft/Allt_under_himmelens_faeste_v2.sid
  TITLE: Allt under himmelens fäste
 ARTIST: Visa Röster

/MUSICIANS/L/Lft/Foerklaedd_Gud_alpha.sid
COMMENT: The Foerkladd Gud tunes are a SID septett, aimed to be played on 7
         SIDs simultaneously.

/MUSICIANS/L/Lft/Foerklaedd_Gud_beta.sid
COMMENT: The Foerkladd Gud tunes are a SID septett, aimed to be played on 7
         SIDs simultaneously.

/MUSICIANS/L/Lft/Foerklaedd_Gud_delta.sid
COMMENT: The Foerkladd Gud tunes are a SID septett, aimed to be played on 7
         SIDs simultaneously.

/MUSICIANS/L/Lft/Foerklaedd_Gud_epsilon.sid
COMMENT: The Foerkladd Gud tunes are a SID septett, aimed to be played on 7
         SIDs simultaneously.

/MUSICIANS/L/Lft/Foerklaedd_Gud_eta.sid
COMMENT: The Foerkladd Gud tunes are a SID septett, aimed to be played on 7
         SIDs simultaneously.

/MUSICIANS/L/Lft/Foerklaedd_Gud_gamma.sid
COMMENT: The Foerkladd Gud tunes are a SID septett, aimed to be played on 7
         SIDs simultaneously.

/MUSICIANS/L/Lft/Foerklaedd_Gud_zeta.sid
COMMENT: The Foerkladd Gud tunes are a SID septett, aimed to be played on 7
         SIDs simultaneously.

/MUSICIANS/L/Lft/Slaepwerigne.sid
COMMENT: "This SID tune was composed for Breakpoint 2009. It ended up 7th
         in the Oldschool Executable Music compo, which isn't too bad
         considering its original approach." (LA)

COMMENT: "This is my first regular SID tune. It was written for Backslash 2007,
         where it ended up on 4th place." (LA)

### /MUSICIANS/L/Luca/Old_Tunes ##############################################

/MUSICIANS/L/Luca/Old_Tunes/
COMMENT: Older tunes were composed on a Commodore Plus/4 using a specially
         converted version of Future Composer, and then ported back to a
         C64. As the Plus/4 has a limited sound chip, the instruments will
         sound a little flat. Luca's own comments are indicated by (LC).

/MUSICIANS/L/Luca/Old_Tunes/Ah_my_Goddess.sid
  TITLE: My Heart Iidasenai, Your Heart Tashikametai
 ARTIST: Takeshi Yasuda
COMMENT: The tune is the opening theme from anime "Ah My Goddess!" and its
         rough English translation is "My Heart won't let me say, I want to be
         certain of Your Heart".

/MUSICIANS/L/Luca/Old_Tunes/Ai_oboeteimasuka.sid
  TITLE: Ai oboeteimasuka
 ARTIST: Kazuhiko Katoo, performed by Mari Iijima
COMMENT: "Translated from Japanese, the title means "Love, do you remember?".
         "This is the main song of the animation movie 'Superdimensional
         Fortress Macross - Love, do you remember?', sung by Lynn Minmay
         during the final battle." (LC)

/MUSICIANS/L/Luca/Old_Tunes/Anywhere_is.sid
  TITLE: Anywhere Is [from The Memory of Trees]
 ARTIST: Enya

/MUSICIANS/L/Luca/Old_Tunes/Attenti_al_lupo.sid
  TITLE: Attenti al lupo
 ARTIST: Lucio Dalla

/MUSICIANS/L/Luca/Old_Tunes/Battery_Remix.sid
  TITLE: Spellbound, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Rob Hubbard
COMMENT: "A digitized excerpt from Hubbard's 'Spellbound' theme has been used
         in the intro of a Commodore Plus/4 game called 'Battery', this would
         explain the name of this tune." (LC)

/MUSICIANS/L/Luca/Old_Tunes/Bloody_Bullet.sid
  TITLE: Iron Horse, Tune #1
 ARTIST: David Whittaker

/MUSICIANS/L/Luca/Old_Tunes/Book_of_Days.sid
  TITLE: Book of Days [from Shepherd Moons]
 ARTIST: Enya
COMMENT: "Completely wrong volume levels here...sorry!" (LC)

/MUSICIANS/L/Luca/Old_Tunes/Colla.sid
  TITLE: Colla [from Acido-Acida]
 ARTIST: Prozac+
COMMENT: The title translates from Italian as "Glue". "Although I think it
         refers to...strange kinds of glue..." (LC)

/MUSICIANS/L/Luca/Old_Tunes/Dragonball_Promo.sid
COMMENT: "This music is covered from the italian spot for the japanese cartoon
         series 'Dragon Ball'" (LC)

/MUSICIANS/L/Luca/Old_Tunes/Galaxy_Express_999.sid
  TITLE: Galaxy Express 999
 ARTIST: Oliver Onions
COMMENT: This song is the Italian title song for the Japanese cartoon series
         "Ginga Tetsudo 999" (translated from Japanese: "Galaxy Express 999")
         It has also been used in a movie with another title, "Fantasy".

 ARTIST: Mike Oldfield
COMMENT: "on the +4, the ascending sound was descending...AARGH!" (Luca)

/MUSICIANS/M/Merken_Vincent/Fairad.sid
(#1)
 AUTHOR: Vincent Merken (Vip)
(#2)
 AUTHOR: Vincent Merken (Vip)
(#3)
 AUTHOR: Vincent Merken (Vip)
(#4)
 AUTHOR: Vincent Merken (Vip)
  TITLE: Red October
 ARTIST: Linus Walleij (King Fisher)
(#5)
   NAME: Enfairlightenment
 AUTHOR: Warren Pilkington (Waz)
  TITLE: Enlightenment: Druid II, Tune #3
 ARTIST: David M. Hanlon
COMMENT: "Well, seeing as this tune was so well used for the FairLight
         crack intro, I did a remake for the intro remake." (WP)
(#6)
   NAME: Enfairlightenment II
 AUTHOR: Warren Pilkington (Waz)
  TITLE: Enlightenment: Druid II, Tune #3
 ARTIST: David M. Hanlon
COMMENT: "More loosely based, more fantasy inspired midway." (WP)
(#7)
   NAME: Vem er Emmy Köhler?
 AUTHOR: Warren Pilkington (Waz)
  TITLE: Nu Tändas Tusen Juleljus
 ARTIST: Emmy Köhler
COMMENT: "Seeing as Avalon was a member of FairLight, I thought it'd be
         a nice idea to cover one of his C64 tunes.  I really loved this
         one and fitted perfectly into an intro." (WP)
(#8)
   NAME: Gray Matter of Doom
 AUTHOR: Warren Pilkington (Waz)
COMMENT: "An oldskool type Matt Gray soundalike, to imagine the time when
         crack intros used old ripped game themes." (WP)
(#9)
   NAME: The End, Or Is It?
 AUTHOR: Warren Pilkington (Waz)
COMMENT: "Really punchy.  As we were running out of sequences in JCH
         Editor, I had to compromise slightly and use a few sequences
         from an earlier tune.  It worked well though as it also meant
         back to oldskool style of composers ripping ideas off each
         other ;)." (WP)

/MUSICIANS/M/Merken_Vincent/Fungus.sid
  TITLE: Test Drive, Tune #2 (0:00-0:23)
 ARTIST: Patrick Payne
COMMENT: Only bassline covered.

/MUSICIANS/M/Merken_Vincent/IntergaViptiC.sid
  TITLE: Intergalactic [from Hello Nasty]
 ARTIST: Beastie Boys
COMMENT: This tune was part of the Padua demo "Very Wicked/Most Delicate"
         which won the Beastie Boys AV logo competition held on the
         band's official website.

         think of a plane game." (Mermaid)

               My eight-bit computer

/MUSICIANS/M/Merman/Three_Lions.sid
  TITLE: Three Lions
 ARTIST: Baddiel and Skinner and The Lightning Seeds
COMMENT: David Baddiel and Frank Skinner are two popular comedians in England
         who presented the BBC2 TV show 'Fantasy Football League'.  Together
         with The Lightning Seeds they did the official England song for Euro
         '96, which was played before every England game in the tournament.
         Interestingly, this song also charted in Germany, as their fans used
         the song once they beat England on penalties in the semi-final.

### /MUSICIANS/M/Metal #######################################################

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/
COMMENT: Metal's own comments are denoted (TH). All of his comments are
         taken from Past'n'Present.

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/2_Jingles.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Newplayer v11.
         Then first jingle in this tune is a conversion of a little tiny tune,
         that I heard in a commercial for a radio-show (something about books I
         think). Well, the other jingle was just something I did." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/3_Monkeys.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         My latest and probably last tune. It's the result of my efforts to
         create a tune that was to compete at the open-competitions at
         Demobit'96, but as we all know that party was cancelled, so I had a
         tune without a destiny... Well, guess not as Jazzcat wanted it for
         Domination. It was used in the DOMINATION #8 outfit." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/5_Mugs_of_Coffee.sid
  TITLE: 5 Mugs of Coffee [from the XM module]
 ARTIST: Torben Hansen (Metal)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Abnormal_Intro.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v9.
         This tune was made for an Abnormal intro, but I think it was used by
         Walt in one of his many parts for Bonzai." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Ashtira.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         This tune is partly influenced by the tune 'Pigebluse' by Laxity -
         however, the tune is way different than the original and it has an OK
         ending with some nice bass-lines and chords. The tune was first used
         in a Unifier-part for Flash Inc. Don't ask me about the name - I'm
         lousy at remembering titles..." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Axel_Fjols.sid
  TITLE: Axel F [from the movie Beverly Hills Cop]
 ARTIST: Harold Faltermeyer
COMMENT: "My first try in the Music Assembler. I think this tune was made about
         the same time when Drax made a version of Axel F. in the NP-V14. "
         (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/BZ_eren.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Newplayer v14.
         This tune was supposted to be featured in Lethal Display 4, but the
         tune didn't fit the part at all and instead Walt used an old
         JCH-track. To my knowledge it has never been used." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Basmania.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Newplayer v13.
         This tune was made back in 1990, when I was in Contex and was featured
         in my Music-Collection #1, which was mysteriously lost in the mail
         when I sent it to Flex. Also it disappeared from my own disks... I
         guess it just wasn't meant to be. Anyway, Trap found this tune useful
         for a screen in Lethal Display 3." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Beachfunk.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v9.
         This is the second tune I ever made in the NP-players, and it was made
         on the very same day that I received the pack from JCH with the
         player. This tune has never been used listen and you'll know why.
         Composed on a shiny day in the early autumn of 1989." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Bezerk.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         This is one of my better house-tunes, I think. It has some annoying
         parts, which I would have excluded today, but that was then and I did
         it this way..." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Bladan.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v17.
         A short little tune. I don't think it's ever been used." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Boneyard.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         A try to make something laid back acid-like jazz, without really
         succeeding. The end is probably the most interesting thing about this
         tune. Quite unexpected." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Bonziied.sid
COMMENT: There may be more covers in this file.
         "Made with Newplayer v15.
         The main tune of the Bonzai demo Bonziied. I made this tune at a
         Bonzai meeting at THA's place in 1990. I got inspiration from Fox,
         Trap, Walt and Dize for the themes in the tune. However, there are a
         few sequences which were converted from the tune in Rebels legendary
         Amiga-demo from which we got the inspiration. I think Static/Rebels
         did the original tune..." (TH)
  TITLE: Itsy Bitsy Spider (0:34)
 ARTIST: Traditional
COMMENT: Folk song.
  TITLE: Wedding March [from A Midsummer Night's Dream] (0:46)
 ARTIST: Felix Mendelssohn Bartholdy

 ARTIST: Deep Purple

 ARTIST: Kaoma
  TITLE: Popcorn [from Music To Moog By] (2:49)
 ARTIST: Gershon Kingsley

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Bordella.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         At some point in time you get to compose a tune that you feel is your
         best. Well, this tune is one of those tunes I've done which I like the
         best. I guess I was a bit inspired by Jeroen Tel, but then again,
         ain't we all... :) It was used in... a Flash Inc. demo, I think... Or
         was it never used?? Err... whatever." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Burner.sid
  TITLE: Happy Birthday (0:00-0:12)
 ARTIST: Mildred J. Hill
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v9.
         Burn some rubber, baby!! Another one of those really old tunes..."
         (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Camel_Funk.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         Sitting at my keys I played these chords. Anyway, I converted this
         tune to the PC and put it together with 2 other themes making the
         Trilogy on the PC. Trilogy made it to the 2nd place in the
         multichannel competition at X96 and I got alot of feedback on it. Go
         get it - it's on the Vibrant's Homepage." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Cock-Cut.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         Naughty naughty naughty title... Rather unpleasant really. :) Anyway,
         this tune is a partly inspired by a real tune, which most Danes know
         for sure... Yep, it's 'Take no crap' by Cut'n'Move. The rest is
         basically something heard a zillion times before..." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Contex.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v9.
         Ah, this one was an attempt to do something like the ANM-Intro tune,
         but I failed... And, of course, Contex never used it - they didn't use
         one single tune of mine." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Crack.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         As far as I recall, this tune was meant for Deff/Avantgarde to use in
         a crack-intro. To my knowledge it was never used though." (TH)

         Another tune converted from the fab Walkman. It was used in a few

         (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Deaf_Deff.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         Ahh, this is the awful tune Deff forced me to do for him. As I
         mentioned in the text for the tune 'Sidekick', this tune is kind of
         sequel to that one. I only think that this tune stinks alot if
         compared to 'Sidekick'." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Diane.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v17.
         A lot of people seemed to like this one. Strangely enough it has never
         been used. Hmm... Well, I did an Amiga version of this tune as well,
         but it disappeared when I got rid of that lousy piece of junk."
         (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Dixie_Jazz.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v17.
         I made this tune at the Dexion party in Odense, Denmark at Xmas in
         1990. I made it on an old computer and I used earphones - when I got
         home it sounded like crap... Typical... Since then I've never composed
         anything at a party. BTW, I composed it for the intro of Lethal
         Display 3, but the demo was completely re-done after the party, and
         the intro-part was kicked along with my tune. Can't say I disagree."
         (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Dovne_Ged.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Newplayer v11.
         Wasn't meant to be packed, but when I went through my work-disks I
         found it, and as it was practially finished, I simply packed the damn
         thing... It was never meant for any particular production." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Drughouse.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Newplayer v15.
         Inspired by the Ghostbusters theme I came up with this house-version
         of the tune - well more or less... I liked it back then, but today
         it's way too flat." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Einstein.sid

 ARTIST: Poul Peder Hestbek (Einstein of Upfront)
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v18.
         Another tune which I converted from the Amiga. This time the tune was
         composed by Einstein - musician, who I regarded as one of the best
         during my years on the Amiga." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Emotions.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         Again an old tune I located on my work disks. I made the tune in 1992
         and added a few modifications in 1996." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Eurobarbie.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         Kind of a sequel to 'Jump Around', as it features a lot of the same
         stuff. It has a tiny bit of PVCF to it (ARFGHHH!!)....... Excuse me, I
         have to Vommit! It must have been a mistake. Did I do that... Hand me
         some valium... NOW!... Someone PLEASE erase this tune... Turn it
         off... Delete... DO SOMETHING!" (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Flaciied.sid

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Flopper_2.sid

         A tune, which I did just before my old C64 burned out. The tune got
         lost when I moved to Aalborg, but fortunately Syndrom had the tune."
         (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Funcommie.sid

         A tune building on the chords used in the last part of my PC-tune
         called Trilogy. The tune however is totally different." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Fusion.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         This tune was completed just before the Sams0 party in Denmark during
         the summer of 1992. I got Steve/ex-Xfactor to deliver this tune to the
         music competetion - however, I've never heard nor seen any results
         from that party, so I really haven't got a clue as to how it did...
         The tune itself is a combination of early C64-techno and some strange
         stuff - hence the name 'Fusion'!" (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Garrison.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v9.
         Another one of those early tunes in the NP-players, which really don't
         need any comments..." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Gedefims.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Newplayer v14.
         This is probably one of my most used tunes. Back in 1990, when it was
         made, I think it got used in 3 or 4 demos. The tune was composed
         immediately after listening to a Charles Deenen tune for some
         race-game (forgot the name). I made a conversion of it on the Amiga,
         which never got released." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Geologic.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         Ahh... Mot many liked this tune I guess. I didn't get much response to
         it, when it was in Skyhigh #19 - perhaps it was caused by an error in
         the coding of the outfit which caused the tune to sound like crap... I
         guess you could say this tune was heavily inspired by Jamiroquai."
         (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Gravoel.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         The title for this one is also Danish and means funeral-beer... It was
         actually an attempt to do something in a similar style as JCH.
         However, I think this tune without any doubt is 100% Metal. The tune
         has never been used - not to my knowledge anyway..." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Groovin_High.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         I converted this tune from Drax and Laxity's PC-version. Just couldn't
         resist it, as it was such a cool tune." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Hiscore.sid
  TITLE: a.hiscore [from the Amiga MOD module]
 ARTIST: Jesper Kyd
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v17.
         A tune converted from Amiga. It's originally made by Jesper Kyd and
         was featured in a Silents demo. I converted this in the summer of
         '91." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Hotshot.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Newplayer v15.
         I did this tune exclusively for my pal Morpheus/Flash Inc. for his mag
         Hotshot. I think it was used in 2 or 3 issues in the intro. This tune
         is not the one used in Hotshot though, as I changed the filters a bit.
         Hot V2.0 is the 'real' tune. Anyway, I thought this should be included
         as well as I bothered to spread it." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Hotshot_v2.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v15.
         This is the 'real' version of Hotshot M. with the filters changed a
         bit." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Incoqnito.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         A fast composed tune which I made especially for Iceball/Motiv8 to use
         in his game 'Tric Trac' or so... As usual I never got the money for
         it, as the fantastic incredible Cherry Software managed not to pay."
         (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Introjam.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v10.
         Another tune from 1989 which was meant as an intro-tune for Contex,
         but it never made it, and I think to this date it's never been used."
         (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Jensemand.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v17.
         I kinda named this tune after JCH, not that the tune itself has
         anything to do with him... It's just like with most of my work - fuck
         the name, it's the tune that counts." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/JozzMatazz.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         A tune, which Johannes Bjerregaard has been composing in the
         MIDI-format. It's fairly different from what Johannes usually did on
         C64." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Jump_round.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         Sitting at my synth I came up with these chords, and thinking
         immediately that they would suit a house-tune just perfectly I did
         this tune. It's fairly simply, but then again so is all house-music.
         It has a catchy theme though I think. Lion/Chromance used this for the
         intro for Domination #8. The tune was supposed to be exclusive, but
         then suddenly out of the blue an old AVT-project called 'Icarus'
         surfaced, and as my tune was first intended for that production I was
         quite annoyed by this. Who thought an AVT-production would turn up as
         a Padua*Hitmen production. Oh well, fuck that." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Kedsomehed.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v9.
         A tune inspired a bit by rock'n'roll. Anyway as far as I know it was
         used in an Abnormal crack-intro by Stone, I think - however they
         screwed up the credits as it was credited to Torben Larsen instead of
         the correct Torben Hansen or simply Metal... But who cares about that
         now..." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Koeleskab.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         I made this tune in December 1991 especially for the upcoming Lethal
         Display 4, but I ended up delivering if to Steve/X-factor, as he had
         just started his software label called Imagination Developments. So,
         at The Party 1 in 1991 he got the finished tune and plugged it into
         the demo, which was then released... Syndrom liked this tune so much
         that he did a 90% copy of it. He explained to me later on, that he did
         it to gain experience, which is OK my me, but unfortunately it got
         used in game for which Syndrom got some money... Anyway, we've
         straightened that out long ago. BTW, the title means Fridge." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Legoklods.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         Haha, well, this tune is basically built totally on one of my other
         tunes, namely 'Geologic' - the chords are the same, but the rest
         differs. Exclusive for DOMINATION #9 Magazine outfit." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Lethalic.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Newplayer v14.
         Made this especially for the intro-sequence of Lethal Display 3,
         however, I think my work was a total waste considering the final
         result of it. Anyway the 3rd tune is ok." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/MF_2DD_XL.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v10.
         This tune was my first in the NP-V10. It was made in 1989, and I think
         it was featured in one of Walt's screens in Lethal Display 3 (the
         circle scroller)." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Microcosm.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         Hmm... Some chords I came up with while playing around on the keys...
         And the rest was basically rushed together. I guess the tune is OK,
         but I really think it's way too boring." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Mon_iacs.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Newplayer v14.
         Inspired by Jeroen Tel's tune for Tintin on the Moon, I sat down and
         put this together in a relative short time. I got a lot of good
         response on this tune, and I also think it's quite catchy. I think it
         was used in Lethal Display 3... or at least it's been used in some
         other demos." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Morpheus.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         My old friend Morpheus/Flash Inc. wanted me to do a tune named after
         him, and after a while I did. Unfortunately my timing was lousy, as
         Morpheus had left the scene when I had finished the tune, ofcoz
         meaning that it had never been used. Too bad really." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Mums_1.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         This is basically another intro-like-tune. It's nothing special."
         (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Mystic.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         This tune was made after fiddling around on my synth. I came up with
         the scales that sounded very mystical... Hence the name. It's very
         short really, and think that Avantgarde got to use it in an intro."
         (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Nedsat_psyko.sid
COMMENT: Nearly the same as /MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Psykologic.sid

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Nosefuck.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         A nice and short bossanova-like tune, which I did in 1993 after
         getting myself a new C64." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Note-It_1.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         A series of chords and BAM! you have a tune... Well, this was
         originally only a work-tune, but I dug it out from the dungeons and
         finished it rather rapidly thinking it would probably suit some
         note..." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Note-It_2.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         This tune - as you may be able to hear - has a few sequences similar
         to the ones in Note-it 1. That's simply because I built this tune from
         Note-it 1 - adding some other chord-theme and yet another note-tune
         was done... I should probably never have released these 2 tunes as I
         really think they stink..." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Ode_2_Riis.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         Odd, coz this tune is dedicated to Bjarne Riis (who?!) - after
         achieving 3rd place in the Tour de France in 1995... Who should've
         known he would win the darn race the year after... Oh well, this tune
         was used in one of The Pulse, when it returned in 1995." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Oh_Baby.sid
  TITLE: Let's Hear It for the Boy
 ARTIST: Deniece Williams
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v9.
         I converted this tune from a Walkman tune [Lets Hear My Baby] on
         the Amiga. Walkman was definitely one of the best composers on the
         Amiga during my time on the Amiga. JCH liked this conversion even
         though I found it a bit dull compared to the original." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Orbital.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         Mitch/Crest/Hype! had been composing another funky-tune and during one
         of our talks he asked me if I couldn't do a techno-thingie using the
         same chord structure. And well, here's the result. I think
         Deff/ex-Avantgarde wanted to use it in a graphics-collection, but that
         didn't go well at all." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Organic.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         This is one half of a Jeroen Tel tune and one half myself. Actually
         after listening to it a number of times I kinda like my parts more.
         Oh well... Judge for yourself. I believe this tune was featured in the
         end-screen in one of the 1st (if not the last) Flash Inc. demo.
         Hmm..." (TH)
  TITLE: Supremacy, Tune #1 (0:00-1:13)
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel
  TITLE: National Anthem of the Soviet Union (1:28-1:36)
 ARTIST: Aleksandr Aleksandrov
  TITLE: Supremacy, Tune #1 (1:55)
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Parrot.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Newplayer v15.
         The name of this tune came from a disk I got from JCH. On the cover
         there was an ugly parrot... Well, the tune is OK, I guess. It was used
         by Kwon, or at least it was supposed to. Hmm... My memory kinda
         sucks." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Plasma_5.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Newplayer v11.
         After finishing this tune, I felt that it was too slow and boring, but
         Walt told me that he thought it was great and he used it in the
         Raytrace-part of Crackle'n'Cocio for the Daniaz party in 1990."
         (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Plastic_T.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         After finishing this tune I was pretty sure that no-one had done
         anything remotely like this on the C64. Ofcoz I was wrong, but still I
         think it's one of the first techno-tunes in the scene. I think it was
         used in a crack-intro for Regina." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Please_Me.sid
  TITLE: Please me [from the Amiga MOD module]
 ARTIST: Kim Tolstrup Christensen (Future Freak)
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         I came across a music-disk on the Amiga from Future Freak/Dexion, and
         on that disk there was a fabulous tune called 'Please me', and I
         thought it was such a great, that I simply had to do a conversion of
         it - ofcoz the original sounds alot better, but still... Unfortunately
         it's never been used." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Profile.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Newplayer v11.
         I had read way too many Dragonlace books when I made this... It was
         used in the end-part in Crackle'n'Cocio." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Ramloesa.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         Ahh... A cool refreshing Ramlosa beats almost everything after a
         fierce battle on the soccer-field. Anyway, this tune is rather wierd -
         at least the first part is kinda strange. I'm not sure if it ever got
         used by anyone, which I think is a darn shame." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Ray-Ban.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         Actually this tune is one of the first where I actually played some
         chords on a piano before composing. It's a fairly melodic tune."
         (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Resigning.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v17.
         Silly as I am, I thought this tune was my last one on the C64...
         ...Well, just take a look at the amount of tunes dated after this
         one... I don't think I resigned after all. :)" (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Revealed.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         Well, as the title 'reveals' this tune was meant for the Camelot
         magazine Revealed. The tune would have suited an intro just as well, I
         think, but Kring decided after Revealed #3 to make the following issue
         a cyber-like issue, and so I had to compose some deep techno."
         (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/S-Depress.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Newplayer v11.
         Ah... Sounds a bit like... well, Drax actually. At this time my style
         was heavily influenced by Drax, as we met quite a lot. This tune was
         used in an X-Factor production - can't remember the name, but it's an
         old thing. I don't think it was used in any Bonzai productions, but
         then again, I might be wrong." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Sayonara.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Newplayer v14.
         This tune is featured in the intro to the Bonzai demo Bonziied. I put
         this together at the Bonzai meeting at THA's place in the summer of
         1990. To my knowledge it hasn't been used in other productions." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Schwantz.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v17.
         Argh, this tune kinda marks the beginning of an era of my compositions
         - the strange year(s)... An era which really isn't over, but I'm not
         half as strange as I was at this time..." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Shaolink.sid
