         Again, an Amiga conversion. This time I converted Jochen Hippel's tune
         for Shaolin. It was in a really lame FM-editor on the Amiga." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Shit_It.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v9.
         Hmm... Another tune from 1989 - yuck. Though, it has a bit of that
         speed-freak attitude that some of my later work has." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Sidekick.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         An attempt to create a Hybrid between C64-heavy metal and just
         something speedy... Deff loved one and made me do a sequel
         (Deaf-Deff), which IMO didn't really turn out as good as this one... I
         think this tune is one of my longest, as I think it goes for some 5-6
         minutes." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Skumbanan.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         A little tune which I composed in some 2 hours or so... It's an ok
         tune, but it's fairly boring..." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Smal_Sag.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v17.
         Another one of those tunes that was just floating around on one of my
         work-disks, and - as usual - I packed and this one ever got spread,
         but I'm not sure if it was ever used." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Sofakoger.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         Boiling in your couch. That's basically what this is all about. I made
         this exclusively for SCS*TRC. I hope they used it in their intros :)"
         (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Soft_Eyes.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Newplayer v14.
         I made this tune in a hurry for Trap's 18th birthday demo back in
         1990. I don't think it's been used in other productions since." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Swingin.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Newplayer v14.
         This tune is one of those tunes which has been used a lot. It was
         originally featured in the fractal-part of the Bonzai demo called
         Crackle'n'Cocio that won the Daniax party in 1990." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Teknolog.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         This was the 3rd tune featured in Revealed #4. It's a mix of a
         Jam&Spoon tune and some of my own stuff... It also has been used for a
         game, with my permission, but unfortunately I got no money for it -
         typical!!" (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Telefax.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Newplayer v14.
         Inspired by a simple thing as the telephone signal, I wrote this tune
         (my own phone, actually). The rest of the tune came out quite well,
         and it was one of my fave tunes for a long time. MSK told me that it
         was the best tune he had ever heard... Hmm.. Anyway, it was used in
         the 1st part in Crackle'n'Cocio." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Time_4_Sex.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Newplayer v15.
         One of those tunes you stumble upon when listening through your work
         disks. Just packed the damn thing because it sounded special. Didn't
         pack it for any particular reason." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Tjuhej.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         A tune that sounds much like it's name. I think it's a rather merry
         tune and I like it somewhat more then the usual tunes I've made. I
         believe the tune was used by Walt in the 1st Starion demo called
         'Oksen' from 1993." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Toerstig.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         The title of this tune means 'Thirsty!' - don't ask me why as it has
         absolutely nothing to do with the tune itself... Silly me as usual."
         (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Toxicjazz.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v9.
         I made this tune especially for a music-contest conducted by the group
         Life/Riffs. I know that Drax and Laxity competed aswell, but no one
         ever knew who won... Oh well, this tune basically sucks, so I don't
         think it stood a chance against the other tunes in that competition."
         (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Triiix.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         Another merry tune, but rather simple tune, which was used by Walt in
         the Starion demo 'Oksen' from 1993." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Trip_2_Jupiter.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         This is another tune made on the same weekend as the other two 'Trip 2
         x' tunes. Read text for 'Trip 2 Mars' for more details." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Trip_2_Mars.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         Oh yes! This is one of my faves as well. I made this and the other 2
         'Trip 2 x' tunes during the one single weekend, as Kring/Camelot
         wanted some strange cyber stuff for his Revealed magazine (issue 4 -
         the last!). Somehow he ended up only using 2 of the 'Trip 2 x'-tunes,
         where this tune unfortunately was the rejected one. Hmf... Not that
         this tune bears no resemblence to my PC tune carrying the same name
         (it's even better). Playing it on a new SID gives the best result!!"
         (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Trip_2_Pluto.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v20.
         This is another tune made on the same weekend as the other two 'Trip 2
         x' tunes. Read text for 'Trip 2 Mars' for more details." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Turbojam.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v9.
         A fast beat - some chords and a horrible lead... Together it describes
         my first tunes very well. I did this tune shortly after getting the
         NP-Players from JCH." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Virginize.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v9.
         A nice little tune, which I originally composed for mine and Drax's
         music group called Unitech Designs, but I never got around to code
         another one of those music demos. The 3 Unitech demos that we did
         release all included Drax's tunes." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Vommit.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v17.
         Oh dear... Another strange tune... Never used. Quiz time! Guess why
         the tune is called Vommit.. yes, correct answer - I was boozing the
         night before and felt soo bad the day after that I actually commited
         during composing this tune... hehe... Also did that during a composing
         session with Drax on the game-project 'Lollypop'... Talk about a
         strange source of inspiration!" (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Weird.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v15.
         Made this tune especially for the demo Crackle'n'Cocio, it was used in
         the x-y-z logo zoomer part. The tune caused a massive positive
         feedback - I guess they liked it." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/What_Now.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v18.
         Together with Hiscore, Einstein, Ray-ban and Cream, this tune was
         supposed to be sold to a Polish group called Axis - however, the deal
         was never really on as they didn't have any money. Tough luck. ;) I
         think this tune is inspired by a Laxity track (guess which one for
         yourself!)." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Wild_Talk.sid
COMMENT: "Made with JCH Newplayer v9.
         We don't need to talk too much about this one - just another of those
         early tunes made in 1989." (TH)

/MUSICIANS/M/Metal/Xmas_Beat.sid
COMMENT: "Made with Newplayer v11.
         I remember having made this just before Xmas in 1989 and I brought it
         along to the Dominators-Trilogy-Upfront party in Randers, where the
         Contex gang heard it - and guess what - they actually liked it... I
         used it in my Music-Collection (the one that never got released...
         Gmm...)" (TH)

### /MUSICIANS/M/Mindflow ####################################################

/MUSICIANS/M/Mindflow/Castlevania.sid

 ARTIST: Koji Kondo

  TITLE: Y
 ARTIST: Front 242

### /MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/ #############################################

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Acrobat.sid
COMMENT: "A classic M&D tune, where the aim was to get fresh percussion.
         I think that when people later on talked about that M&D-style, this
         was pretty much what they meant." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Archangel.sid
COMMENT: "Composed by M&D after having seen 'Get Shorty', a film that sported
         an inspiring soundtrack. Later on used in the Triad demo 'Lucy'. Uses
         filters in some odd ways to get those organ-like sounds." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dazzler.sid
COMMENT: "After a call from Crest management, Dane did the Krestology introtune
         in 6 hours, working on the intro chords that Mitch had provided.
         Crossbow did a very fine job timing the intro to the tune." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dose_of_D.sid
COMMENT: "Mitch did the groundwork, and Dane added some lame parts to it. Not
         something we're awfully proud of, but it got released anyway in the
         M&D Manifesto." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Drown_Me_in_Love.sid
COMMENT: "One of the first co-op tunes that M&D finished. Released to the
         public in Bondage." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/End.sid
COMMENT: "A M&D co-op, that didn't get released until summer 2002, when it
         found itself to the Digital Magic note. Has one of the more bombastic
         intro sequences you'll ever hear in a C64 tune, I think." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Gloria.sid
  TITLE: Stranglehold [from the XM module] (0:00-0:32)
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel
COMMENT: "Borrowing the intro from Jeroen Tel, this tune is an M&D co-op,
         that got much praise from non C64-sceners. Dane uses the main chords
         as his cellphone ringsignal." (SA)
         This SID won the music competition at The Party 6.

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Hip_Trip.sid
COMMENT: "Owes a lot to Drax's 'Dope Out', a tune that was on heavy rotation
         at the time of composing. An M&D co-op that was featured in
         Krestology." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/In_Velvet.sid
COMMENT: "A solid worktune from Mitch, that Dane polished til it shone. It
         was later used in Krestage." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/In_Your_Bed.sid
COMMENT: "An M&D coop, with much of the groundwork from Mitch. Used in
         Krestology, it influenced Vip's tune 'Raging inferno', one might
         guess. :)" (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Jigsaw.sid
COMMENT: "Inspired by many fine tunes from MSK, this tune takes a couple of
         turns after the extended intro. Released in Krestology. Done by M&D."
         (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Legoman.sid
COMMENT: "Originally titled 'Bombs over Dresden', a name we changed after some
         consideration. An M&D co-op." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Liptonman.sid
COMMENT: "A very catchy tune, of which Mitch did most of the work. Final
         sequences and instruments were Dane's however." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Listen_and_Learn.sid
COMMENT: "Up until 02:16, this is only Dane's tune. At that point, the slow
         segment of the song starts. It was composed at Mitch's place the night
         before TP5, the party that originally didn't have a music competition.
         What happened was that C64 sceners gathered round a TV-set with a
         blasting speaker and contributed songs were played. This tune, M&D's
         first release as a team, must have pleased the audience as it placed
         1st." (SA)
         Won first place at The Party 5 music competition.

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Magnetic_Moons.sid
COMMENT: "A generic M&D-tune with a messy cluster of instruments." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Metro.sid
COMMENT: "A tune with that special M&D touch. Some bass, some chords, some
         percussion and a wild lead as icing on the cake. Way too short,
         though." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Miranda.sid
COMMENT: "Although Dane added a couple of sequences before releasing it, this
         is in essence Mitch's romantic tune for a girl he never met." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Most_Wanted.sid
COMMENT: "The first co-op tune ever from M&D, Mitch made most of it." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Mountain_Breeze.sid
  TITLE: Mountain Breeze [from the XM module]
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel
COMMENT: "Something that would suit any intro very well ;) ..a hint to all the
         coders out there. From Mountain Breeze.XM by JT" (M&D)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/No_Match.sid
COMMENT: "An old co-op tune, that was revived in time for the release of
         Digital Magic." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Ode_to_Xayne.sid
COMMENT: "M&D tried out JCH-player v19 and made this tune for our favourite
         Giuseppe. :) The very first beats are straight off from Xayne's
         'Rastatime', actually." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Peachy.sid
COMMENT: "Released in the massive M&D Manifesto, a one-filer Crossbow put
         together with a full disk of tunes we had sent him earlier, just to
         show it could be done." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Pools_of_Poison.sid
  TITLE: Pools of Poison [from the XM module]
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel
COMMENT: "Jeroen's catchiest tune ever? Originally Pools of Poison.XM which
         Dane converted cause his roommate loves it." (M&D)
         "Brilliant cover 8) It's amazing how they've achieved to get that many
         channels into 3 channels 8)" (comment by Jeroen Tel)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Shelter.sid
COMMENT: "Something we thought we had lost when it finally surfaced in HVSC,
         to our surprise. It should have stayed lost. :)" (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Street_Wise.sid
  TITLE: Streetwise [from the PC Edlib module]
 ARTIST: Thomas Mogensen (DRAX)
COMMENT: "M&D going crazy with a tune originally supplied by Drax." (SA)
         "Also, the chords have been 'raped' quite a bit, perhaps because of the
         hard hardrestart! :)" (Comment by DRAX.)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Vertigo.sid
COMMENT: "Something in the traditional M&D-style, that was given to Jazzcat
         for Album of the Year." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Winners.sid
COMMENT: "Growing up with Abba, it was only a matter of time before Dane would
         soil one of their tracks with his touch." (SA)
  TITLE: The Winner Takes It All [from Super Trouper]
 ARTIST: ABBA

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Winona.sid
COMMENT: "High on Toto, this was composed at Mitch's place on a hot summer's
         day. We just knew it had to have a girl's name and finally settled on
         Winona Ryder after having seen Bram Stoker's Dracula, falling in love
         with her gasps." (SA)

### /MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane #########################################

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/
COMMENT: Comments by Dane (Stellan Anderson) are denoted (SA).

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/400.sid
  TITLE: 400 Slag [from Du & Jag Döden]
 ARTIST: Kent

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/747.sid
  TITLE: 747 [from Isola]
 ARTIST: Kent

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/912.sid
COMMENT: "A fusion of Jeroen Tel's tune "911", "Robocop III" and some of my
         weird ideas. Released at Floppy 2003." (SA)
(#1)
  TITLE: Nine One One [from the XM module]
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel
COMMENT: 1st place in the Floppy 2003 music competition.
(#2)
  TITLE: Nine One One [from the XM module]
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel
(#4)
  TITLE: Robocop 3, Tune #1 (0:00-0:36)
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel
  TITLE: Robocop 3, Tune #1 (1:45-2:35)
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Altitude.sid
COMMENT: "Originally featured in Attitude#8. A take on the theme music from
         the game Morrowind." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Another_Day.sid
COMMENT: "An attempt to get back to the roots of smart funk." (SA)
         This tune won shared 1st place in BCN Party 2003 music competition.

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Arctic_Circles.sid
COMMENT: This tune won the 2006 www.c64.sk online SID Compo 6.

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Bitchbass.sid
COMMENT: "Dane playing around with instruments. No more, no less." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Blackout.sid
COMMENT: Competed at The Party 7. It placed 1st.
         "After the 4hr power failure at TP7, Dane named the winning compotune
         BlackOut. Covers odd segments of various tunes for fun, and is,
         essentially, Dane's first effort in 4x." (SA)
  TITLE: Breathe [from The Fat of the Land] (1:49-1:53)
 ARTIST: The Prodigy
  TITLE: Ghosts'n Goblins, Tune #2 (2:40-2:51)
 ARTIST: Mark Cooksey

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Blowtorch.sid
COMMENT: "Inspired by the veritable assault in the mid-90's of Smash Designs
         demos, this tune by Dane was given to AEG, and was later on used in
         the Smash demo 'Scream'." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Bondage.sid
COMMENT: "We had a music demo and needed an introtune. Playing with Bondage,
         the name of the collection, Dane concocted a different C64-version of
         the classic James Bond-theme. Strangely enough made in JCH-player v19,
         well-known for it's limitations." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Bondage_2.sid
  TITLE: Rubicon, Tune #1 (0:18-0:35)
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel
COMMENT: "Mixing the Bond influence with something of Jeroen Tel's seemed only
         fitting for the sequel to our first music demo. Dane did all the
         work." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Break.sid
COMMENT: "The closest I ever got to drum'n'bass. Released in the demo 'Wok
         Zombie' at the Floppy party in 2004." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Break_the_Cycle.sid
COMMENT: This is a 4x-amalgam of interwoven and recycled themes from the
         following tunes on Madonna's album American Life: "I'm So Stupid",
         "Nobody Knows Me", "Nothing Fails", "Die Another Day", "Mother &
         Father", and "Love Profusion".

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Breatheme.sid
COMMENT: "A catchy but simplistic and short tune by Dane, that Drax thought was
         a cover since he wanted to sing along to it. :) If it can make Drax
         sing, it can't be all bad, eh?" (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Burn_Me.sid
COMMENT: "Used in the Triad demo 'Oktober', this doublespeed ditty is something
         Dane did to try out multispeed composing." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Bus_Notemusic.sid
  TITLE: Bus [from the PC Edlib module]
 ARTIST: Thomas Mogensen (DRAX)
COMMENT: "It was decided that in Bondage, the first music demo from M&D, we
         wanted to have the most asskicking tune not in the demo itself but in
         the note, just to piss people off. I wonder if it worked? Dane loved
         Drax's version so much that he did his own." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Bushido.sid
COMMENT: "An old worktune brushed up for the PHASES demo as the title tune.
          Originally meant to be included in a Triad release." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Cassanovas.sid
COMMENT: "A simple and slow tune by Dane. Given away to a disk magazine." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Cryogenic.sid
COMMENT: "One of Dane's finest from the Krestology part-selector." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Dalai.sid
COMMENT: "Dane brushed up a -95 worktune for the Singles Collection intro."
         (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Dane_vs_Danko.sid
  TITLE: Deformata
 ARTIST: Tomas Danko
COMMENT: Covers /MUSICIANS/D/Danko_Tomas/Deformata.sid

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Dane_vs_Deek.sid
  TITLE: The Thief (he eats beef)
 ARTIST: Richard Rinn (Deek)
COMMENT: Inspired by /MUSICIANS/D/Deek/Thief_he_eats_beef.sid

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Dane_vs_Scortia.sid
  TITLE: Thai Myth
 ARTIST: Thomas Bendt (Scortia)
COMMENT: Inspired by /MUSICIANS/S/Scortia/Thai_Myth.sid

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Dane_vs_Zardax.sid
  TITLE: Elysion (tune 2)
 ARTIST: Ari-Pekka Paljakka (Zardax)
COMMENT: Covers /MUSICIANS/Z/Zardax/Elysion_tune_2.sid

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Dead_Another_Day.sid
  TITLE: Die Another Day
 ARTIST: Madonna/Mirwais

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Deadline.sid
  TITLE: Deadline [from the XM module]
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel
COMMENT: "The lead was very troublesome to convert correctly.. hehe" (M&D)
         "Deadline, Mountain Breeze, Pools of Poison - Jeroen Tel covers. Dane
         did them all, and even sent a cassette to JT for his approval." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Dear_Brandon.sid
  TITLE: Chip. House. Doskpop. Love. [from Old school, new school, high school]
 ARTIST: Daniel Wressle (Brandon Walsh)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Dirty_Pair.sid
COMMENT: "Originally meant to be the concept of the M&D music demos, with a
         cool dude in an afro, and some feisty Manga chicks waving futuristic
         guns. We outgrew that, and never finished this intro tune, which was
         later on released in the M&D Manifesto. One of the few tunes that
         sport heavy dual filtered basslines. Dane's sordid work." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/DraxMix.sid
COMMENT: "Did you manage to rip it from Give or Take III? After having seen
         Krestology, Dane was amazed at two of the Drax tunes in it,
         'Bombastic' and 'Tristesse', so he decided to paste them together as a
         special surprise for St.Thomas. :)" (SA)
  TITLE: Tristesse (0:00-1:12)
 ARTIST: Thomas Mogensen (DRAX)
  TITLE: Bombastic (1:13-1:57)
 ARTIST: Thomas Mogensen (DRAX)
  TITLE: Tristesse (1:57-3:08)
 ARTIST: Thomas Mogensen (DRAX)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Dutch_Breeze_II.sid
  TITLE: Robocop 3, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel
COMMENT: Jeroen's tune was also used in the Blackmail demo "Dutch Breeze" hence
         the title of Mitch & Dane's tune.
         "Dane learned a lot about melodies while recreating the wonderful
         Dutch Breeze intro tune in JCH 20.g4. Used in the c128-demo 'Risen
         from Oblivion', which not that many people could watch. Thankfully,
         the music was released separately." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Edge_of_Disgrace.sid
COMMENT: Subsong #1 contains the entire demo soundtrack. Other subsongs simply
         skip to the beginning of other subparts.
(#1)
  TITLE: Terminator 2 Title Theme [from the movie] (11:08-11:36)
 ARTIST: Brad Fiedel

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Edge_of_Disgrace_note.sid
  TITLE: Harder, Better, Faster, Stronger
 ARTIST: Daft Punk

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Escape_from_Reality.sid
COMMENT: "Dane meddled around with new ways to make instruments after
         overdosing on Drax's 'Focus' from Krestology." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Fireflies.sid
COMMENT: This tune won the music competition at the Solskogen 2002 party.
         "A traditional melodic tune with funky beats. The tune was later
         included in the Digital Magic note as well." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Flowerguys_Pool_Party.sid
COMMENT: "PC version by Virt, C64 version by Dane. Composed in a hurry for the
         Digital Magic slideshow, and the LCP music competition, where it
         placed 3rd."
  TITLE: Flowerguy's Pool Party [from the Impulse Tracker module]
 ARTIST: Jake Kaufman (virt)
COMMENT: Used on the PC in the demo "Rebels Chiptune Disk #1".

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Frozen.sid
  TITLE: Frozen [from Ray of Light]
 ARTIST: Madonna
COMMENT: "An attempt by Dane to cover one of the best Madonna tunes ever.
         Strings aren't really something you can do successfully on C64,
         however." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Gaijin_6581.sid
(#4)
  TITLE: Halcyon [from Behind the Sun] (1:11-2:01)
 ARTIST: Chicane
COMMENT: "My attempt at epic house music with a tinge of sadness. Released in
         the demo Tsunami in 2005." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Gaijin_8580.sid
(#4)
  TITLE: Halcyon [from Behind the Sun] (1:11-2:01)
 ARTIST: Chicane
COMMENT: "My attempt at epic house music with a tinge of sadness. Released in
         the demo Tsunami in 2005." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Game_Over.sid
COMMENT: "Heavy bass and a beat to go with it. Ends with a nod to Daft Punk's
         'Da Funk'. Released in the demo Game Over at the Deadline party in
         2003." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Great_Destroyer_Selfdestruct_mix.sid
  TITLE: The Great Destroyer [from Year Zero]
 ARTIST: Nine Inch Nails

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Hybrid-96.sid

         with it." (SA)

         Digital Magic note." (SA)

  TITLE: Fly Me To The Moon (0:00)
 ARTIST: Bart Howard
  TITLE: Take Five [from Time Out] (1:03)

  TITLE: Raindrops Keep Fallin' on My Head (1:27-2:05)
 ARTIST: B. J. Thomas (written by Burt Bacharach & Hal David)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Le_Beau.sid
COMMENT: "Dane's response to Mitch's sentimental tune Miranda, this is a
          simple love song that got lost somewhere along the way." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Leaving_on_a_Jetplane.sid
COMMENT: "A great song covered by Dane, used in 'Demus Interruptus'." (SA)
  TITLE: Leaving, on a Jetplane [from Rhymes And Reasons]
 ARTIST: John Denver

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Legacy.sid
  TITLE: Tron: Legacy (end titles) [from the movie Tron: Legacy]
 ARTIST: Daft Punk

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Leviathan.sid
COMMENT: "Released exclusively for HVSC, this is a Dane worktune that never
         made it anywhere else." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Live_Forever.sid
COMMENT: This is a 4x-amalgam of interwoven and recycled themes from the
         following tunes on Madonna's album American Life: "Nobody Knows Me",
         "Mother & Father", "Easy Ride", and "Love Profusion".

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Lois_Lane.sid
COMMENT: "The loading tune from Krestage is just Dane trying out some techno
         instruments. Couldn't believe his eyes when this showed up as an mp3
         on a random Napster search. Weird!" (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Loretta.sid
  TITLE: Loretta Young Silks [from Bloodsport]
 ARTIST: Sneaker Pimps
COMMENT: According to Dane himself, his tune is "based on it". This
         tune achieved joint 1st place in the online SidWine2 music
         competition in 2003.

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Madonna_Remix.sid
COMMENT: "In the following order, this tune covers 'Sky fits Heaven', 'To have
         and not to hold' and finally 'Swim' from Madonna's superb album 'Ray
         of Light', although in a very personal arrangement by Dane. A full
         collection of covers from that album was originally meant for release,
         but it never saw the light of day, and this tune was instead given
         away to the soundtrack of the Elysium demo 'Illmatic'." (SA)
  TITLE: Sky Fits Heaven [from Ray of Light] (0:00)
 ARTIST: Madonna
  TITLE: To Have and Not to Hold [from Ray of Light] (1:51)
 ARTIST: Madonna
  TITLE: Swim [from Ray of Light] (2:43)
 ARTIST: Madonna

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Magneto.sid
COMMENT: "The Digital Magic loadertune features some of the best syncopated
         stuff Dane has ever pulled off. Too bad Graham's loader was so fast
         no one would hear it. :)" (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Maine.sid
COMMENT: "The main tune of Bondage is a dramatic piece by Dane, who has read
         way too many Stephen King books and named his tune thereafter." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Mashiara.sid
COMMENT: "A small try-out of chords and instruments, this microtune was
         featured with Wiggen's compopicture from LCP 2002, for which Dane
         coded the viewer." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Melissa_D.sid
COMMENT: "One of the more bombastic tunes in the collection. Dane wasn't
         pulling any stops while composing this." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Metamorphosis.sid
COMMENT: Won first place at the LCP'2011 music competition.

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Metrofish.sid
COMMENT: "Dane made the tune and forgot to scratch it. A pity." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Multi.sid
COMMENT: "A musical experiment by Dane that turned out both well and a bit on
         the annoying side." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Naiv_Loop.sid
COMMENT: "A stripped down version of the musical theme from Cycle. A homage to
         Madonna's 'Nobody Knows Me'." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Neurotica.sid
COMMENT: "A tune that was origianlly meant for 'Krestory'. Crossbow instead
         used it elsewhere, and it inspired GRG to do a 4x version." A musical
         collage which was quite inspired by epic heavy metal music." (SA)
         As this was originally an XM-composition by Dane, there is a
         completely different take on it somewhere on an old workdisk
  TITLE: Slomo [from the XM module]
 ARTIST: Stellan Andersson (Dane)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Nick_De_Caro_and_Orchestra.sid
COMMENT: "Titled 'Happy Heart', this is another cover of an easy listening
         track." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Night_of_the_Sentinels.sid
COMMENT: "Dane did the blasting techno tune from 'Risen from Oblivion', unaware
         that it would be used there." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Nothing_Really_Matters.sid
COMMENT: "Dane at work, covering a track from Madonna's 'Ray of Light'. A full
         collection of covers from that album was originally meant for release,
         but it never saw the light of day." (SA)
  TITLE: Nothing Really Matters [from Ray of Light]
 ARTIST: Madonna

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Peek-a-Boo.sid
  TITLE: Peekaboo [from the XM module]
 ARTIST: Jakob Svanholm (Radix)
COMMENT: "This introtune was originally done by our good friend Radix on the
         PC. We liked it and converted it." (M&D)
         "Dane was taunted to do the C64 version, after he had worked
         successfully with the JT remakes." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Politik_and_Science.sid
  TITLE: Politics [from A Rush of the Blood to the Head]
 ARTIST: Coldplay
  TITLE: The Scientist [from A Rush of the Blood to the Head]
 ARTIST: Coldplay
COMMENT: "Later released as the Domination#17 main tune, this work of Dane's
         was withdrawn from the SID Compo II in favor of an original
         composition to the dismay of many people who liked the track." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Power_of_Goodbye.sid
  TITLE: The Power of Goodbye [from Ray of Light]
 ARTIST: Madonna
COMMENT: "It's the Power of Goodbye and the combined power of Madonna, Dane,
         and an unwilling SID." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Random_Access.sid
COMMENT: Mixes several pieces of the Daft Punk's album Random Access Memories
         during the whole song.

 ARTIST: Daft Punk

 ARTIST: Daft Punk

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Ray_of_Light.sid
  TITLE: Ray of Light [from Ray of Light]
 ARTIST: Madonna
COMMENT: "Ok, I should have let this one be. It's just not an original meant
         for a SID-remake." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Retro.sid
COMMENT: "Mixing new and old, this is Dane playing around with songs that he
         likes." (SA)
         "A medley of Intermezzo.XM by Drax, Urgent but Unwanted.XM, and the
         tune from Supremacy by Jeroen Tel. Play it on a new SIDchip." (M&D)
  TITLE: Intermezzo [from the XM module] (0:00-0:18)
 ARTIST: Thomas Mogensen (DRAX)
  TITLE: Urgent But Unwanted [from the XM module] (0:19-0:49)
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel
  TITLE: Intermezzo [from the XM module] (0:50-1:06)
 ARTIST: Thomas Mogensen (DRAX)
  TITLE: Supremacy, Tune #1 (1:07-2:01)
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel
  TITLE: Urgent But Unwanted [from the XM module] (2:02-2:32)
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Round_and_Round.sid
COMMENT: This is a 4x-amalgam of interwoven and recycled themes from the
         following tunes on Madonna's album American Life: "Hollywood",
         "Mother & Father", "Easy Ride", "X-static Process", and
         "Intervention".

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Seeress_Foretold_My_Future.sid
COMMENT: "Used in 'Risen from Oblivion', this is a tune Dane made inspired by
         Drax's phenomenal tune 'Bombastic'." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Shiit.sid
COMMENT: "This ultimate shuffle-tune was something Dane surprised himself with.
         A basic structure with nice chord twists and feisty snaredrums." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Shining_Hour.sid
COMMENT: "An attempt to go back to the roots of melodic funk. Released in the
         online Sid-compo at c64.sk in 2003." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Shorty.sid
COMMENT: "Crossbow mailed Dane, asking for a tune for 'Demus Interruptus'. It
         had to be under $0800 bytes, below $0a rasterlines and longer than a
         minute. Probably the best tune Dane's made in JCH v19." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Sit_in_My_Underwear_Drinking_Pepsi.sid
COMMENT: "The online spoof collection 'Sit in my underwear, drinking Pepsi'
         resulted in a bunch of tunes all with the same name. Unfortunately
         none of them won the competition at the Vision party. Twoflower/Triad
         actually had the nerve to say he loved this tune! :)" (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Slap_Mix.sid
COMMENT: "Composed live at LCP 2002, this tune of Dane's is a medley of
         Listen&Learn, Gloria and BlackOut [TP winners 1995-1997]. Used in
         the Digital Magic note." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Slideshow.sid
COMMENT: "A nice and slow tune by Dane originally meant for a slideshow, this
         tune was released in the Digital Magic note." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Smashing.sid
COMMENT: "Dane did a funk number that ended up in Krestology. Too bad it is cut
         in the demo at the point where the best part of the lead is about to
         start." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/So_Easily_Broken.sid
COMMENT: This tune won 1st place in the Big Floppy People 2007 music competition.

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/St_Thomas.sid
COMMENT: "It probably doesn't come as a major surprise that the Saint in
         question is Thomas Mogensen aka Drax, a major influence of Dane's."
         (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Stars_in_Her_Eyes.sid
COMMENT: "As a worktune in progress, this was released in 'Risen from
         Oblivion'. A more finished version of it was spread in the Digital
         Magic note." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Substitute_for_Love.sid
  TITLE: Drowned World/Substitute for Love [from Ray of Light]
 ARTIST: Madonna

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Synch.sid
COMMENT: "Dane syncopating like a madman." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Tapestry.sid
COMMENT: "A sad tune that was offered to Oswald/Resource for use in his
         upcoming demo. Graham was probably unaware of this, and included it in
         Risen From Oblivion, before the release of Soiled Legacy. Dane took a
         class in amateur composing at university and handed this tune in as
         his exam piece. He passed." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Tasty.sid
COMMENT: "An old worktune from 1995 of Dane's entered the Antiq music
         competition. It didn't place too well." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Til_Death_Do_Us_Part.sid
COMMENT: "Dane did this tune, that was originally meant for the TP8 music
         competition. He didn't visit that party, hoever, and ended up remaking
         it into a 4x tune for Elysium's demo 'Illmatic'. It is amazing that no
         one has sniffed out the cover segment of this tune, with a part lifted
         straight off the 1989 Madonna track 'Til Death do us part'. Cat's out
         of the bag now. :)" (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Trial_and_Error.sid
COMMENT: Winner of the online SID Compo II in 2002.
         "This tune replaced Politik & Science in the SID Compo II and placed
         1st. Very proud of some of the instruments, Dane used parts of an old
         1994 worktune for the melodies and chords." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Trick_Bag.sid
COMMENT: "An old composition of Dane's, originally meant for the piano. It
         featured with a picture called 'The Awakener', in a one-file
         production that was the first ever by Dane and Iopop." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Uncensored_part_1.sid
(#1)
COMMENT: First part of the demo soundtrack, played in sequence. The other
         subsongs play to the beginning of other subparts.
         For the remaining tunes of the demo, see also
         /MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Uncensored_part_2.sid and
         /MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Uncensored_part_3.sid

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Uncensored_part_2.sid
(#1)

         subsongs play to the beginning of other subparts.
         For the remaining tunes of the demo, see also
         /MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Uncensored_part_1.sid and
         /MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Uncensored_part_3.sid

COMMENT: "A house tune dedicated to Henrik Jansson." (SA)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dane/Unisexual.sid

### /MUSICIANS/M/Monk ########################################################

/MUSICIANS/M/Monk/
COMMENT: Comments by Monk are denoted (AM).

/MUSICIANS/M/Monk/Beamship.sid
COMMENT: "A tune made just for fun." (AM)

/MUSICIANS/M/Monk/Bluce_Li.sid
COMMENT: "Inspired by Bruce Lee gametune." (AM)

/MUSICIANS/M/Monk/Crystaldrive.sid
COMMENT: "Made during a night when I had too much coffee." (AM)

/MUSICIANS/M/Monk/Divine_Current.sid
COMMENT: "I tried to create a song that is consistent, and doesn't change too
         much. This is always difficult for me. It may repeat itself too much
         because of that, but otherwise I think I succeeded fairly well." (AM)

/MUSICIANS/M/Monk/Flow_of_Existance.sid
COMMENT: "My second SID ever. Tried to play with the filters a bit." (AM)

/MUSICIANS/M/Monk/Innocent_Reaction.sid
COMMENT: "Tried to create some crickets-sound for the intro. Inspiration from
         Rob Hubbard's One Man and his droid." (AM)

/MUSICIANS/M/Monk/Internal_Bonding.sid
COMMENT: "I started with trying to create a sound of a horse running. There is
         some cheerful melody near the end. I don't like the melodies in the
         beginning though. Not a very good tune all in all." (AM)

/MUSICIANS/M/Monk/Partial_Visits.sid
COMMENT: "This is practically a medley or megamix of a few very known songs.
         There are pieces of Thrust, Professional BMX Simulator, Turrican II
         (Amiga), Spy Vs. Spy and Noisy Pillars. This song 'visits' those
         other songs partially, thus the name 'Partial Visits'." (AM)

/MUSICIANS/M/Monk/Quasaris.sid
COMMENT: "This is my first SID ever. And you can tell.." (AM)

/MUSICIANS/M/Monk/Tones_Part_II.sid
  TITLE: Tones Part II [from the Amiga MOD module]
 ARTIST: Pasi Siukonen (Jack-All)
COMMENT: "I tried to create as accurate rendition of the mod as I possibly
         could. Although with arpeggios it's difficult to create similar
         effect as the mod has. Maybe I should have settled for a less
         difficult song. The original mod, composed in 1993, can be found
         in http://www.amp.dascene.net/)" (AM)

/MUSICIANS/M/Monk/Triangelis.sid
COMMENT: "I wasn't very inspired when creating this song.. And you can tell."
         (AM)

### /MUSICIANS/M/Mr_L ########################################################

/MUSICIANS/M/Mr_L/Jukebox_1_tune_17.sid
COMMENT: "The song is from a friend of mine who has rediscovered his C128 after
         months of working on the PC! Now he is busy learning MC, trying to
         paint and writing songs! Here's the first song from him! Composed by
         him, converted to the 64 by me, b-coz he isn't yet able to use the
         DMC-Composer! I hope that you'll like his song! I can't tell you his
         name till now, b-coz he hasn't got one by now!" (Mister L, quote from
         Juke-Box)

 ARTIST: L.A. Style

### /MUSICIANS/M/Mr_Mouse ####################################################

/MUSICIANS/M/Mr_Mouse/
COMMENT: Comments by Michael Zuurman (Mr.Mouse) are denoted (MZ).

/MUSICIANS/M/Mr_Mouse/Digihack_1_Graphixmania.sid
  TITLE: Graphixmania 2, Part 6
 ARTIST: Tim Kleinert
COMMENT: Only the sample channel of the above tune
         (/MUSICIANS/K/Kleinert_Tim/Graphixmania_2_part_6.sid)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mr_Mouse/Europe_United_2002.sid
  TITLE: Prelude [from Te Deum]
 ARTIST: Marc-Antoine Charpentier
COMMENT: The Eurovision fanfare. First occurance is just a cover, then
         freelance interpretation starts.

/MUSICIANS/M/Mr_Mouse/Freakey.sid
COMMENT: "The tune "Freakey" was actually a contest between The Gee/XeNTaX and
         I as to who could create the fattest sounding toms (drums). We were
         inspired by a piece from Andreas Vollenweider that had some full
         reverb, echoing toms kicking in at some point. ;)" (MZ)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mr_Mouse/Late_A-Early_A_Cover.sid
COMMENT: Remake of /MUSICIANS/M/Mr_Mouse/Early_A.sid

### /MUSICIANS/M/Mr_SID ######################################################

/MUSICIANS/M/Mr_SID/Kryo_Chiptune.sid
  TITLE: The hardware chiptune project song
 ARTIST: Linus Åkesson (lft)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mr_SID/Phasor_Soundtrack_HiFi.sid
  TITLE: Phasor Soundtrack
 ARTIST: Linus Åkesson (lft)
COMMENT: The original music data from the ATMega88 demo "Phasor" played on C64.

/MUSICIANS/M/Mr_SID/Prince_of_Persia.sid
  TITLE: Prince of Persia [from the game]
 ARTIST: Francis Mechner
COMMENT: Music converted from the midi files of PC game "Prince of Persia" and
         slightly edited. Sound effects made by Owen Crowley.

         different digis added.

### /MUSICIANS/M/Mueller_Markus ##############################################

/MUSICIANS/M/Mueller_Markus/
COMMENT: Markus Müller composed all the tunes for the group Sidbusters.
         Sidbusters consisted of Markus along with Andras Molnár, nicknamed
         Andrew Miller (an English translation of his Hungarian name).  Andras'
         actual handle was Burton, and he made the music editor AMP which
         Markus used.

/MUSICIANS/M/Mueller_Markus/A_View_to_a_Coke.sid
  TITLE: Everlasting Love
 ARTIST: Robert Knight
COMMENT: This sid covers the 80's version by Sandra Cretu. "It was a great hit
         back in the 1980s, and a friend of mine made a bet, that I can't
         reproduce it with a C64, but I did... And I won a barrel of beer" (MM)

/MUSICIANS/M/Mueller_Markus/A_View_to_a_Kill.sid
  TITLE: A View to a Kill [from the movie]
 ARTIST: Duran Duran & John Barry

/MUSICIANS/M/Mueller_Markus/Axel-F.sid
  TITLE: Axel F [from the movie Beverly Hills Cop]
 ARTIST: Harold Faltermeyer

/MUSICIANS/M/Mueller_Markus/Coco_Intro.sid
COMMENT: Both Edwin van Santen and Markus Müller have claimed ownership of
         this tune, but due to the fact that Markus Müller vividly
         remembers even tiny details about it, and that Edwin van Santen
         never released any Soundmonitor tunes, it seems more likely it is in
         fact Müller's. Sadly, with Edwin van Santen having passed away, we
         may never know the complete story behind it.
         Also see /MUSICIANS/0-9/20CC/van_Santen_Edwin/Vlindertjes.sid

/MUSICIANS/M/Mueller_Markus/Delta_v2.sid
  TITLE: Koyaanisqatsi [from the movie] (0:00)
 ARTIST: Philip Glass
COMMENT: Covers Rob Hubbard's C64 version in
         /MUSICIANS/H/Hubbard_Rob/Delta.sid, Tune #12.
  TITLE: Delta, Tune #12 (0:52)
 ARTIST: Rob Hubbard
COMMENT: Covers Rob Hubbard's original part of the tune, which plays from 0:52
         onwards in the original.

/MUSICIANS/M/Mueller_Markus/Depeche_Mix.sid
  TITLE: Blasphemous Rumours [from Some Great Reward] (0:00)
 ARTIST: Depeche Mode
  TITLE: Strangelove [from Music for the Masses] (0:57)
 ARTIST: Depeche Mode
  TITLE: Stripped [from Black Celebration] (1:13)
 ARTIST: Depeche Mode
  TITLE: Everything Counts [from Construction Time Again] (1:43)

  TITLE: People Are People [from Some Great Reward] (1:59)

  TITLE: Personal Jesus [from Violator] (2:20)

  TITLE: Blasphemous Rumours [from Some Great Reward] (2:43)
 ARTIST: Depeche Mode

### /MUSICIANS/N/Nebula ######################################################

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/
COMMENT: Nebula's (Wolfgang Reszel) own comments are denoted (WR).

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Bangle_Bells.sid
  TITLE: One Horse Open Sleigh
 ARTIST: James Lord Pierpont
COMMENT: "Merry X-Mas !?!" (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Bass_Sound_Lauf.sid
COMMENT: "I just needed a repeating baseline for learning drums." (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Big.sid
COMMENT: "At the end I'm going crazy with ring modulation. ;-)" (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Boom-Bass-Tick.sid
COMMENT: "The most time all 3 voices are filtered, so that it sounds good on a
         real SID" (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Conquest.sid
  TITLE: Conquest of Paradise [from the movie 1492] (0:00-1:43)
 ARTIST: Vangelis
COMMENT: "Well, only the first part of the whole song." (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Death.sid
COMMENT: "Inspired by the slowness of the loading tune of the game Digital
         Tangram." (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Drum_n_Bass.sid
COMMENT: "At this time I've heard my first Drum'n'Bass song and I tried to do
         this on the C64. It's one of my last things I've done on the C64."
         (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Dschunfu.sid
COMMENT: "I've never managed to pack this song with the JCH-Packer" (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Duke.sid
COMMENT: "If I remember right it's inspired by a level tune from Duke Nukem
         3D." (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Emorave.sid
COMMENT: "Released in the Disk-Mag Nitro by Excess" (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Golden_Eye.sid
COMMENT: "This song has nothing to do with the James Bond film" (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Greed.sid
COMMENT: "Greed was a longer tune, I remember I had problems at that time." (WR)
         The only source disk of this song had a bad sector so the result is
         shorter than it was intended.

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Harmless.sid
COMMENT: "It's a double-speed tune, but it sounds like a single-speed!?!" (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/HipHop.sid
COMMENT: "This song I've composed with Soundmaster 3.1 by SoedeSoft (where I
         never found a packer for)."

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Idee.sid
COMMENT: "At night I had an idea for playing my drums. I didn't want to forget
         that until the next morning so I hammered it into Soedesoft's
         Soundmaster." (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Kiahrella.sid
COMMENT: "This is the real Kiahrella which is dedicated to my ex-girlfriend
         Karla (the first of all). Her name is encoded into the song name:
         K_a_r_l_a. She never heard that song. I was very proud of it, because
         it was the first time I managed to put more than one verse and a
         refrain into one song. Used in the game Duo Box which was rejected to
         publish from CP Verlag." (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Ludium.sid
  TITLE: Prelude No. 1 (BWV 846)
 ARTIST: Johann Sebastian Bach
COMMENT: "It's not exactly the Prelude from Bach, but highly inspired from it.
         The same theme is repeated quite a lot with different rhythms and
         instruments. This song was made in 1993 but was released 3 years
         later. Used in the game Duo Box which was rejected to publish from
         CP Verlag." (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Mad_Peep_Tekkno.sid
  TITLE: No Limit [from No Limits] (5:03-6:23)
 ARTIST: 2 Unlimited
COMMENT: "This song begins soft and harmonic and abruptly changes to 90s
         techno style at 1:29. It has some silent breaks what leads you assume
         the song is over. Used in the loader of the game Duo Box which was
         rejected to publish from CP Verlag." (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Many.sid
COMMENT: "I tried to make some classic music, but it sounds more like 'chaotic
         harmonies'" (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Monotype.sid
COMMENT: "This tune I've especially composed for a demo by Onslaught Design,
         but I don't know if they did ever release it." (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Music.sid
COMMENT: "I tried to do "real drumming" with cymbals and hi-hat on the C64" (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Never_Loved.sid
COMMENT: "The title is wrong, I always loved this song. Used in the game Duo
         Box which was rejected to publish from CP Verlag." (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Normalry.sid
COMMENT: "A small and unfinished remix of Novadrive" (WR)
         See also /MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Novadrive.sid

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Novadrive.sid
COMMENT: "Used in the game Duo Box which was rejected to publish from
         CP Verlag" (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/OS_2.sid
COMMENT: "I can't remember why I used this name." (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/One_In.sid
COMMENT: "Used in the game Duo Box which was rejected to publish from
         CP Verlag" (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Palmoliv.sid
COMMENT: "Used in the game 'Leisure Suit Leo 2' by Out of Order" (WR)
         for additional Comments see 'Phronk'!

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Phronk.sid
COMMENT: "Damn, I used Filter $F6 at a very low Freq., but it seems that it
         only sounds good on my SID." (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Quatechtro.sid
COMMENT: "From around 1:09 it gets out of sync." (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Ra.sid
COMMENT: "Only used to play along with my drums. I attached my C64 to a guitar
         amp with some distortion to simulate an e-guitar." (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Ra_2.sid
COMMENT: Another loop to play along with my drums.

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Raggy.sid
COMMENT: "Used in the game 'Leisure Suit Leo 2' by Out of Order" (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Revolte.sid
COMMENT: "Used in an Intro for the group Hardcore, which recognizes the
         SID-Chip (new or old) and modificates the music, so that it sounds on
         both chips near equal." (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Russian.sid
COMMENT: "In previous HSVCs (before #52) it was erroneously named Kiahrella" (WG)
         The error was due to an early version of "Micro-Music-Player" where the
         title was wrong. Correct title found in a later version and confirmed
         with Nebula's disks.

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Shadow_Intro_Tune_1.sid
COMMENT: Also used in "Tiefkühltruhenmanager" (Deep Freezer Manager), published
         by Magic Disk 64.

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Shadow_Intro_Tune_3.sid
COMMENT: "The ring tone was very annoying for my mother while composing this
         song. ;-)" (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Shadow_Intro_Tune_4.sid
COMMENT: Also used in the Ninja Tools, published by Magic Disk 64.

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Shadow_Intro_Tune_5.sid
COMMENT: "A mix of a lot of music styles." (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Slaughter.sid
COMMENT: "Another (my first and best) Filter-intensive tune that only sounds
         good on the new SID-Chip." (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/T-Rave.sid
COMMENT: "This tune I've used in a release of my FSC-Noter, which should some
         german guys should remember (greets to all)." (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Variations.sid
COMMENT: "My very last song I ever made on a Computer (till 98-10-17).
         It was composed on a big Bass-Amp, so play it also on a big one, you
         will miss (=not hear) the deep bass. On SIDPLAY its hard to let the
         Hi-Hat sound like on a real C64" (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Wake_up.sid
COMMENT: "Used in a Toolcollection called 'Toolbase 1' by Shadow, which I coded
         unders the Handle Seesaw Widow (with this I entered the scene.)" (WR)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nebula/Yen_on_Love.sid
COMMENT: "Used in the game Duo Box which was rejected to publish from
         CP Verlag" (WR)

### /MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo ###################################################

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/
COMMENT: NecroPolo's own comments are denoted (NP).

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/071D.sid
COMMENT: NT2.03 "Super-slim 2-channel SID for A(PI)MAZE 4K intro by LHS that
         won Euskal Encounter #18." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Alpenmilch.sid
  TITLE: Alpenmilch [from Earthview album]
 ARTIST: NecroPolo
COMMENT: FC4.0 "A not-direct cover of an experimental tune of mine. This SID
         was created in a little more than 1 hour, including some freezing of
         Future Composer 4.0 just like in the old times. Just for the full
         picture: It landed at the bottom of the list of Forever 2010 music
         compo :)" (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Angus.sid
COMMENT: FC4.0 "This one was inspired by AC/DC, hence the title. That was
         one of the short intro tunes that I gave to a guy called Aero to
         use in his stuff. I don't know if he produced anything afterwards,
         I could not find him in CSDb archives so I guess not."
         (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Arthrobob.sid
COMMENT: 1RT1.0 "Originally it was a test file of Hermit's 1-RasterTracker.
         Before the release time, Knut asked Vincenzo if he could make a SID
         for his return one-part demo made for DOTY2013. Vincenzo did not
         have any time so he passed the project to me. At that moment I had
         only this raw little SID in the hatch. Finally it appeared to be
         a very nice fit to Knut's awesome bob demo part that uses perfect
         synch to the music." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Bare_Knuckle.sid
COMMENT: MS1.2 "Heavy stuff to stretch the features of Martin Piper's
         Music Studio editor a little. It was included in the 1.2 release as
         an example tune." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Berzerk_Redux_Loader.sid
COMMENT: MS2.1 "Tune has a long way home: initially it existed as an audio
         track for an iPhone race game called "Freeway'86". The game had a
         C64 style mode so original SID sounds were to be included. For that
         I created six or seven of SID worktunes and some short jingles. The
         game did not reach the finish line so most of tunes eat dust. For
         Martin's MS2 online compo I fed the music data of the "Coastal"
         subtune into the proggie. Checking the tune, Martin asked if he
         can use it for the loading screen of Berzerk Redux cart version.
         It is one of my fav new-old games so I was really happy to provide
         that." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Blahblah.sid
COMMENT: FC4.0 "That was one of the short intro tunes that I gave to a
         guy called AERO to use in his stuff. I don't know if he
         produced anything afterwards, I could not find him in CSDb
         archives so I guess not." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Bluesbird.sid
COMMENT: FC4.0 "In early May of 2011 a pack of worn disks were returned
         to me that included some old SID and other workfiles in a massively
         unorganised form. Back in time, many times I just saved workfiles
         to gamedisks  to preserve space and I used random filenames. I had
         a notes book to keep some order in the mess. 20 years later this
         book became the only memory of certain songs. According to it, I
         still have 40-50 disks lurking around somewhere. This short tune
         was hiding on one of the retrieved old disks and as archives say
         it's one of my earliest SIDs." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Booogie_8580.sid
COMMENT: GMC1.6 "That's a guitar boogie of mine (converted from a real
         tune) that utilises irregular rhythm pattern and funky slap bass
         line. This tune was in the pack that was given for a demo group
         called "GMC" for their debut demo called "Brand New". I don't know if
         they used any of the songs later on but as I can remember they had
         some problems with the music driver." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Borxx.sid
COMMENT: GMC1.6 "Jan Harries called it "heavy metal SID" and it's the
         closest definition for my dirty style I've heard so far. Indeed,
         the song is a collection of pre-historic heavy guitar riffs of mine.
         This tune won the Exchipo#1 music compo. In 2011 it was recycled
         by my rock band Wackor and we wrote a metal song about it,
         called 'BORXX REDUX'. That version was also included in
         'The Sound of SceneSat Volume 3' music collection that had 89
         tracks by musicians of the demoscene all around." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Breaker.sid
COMMENT: SW1.0 "As far as I can remember it was my very first short tune
         for Hermit's SIDwizard initial to test basic functions. It is not
         a MIDI conversion." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Cadmium.sid
COMMENT: GMC1.6 "Jan invited me to SIDwave shortly after Borxx was released.
         For a debut, I wanted something more than my previous 'just music'
         black-screen releases that ended up to be a scroll + pic demo,
         almost entirely done by me. Hermit helped me out in coding, fixed
         lots of bugs. The tune itself is re-assembled from different pre-1994
         parts. The intro engine sound is not digi. I created it in 1992 as a
         tribute to Nigel Mansell who won the F1 championship that year." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Cassiopeia.sid
COMMENT: FC4.0 "A Sci-Fi inspired tune. Certain parts were used in Wackor's
         debut album first track, "Khemotox BloodPaint", released in 2004 by
         Holosonic Music." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Choronzon.sid
  TITLE: Choronzon [from Exit]
 ARTIST: Tangerine Dream
COMMENT: SW1.2 "I celebrated the release of SIDwizard 1.2 with this SID.
         I've been a fan of the original Tangerine song as it was used as
         a TV show in the old times called 'Panorama', I thought the first
         time I heard it that it would make a good SID. It took 20 years or
         so but here it is. It is completely 'wired' as I used a stripped
         down MIDI file and SIDwizard's own converter." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Chronomorph.sid
COMMENT: GT2.7 "Based on a worktune for Wackor, called 'Time' but ended up
         to be totally different from the source song (hence the title) so
         it can't be considered as a cover. Hackers' Top 2010 music entry,
         place#2. Out of 2... :)" (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Colony.sid
COMMENT: GT2.7 "Music dressing for the movie demo idea by LHS that won the
         demo compo at Forever 2011 Party. I had a relatively easy task: by
         the time I could start composing, the code and GFX were almost
         ready, I just had to create a fitting score for the work of LHS
         and AGod. These worked like a charm for inspiration." (NP)
(#1)
   NAME: Flock'n'Roll
(#2)
   NAME: LOL Copter /intermission/
COMMENT: Sound FX (not included in this SID) by LHS
(#3)
   NAME: Colony main theme

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Cracktro.sid
COMMENT: GMC1.6 "Grass contacted me shortly after X2010 where the THSX
         music colly by SIDwave was released, including Destronaut pt1. He
         imagined a similar way powerful tune for his brand new pic for a
         new Avatar intro, called 'Cracktro'. I picked up an unfinished
         1994 worktune that I originally created for the Geister game
         project and started to expand/refine it. I did not have to start
         from the scratch so this SID was ready much sooner than others
         I released around that time." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Curable.sid
  TITLE: Curable [from Rendhagyás EP]
 ARTIST: RKH
COMMENT: GMC1.6 "This is neither a cover, nor a "real" SID tune: it's a
         work-in-progress arrangement demo from the first RKH EP, released in
         1995. It contains parts from the game tune pack "Geister"." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Demultiplexer.sid
COMMENT: GMC1.6 "A second-gen GMC track of mine with advanced filters.
         The original file had some bugs that were fixed by iAN CooG." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Depression.sid
COMMENT: FC4.0 "One of my very first original tunes. This dirty experimental
         song defined all my following ones in a way or an another. Certain
         parts were used in the first Wackor album opening song, "Khemotox
         BloodPaint", released in 2004 by Holosonic Music." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Destronaut_1.sid
COMMENT: GT2.7 "This 2-part piece is among the first ones I composed with
         GoatTracker 2, playing 2x speed. The tunes include lots of real guitar
         riffs. Both parts were included in the THSX music collection." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Destronaut_2.sid
COMMENT: GT2.7 "This 2-part piece is among the first ones I composed with
         GoatTracker 2, playing 2x speed. The tunes include lots of real guitar
         riffs. Its "home" SIDwave demo delayed for months so I detached this
         part and released it in Euskal. Later, both parts were included in the
         THSX music collection." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Eucalyptus.sid
COMMENT: GMC1.6 "Title tune for a "save the little cute koala" game from the
         early '90s. Never released. Developer was a female C64 graphician
         called Paula or something. All I can remember is she was a hot
         redhead and boobs were epic." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Everything_Counts.sid
  TITLE: Everything Counts [from Construction Time Again]
 ARTIST: Depeche Mode
COMMENT: FC4.0 "That was one of the short intro tunes that I gave to a
         guy called AERO to use in his stuff. I don't know if he produced
         anything afterwards, I could not find him in CSDb archives so I
         guess not." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Fender_of_the_Crown.sid
  TITLE: Defender of the Crown (subtune 7 & 10)
 ARTIST: Richard Joseph
COMMENT: NT2.03 "Shortly after my SID remix album 'rakBIT' was released
         including a remix of Richard's brilliant 'Rimrunner', Jazzcat
         contacted me and asked to join the Richard Joseph (R.I.P.)
         tribute demo project with a C64 remake of one of Richard's great
         SIDs, a tune of my choice. It's been an honour to be invited: I
         respect Richard and admire his works much, not to mention the fine
         array of SID composers who also contributed to the demo. This remake
         was made in a rather short time and it includes very old ideas of
         mine that are rooted back in '89. The SID was named after the guitar
         that I used to grab the notes." (NP)
         Covers /MUSICIANS/J/Joseph_Richard/Defender_of_the_Crown.sid,
         Tune #7 and #10.

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Flatline.sid
COMMENT: GT2.7 "Entry for Didi's cracktro music compo. It uses the least
         possible number of blocks. The tune was among the firsts I created
         with GoatTracker2 around 2009, unreleased until the 2013 compo." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Freeway_86_Jingles.sid
COMMENT: GMC1.6 "These little jingles were created for a retro race game
         project for iPhone in 2010 that haven't reached the finish line so
         far. All were extracted from full length audio tracks and full-size
         SID tunes. Project is just iced but not completely aborted so
         depending on it I'll see what the future of the full tunes will be."
         (NP)

   NAME: Game over
COMMENT: "Similar to a famous Top Gun movie track but not a cover" (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Fu_Chen.sid
COMMENT: GMC2.0 "1991 GMC1.6 worktune optimised and finished with GMC2.0 as
         a compliment for AGod's funny ninja picture for X2010." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/GMC-Brandnew.sid
COMMENT: GMC1.6 "That was my first complete track composed with Game Music
         Creator v1.6 and I stuck with its aggressive sound until the end of
         my SID composer days. This tune was in the pack that was given for a
         demo group called "GMC" for their debut demo called "Brand New".
         I don't know if they used any of the songs later on but as I can
         remember they had some problems with the music driver. The original
         file had some bugs that were fixed by iAN CooG in 2009." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Geister.sid
COMMENT: GMC1.6 "My second (and last) game tune back in the time, created for
         an odd software developer called zOnE. Geister was a minimalistic
         and badass turn-based sci-fi strategy, a bit similar to Laser Squad.
         All the source code was destroyed when zOnE's place burnt to dust in
         October, 1994. zOnE stopped writing games and I stopped writing C64
         music afterwards. Some riffs of Geister survived in my later band
         projects. This collection was onefiled by iAN CooG, packing together
         independent workfiles." (NP)
         All tunes are made in 1994, released in 2009.
(#1)
   NAME: Intro
(#2)
   NAME: Start/title screen
(#3)
   NAME: Reactor level
(#4)
   NAME: F'n big droid level
(#5)
   NAME: Scanner level
COMMENT: "There is some off-beat "beep" for zOnE's request as a scanner-like
         sound. That was zOnE's fav track, especially the concrete breaker part
         from 1:30." (NP)
(#6)
   NAME: Abductor level
(#7)
   NAME: Dreadnought level
COMMENT: "Riffs from this subtune were used in the first Wackor EP in 1999 in
         the song 'Iced'." (NP)
(#8)
   NAME: Time out! /last turn/
COMMENT: "zOnE wanted an annoying little tunelet that alarms the player that
         he has mere seconds (one turn) until next failure. I guess, that's
         fulfilled :)" (NP)
(#9)
   NAME: Level complete
COMMENT: "Riffs were used in the first RKH album in 1995 in the song "Curable".
         I wrote the whole song around that little piece." (NP)
(#10)
   NAME: Weapon shop
COMMENT: "Riffs of this subtune were used in the first Wackor EP in 1999 in
         the song 'Iced'." (NP)
(#11)
   NAME: Highscore

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Globe.sid
  TITLE: Globe prologue
 ARTIST: NecroPolo
COMMENT: GT2.7 "SID was originally created for AGod (my API teammate) for his
         3-screen pic. Because of some other releases that needed his pixel
         art the pic delayed so the tune was finally included in a SIDwave
         music collection. The original was composed for a show called
         'The Globe' in 2008. The client picked a more guitar-oriented rock
         style intro so this short tune rested in the box for a while. 1:1
         conversion." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Grotto_Motto.sid
COMMENT: GMC1.6 "This long tune was in the pack that was given for a demo
         group called "GMC" for their debut demo called "Brand New". I don't
         know if they used any of the songs later on but as I can remember
         they had some problems with the music driver." (NP)

         more powerful than the original - just as intended.
         The original file had some bugs that were fixed by iAN CooG in
         2009." (NP)

         guitar outro riffs I've ever written." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Inhuman_Race.sid
  TITLE: Inhuman Race [from Brainchain EP]
 ARTIST: Wackor
COMMENT: GMC1.6 "This is neither a cover, nor a "real" SID tune: it's a
         work-in-progress arrangement demo from the first Wackor EP, released
         in 1999. The original file had some bugs that were fixed by
         iAN CooG in 2009." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Its_My_Life.sid
  TITLE: It's My Life [from One Love]
 ARTIST: Dr Alban
COMMENT: GMC1.6 "One of the few covers I created in the early '90s. It had a
         function back in time. This one was used to create some live
         arrangement as I did all the song skeletons on C64 for my rock band.
         During performance we broke stuff and kicked major ass, got banned
         from clubs and so on. This actual file rot in the box until C64.sk
         online cover compo in 2013. Zombie SIDs never die." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Jackhammer.sid
COMMENT: FC4.0 "Metal SID originally from 1990 or so, inspired by Napalm
         Death songs. Parts were used in some of my other metal songs during
         the years. I thought that the disk including that was either lost or
         damaged but many tunes were returned to me in 2011 that included
         this workfile. The SIDrip Alliance live set ate all my time so I
         finalised this one in a few hours before AROK2011 and released the
         ancient tune there, after more than 20 years passed." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Killswitch_Blues.sid
COMMENT: FC4.0 "Barebone blues trainer from the old times, extraced from a
         pack of ancient workdisks that was returned to me in May 2011. I
         used to practice guitar solo improvisation to that. I could not find
         the title in my archive papers but this trainer loop can be found
         on a 1990 audio tape containing my earliest tunes so I guess it was
         one of the first SIDs I've ever created." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Laser_Squad_Tribute.sid
COMMENT: GMC1.6 "This tune was the reason for digging out all my old SIDs.
         I started to make a remix of my LS Tribute in early 2009 but its
         audio archive was not complete so I had to dig out my old machine.
         Well, I loved Laser Squad so much that I even composed a tribute
         tune. This one was among the first tracks I created with
         GMC 1.6 editor. There is also an audio remix of this tune in my
         2009 SID remix album, 'rakBIT'." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Le_Point-Blanc.sid
COMMENT: GT2.7 "These are 2 short classical guitar trainers I composed back
         in the early '90s. SIDs were created for SIDwave for the music
         collection THSX in 2010." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Lights_On.sid
COMMENT: SW1.4 "It was one of the most challenging tasks I've ever done on
         many sides. Partly because I had to pack 16 subtunes in $15FF space
         and partly because I had extremely little time for the project
         because of album recording project I was working on at the time.
         So I created all the subtunes with a zero data separator part with
         a MIDI keyboard and DAW software Reaper as 3-channel MIDI, fed it
         with SWMconvert.exe and set the sounds. Instead of days the whole
         project was ready in an afternoon's time, all in all. I had to keep
         in mind from recordnig the first MIDI note that only a couple of
         blocks are allowed per subtune because of the memory limit. Due to
         planning, everything worked fine and it became the most efficient
         SID project I've done to date." (NP)
(#1)
   NAME: Title
COMMENT: "A MIDI conversion and also a really fast project." (NP)

   NAME: Ingame 01
(#3)
   NAME: Ingame 02
(#4)
   NAME: Ingame 03

   NAME: Ingame 04

   NAME: Ingame 05

   NAME: Ingame 06

   NAME: Ingame 07

   NAME: Ingame 08

   NAME: Ingame 09 "Crappy Comments"
COMMENT: "It uses elements by Rob Hubbard's 'Crazy Comets' but everything
         is seriously altered of course. I'm not fuckin' Timbaland to
         directly rip off a SID by someone else in my own production :)" (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Lobster.sid
COMMENT: MS1.2 "3-sub example tune created for Music Studio 1.2 version by
         Martin Piper." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Lying_Rosie_Flying_Horsie.sid
COMMENT: GMC1.6 "My craziest SID tune, ever. This one was in the pack that
         was given for a demo group called "GMC" for their debut demo called
         "Brand New". I don't know if they used any of the songs later on but
         as I can remember they had some problems with the music driver. The
         tune includes my 02-06-41 horse instrument as mentioned in the
         'Moleman' 2011 demoscene documentary movie. Everyone believed I was
         joking with that. I was not." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/MIDIchlorian.sid
COMMENT: SW1.2 "It was a test MIDI file that we used to push and test
         SWMconvert until meltdown as it is a rather irregular piece with a
         lot of data. Many bugs were detected with it and we could work out
         many tricks of how to create a MIDI file for seamless conversion.
         This experience was super useful for all my later MIDI based SIDs." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/M_U_L_E.sid
  TITLE: M.U.L.E., Tune #1
 ARTIST: Roy Glover
COMMENT: MS2 "Example tune for MS2, 1-to-1 conversion of the lovely original.
         Old-school stuff, reminds me of concentrating on melody instead of
         bells 'n' whistles." (NP). See also /GAMES/M-R/M_U_L_E.sid

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/March_into_Abyss.sid
COMMENT: FC4.0 "Inspired by some movie about the wave of XIX. Century wars
         of independence." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Mean_Streak.sid
  TITLE: Mean Streak
 ARTIST: Matt Gray
COMMENT: MS2 "Back in time, we played a lot of this 1987 bikefight game
         with a goodfellow of mine so the tunes stuck in mind pretty hard.
         This SID was re-created (and fully remixed in places) with MS2
         multi-platform editor by Martin Piper, included as an example tune."
         (NP). See also /MUSICIANS/G/Gray_Matt/Mean_Streak.sid

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Minorita.sid
COMMENT: NT2.03 "API version with 'Myth' intro. Its original 'home'
         is an unreleased API demo, a tribure to musician girls. Hence the
         title, 'Minority Senorita'. Later I added this one to my info PRG
         file for the C64 executable interactive 'cover' of the SID remix
         album 'rakBIT' because this one happened to be my only tune that
         has no 8580 vs 6581 issues (my chip is a new 8580). There also
         exists a 'Rising Sun' version, created exclusively for
         Hokuto Force." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Model.sid
  TITLE: The Model [from The Man Machine]
 ARTIST: Kraftwerk
COMMENT: FC4.0 "My second SID and my last completely finished cover back
         in the time. For some unknown reason a bass note is out of tune." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Model_2.sid
  TITLE: The Model [from The Man Machine]
 ARTIST: Kraftwerk
COMMENT: MS1.2 "This one was created with MS1.2 converter from FC4.0 source
         file. The sounds are tailored to MS. This SID was included in the
         1.2 release as an example tune: more powerful sound and fixed bass
         note." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Moodblender.sid
COMMENT: MS1.2 "This actual tune was completely re-created from audio
         archives with Music Studio 1.2 and was included in the release
         of it as an example/demo tune. This old school-new style editor
         was fun to use, feels like to be the AC/DC of SID creators :)" (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Moodblender_1992.sid
COMMENT: FC4.0 "This is the last working FC version I could find on a
         retrieved disk. As far as I can remember, it was the last SID that
         I created with FC4.0 back in the days. On audio tape labelled 1992
         there was an improved version that I re-created in 2010 with Music
         Studio 1.2 by Martin Piper." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Moodblender_Remake.sid
COMMENT: MS2 "Converted from MS1.2 and expanded with many new feats of MS2
         multiplatform editor. This is the final version." (NP)

         riffs. The original file had some bugs that were fixed by iAN CooG

  TITLE: Nautilus, Tune #1
 ARTIST: <?>
COMMENT: SW1.2 "It is a quick MIDI conversion of the old 'Nautilus' game
         tune for AGod's similar named multiscreen pic. I used SID2MIDI
         utility that SID remixers use often, I edited the MIDI file a
         little, exported the SW format then set the sounds. It was ready
         in an hour or so." (NP)
         Covers /GAMES/M-R/Nautilus.sid, Tune #1.

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Nerdistan.sid
COMMENT: DMC4.0 "My old SIDding started with FC 4.0 in 1989 and ended with
         GMC v1.6 in 1994. This is my first tune using something different: DMC
         was quite a joy to use. Also, was my compo tune for AROK #11 party,
         ended up 4th. The song is based on a metal song of mine from 2004.
         AROK 2009 was an important event for me because that was my 'official'
         return to the 8-bit scene after 15 years. Among some great guys, I met
         there with Leon (GFX) and Hermit (coder) who later contributed greatly
         to my SID remix album, 'rakBIT'. (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/New_Depression.sid

         guy called AERO to use in his stuff. I don't know if he produced
         anything afterwards, I could not find him in CSDb archives so I guess
         not." (NP)

         I decided to release a heavier piece, too. It is based on 1994
         'Geister' workfiles but I can't recall what was the purpose of
         the original workfile in the game as there is no any description
         left." (NP)
