COMMENT: SW1.2 "A little sound effect for Level64 demo intro screens." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Ninfa_main_tune_1.sid
COMMENT: SW1.2 "A MIDI conversion that patches together 3 different ingame
         tracks I created for iPhone, most are from Project:Downforce.
         It was a quick job considering music (melody) data and creating
         sounds but later on it took a while to bring parts together with
         the flow of the demo. With this SID I used the maximum flexibility
         of SIDwizard, using the effective MIDI converter, subtune jumper
         command and all the workflow enhancing and editing functions." NP

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Ninfa_main_tune_2.sid
COMMENT: NT2.03 "A 2:30 cut of the extended version. This is the SID that
         was finally used in the demo." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Ninfa_main_tune_2_ext.sid
COMMENT: NT2.03 "The original long version of the main demo tune. The song
         was originally picked from the hundreds of old song demos I've made
         in MIDI during the years. As the othewise great NinjaTracker has no
         MIDI converter, just feeding the proper notes data was days of
         work." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Ninfa_outro.sid
COMMENT: NT2.03 "Inspired by AGod's pictures, this is the 'frame' tune of the
         demo 'NINFA'. Being groupmates in API, we had nice cooperations
         so AGod asked me to compose a couple of new tunes for the new L64
         demo. I loved their releases and considering the composers like
         Hein or Intensity (R.I.P.) who had created SIDs for L64 demos
         - I was honoured." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Ninfetta.sid
COMMENT: GMC1.6 "It was the very first tune that I created for the Ninfa demo
         but as it turned out the raster hungry GMC driver was not too code
         friendly so with L64 boys we decided to use more economic drivers,
         Ninja Tracker and later on SIDwizard. For years it just rested in
         the box as a worktune but I decided to finish it and release it at
         Arok 2013." (NP)
         Won first place at the Arok 2013 music competition.

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Not_Even_Your_Shadow.sid
  TITLE: Árnyékod sem... (Not even your shadow...) [from Rendhagyás EP]
 ARTIST: RKH
COMMENT: GMC1.6 "An another arrangement demo song from a 1995 EP that was
         performed may times by my band. Without lyrics it is a little sleepy
         but it was an important file to carve the song to its final form
         back in time." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Out_of_Noises.sid
COMMENT: FC4.0 "It is a guitar solo trainer from my early guitar player
         days. It was my first song-like full tune I guess, with the footnote
         that it lacks arrangement as such..." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Poisoned_Mouse.sid
COMMENT: FC4.0 "A Ben Daglish-inspired fast tune, featuring one of my first
         original guitar solos that I converted to C64." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Prolyx-69.sid
COMMENT: GMC1.6 "Prolyx-69 was a two-member demo group who asked me to
         write some songs for their stuff. While this tune was finished, the
         demo was not. The song also has an audio remix version available at
         kwed.org / remix64.com sites." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Raster-Blaster.sid
COMMENT: GMC1.6 "After 15 years of pause, it became my comeback SID.
         This aggressive tune was started as some kind of sound test file to
         refresh my mind about GMC editor and help to remove weird sound bugs
         from my pre-1994 SID tunes that I wanted to send to HVSC for the #51
         update. Ended up to be a full tune and my first release on CSDb." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Rising_Sun.sid

         "The difference is the Japanese style intro of this version, created
         exclusively for Hokuto Force." (NP)

 ARTIST: The Destiny's Child

         cover of the chicky funky song - or, at least, in the first couple
         of seconds before it goes totally wild." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/S-Blox.sid
COMMENT: NT2.03 "Super slim 2-channel gametune created for King Durin in 2012.
         Originally it belonged to an another game with sound effects on the
         3rd channel but that project was aborted and finally the SID found
         its home in this nice Tetris cartridge game." (NP)
(#1)
   NAME: Ingame
(#2)
   NAME: Game over
(#3)
   NAME: The unused 3rd
COMMENT: "This part became the template of Worlds Apart" (NP)
         See also /MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Worlds_Apart.sid

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Scooby.sid
  TITLE: Scooby-Doo Theme [from the cartoon series (1976)]
 ARTIST: Hoyt Stoddard Curtin
COMMENT: MS2 "After their splendid crack (rather fix/upgrade) version of
         Outrun Europa, Hokuto Force mates requested a short rendition of
         the original Scooby Doo music score for their next release. This
         one was rather fun to make." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Sky.sid
COMMENT: FC4.0 "The second part of my Sci-Fi inspired tune "Cassiopeia" with
         a weird outro." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Slavers.sid
COMMENT: GMC1.6 "That was written in 20 minutes from the scratch for a
         fellow to demonstrate how can 3+ instruments be squeezed out of 3
         channels. I can still remember the face :)" (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Speed_Demon.sid
COMMENT: FC4.0 "This short SID was inspired by '70s disco basslines.
         That was one of the intro tunes that I gave to a fellow called
         AERO to use in his intros. I don't know if he produced anything
         afterwards, I could not find him in CSDb archives so I guess
         not." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Stateless.sid
  TITLE: Stateless
 ARTIST: Local Mind Provider (naaina)
COMMENT: GMC2.0 "Same as /MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Stateless_v1.sid with the
         difference that it was heavily optimised then finished with GMC2.0
         by Fenek and Wackee of Arise. Finally, this version was used in
         the demo with the same name which won the Forever 2010 party." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Stateless_v1.sid
  TITLE: Stateless
 ARTIST: Local Mind Provider (naaina)
COMMENT: GMC1.6 "Shortly after I joined API we shared our other audio
         hostilities with naaina. This fine song is from his ambient /
         experimental album. SID was converted in August of 2009." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Stihl.sid
COMMENT: GMC1.6 "After some brainstorming with LHS, that became our brute
         'armoured rhino rams the china shop' style chainsaw intro for
         AROK#12 party, placed #3 in the demo compo. I guess no one
         noticed that the scrolltext is some kind of a letter from Texan
         chainsaw massacre story, from the chainsaw's point of view :)" (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Strauss.sid
  TITLE: An der Schönen blauen Donau (Blue Danube)
 ARTIST: Johann Strauß
COMMENT: NT2.03 "Everyone's favourite space docking theme. This 1-channel
         tune was included in my HALtrix pic release, as some kind of
         reference to Stanley Kubrick's 'Space Odyssey' movie." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Summerset.sid
  TITLE: Yie Ar Kung Fu, Tune #12 (1:55)
 ARTIST: Martin Galway
COMMENT: MS2 "My AROK#12 music entry, placed #2 (out of 2, haha) with a
         little nodding to Martin Galway at the end. The tune has 4
         different audio remixes made for iPhone game projects,
         and none of the games were released." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Telecommando.sid
COMMENT: GMC1.6 "My first game tune written for an odd game developer guy
         called zOnE for his hacking - sneaking - data stealing game, much
         like Paradroid. All the source code was destroyed when zOnE's place
         burnt to dust in October, 1994. zOnE stopped writing games and I
         stopped writing C64 music afterwards. The original file had some
         bugs that were fixed by iAN CooG in 2009. For the 2010 X-Mas SIDrip
         alliance music collection the file was optimised and the sound bug
         was found and removed." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Test_GMC.sid
COMMENT: GMC1.6 "For demo performance testing purposes I created a couple of
         short test tunes with different editors, with 3 subs each. This
         test tune is to measure Games Music Creator V1.6, based on
         /MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Telecommando.sid source file." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Test_GT.sid
COMMENT: GT2.7 "3-sub single speed demo test tune created with Goat Tracker 2.7
         containing multispeed instruments from Destronaut" (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Test_NT.sid
COMMENT: NT2.03 "3-sub demo test tune created with Ninja Tracker 2.03, based
         on /MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Minorita.sid" (NP)
(#1)
COMMENT: "This tune doesn't loop properly. Intentional :)" (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Thanx_iAN.sid
COMMENT: MS2 "Dedicated to iAN CooG. Bass theme is borrowed from a '90s
         Teleclub TV tune, the solo is original. It was a FC4.0 tune frag
         from '91 that many years later (2009) I sent to iAN saying thanks
         for all the help. He suggested expanding it a little so here it is.
         This vesion is fully re-worked with Martin Piper's multiplatform
         editor and was included as an example tune" (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/We_Will_Rock_You.sid
  TITLE: We Will Rock You [from News of the World]
 ARTIST: Queen
COMMENT: FC4.0 "The first complete SID tune I ever wrote on C64. It was my
         very first SID tune ever and my very first steps with Future Composer
         4.0, so you can hear minor timing issues here and there." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/World_is_Mine.sid
COMMENT: GMC1.6 "This short and simple piece is based on a really old (no
         proper date, I guess it's between '91 and '93) worktune that I
         mounted to my space-themed pic release for AROK#12." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Worlds_Apart.sid
COMMENT: GT2.7 "This is an older worktune that I composed on guitar around
         2000 or so. It did not fit any of my bands so it rested in the box.
         My 'entry composition' for Avatar was a game tunes and FX pack. The
         ingame tune needed to be slow-flow and relaxed so I dusted off this
         one. Some time later I re-created it with Goat Tracker2 and expanded
         it to 3-channels (the gametune is 2-channels) and added a second
         part including heavy riffs. It wanted to release it at
         Revision 2012 but I missed the deadline as we arrived right after
         the oldschool music compo. So, it became released a little later at
         Flashback 2012." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Yo.sid
  TITLE: Girls [from Licensed to Ill]
 ARTIST: Beastie Boys
COMMENT: FC4.0 "This tune is something I heard somewhere in the '80s and it
         stuck in my mind but I never figured out what the original was.
         Some 20 years later in a CSDb thread it turned out that it was a
         Beastie Boys song that I could successfully avoid for such a long
         time despite the fact that I have a number of albums by them (not
         this one) and also watched them live here and there :) Thanks to
         Angel of Death for sorting this out! The SID was one of the short
         intro tunes that I gave to a guy called AERO to use in his intros.
         I don't know if he produced anything afterwards, I could not find
         him in CSDb archives so I guess not." (NP)

/MUSICIANS/N/NecroPolo/Yoppee.sid
COMMENT: FC4.0 "It started as a cover of "Tom's Dinner" by Suzanne Vega /
         DNA but I kept the beat only. That was one of the short intro tunes
         that I gave to a guy called AERO to use in his stuff. I don't know
         if he produced anything afterwards, I could not find him in CSDb
         archives so I guess not."" (NP)

### /MUSICIANS/N/Nilsen_Ronny ################################################

/MUSICIANS/N/Nilsen_Ronny/
COMMENT: Comments by Ronny Nilsen are denoted (RN).
         "Every single tune I ever did on the C64 seems have found its way to
         the HVSC. Although most of them are test-tunes meant for my ears only,
         I've decided not to do any censoring. They are all made with the 8580"
         (RN)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nilsen_Ronny/1995_The_Last_Song.sid
COMMENT: "This is the last song I did on the C64 during my active scene-years,
         though the ending fadeout-fadein leaves space for a comeback." (RN)

 ARTIST: Reyn Ouwehand

         blown up by a bigger spaceship. I don't remember the exact details,
         but this was the result. I don't think it was ever used." (RN)

 ARTIST: Howard Blake

         "A friend of mine really liked synth music. He gave me a tape and
         said 'make this'. And so I did." (RN)

  TITLE: Sainahi Circles [from the Amiga MOD module]

         and over in a specific way. I remember duplicating that instrument for
         this song, making a sid-drumbeat instrument that lasted 8 seconds." (RN)

/MUSICIANS/N/Nilsen_Ronny/True_Story.sid
COMMENT: "Equal/Eternity (brilliant coder) finally gave in and did a music
         editor to rid me of the limitations I felt the DMC editor had. This is
         the very first song done in that editor (The Equalizer) - quite
         possible the best music editor I have ever used. Though this song is
         made in Assembler, as the editor-part was not done at the time." (RN)

### /MUSICIANS/O/ ############################################################

### /MUSICIANS/O/OPM #########################################################

/MUSICIANS/O/OPM/Zoolook.sid

### /MUSICIANS/O/Odi #########################################################

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/
COMMENT: Odi's (Oliver Klee) own comments are denoted (OK).

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/A_Groovy_Night.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         Sascha and I made it a night. Sleep, what's that? By that time, I had
         figured out what number to add to the filter byte to get roughly the
         same sound as with normal filters." (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Ancient_Property.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         One of my longest tunes -- and one of my best! The first part is
         partly inspired by J.S.Bach and Jeroen Tel, the second part mostly by
         Drax, being rather short (out of inspiration, just up'n'down the blues
         scale). Uptonogood (don't remember the group, sorry) from Australia
         used this music in his mag 'The Link'." (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Autumn_Beach.sid
COMMENT: "Done with SoedeSoft's SoundMaster." (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Bachs_Domain.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         Inspired by J.S.Bach again, I composed this piece as another magsound
         for 'Genetic Dreams' by Trinomic Boozeline. Willy/Presence favored
         this piece a lot (he himself liking Bach, too). I chose the name with
         a sidelook to Sascha's piece 'Drax' Domain'. This piece consists of a
         few different parts which I just lined up one after another, as I was
         unable to come up with some interludes." (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Back_to_the_Future_III_Title.sid
  TITLE: Main Title [from the movie Back to the Future Part III]
 ARTIST: Alan Silvestri
COMMENT: "Done with SoedeSoft's SoundMaster.
         This is a remake of the title tune from the game. Hawk had asked me to
         do it." (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Baroque_Parting.sid
COMMENT: "This tunes had been composed with the full player in mind (an loaded
         into the editor). That player uses a slight de-tuning for voice #2 and
         #3 in order to achieve a fuller sound. In addition, the instruments
         make use of pulse width modification.
         For the 'zero page version' of this piece, I had cut down the player
         to almost nothing in order to get a real short file with as little
         raster time as possible. During that step, I removed the routine for
         the pulse modification and increased the detuning of voice #2 and #3
         instead, resulting in a slightly different (and slightly less nice)
         sound." (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Baroque_Parting_Zero_Page.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         I wrote this piece to express my feelings about a freshly broken
         relationship with my (former, sigh) girlfriend. As we just had
         analyzed fugues in music class, I wrote a fugue (in c-minor) as well.
         There is a zeropage version of this tune that saves even more
         rastertime and memory." (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Bass_Fever.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Chris Hülsbeck's Soundmonitor.
         What a shame that I couldn't make a real FAT bassdrum!" (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Chips_in_Music.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         I originally had planned to write a techno tune (without too much
         success, as you can hear). It's one of my personal favorites." (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Chords_of_Endlessness.sid
COMMENT: "Done with SoedeSoft's SoundMaster.
         A magsound for the Alcoholics. I don't know if they actually used it."
         (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Cool_Is_Fool.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         Out of inspiration for any new music, I was listening to some of my
         old tunes and started to play around with the old 'Groovy Night'. The
         result was this funny little thing. Listen to the portamento with the
         arpeggio (the drop-down)!" (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Cowboy_Song_2.sid
COMMENT: "Done with SoedeSoft's SoundMaster.
         In the big band I played the trumpet in at that time, we used to play
         'Cowboy Song' by Fred Lipsius. I couldn't exactly play it properly,
         but I like it very much nevertheless. So I took its name for this tune
         (which is the only thing these two pieces have in common)." (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Dancing_A-Head.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         A funny thing for Trance's diskmag 'A-Head', inspired by the music to
         'Moons' by Drax." (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Dream_in_Space.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Chris Hülsbeck's Soundmonitor.
         Again a tune my trumpet teacher liked a lot! This tune was publically
         performed (err... played from tape) at a performance of his trumpet
         class I was a pupil in. I was very proud of the drums I had squeezed
         out of little Soundmonitor." (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Eternal_Sadness.sid
  TITLE: Eternal Sadness
 ARTIST: Traditional
COMMENT: "Done with SoedeSoft's SoundMaster.
         A schoolmate had asked me to arrange this traditional funeral march
         for him. I did my best, but in the end he didn't really like the
         result he came to hear. =:-(" (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Fuer_Claudia.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Chris Hülsbeck's Soundmonitor.
         I wrote this tune and the previous one on the same afternoon in order
         to impress a girl from dancing class (without success, alas). But at
         least it was fun discussing politics with her on the phone." (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Genetic_Jazz.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         I wrote this piece for Galen/Trinomic (Trinomic Boozeline) for his mag
         'Genetic Dreams' (my favorite mag) as an apology: I had promised to do
         a few conversions for their demo but didn't get them finished in time.
         So they had to use non-exclusive music." (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Happy_Birthday.sid
  TITLE: Happy Birthday
 ARTIST: Mildred J. Hill
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         Just a another crappy conversion of this traditional birthday song.
         Too many wrong chords." (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Happy_Cadaver.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Chris Hülsbeck's Soundmonitor.
         A play on words with the German word for Corpus Christi Day
         ('Fronleichnam')." (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Henry_Level_1.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!."
         (OK)
(#1)
COMMENT: "This swingy thing was composed for the Jump'n'Run 'Henry' by Peter
         Schwarzfischer (Sky/Masters' Design Group). My first Swing tune for a
         long time (since the 'Underground-Rock'). As it seems, I will still
         compose a different piece for Level 1, as the game has changed its
         mood from funny to more Fantasy-like and gloomy. This music is rather
         old anyway." (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Jingle_from_the_Lenor_advert.sid
  TITLE: Lenor advert theme
 ARTIST: <?>
COMMENT: "Done with Future Composer II.
         I didn't like this editor at all (and didn't understand it in full,
         either). An acquaintance from the scene (Doc Holliday or someone from
         Presence ) asked me to convert this music from the 'Lenor' TV ad to
         C64." (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Laser_Beat.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Chris Hülsbeck's Soundmonitor." (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Lax_Up.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         Inspired by some tune by Laxity (and with some of its instruments,
         ripped by hand). In English, the 'Lax' Up' is pronounced exactly the
         same as the German translation of 'lick it off' (leck's ab). =:-> "
         (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Load_the_Power.sid
COMMENT: "Done with SoedeSoft's SoundMaster.
         Hawk/Presence once asked me to compose a short tune for a loader. As
         far as I know, this music has never been used with a loader, though."
         (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Lords_of_Synthesis.sid
COMMENT: "Done with my first own music player.
         Having read about the great features of Soundmonitor, I got fed up
         with the limits of The Music System (TMS) and the music commands from
         BASIC V7.0. So I wrote my own soundplayer. That thing ate memory and
         rastertime like I drink tea and used a notation similar to the BASIC
         commands. But -- it worked and had cool *filters*! I planned to use it
         in a Snake-like game I was coding (Crowding Crawlers), but the game
         made heavy use of raster interrupts and color effects and thus would
         not work with the music (rastertime ranging from $03 to $80 or so...).
         I never finished the game anyway. But my trumpet teacher liked the
         tune _very_ much! =:-> " (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Lunatic_Trashcan.sid
COMMENT: "Done with SoedeSoft's SoundMaster." (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Mega_Put.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Oliver Blasnik's Romuzak." (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Melt_Your_Brain.sid
  TITLE: Piano Sonata in C (KV 545) (0:00-0:06)
 ARTIST: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         A 4-time techno tune (my best one of this kind so far) which I wrote
         together with a good friend of mine, Ingo Meyer. While we were
         composing, the speaker box fell off the shelf due to one extremely
         loud bass-kick (no kidding!). This piece contributed to the music
         competition at the Data-Live '93 in Dessau, winning the 2nd place.
         Possibly it would have made the 1st if they had had good big speakers
         instead of that tiny thing in their video beamer! =:-( " (OK)
         Also used in the game "Orb", (C) 1994 Magic Disk 64/CP Verlag.

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Mothers_Little_Arpeggio.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Oliver Blasnik's Romuzak.
         I came up with the name as my mother didn't like the sound of the
         arpeggios at all." (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Musical_News.sid
  TITLE: Tagesschau [from the German TV news] (0:00-0:14)
 ARTIST: <?>
COMMENT: "Done with SoedeSoft's SoundMaster.
         Asterix/Victory had asked me to convert the jingle from the German TV
         news 'Tagesschau' for the intro to his diskmag. (In this intro, you
         could see a TV news announcer.) Sascha/DOS/MDG liked this tune very
         much and said to me, grinning: 'I think you've listened to Maniacs of
         Noise far too much!'" (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Nameless_Horror.sid
COMMENT: "Done with SoedeSoft's SoundMaster.
         What a horror: I couldn't think of any sensible name for this piece of
         music!" (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Oedipus.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Chris Hülsbeck's Soundmonitor." (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Peaceful_Beauty.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Oliver Blasnik's Romuzak.
         I wrote this tune and the previous one for Presence, both on the same
         weekend (I obviously felt that I had to become a little more active)."
         (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Pocket_Funk.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         I merely composed this piece to show that with a special version of my
         CSS player, it is possible to achieve low rastertime of about $10
         (like Music Assembler/Voicetracker, JCH Player V19 or A.K.'s player)."
         (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Raped_SID.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Oliver Blasnik's Romuzak.
         A guy from Red Sector Inc. asked me to compose a lame-sounding cool
         tune (whatever he might exactly have thought of) for an intro of their
         second group, Ultimate (the section for crap releases)." (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Rhythm_of_Life.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Chris Hülsbeck's Soundmonitor." (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Rock_Around_the_Block.sid
COMMENT: "Done with Chris Hülsbeck's Soundmonitor.
         Again a (rather obvious) play on words. At that time, I used to write
         either Rock'n'Roll style tunes or the usual 'cool' style sidtunes with
         mainly minor scales." (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Rumour_Land.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         This piece was composed at the Data Live '93 for the party report by
         TRL Designs ('The Real Lunatic'). I had a very nasty back-ache after
         the piece was finished." (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Session_Tune.sid
COMMENT: "Done with SoedeSoft's SoundMaster.
         I composed this piece at the Security group Meeting in December 1991
         in Mannheim. Security (Demons of Sound [DOS] being part of it) was my
         second group at that time. With this tune, I started a new approach to
         composing on the C64, very much Vibrants-like: start with a groovy
         bassline and write the lead voice last, using a lot of blues scale."
         (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Sonlasarka_Dunti.sid
COMMENT: "Done with SoedeSoft's SoundMaster.
         This name was supposed to sound Hungarian. My trumpet teacher (who is
         Hungarian) knew better, though. But he liked that tune a lot. I
         composed it for Asterix/Victory as a music for his diskmag." (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Trance_Introzak.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         Rather out of inspiration...just a little music for the intro by
         Trance." (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Underground-Rock.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         The first tune to be packed with the packer of the CSS! It wrote it
         for the addymag 'Underground' by Presence." (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Uranium_Dioxide.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         My first finished attempt to write some techno. I love these harmless
         intros that are composed in an entirely different style than the rest
         of the piece! At the time I composed this piece, we had just learned
         how to write 3- and 4-voiced choir arrangements at school. For
         X-Radical of Nirvana." (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Vagabonds_Groove.sid
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         Ok, ok, this tune _is_ heavily inspired by the first music from Dutch
         Breeze, composed by Jeroen Tel. I even hand-ripped the snare drum and
         the bass sound from that piece. Anyway, I wrote this tune for
         Tardox/Vagabonds (now a member of Smash Designs) for his demo, a
         contribution to a demo competition by the magazine '64'er'." (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Wind_of_Change.sid
  TITLE: Wind of Change [from Crazy World]
 ARTIST: Scorpions
COMMENT: "Done with the Cyberlogic Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!.
         Doc Holliday/Techno Ind. had asked me to do a conversion of this song
         (by The Scorpions) for a coop-demo against racism." (OK)

/MUSICIANS/O/Odi/Winter_from_The_Four_Seasons.sid
  TITLE: Le Quattro Stagioni, Op. 8, No. 4, "L'inverno" (Largo)
 ARTIST: Antonio Vivaldi
COMMENT: "Winter" from "The Four Seasons" by Vivaldi. "Done with the Cyberlogic
         Sound Studio... made by me and Sascha/MDG!. A conversion of 'The
         Winter' from Vivaldi's 'Four Seasons', which I ported to the C64 for
         Domino/Security, an old friend on mine." (OK)

### /MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca #####################################################

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/
COMMENT: Kim Homann's own comments are denoted (KH).

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/10_Alles_Verloren.sid
COMMENT: "Unlike many other of my songs until this point, I had composed and
         arranged this tune on my Casio keyboard BEFORE I started working on
         the SID. I'm not 100% content with the arpeggios, but it's Ok, I'm
         proud of this SID. Interlude (1:46-2:04) inspired by Tanita Tikaram's
         Twist in My Sobriety." (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/11_Spacelab_Meets_Cybernoid.sid
  TITLE: Spacelab [from The Man Machine] (0:00-2:30)
 ARTIST: Kraftwerk
  TITLE: Cybernoid, Tune #1 (2:31-4:28)
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/12_Argon.sid
  TITLE: Carbonara (3:09-4:54)
 ARTIST: Spliff
COMMENT: "I ran out of ideas for the first part, so I added the second, bouncy
         part just for fun. But I like the first part better. I should have
         let this tune end at 3:08." (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/13_Return_of_the_Thundercats.sid
  TITLE: Thundercats
 ARTIST: Rob Hubbard

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/14_Scary_Zak.sid
COMMENT: "This tune's supposed to be the successor of my -3, but I'm very
         discontent with it. Especially the fast part starting at 3:59 is
         uninspired and sort of ridiculous. Lead sound starting at 3:43
         inspired by Chris Grigg's Maniac Mansion and Matthew Kane's Zak
         McKracken." (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/15_Venus.sid
COMMENT: "I was (and still am) very proud of this tune. At that time, it was my
         best one so far, at least IMHO. Especially the no-melody part
         (1:23-1:52) is very crisp and drummy. Bass starting at 2:54 inspired
         (once again) by Jeroen Tel's Cybernoid." (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/16_Mirror_of_Soul_Remix.sid
  TITLE: Mirror of Soul
 ARTIST: Peter Thierolf

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/17_Neon.sid
COMMENT: "Bouncy and a little thin-sounding. Not bad, but nothing special!" (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/18_Storm.sid
COMMENT: Inspired by LED Storm on the Amiga. (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/19_Sonic.sid
COMMENT: "I consider this tune my final breakthrough to the world of good SID
         music. The sound is the best I could squeeze out of the Sound
         Monitor. Rocks! Only the filtered lead sound at 1:31 doesn't sound in
         sidplay as it's supposed to." (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/1_Omega.sid
COMMENT: "This tune marks the beginning of a new era of my personal development
         as a musician. Until then I had only desperately struggled to get
         familiar with the Sound Monitor and its features, and now I actually
         started USING them. Originally I only gave the tunes numbers instead
         of names, but now, about 20 years later, I felt like it was time to
         also add some names." (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/20_Leapfrog.sid
COMMENT: "After I had been very content with the tune -19, I lost my
         orientation a little. I wanted to try something new, but it became
         too bouncy and light-weight, not the way I wanted it to sound like."
         (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/21_Xenon.sid
COMMENT: "After I had been very content with the tune -19, I lost my
         orientation a little. I wanted to try something new, but it became
         too bouncy and light-weight, not the way I wanted it to sound like."
         (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/22_Labyrinth_of_Psychic.sid
  TITLE: Cybernoid II, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel
COMMENT: "This tune represents everything I had been trying to achieve since
         tune -1. This is the tune from that period I'm most proud of." (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/23_Return_of_Yie-Ar_Kung_Fu.sid
COMMENT: "Only slightly inspired by Martin Galway's Yie-Ar Kung Fu. With this
         tune I tried to create another masterpiece like tune -22, but
         unfortunately it kind of went over the top somehow. Especially the
         grave part starting at 3:09 isn't as powerful as I wanted it to be."
         (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/2_Kidz_in_da_Hood.sid
COMMENT: "Slightly influenced by Martin Galway's Arkanoid." (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/3_The_Golden_Glove.sid
  TITLE: The Last Ninja, Tune #9
 ARTIST: Anthony Lees
COMMENT: "Also slightly influenced by Martin Galway's Arkanoid." (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/4_Madman.sid
COMMENT: "Bass inspired by Martin Galway's Combat School title tune." (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/5_Last_Ninja_2_vs_Parallax.sid
  TITLE: Last Ninja 2 (0:00-4:01)
 ARTIST: Matt Gray
  TITLE: Parallax, Tune #1 (4:02-6:53)
 ARTIST: Martin Galway
COMMENT: "The snaredrum was added later. With this tune I fooled a friend,
         telling him that I had finished playing Last Ninja 2 (while we were
         still both stuck in level 3) and that I was able to load the outro
         tune in Sound Monitor. He believed me. ;-) This is my earliest tune
         I'm really proud of." (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/6_Krypton.sid
COMMENT: "After I was so proud of tune -5, I felt a little burnt out and became
         uninspired in -6 to -9." (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/7_Girl_You_Know_Its_True.sid
  TITLE: Girl You Know It's True (0:00-2:54)
 ARTIST: Milli Vanilli

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/8_Wings.sid
  TITLE: Doctor in the Tardis (2:18-3:25)
 ARTIST: The Timelords (KLF)
  TITLE: Equinoxe Part 4 [from Equinoxe] (3:26-6:23)
 ARTIST: Jean Michel Jarre
COMMENT: "My first (uninspired) tune with this cool snaredrum. I had found it
         in some demo tune, which I got by incident after I had already given
         up hope to ever find a good snaredrum in Sound Monitor. In the Jarre
         part, I rhythmically got something wrong, I know." (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/9_Acid_Ants.sid
COMMENT: "Uninspired strumming, just to tryout my new snare drum sound." (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/Amidor.sid
COMMENT: "Short but bad! Inspired by Parker's Amidar video game." (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/Flyguy.sid
COMMENT: "This tune paints the flight of an Air Force jet, with start, flight
         (with stormy weather and clouds inbetween), and finally the landing.
         Lead sound starting at 1:54 inspired by Fred Gray's Mutants. Some of
         the arpeggios and noise waveforms inspired by Martin Walker's
         Armalyte." (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/Grave.sid
COMMENT: "This is the SID I'm most proud of. The tune was also recorded later
         as "Patty, Kim & Gunnar" with keyboards and vocals and had the title
         "Just Good Friends". It was "covered" in 1996 by Dieter Bohlen, who
         we had sent a demo tape to, and released in 1996 as Blue System's
         single "Only With You" and on his album "Body To Body". Of course I
         was neither asked for permission nor given a profit sharing. The
         single went #58 on the German charts." (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/K_I_M.sid
COMMENT: "I wrote this as a love song for a girl named Kim, at least I thought
         so. She of course never listened to it, as she didn't want to have
         anything to do with a freaky C64 nerd like me. Weeks later I found
         out that the girl's name wasn't Kim at all, but I didn't change the
         title of this tune to her real name. Mind the funny ping-pong sound
         starting at 3:09! ;-)" (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/Kirchenlied.sid
COMMENT: "Just a small sound study." (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/La_Serenada.sid
COMMENT: "With this elaborate composition, I ran out of memory very quickly. At
         1:41-1:45 I frivolously used a "forbidden" memory part, so the music
         data is overwritten during the initialization of the tune's playback
         by the drums samples. Bummer! Tune inspired by Rondo Veneziano." (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/Live_as_Friends.sid
COMMENT: "The samples sound quite muddy in this one, probably bc the filter in
         the bass sound interferes with them. Bummer!" (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/Medusa.sid
COMMENT: "My first tune with digidrums, which I had ripped from the game
         "Danger Freak". This tune marks a turning-point in my personal
         development as a musician, putting the focus more on harmonies and
         elaborate arpeggios than trying to produce a "cool sound". From this
         tune on, I also made myself a strict rule that I FIRST finish
         composing the tune on my piano or my Casio keyboard and THEN switch
         the C128 on and start with the data input. In order to reflect this,
         I also started to give the tunes names instead of numbers again." (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/Over_the_Top.sid
COMMENT: "Inspired by the 1986 Sylvester Stallone movie." (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/Paradies.sid
COMMENT: "Another prototype for a song I wanted to record later with electric
         guitar, keyboard and vocals, which then, as always, never happened."
         (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/Pursuit.sid
COMMENT: "Refrain starting at 1:16 inspired by Vangelis' Bladerunner OST." (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/Russian.sid
COMMENT: "Just a prototype for a song I wanted to record later with a couple of
         friends using keyboards, electric guitar and vocals. But that never
         happened. ;-)" (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/School_Song.sid
COMMENT: "My very first composition on the piano. I made it as a kid, long
         before I started making SID music." (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/Schwacksinn.sid
COMMENT: "Just some uninspired strumming recorded "live" without any
         quantization. Horrible! Skip this one!!! ;-)" (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/Stormlord.sid
  TITLE: Stormlord intro
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel
COMMENT: "I had originally intended to add digidrums to this one, but after
         finishing the 3 "regular" voices I had already used up too much
         memory. So I just left the tune as it was." (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/Suzette.sid
COMMENT: "This tune's title was actually the name of a character from a radio
         comedy show called "FFN Frühstyxradio", Suzette Nietmeyer, spoken by
         Sabine Bulthaup. http://www.fruehstyxradio.de/ " (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/Thimo_Ist_Schlau.sid
COMMENT: "In this tune I tried to musically describe what it looks like in the
         mind of a madman." (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/Use_Beate.sid
COMMENT: "My very first SID tune ever. It was made while I read the Sound
         Monitor tutorial in a C64 magazine. Everything mentioned there went
         into this tune, step by step. Unfortunately, quantization was not
         mentioned there, as you can hear in the improvisational part starting
         at 2:41. ;-) Bass inspired by Erasure's Ship Of Fools." (KH)

/MUSICIANS/O/Omoroca/We_ll_Go_for_It.sid
COMMENT: "This is my first SID I actually consider a real composition. I was
         very proud of this one back then." (KH)

### /MUSICIANS/O/Orc #########################################################

/MUSICIANS/O/Orc/Welcome.sid
COMMENT: Edit of /MUSICIANS/B/Banana/Headbanger_Demo.sid with added digis.

### /MUSICIANS/O/Ouwehand_Reyn ###############################################

/MUSICIANS/O/Ouwehand_Reyn/
COMMENT: Comments by Reyn himself are denoted (RO).

/MUSICIANS/O/Ouwehand_Reyn/A_Game_Over_Tune.sid
COMMENT: "I didn't compose it for anyone, I just wanted to know how it was like
         to make a GameOver-tune..." (RO)

/MUSICIANS/O/Ouwehand_Reyn/Armada.sid
(#6)
COMMENT: "[...]listening 2 the title of this song I don't think this piece of
         music was ever finished because it only lasts 32 bars and then it
         repeats itself again. I don't think it was my will to publish this
         tune at all....." (RO)

/MUSICIANS/O/Ouwehand_Reyn/Audio_Art.sid
COMMENT: "I believe I made this tune for a mag called Magna Magazine. A lot of
         things happen in this song. When a song is made for a mag it has to be
         long and not boring. Hmmmm.....the beginning sounds like a Galway
         rip-off tune 2 me....." (RO)

/MUSICIANS/O/Ouwehand_Reyn/Batmania_II_2.sid
COMMENT: "All these tunes were especially made for the demo called 'Batmania'
         from the group 'ATG' (Actual Trading Generation). At the time the
         first 'Batman'-movie was in cinema." (RO)

/MUSICIANS/O/Ouwehand_Reyn/Batmania_II_5.sid
COMMENT: Remix of /MUSICIANS/O/Ouwehand_Reyn/Wendy.sid

/MUSICIANS/O/Ouwehand_Reyn/Blackmail_Tune_1.sid
COMMENT: "I think this tune was one of the first tunes I made in the
         MON-editor. I got that from Dave Hogendorf from Scoop, who knew
         Charles Deenen from MON. I like the delay-effect in the tune and the
         sudden stop." (RO)

/MUSICIANS/O/Ouwehand_Reyn/Caveman_Ninja.sid
COMMENT: Title tune for the projected game "Caveman Ninja".

/MUSICIANS/O/Ouwehand_Reyn/Christmas_Remix.sid
  TITLE: One Horse Open Sleigh
 ARTIST: James Lord Pierpont
COMMENT: "I wrote it for Dave Hogendorf from Scoop Designs, when they wanted to
         make some sort of Christmas-card/demo...." (RO)

/MUSICIANS/O/Ouwehand_Reyn/Concerts_in_China_2.sid
  TITLE: Fishing Junks at Sunset [from Concerts in China]
 ARTIST: Jean Michel Jarre

/MUSICIANS/O/Ouwehand_Reyn/CosMail_tune_08.sid
COMMENT: "CosMail-08 sounds like a Flimbo-song. Except for the crappy middle
         part which has nothing 2 do with it and sounds 2 much like the title
         from Rubicon made by JT. JT's title was amazing, though." (RO)

/MUSICIANS/O/Ouwehand_Reyn/Deadlock.sid
COMMENT: Deadlock was a game that System 3 never finished or released. It was
         to be programmed by the same programming team that also created
         Armalyte for Thalamus. Also used in the cartridge version of Myth, in
         addition to the original Myth music.
         "System 3 asked me to make music for Deadlock, but the game was never
         finished - maybe they never even started. I never got any money for
         this. And I didn't know it was used in the cartridge version of
         Myth...." (RO)
(#1)
   NAME: Title
(#2)
   NAME: High-score
(#3)
   NAME: Get Ready
(#4)
   NAME: Game Over

/MUSICIANS/O/Ouwehand_Reyn/Dervish_D.sid
  TITLE: Dervish D [from Spiral]
 ARTIST: Vangelis

/MUSICIANS/O/Ouwehand_Reyn/Domination.sid
COMMENT: "I made this tune just after I bought my JUNO-106. I composed this
         song on the JUNO. There is even an 'analogue' version of this song."
         (RO)

/MUSICIANS/O/Ouwehand_Reyn/Dutch_Breeze_FLI_Scroll.sid
COMMENT: "It's not like the title is sung in the chorus, so I really don't have
         a clue what my working-title was!! ... It's a tune from me. Falco Paul
         (20CC), who lived in the neighbourhood that time fixed all the sounds.
         At the end of my C-64 career I used his editor and he helped me with
         the sounds. I'm a bad programmer myself, you see."(RO)

/MUSICIANS/O/Ouwehand_Reyn/Dutch_Breeze_Soft_and_Wet.sid
COMMENT: "It was specially made for a girl I fell in love with called Pascale.
         There is also a real version with lyrics, which was made before the
         C64 version." (RO)

/MUSICIANS/O/Ouwehand_Reyn/Dutch_Breeze_The_Cow.sid
  TITLE: Some Skunk Funk
 ARTIST: The Brecker Brothers

/MUSICIANS/O/Ouwehand_Reyn/Dutch_Breeze_The_End.sid
COMMENT: Same as /MUSICIANS/O/Ouwehand_Reyn/Deadlock.sid #2

/MUSICIANS/O/Ouwehand_Reyn/Effe_Snel.sid
COMMENT: Title translates as "A Quick One".

/MUSICIANS/O/Ouwehand_Reyn/Electricity.sid
  TITLE: Electricity [from Orchestral Manoeuvres In The Dark]
 ARTIST: Orchestral Manoeuvres in the Dark (OMD)

/MUSICIANS/O/Ouwehand_Reyn/Falcon_Dump.sid
COMMENT: "I made this for an intro from a cracking group. Called 'Falcon'? I
         know the contact person was called KRS#1." (RO)

/MUSICIANS/O/Ouwehand_Reyn/Flimbos_Quest.sid
(#1)
 AUTHOR: Reyn Ouwehand
(#2)
 AUTHOR: Johannes Bjerregaard
COMMENT: According to Reyn, the loading tune was initially done by Johannes
         Bjerregaard. "[...] It's much better than mine. But Laurens van der
         Donk (the author of Flimbo's Quest) didn't like it." (RO) So they used
         Reyn's instead. "I believe it's still 'hidden' in the soundtrack."
         (RO) In fact, it is and it's this tune.

         long until it repeats....." (RO)

/MUSICIANS/O/Ouwehand_Reyn/Infinity.sid
  TITLE: Infinity [from Infinity]
 ARTIST: Guru Josh

/MUSICIANS/O/Ouwehand_Reyn/Knights.sid
COMMENT: "I did this just for fun. I made a sound which sounded like a horse
         whining. Then I invented some sort of story, a knight riding his
         horse. Stops before the castle. The gate opens. Coming into the
         castle, there is a Middle Age song playing. The Knight gets into a
         fight and dies. And this repeats and repeats." (RO)

/MUSICIANS/O/Ouwehand_Reyn/LN3_Lvl_5_Temple_of_Earth.sid
COMMENT: Also called "End Tune" in Reyn's LN3 soundtrack demo in 1991.

/MUSICIANS/O/Ouwehand_Reyn/Last_Ninja_3.sid
(#3)
   NAME: Intro Tune
COMMENT: The tune falls out of synch at around 4:50, which is when the tune
         should loop. However, this is due to the music data in the game
         behaving exactly the same way. You would never get to hear this part
         of the tune in the game, as the intro would finish and load the first
         level before the music got to that point.
         "I guess I had some time pressure... I knew it would fade away
         anyhow... never thought about that fact that people in 2000 would
         listen to it with SIDPlay.... :)" (RO)
         The data has been restored in this SID, to make it loop properly,
         and is confirmed by Reyn to be correct.
(#4)
   NAME: Mountains
(#5)
   NAME: Wind Temple
(#6)
   NAME: Water Temple
(#7)
   NAME: Fire Temple
(#8)
   NAME: Void Temple
(#9)
   NAME: Game Over

         liked it and I made a cover of it. Just for fun...." (RO)

  TITLE: Happy Birthday (0:00)
 ARTIST: Mildred J. Hill
  TITLE: Malbrouk s'en va-t-en guerre (0:26)
 ARTIST: Traditional
COMMENT: An Arab tune that was brought to Europe during the crusades and
         became popular during the french revolution, ever sinced spawned
         many songs, including "For He's a Jolly Good Fellow".

/MUSICIANS/O/Ouwehand_Reyn/Midnight_Express.sid
  TITLE: Chase [from the movie Midnight Express]
 ARTIST: Giorgio Moroder
COMMENT: "I believe this was the first tune where I experimented with the
         MON-editor before I was a member of MON. I got it illegally from a
         member of Scoop, who was a friend of Charles Deenen. This tune has
         never ever been used, I think/hope." (RO)

/MUSICIANS/O/Ouwehand_Reyn/Primary_Star.sid
COMMENT: This tune won the music competition at the Primary Star 2003 party.

         before I joined MON. This song was a sort of application-song..." (RO)

### /MUSICIANS/P/PFK #########################################################

/MUSICIANS/P/PFK/
COMMENT: PFK is short for Per Fredrik Kvarme.

COMMENT: Early version of /MUSICIANS/P/PFK/Unbounded_tune_8.sid

COMMENT: A slightly modified version of this tune was later used in the game
         Ballerup, (C) 1992 DOME Development.

/MUSICIANS/P/PFK/Wired_97_Invitation.sid
COMMENT: Made in 1994, released in 1997.

### /MUSICIANS/P/PST #########################################################

/MUSICIANS/P/PST/
