### /MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/ #######################################################

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/
COMMENT: PVCF is short for "Pro Velochistische Contra Fraction".

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Access_Denied_intro.sid
COMMENT: "This was done very quick & dirty, if I remember right I've had only
         3-4 hours time to compose this track in our new developed and
         finished Reflex-Tracker, a 2 channel sampletracker. Access Denied
         sample spoken by me. The bass-drumm split was make with an Amiga 500
         and converted to my C64. Later in version v1.1 of Reflex-Tracker the
         user could do this without directly in the trakker. Funny: most of
         the time in this song I use only one digichannel, after release I
         created a remix which prooves the ability of Reflex-Tracker a little
         bit better. After winning the C64 democompo at THE PARTY'94 in
         Denmark, most of the people thought our group name is 'Access Denied'
         but it was 'Reflex' instead ;)" (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Access_Denied_remix.sid
COMMENT: "This is the remix of Access_Denied_intro.sid where I show some of the
         features of Reflex-Tracker: 2 channels of digi-sounds, faked third
         voice (drum and snare which are rendered in the bassvoice), volume,
         echoeffects and flanger. All samples by me, except the "ho ho" which
         I have sampled from the german rap song 'Edelweiß'." (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Africa_Corps.sid
COMMENT: "Interesting fact: it's a 2 channel digi music but not a
         Reflex-Tracker tune. It's a routine which allows you theoretical add
         3 SID voices. The music editor is named 'Perfect Sound 3.2'.
         Unfortunately the 2 digi voices have always the speed (and pitch) of
         the first digi voice and if you really use both voices the SID
         channels were nearly destroyed and the CPU was down...
         We used this track in the note file of our (Reflex) first trackmo
         'Cafe Odd'. Later it became a very nice practice for us to use always
         a very special notefile-soundroutine for our trackmos.
         All (!) samples was sampled with my Phillips-Workman!!
         Sample-software by Zork and TTS! Sampler by Zork's Brother." (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Axel_F.sid
  TITLE: Axel F [from the movie Beverly Hills Cop]
 ARTIST: Harold Faltermeyer
COMMENT: "My second doublespeed tune. After all the other conversions of this
         great song I thought it was a good idea not only to use the original
         melody. The great mood with the sfx and sounds should even be copied.
         At 2:01 I started to remix the song with some special drums and
         clave sticks." (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Black_Crystall.sid
COMMENT: "If you are using a old sid chip or emulation you will probably not
         hear too much from the melody line, the 6581 doesn't know the used
         $31 waveform. Sorry for that. Doesn't know much about this song, its
         15 years ago and this song was only made just 4 fun and to learn...
         I never planned to release this song (and during composing this I
         even didn't have the ability to do this^^)" (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Bladeswede.sid
  TITLE: px.bladeswede remix! [from the Amiga game Project-X]
 ARTIST: Allister Brimble
COMMENT: "I listened to Allister Brimble's great song on Amiga and decided that
         this song has to be remixed to the C64. Unfortunately I don't have
         the needed amount of channels so I used a big bunch of arpeggio-lead
         & bass-splits. The patterns looks like a exploded memorydump, it was
         very hard to compose this with a durationeditor (DMC4.x). I really
         forced the lead melody between the arpeggios. The music got used in
         Access Denied trackmo-notefile with a raytraced animation and a
         layered scroller. Regarding our tradition to use some special in our
         trackmo-notefiles I tried a faked 4 speed tune, that means: normal
         doublespeed routine and additionally I called the sidroutine 2 times
         (without the filterroutine), that gives: 4speed wave and 2speed
         filter." (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Brainbeat_3_Introrap.sid
COMMENT: "Again a Reflex-Tracker song, the rap and the beats are realtime
         mixed. Rapped by myself ;) The string was ripped from Georg Brandt's
         Paranoia_Complex.sid, Tune #1, thanks to Georg! As I've made this tune
         I thought it would be a revolution, the first realtime rap on C64 and
         so... but no one, I repeat: no one! cared about ;) Later I composed
         a very long CBA&Nightshade hate hip-hop track, (they have stolen and
         cracked a game which we have made), but this song was never spread by
         our swapper Happymaker. Very sad.)" (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Breitbandkatze.sid
COMMENT: "This is one of the few songs which I have made in our own sid-editor
         called LSD (Low Sound Dealer, IIRC). Nothing special here, I think I
         have composed this tune mustly to show what clear filter sounds are
         possible with this routine. It's a single speeder. Unfortunately I
         didn't know the trackmo (Breitbandkatze / Reflex) and the demo parts
         during composing. You need a new sidchip, or you will miss some
         complete channels. It's possible that this tune is the track, which I
         would do just for fun with the goal that no voices are listenable on
         a old sid chip. But I'm not sure if I realy have done this, its not
         very hard to do such things ;) (my intention: all my filtereffects
         sounds horrible on a old sid and I thought it was better to show
         listeners with old sid nothing than crap) it was the last song which
         I did on C64 after 5 years of sid composing. Since 2001 and now
         (2008) I rarely compose sidtunes with QuadraSID, one or two times per
         year. Some of this tracks you can download from my website as mp3
         (www.reflex-studio.com)" (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Cafe_Odd_6581.sid
COMMENT: "The first trackmo of our group Reflex which was released at THE PARTY
         '93. The first trackmo with a doublespeed music 8) This was the first
         music of me on C64 which was really released AND spreaded ;) This
         trackmo also have two 2 channel digiparts! The first one is in the
         notefile, listen to Africa_Corps.sid and read the STIL comments!
         The second one is the first version of our 2 years later released
         Reflex-Tracker. The Cafe_Odd_end.sid digi music was composed in pure
         assembler." (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Cafe_Odd_8580.sid
COMMENT: See /MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Cafe_Odd_6581.sid

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Cafe_Odd_end.sid
COMMENT: "This is the first music which was done in the Reflex-Tracker engine,
         without editor. 8) I "composed" this track live at THE PARTY'93 in
         Denmark, in assembler... I typed the pattern and notes with Action
         Replay monitor in the memory. It was a very funny time, with hardcore
         party in the sleeping hall and so on 8)" (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Centric.sid
COMMENT: "I've spent very long time for the whole project, I think something
         about 6-9 months (besides graduation diploma and some rfx-trackmos).
         as the game was finished and the music was put in and I played it,
         I noticed: "shit, I've made the first ingame musics very very long,
         2-5 minutes each and the players died after some seconds of playing!"
         That was a very harsh lesson. Oh, and the game sold horrible...
         Later I composed most of the following songs a little bit shorter."
         (PVCF)
(#1)
COMMENT: "This is one of the few songs which I have made in our own sid-editor
          called LSD (Low Sound Dealer, IIRC)." (PVCF)
(#2)
COMMENT: "This was the menu tune" (PVCF)
(#3)
COMMENT: "Loader tune" (PVCF)
(#4)
COMMENT: "ingame1, huh, about every 30 seconds a totally different style."
         (PVCF)
(#5)
COMMENT: "ingame2, if you like techno on C64 this song is possible for you"
         (PVCF)
(#6)
COMMENT: "nice ringmodulation at the beginning, it was only a loader tune."
         (PVCF)
(#7)
  TITLE: Danger Freak, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Chris Hülsbeck
COMMENT: "ingame3, I tried to copy the original melody and soundset from
         'Danger Freak/Chris Hülsbeck'. Just 4 fun :)" (PVCF)
(#8)
COMMENT: "ingame4, too long, too many styles, too much work..." (PVCF)
(#9)
COMMENT: "Only a loadertune" (PVCF)
(#10)
COMMENT: "ingame5, a multispeed song, the original title is
         'dance of the robot', one of my favourite songs :)" (PVCF)
(#11)
  TITLE: Scapelands [from the C64 demo Access Denied]
 ARTIST: Kai Walter (PVCF)
COMMENT: "ingame6, a very nice remix of Scapelands.sid, just after the first
         30 seconds of boreness, which was released in Access Denied trackmo.
         I also put in some Martin Galway like athmosphere, listen from
         1:30 for this." (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Centric_end_sequence.sid
COMMENT: "The sid music and the digisequence was composed with two different
         routines: 3sid voices in DMC4.x and after finishing I have loaded
         it in Polonus' DigiTracker and added the samplesequences. Very
         funny way to compose: if you changed a sample, for example after
         2 min in songlength, you have to start the song from begin to check
         if it works in minute two. I was very masochistic those days.
         Polonus did NOT include a fast forward routine, so later I added
         one in his editor." (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Centric_trackmo.sid
COMMENT: "The trackmo Centric/Reflex of our gamesection 'Cyance' won a C64/Amiga
         democompetition at a multiplatform party in Berlin in 1996, IIRC. We
         decided to give up the trackmo spontaneously, but it was a big success
         :) To tell the truth: I don't like this song very much, especially the
         total uninspired first minute is horrible. It's a doublespeed song.
         This is one of the few songs which I have made in our own sid-editor
         called LSD (Low Sound Dealer, IIRC)." (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Dr_Nabla.sid
  TITLE: Look Who's Talking [from Look Who's Talking]
 ARTIST: Dr. Alban
COMMENT: "Yeah, a 5-speed tune, IIRC. The drumtable was longer than my arm ;)
         Just composed for fun. it sounds a little disharmonic at begin, that's
         caused by Brian/Graffity, who didn't implement the right frequency
         table in his DMCs. From DMC4 I used a own table, which
         KB/TOM/farbrausch has edited. From 2:30 min there are very nice
         remixes and soundeffects which are inspired by the samples from Bad
         Cat by Chris Hülsbeck  8)" (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Dresden_Party_95_II.sid
COMMENT: "This song was composed live on a local computerparty. I would say it
         was funny, but on other had: how funny is a party where you sit down
         and work on a C64 and there is only one of this machine running and
         other people (Ron Grahnert aka Odysseus) are even bored and tried to
         get his hands on the keyboard? So we found a compromise and worked
         10 min each on DMC :) That's the result!
         Ah, one interesting thing: it's a special more and halfspeed-mix. One
         channel (arpeggio channel) is halfspeeded and the other 2 channels
         are massive multispeeded (did I mention that it was very bored at this
         party ? ;) For exact details about the routine you can simply
         watch the partydemo which was released together with BrainBeat 4,
         called Party Dresden 95. If you find out that it sounds different in
         the demo; that's right. However the tune in HVSC sounds as I've
         intended it to sound :) The swinging logo have destroyed the
         multispeed routine." (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Ende.sid
COMMENT: "Made in GMC, the predecessor of the great DMC. One of my first songs
         in a duration editor, right after 7 months of composing in
         Soundmonitor. For more details look at comments for Game_Over.sid.
         This song got never released, its a HVSC first release." (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Fast_Shit_Insider_3_2.sid
COMMENT: "Uh, that name was harshly criticised by Happymaker which was
         responsible for our mag 'Insider'. I don't know why I called it
         Fast Shit, but it was very important for me... ;)
         Nice doublespeed tune, made in DMC3.x." (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/For_Guilty.sid
COMMENT: "Bad story: to become famous I thought I compose some tunes for other
         groups, so they spread my musics with their demos/mags. I spent a
         lot of time for this tune. After 2 years or so a guy from Guilty
         met my at a party and told me something like "I'm so so sorry, but
         we haven't released your track, because blabla", I was very pissed off.
         So in fact it's a HVSC release." (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/For_Ingenious_Brain_5.sid
COMMENT: "Same like For_Guilty.sid, to become famous I thought I compose some
         tunes for other groups, so that they spread my musics whith their
         demos/mags. So I spent a lot of time for this tune. I don't know if
         I really sent it to the mag Ingenious Brain, but if I did or not, the
         song was never released there. I put it later in one of my
         soundcollections 'Brainbeat'. After 1:40 it changes to a new song..."
         (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/For_Insider_02.sid
COMMENT: "One of my earlier works, every 30 seconds a complete different theme
         :/  Later I used part 2:50-3:00 as the base for Nova 2, track #7
         (The scratch effect, I think)" (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/For_Insider_04.sid
COMMENT: "Strongly needed a new sid chip. Later I used the knowledge which I
         earned during composing this sound in the technotracks for the game
         'Geometric2'." (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Game_Over.sid
COMMENT: "The samples were ripped from Jeroen Tel, Rob Hubbard/Simon Nicol
         and Chris Hülsbeck if I remember right. One of my countless
         Rockmonitor songs. I composed about 8-9 months with some versions
         of Hülsbeck' Soundmonitor and Rockmonitors and similar composing
         programs. I made about 30-40 songs with digis, not a single one
         was released! In 1997 I gave this bunch of disks to Happymaker,
         together with tons of disks with samples... Only this song and
         Trance_HQ.sid are left, which I found later (1999) on a disc
         which was in a 1541 drive which I plugged on my PC just to look
         if I can use StarCommander to transfer stuff from a C64 disc to
         a harddrive." (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Geometric_2.sid
(#1)
COMMENT: "The task: compose a absolut High Quality techno song for the intro of
         our AFLI game :) I think its my best techno song on C64, it's a
         doublespeeder which really forces the 8580 to its limits. The ingame
         songs are simple singlespeeders, but I've spent much time in editing
         filter LFOs to get those clear and hard sounds on DMC3. IIRC the coder
         (Quiss) gave the tester of a german C64 mag called "64'er" a call and
         asked him to use a new sid chip for the review of the game. I got 10
         of 10 points for the music :) Sadly only one of the 2 ingame tracks
         were used. Some memory problems... The same sh*t like nowadays on
         NintendoDS :(" (PVCF)
(#3)
COMMENT: "I really love the echo-arpeggios after 1:33 and the echo effect in
         the flute lead. It's only one channel, I added the echo-effect with
         a simple trick: I repeated the last two notes with very low volume."
         (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Giana_2.sid
COMMENT: "Very funny story why I created this song: if you look carefully in
         this directory you will find a song called "Axel_F" which I adapted
         from Harold Faltermeyer. I found out, if I play the original Beverly
         Hills Cop chords from Axel F in the other direction OR simultaneously
         it's exact(!) the same like "The Great Giana Sisters, Tune #5".
         To answer all other game related questions: NO!  :)
         It was NOT a Giana/Mario-clone. It was NOT released. I have NO copy
         (only one level was finished and playable, ask Quiss!) We do NOT have
         had a permission to use the name and the sprites of Giana :) The idea:
         what do if you get stressed by work / family / girlfriend/... ? What
         about a game where you can shoot very brutal? What enemy would you
         like to kill to vent your anger? Right! The dinky Giana Sister :p
         And what weapon would you like to use to kill Giana? Right! A tank! So
         here is the game: you have a tank with a machinegun which drove from
         right to left (on your will) and from above it was raining little
         Giana Sisters with parachutes. Now you could use your heavy machinegun
         and blow them into hell (subtune #6!). If you missed one and landed in
         front of you, you could try to drive with your tank chain over Giana :)
         then #5 was played. If you only have destroyed the parachute and
         little Giana falls & hit the ground #4 was played. #7 if a Giana hits
         your tank (and eats some of your health)." (PVCF)
(#1)
  TITLE: Great Giana Sisters, Tune #5
 ARTIST: Chris Hülsbeck
COMMENT: "The sid music and the digisequence was composed with two different
         routines; DMC3 and Polonus' DigiTracker. Very funny way to compose:
         if you changed a sample, for example after 2 min in songlength,
         you have to start the song from begin to check if it works in min 2.
         I was very masochistic those days. Polonus did NOT include a fast
         forward routine, so I added one in his editor.
         The samples: for track 1 I used some placeholder voices (bad man,
         sumba-he!) just to see if the spoken samples work, after some months
         of work on this game and the decision that we do not release the game
         I stopped the work and I left the samples like they were. Later I
         released the Giana 2 soundpack in Brainbeat 4, SideB." (PVCF)
(#2)
COMMENT: "Ingame tune. 2 voices only, so we could use the remaining one for the
         digi effects." (PVCF)
(#3)
COMMENT: "Was supposed to be the loadertune and the highscore track." (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Gubber.sid
COMMENT: "Reflex-Tracker demo song. It was only a joke :) Took about 4 hours.
         I think absolutely no one liked this song but me, I'm proud of it,
         hehe!" (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Hamburger_Special_Happy_PVCF-Mix.sid
COMMENT: "Yeah, my first DMC2 song with digis. The sid music and the digi
         sequence was composed with two different routines, DMC2.x and
         Polonus' DigiTracker.
         Most of the samples were recorded by me, the spoken "PVCF of BBP" and
         "Hamburger" was my voice. Some additional samples ("Hit it" and
         "HE!") were ripped from Jeron Tel. BBP was my first demogroup from 1992
         (Buckaroo Banzai Productions, only minor releases). This tune was not
         really released, it's one of my fun-composings :)" (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Hexzakk.sid
  TITLE: Turrican 2, Tune #1 (1:21-1:39)
 ARTIST: Stefan Hartwig
COMMENT: "OK, double, triple, 5-speed, what comes next? Right, a hexspeed
         tune :) It was only a test, but it was very hard to edit drums,
         snares and effects, 6-time-speed is veery fast in the waveformtable.
         In 1:21... the Turrican2 like melody, believe me, it was not a cover,
         it was an accident ;)" (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Introfronty.sid
  TITLE: Introfronty [from the Amiga MOD module]
 ARTIST: Markus Merilainen (Dezecrator of Classic)
COMMENT: "It was a boring afternoon, I listened to this track on the Amiga and
         tried to get them in my DMC ^^ 2 hours of work. Smash Design used
         this song later in a 4k demo :) It's a doublespeed track." (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/KJU_intro_6581.sid
  TITLE: utopia ingame3
 ARTIST: Barry Leitch
COMMENT: The lead covers a portion of the intro tune for the Amiga game Utopia
         by Barry Leitch.
         "Hmm, one of my favorit songs on C64, unfortunately I haven't finished
         this song (it's currently about 50%) because the parts which used this
         music are not long enough, so I stopped to work on this track." (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/KJU_intro_8580.sid
  TITLE: utopia ingame3
 ARTIST: Barry Leitch
COMMENT: See /MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/KJU_intro_6581.sid

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Kata_Sandom.sid
COMMENT: "This is the soundtrack (track 2) from our second trackmo 'Access
         Denied'. With this trackmo Reflex got his "name" in the scene.
         One interesting detail: I got the complete working and finished
         trackmo and 2 or 3 weeks time to make the soundtrack. So I took
         paper and pencil, put down all timers/parts and the first real
         demo soundtrack on C64 was born. It was great, every part got his
         own style of music but all was one song! It was a very hard work.
         After winning the C64 democompo at THE PARTY'94 in Denmark, most of
         the people thought our group name was 'Access Denied' but it was
         'Reflex' instead!!" (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Maniac_Fred.sid
  TITLE: Maniac Mansion, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Chris Grigg & David Lawrence
COMMENT: "Hm, its a 4 or 6 speed song, if I remember right." (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Mathematica_tune_1_6581.sid
COMMENT: "Interesting thing about this song: first I have spoken with the
         programmer (Zorc) about the possible parts, then we have made a demo
         design document which exactly described what should happen and then
         I composed this track. The result is one of the most styled intros
         ever (I hope ;) ). I worked on this tune for about 7 months (no joke)
         The complete intro from mathematica was supposed to be the intro of
         Access Denied one year before. But it didn't got finished so we added
         the 2 channel samplepart in front of Access Denied. Zorc has worked
         very hard to keep the next deadline for Mathematica 1995  ;)
         The sid detection routine is working also with a sid-card on PC with
         a C64 emu 8) The trick which KB have found out: the new 8580 SID have
         cleared a register faster than the 6581 (old). Simple isn't it ? ;)"
         (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Mathematica_tune_1_8580.sid
COMMENT: See /MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Mathematica_tune_1_6581.sid

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Mathematica_tune_2.sid
COMMENT: "This is one of the few songs which I have made in our own sid-editor
         called LSD (Low Sound Dealer, IIRC). One of my costly and longest LSD
         tracks. in this routine I could trigger demoparts with numeric
         commands in the soundpattern, Quiss (the programmer of LSD and some
         of the trackmoparts in Mathematica) have included a fallback routine
         in the demo, that waits 10 sec if the floppydrive of the user is to
         slow and a trigger was missed. Unfortunately he forgot to tell me that
         the first numeric trigger he was expecting was a "0". But I began the
         count with "1" ... so 10 sec failbackpause is in all versions of
         mathematica, right before the Doom-part. Funny thing: exact 5.34 min
         long was the centerpart, I composed exact 5.34 min :)  but I don't
         know about the 10 sec fall back routine, and Quiss didn't tell me...
         he simply took notice that the music was too "short", removed the
         stop-bytes at the end of the LSD track and was satisfied. Watching
         the trackmo first time and live at THE PARTY'95 I was pissed of as
         I saw/heard the result: the music wild remixed itself after 5.34
         unless the last part was finished. I learned one thing:
         (its true up to now, 2008!!) programmers don't have any savvy about
         music.  Last funny thing: I asked all people around me what they
         thought about this crazy and disharmonic music?  All(!) comments
         sounded like this: "If PVCF compose like this it has to be like
         this" ... aha.. ha ..ha... Funny thing: after the democompetition
         the organizers have shown this trackmo again, in this time (1995)
         Mathematica was like a revolution on C64 in design & code and I
         put in at 1:36 a little irish sounding melody which forced some
         people with hooked arms to dance together on tables, I was very
         very very proud :p  It's possible that you need a new sidchip to
         hear this part, sorry for that. (yes, the trackmo has a
         sidchip-selector and detector, but this should be used in an other
         trackmo of us, read the STIL comments for
         Mathematica_tune_1_6581.sid for more information about this)." (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Mathematica_tune_3.sid
COMMENT: "Ah, second Doom part. This time coded by Guru, it's a DMC music,
         because it was not sure if this part could be finished in time
         and a LSD music have to be converted with Quiss' help and PC-C64
         cross system, and in times without internet it was not safe enough :)
         So I used the good old DMC with a playable music after saving :)"
         (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Mathematika_II.sid
COMMENT: "For us in Reflex this music was too fast, but AEG/Smash Design
         has accepted the challenge and took this song for one or two of his
         demos 8) (one was called "NO")
         It's a DMC and somekind of doublespeed tune IIRC. I think only the
         third voice is doublespeeded." (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Megasweet_6581.sid
COMMENT: "Uhh, this song taught me a very hard lesson: save your work every
         3-5 minutes, ... save !!!!
         I worked on Megasweet a whole day and I swear, it was twice as good
         as what you can hear now. But after about 8 hours of composing on my
         C64 (it was a sunny day, I ought to learn for my A-level examination)
         the C64 was freezed (a DMC-crash which occured about once per year).
         After that I was so frustrated that I released this truly unfinished
         version. Check out the great mp3 conversion from DJ SKITZ. To be
         honest I have ripped out the idea for the filtered glide effect in
         the main bassline from an Amiga-mod called "Megasweet". I thought
         it would be nice to try something similar on C64 for testing purpose.
         Then I added the chord, but didn't play it as arpeggio-sound (typical
         C64), instead I played it like a triad, very slow and voila - the
         base idea of the first real trance/chill techno music on C64 was
         born. Now the "work" begun: in DMC4 doesn't exists a filtercommand
         in pattern, so I must use different filtered basses and endless
         glide-effects in bassline. It's not much fun to work like this." (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Megasweet_8580.sid
COMMENT: See /MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Megasweet_6581.sid

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Nova-Soundcollection_Intro.sid
COMMENT: "Made with DMC4. singlespeed but with some intresting ringmodulations
         at the beginning." (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Nova_2.sid
COMMENT: "One of my first games ever which I have composed the soundtrack for.
         (2008 about 40-50, I can't count all). In this game I learned one
         thing: never, never ever never use one song per level. Never ever!!!
         The best song get on your nerves after repeating it for the 5th time.
         And as stated in the comments about Mathematica_tune_2.sid,
         programmers don't want to hear this, up to now. They know it better,
         of course ;)" (PVCF)
(#1)
   NAME: Introduction
 AUTHOR: Kai Walter (PVCF)
(#2)
   NAME: Ingame 1
 AUTHOR: Kai Walter (PVCF)
(#3)
   NAME: Ingame 2
 AUTHOR: Ron Grahnert (Odysseus)
(#4)
   NAME: Ingame 3
 AUTHOR: Kai Walter (PVCF)
(#5)
   NAME: Ingame 4
 AUTHOR: Kai Walter (PVCF)
  TITLE: The Good, The Bad and The Ugly [from the movie]
 ARTIST: Ennio Morricone
(#6)
   NAME: Ingame 5
 AUTHOR: Ron Grahnert (Odysseus)
(#7)
   NAME: Ingame 6
 AUTHOR: Kai Walter (PVCF)
(#8)
   NAME: Outro
 AUTHOR: Ron Grahnert (Odysseus)
(#9)
   NAME: Outro
 AUTHOR: Ron Grahnert (Odysseus)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Ode_to_PJO_Vibrants.sid
COMMENT: "In 1995 I got a PC386 and a Adlib card together with a Adlib composer
         by Vibrants and I tried this out. It was possible that the future of
         gamemusics could be with this system (not really, one year later
         Gravis Ultrasound and later Soundblaster won the battle with sampled
         digisound). PJO have made a nice demosong for this Adlib tracker, I
         tried to cover some of the basslines and the chords (14 voices...)
         in DMC4 on C64 just to give some respects to him for this great
         song :)  I don't know anymore how much of this song is inspired by
         PJO's song but the bassline at the intro is nearly 100% converted."
         (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Originalzak.sid
COMMENT: "This is the first music which was made in the finished Reflex-Tracker,
         it has no melodie or inspiration, it was more a test than a song.
         Altough it's not the first song which was made with our 2channel
         digiroutine: the first one was used as endpart in our trackmo
         'Cafe Odd'. The Cafe_Odd_end.sid digi music was composed in pure
         assembler." (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Radio_Napalm.sid
COMMENT: "This was made for and released in the trackmo 'Radio Napalm' of our
         group 'Reflex', which has won a party, but I can't remember which.
         [It won the X'95 demo competition held in Utrecht, Netherlands]
         Quiss told me it was shown with a old sid chip 6581 and the music
         wasn't that what it should be supposed to, but the crowd was so
         impressed by the trackmo that the applause during the whole demo
         was even louder than the sound equipement. So the old sid wasn't
         that much of a problem :)
         It's a DMC music and I hate it for the 16 slots instrument
         limitation, you can hear it: the filter doesn't sweep smooth at the
         first part, they are like triggered in a mod file. :( Later I
         released this song in one of our Brainbeat music collections, but
         I forgot to relocate the song, so every one could load the tune
         directly in his DMC. The result: some very bad remixes (which uses
         this horrible filter off-set soundsystem). The party [the demo was
         released on] had a limitation in length of demos: 5 minutes. So first
         I composed the music as a 5 minutes track. Unfortunately Quiss (the
         coder of the trackmo) didn't get enough parts in time to fill up
         the 5 minutes complete. We first have planned to show during the
         whole demo a backward timer which runs from 5 min to 0 with the
         comment "We hate timelimits!!!". After Quiss told me the lack of a
         needed last part I shortened the music drastically. I have done this
         track on a new sidchip, KB/TOM (now farbrausch) later converted
         this song for the old sidchip and released a "old sid chip" version
         of the trackmo." (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Reflection.sid
COMMENT: "This is one of the few songs which I have made in our own sid-editor
         called LSD (Low Sound Dealer, IIRC). Again I got the whole finished
         trackmo 'Reflection' from Quiss and I could compose the music right
         fitting to the parts. It's an unusual multispeed setup: the first
         channel is singlespeed, the second double and the third something
         around 4-6, don't know anymore. It was only possible with our new NMI
         timer trackmosystem, no dull rastertime ;). Hehe, no one have beat
         this, I think 8) The next step should be a trackmo with multispeed
         LSD music and a one channeled digiroutine. LSD was prepared for this,
         but Quiss and I haven't found the time to manage a new trackmo and
         complete the LSD composer due to our gamedeveloping ambitions on PC.
         I don't know exactly at which party we released this trackmo, but
         it could be THE PARTY 95 together with Mathematica, but I'm not
         sure as mentioned." (PVCF)
         [The demo Reflection was released at the Convention 1996]

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Sampled_Birds.sid
COMMENT: "I like this track very much, but I never ever got any feedback of
         anyone else which likes this song as well. What's wrong with this
         track??? OK, its a fun-song, without any sense but with wonderful
         harmonies and chords. I released it in one of my soundcollections
         called 'Brainbeat'." (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Scapelands.sid
COMMENT: "This was the music of the IFLI endpart of our THE PARTY'94 winning
         trackmo Access Denied. In 2005 I got a feedback in a german
         gamedeveloper forum of one person which liked this tune (beside me).
         it was the first and last reaction which I got for this track in 14
         years after I composed it. The song was arranged with DMC3 or 4."
         (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Scratch_It.sid
COMMENT: "My first doublespeed song. 8) Horrible intro, but after 30 seconds
         of it the song is very stylish. 8) Odysseus has programmed my DMC3
         to turn those trendy morespeeder. 8) He was sitting about 8 hours
         the whole night beside me and hacked my C64 after we listened to
         Jeroen Tel's Invest Intro which was a very impressive morespeeder.
         It sounds a little disharmonic at begin, that is caused by
         Brian/Graffity, who didn't implement the right frequency table
         in his DMCs. From DMC4 I used a own table, which KB/tom/farbrausch
         have edited. Some complete channels are only audible on a new sid
         chip, as usual: sorry 4 this." (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Single_5.sid
COMMENT: "Never released, was found on my workdisks. Maybe it should be a
         Centric loadertune or something like that. Made with DMC3. New sid
         chip reccomended. In this song I learned some elementary things with
         filterglide effects which I have used later in 'Megasweet.sid'."
         (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Single_6.sid
COMMENT: "Never released or finished. It's one of my first musics and the first
         in GMC or DMC2 duration editor. found on my workdiscs. I like it
         very much, very happy song. Unfortunately you must use a 8580 (new sid
         chip) to listen for all channels. Sometimes a Airwolf-main-theme-like
         bassline appears, it was not intended to sound like Airwolf." (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Sound_Test.sid
COMMENT: "Massive multispeed 8) If I remember right it was a 11-speeder, sounds
         like samples 8) We used this track in front of our (Reflex) trackmo
         'Reflection'." (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Strange_Acidshit.sid
COMMENT: "Ahaa, octa multispeed 8) Only hours after I have had my hacked DMC
         with doublespeed I added some additional $1003er callings ;) This
         track is the result and was released in a "Insider" mag announce,
         a mag from our group Reflex. (which only has 4 releases, one per
         year where Reflex existed, I think)" (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Theme.sid
COMMENT: "Some of my first DMC3 tracks, it's one of those senseless songs
         which I only could release by myself in my music collections
         called 'Brainbeat'. A very happy or better cheerful style, this
         song makes me smile :)" (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Thomkat_with_Strange_End.sid
COMMENT: "DMC3 with 5 times multispeed routine. Too much bass... But the end
         of this song is great 8) This song got never released. I did this
         song in 1993, it sounds very "analog", I detuned every instrument
         a little bit at the begin of his wavetable, so the result is a very
         organic sound. Very nice techno part at 2:00, I should remix this
         somedays. (And I don't like techno at all)" (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/To_Be_on_Top_Remix.sid
  TITLE: To Be on Top, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Chris Hülsbeck
COMMENT: Used in the game "Black Quiz", (C) 1995 Magic Disk 64/CP Verlag.
         "I played around whith Soundmonitor and found this song from Chris,
         so I simply started to make this song in DMC. After 30 sec of boring
         intro I begun to remix it with some PVCF styled elements. I never
         released this song beside my Soundcollections 'Brainbeat'. As
         mentioned in comments for Trance_HQ.sid and Game_Over.sid I have
         composed lot of rock/sound-monitor songs, so I made a very very big
         10 min remix of the original 4 channeled 'To Be on Top' by Chris,
         so I don't gave much effort in this DMC -sid only mix." (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Trance_202.sid
COMMENT: "The second Reflex-Tracker demosong, this song was released with
         Brainbeat 4 on SideB. It shows some volume effects and wave/drum
         splitting." (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Trance_HQ.sid
COMMENT: This tune was composed on an 8580 with a digi booster installed.
         "The samples was ripped from Jeroen Tel, Rob Hubbard/Simon Nicol
         and Chris Hülsbeck IIRC. One of my countless rockmonitor songs.
         I composed about 8-9 months with some versions of Hülsbeck's
         Soundmonitor and Rockmonitors and similar composing programs.
         I made about 30-40 songs with digis, no one was released!
         In 1997 I gave this bunch of disks to Happymaker, together with tons
         of disks with samples... only this song and Game_Over.sid are left,
         which I found later (1999) on a disc which was in a 1541 drive which
         I plugged on my PC just to look if I can use StarCommander to
         transfer stuff from a C64 disc to a harddrive." (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Triage_tune_2.sid
COMMENT: "This is one of the few songs which I have made in our own sid-editor
         called LSD (Low Sound Dealer, IIRC). Released and used in trackmo
         'Triage' by Smash Designs. I don't know if it is a multispeeder,
         but it sounds like a double speed DMC so it's possible that it is a
         normal speeded LSD where I wanted to prove what's possible with this
         great soundroutine." (PVCF)

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/execute_overdrive_intro.sid
COMMENT: "I was very surprised in 2004 as I heard this track in a new Smash
         Designs trackmo. Hm, I stopped composing on C64 in 1997 and in 2004
         there appears a new song... what happened? After analyzing the chords
         and melodies it was clear: it must be a working track, maybe a loader
         tune for centric. AEG, which is the lead programmer of Smash Designs,
         has the permission (since 1995) to use all PVCF-C64 songs on all C64
         productions and so he did :) I'm not sure, but I think he used more
         of my musics in his trackmos than we could in Reflex ;) Ah, AEG, if
         you care (and if you read this) : I've really planned in 1992(?)
         (after your first demo (bei nebenwirkungen essen sie die
         packungsbeilage...)) to ask you if I could join Smash Designs, no
         joke! But in those times my musics were so bad that I waited and then
         I got an offer from Reflex." (PVCF)

### /MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Early_Tunes ############################################

/MUSICIANS/P/PVCF/Early_Tunes/Mixed_Steps_on_Raining_Days.sid
COMMENT: "This tune is 100% by me, but I made this zak for a competition where
         the musician have to be there to compete. So I gave the tune to CDAW
         and he competed with this track in the competition under his handle.
         The credits for CDAW are false. It's my tune but the player on the
         compo which are released with the song shows his name. Songcollection
         'Brainbeat 1', which surely have included the song (ed: in the note)
         should credit me." (PVCF)

COMMENT: Paco's (Ádám Papp) own comments are denoted (AP).
         "All SIDs were composed in Brian's GMC 1.0 (not DMC). I made more
         than 150 tunes in 7 active years, so this is a little selection,
         my personal favorites (even if a tune is short or not finished).
         SidPlay cannot play back some of them, so please use a real Commodore
         64. Thanx!" (AP)

### /MUSICIANS/P/Palmonari_Stefano ###########################################

### /MUSICIANS/P/Pedersen_Inge/Worktunes #####################################

/MUSICIANS/P/Pedersen_Inge/Worktunes/Its_a_Sin.sid
  TITLE: It's A Sin [from the 12" maxi version]
 ARTIST: Pet Shop Boys
COMMENT: "Gentlemen, this is done in my *own* player. When listening
          to this tune today, I'm happy I didn't develop the player
          any further, as it was crap from the start. I have to admit
          that I do not remember what speed it should be, but I think
          it was non-IRQ, ie just like this rip." (IP)

### /MUSICIANS/P/Phobos/ #####################################################

/MUSICIANS/P/Phobos/
COMMENT: Phobos' (Krzysztof Malczewski) own comments are denoted (KM)
         (translated by Raf).

/MUSICIANS/P/Phobos/8_Speed_Music.sid
COMMENT: "Simple tune written on SIDWinder. Inspired by SPEED UP tune and its
         instruments, also uses them." (KM)

/MUSICIANS/P/Phobos/A_Morning.sid
COMMENT: "One of my first tunes , made with original tape version of HARDTRACK
         COMPOSER" (KM)

/MUSICIANS/P/Phobos/Abra.sid
  TITLE: Abra [from the Amiga MOD module]
 ARTIST: Jogeir Liljedahl
COMMENT: "One of the best Amiga modules by Jogeir Liljedahl, making a cover was
         a must. I don't know how this tune arrived at North Party 9,
         additionally it participated in the compo and it possibly could win
         (there was an error on Ramos' disk). In the end it placed 4th." (KM)

/MUSICIANS/P/Phobos/Akening.sid
COMMENT: "One of many tunes made on SDI 0.98. Seems to be an accident ;-)" (KM)

/MUSICIANS/P/Phobos/Albion.sid
COMMENT: "Written with Cactus (he wrote few notes). Inpired by Shogoon's
         Trance, percussion is copied from one Tangerine Dream's piece from
         Lili on the beach album, I think it was Crystal Curfew" (KM)

/MUSICIANS/P/Phobos/Aliens.sid
  TITLE: Aliens, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Russell Lieblich

/MUSICIANS/P/Phobos/Arachnophobia.sid
COMMENT: "This was accidentally used in Arachnophobia magazine. Was written for
         MacArthur / Samar" (KM)

/MUSICIANS/P/Phobos/Autumn_Storm.sid
(#2)
  TITLE: Twilight Zone [from Get Ready!] (0:06)
 ARTIST: 2 Unlimited
(#7)
COMMENT: "One of my first tunes which looks 'complete'. It's a sequel
         to 'Autumn's Rain'" (KM)

/MUSICIANS/P/Phobos/Autumns_Rain.sid
COMMENT: "One of the very first tunes made by me. It didn't make me proud.
         Inspired by a poem which is lost unfortunately." (KM)

/MUSICIANS/P/Phobos/Autumns_Rains_2.sid
COMMENT: "Remake of 'Autumn's Rain' using JCH editor." (KM)

/MUSICIANS/P/Phobos/Axelerate_Intro.sid
COMMENT: "Music written specially to Axelerate's intro." (KM)

/MUSICIANS/P/Phobos/Batman.sid
  TITLE: Batman, The Caped Crusader, Tune #2
 ARTIST: Fred Gray
COMMENT: Phobos has mistakenly signed this tune "BATMAN BY M.GRAY", while it
         covers /MUSICIANS/G/Gray_Fred/Batman_the_Caped_Crusader.sid, Tune #2.
         "My first tune written in JCH editor with Glover's 2x player. This one
         was written in 1x in 21.g6, instruments were checked with Turbo
         Assembler +60K." (KM)

/MUSICIANS/P/Phobos/Blue_Hit.sid
COMMENT: "One of two tunes written after a nervous collapse, Used in Inverse -
         Oxygen's Polish magazine" (KM)

/MUSICIANS/P/Phobos/Boon.sid
COMMENT: "Partially written using Moog's DMC v4 instruments." (KM)

/MUSICIANS/P/Phobos/Chronologie_3.sid
  TITLE: Chronologie 3 [from Chronologie]
 ARTIST: Jean Michel Jarre
COMMENT: "Another cover, not too successful." (KM)

/MUSICIANS/P/Phobos/Continued.sid
COMMENT: "Written with Glover. Actually most of it was made by Glover with SDI
         0.98, I finished it but the music couldn't be packed properly (an
         error) so I rewrote it in JCH. It placed 5th on North Party 6." (KM)

/MUSICIANS/P/Phobos/Cover.sid
  TITLE: <?> [from the Dzwoniê do pana / pani w bardzo nietypowej sprawie radio show]
 ARTIST: <?>

/MUSICIANS/P/Phobos/Crazy_Mix.sid
  TITLE: Poci¹g widmo [from the TV series Lucky Luke] (0:00-0:17)
 ARTIST: <?>
  TITLE: Train (0:17-0:45)
 ARTIST: Phobos
COMMENT: A part of /MUSICIANS/P/Phobos/Train.sid
  TITLE: Fable (0:45-1:37)
 ARTIST: Robert Miles
  TITLE: Every Breath You Take [from Synchronicity] (1:37-1:51)
 ARTIST: The Police

/MUSICIANS/P/Phobos/Cyberworm.sid
COMMENT: "First intuitive techno in my career, ended poorly which can be heard,
         seen and felt, surely you can delete it from disk :)" (KM)

/MUSICIANS/P/Phobos/Dance_in_the_Rain_1.sid
  TITLE: Dance in the Rain [from Amiga MOD module]

         memory of my cat called Dee - rest in peace." (KM)

/MUSICIANS/P/Phobos/Excalibur.sid
  TITLE: Hotel California [from Hotel California]
 ARTIST: The Eagles
COMMENT: "In my opinion one of my best tunes. Actually inspired by Hotel
         California , but certainly it's not a cover! got 17th place on Mekka &
         Symposium 2000." (KM)

/MUSICIANS/P/Phobos/Excalibur_2SID.sid
  TITLE: Hotel California [from Hotel California]
 ARTIST: The Eagles
COMMENT: Not a direct cover, but heavily inspired by it.

COMMENT: "Idea for this zak appeared in an art gallery (in Sosnowiec, Poland)
         named the same as the title" (KM)

         Rather nice arpeggios appear near end of the music." (KM)

/MUSICIANS/P/Phobos/Sequences.sid
COMMENT: "First try to write something longer. After nearly 5 minutes I had to
         stop because music was unpackable. Packed one is 47 blocks long (!).
         This is first time I used lead with synch turned after some time."
         (KM)

         improved." (KM)

### /MUSICIANS/P/PseudoGrafx #################################################

/MUSICIANS/P/PseudoGrafx/
COMMENT: All comments on PseudoGrafx's tunes are by the author Zdenek
         Eisenhammer (ZE).

/MUSICIANS/P/PseudoGrafx/Aurora.sid
  TITLE: Hymn to Aurora [from the Amiga MOD module]
 ARTIST: Horace Wimp
COMMENT: "The first version I made on my Atari a few years ago and since I
         love this MOD, I also had to make the C64 version. I was trying to
         make the instruments sound the nearest possible to the original and I
         was quite successful (also because I ripped the trumpet sound from
         some DOS/ADSR tune - check /MUSICIANS/D/DOS/Pursuit.sid).
         Sounds best on a real C64." (ZE)

/MUSICIANS/P/PseudoGrafx/Close_to_Me.sid
  TITLE: Close To Me [from The Head on the Door]
 ARTIST: The Cure
COMMENT: "This is probably my last tune ever made on C64 - finished in March
         97. I really wonder why I did it in TFX 1.3 although v2.4 was already
         finished..." (ZE)

/MUSICIANS/P/PseudoGrafx/Fire.sid
  TITLE: Laser Squadron [from the Atari XL/XE game]
 ARTIST: Dieter Bohlen
COMMENT: "A cover of an ATARI XL/XE music from an ugly german game, which was
         really lame although it was quite new ('92 or '93). The music was
         cool anyway :-)." (ZE)

/MUSICIANS/P/PseudoGrafx/Fonttime.sid
COMMENT: "Made for the font collection in Unreal's tooldisk 'Tooltime'. My
         first original tune (not a cover) on C64 (November 95). Tooltime was
         full of this tune - it was used in nearly all notes on the disk
         because we didn't have any other tunes to use and we didn't want to
         use the ripped ones." (ZE)

/MUSICIANS/P/PseudoGrafx/Mountain_Bike.sid
  TITLE: Mountain Bike Racer, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Adam Gilmore
COMMENT: This was my first C64 tune made in October 95 and also the first
         tune ever finished in our music editor TFX 1.0. It covers ATARI XL/XE
         version, since I had an 800XE before C64. Anyway the C64 version is
         nearly the same. Maybe if I had known that Adam Gilmore made it
         also on C64, I wouldn't have covered it." (ZE)

/MUSICIANS/P/PseudoGrafx/Partyzak.sid
COMMENT: "IMHO my worst tune because I was absolutely out of inspiration when
         doing it. I had to finish it during one afternoon since it was a
         tune for our partyreport which was held on one weekend in spring 96
         - and I also had to make a picture for that report on the same day. My
         first tune made in an improved version of TFX - v1.3." (ZE)

/MUSICIANS/P/PseudoGrafx/Wish_Me_Luck.sid
  TITLE: Wish Me Luck [from the Amiga MOD module]
 ARTIST: Martin Wall (Mantronix of Panorama)
COMMENT: Made for Ray's (Unreal's main coder and HQ) request. It was quite
         an easy work to rewrite it (he recorded the module for me on a tape
         since I didn't have PC yet) - it took me only 1 day and it's nearly
         the same as the original. Made in February 1997. Sounds the best on
         a real C64." (ZE)

### /MUSICIANS/R/Raf/ ########################################################

/MUSICIANS/R/Raf/
COMMENT: Comments by Raf (Rafal Szyja) are denoted (RS).

/MUSICIANS/R/Raf/3_Sl0wa.sid
COMMENT: "The conversation in the begginning says:
         "prosze sluchamy Radia Maryja , [priest]
         (halo), [listener]
         szczesc boze,
         (szczesc boze , 3 slowa do ojca prowadzacego : chuj ci w dupe)"
         which means:
         "please , we're listening to Radio Mary,
         (halo),
         god bless you,
         (god bless you , three words to leading priest: dick in your ass!)
         obviously this is very controversal and was used many times
         (completely or cut) in some Polish music, mainly hip-hop." (RS)

/MUSICIANS/R/Raf/COMPOSEED_c0de.sid
COMMENT: "Title is right... it was meants to sound like "SID" somewhere .
         and $c0de? I'm a coder too ;-)" (RS)

/MUSICIANS/R/Raf/Ditexetoluen.sid
  TITLE: Giana Cracktro [from Amiga MOD]
 ARTIST: Manfred Linzner (Pink of Abyss)
COMMENT: "This little piece was finished during North Party 10 while I was a
         bit drunk, I actually finished assembling compoplayer and packing all
         the stuff at 18:21 on Saturday but organizers stated that deadline
         hits at 16:00  I also tried to make the tune polished earlier (I was
         sobre in the morning , you know) but I wanted to use Goat Tracker
         v2.54 with C64 connected to my old Toshiba Tecra 510 CDT via PC64 but
         some guys have taken out monitor I used as speaker  so later I
         started from scratch on Viper's high-end laptop and tracked this in
         about 30 minutes with ReSID :(" (RS)

/MUSICIANS/R/Raf/God_is_a_girl.sid
  TITLE: God is a Girl [from Covergirl]
 ARTIST: Groove Coverage

/MUSICIANS/R/Raf/Kanikurwy.sid
  TITLE: Kanikuly
 ARTIST: Code Red
COMMENT: Covers chorus only.

/MUSICIANS/R/Raf/Kikstart.sid
  TITLE: Be My Boogie Woogie Baby [from the TV series Kick Start]
 ARTIST: Mr. Walkie Talkie
COMMENT: "First 20 seconds are nearly exact cover of
         /MUSICIANS/S/Southern_Shaun/Kikstart.sid, Tune #2" (RS)

/MUSICIANS/R/Raf/Lizak.sid
  TITLE: Lizak
 ARTIST: Jacek Skubikowski

/MUSICIANS/R/Raf/Looping_Crackmuzak.sid
COMMENT: "Music was composed by MCH, I rearranged it a bit and created
         instruments." (RS)

/MUSICIANS/R/Raf/Memories_C64_Remix.sid
  TITLE: Memories
 ARTIST: D-Tune
COMMENT: "It was a bit hard to cover it because beats and bass notes occur at
         the same time so I had to use 2 oscillators just for them (well... at
         least I thought so). Surely I could push more from SID ;-)" (RS)

/MUSICIANS/R/Raf/My_Little_Ponies.sid
  TITLE: My Little Ponies [from the Amiga MOD module]
 ARTIST: Jakob Svanholm (Radix)

/MUSICIANS/R/Raf/No_Milk_Today.sid
  TITLE: No Milk Today [from There's a Kind of Hush All Over the World]
 ARTIST: Herman's Hermits
COMMENT: In Poland Dr. Huckenbush covered this around '81-'84 with
         alternate lyrics as "Jeba³ ciê pies" (A dog fucked you).

/MUSICIANS/R/Raf/Raindrops.sid
  TITLE: Raindrops
 ARTIST: Toby Emerson
COMMENT: "Original was made with Fruityloops 3 on PC using 28 tracks,
          covers about 2 mins out of original 3:10." (RS)

/MUSICIANS/R/Raf/Raindrops_v2.sid
  TITLE: Raindrops
 ARTIST: Toby Emerson
COMMENT: "This re-remix was made exclusively for Scene World magazine, based
         on another cover I made earlier." (RS)

/MUSICIANS/R/Raf/Remix.sid
  TITLE: Noisy Pillars, Tune #3
 ARTIST: Jeroen Tel
COMMENT: "This tune is actually re-ordered example from Future Composer v2.1++"
         (RS)

/MUSICIANS/R/Raf/Sex_w_Radiu_Maryja.sid
COMMENT: "MCH fucked things up by using XM format which sounded bad just after
         converting to MOD first and under GT it was total crap - some effects
         were not easily reproductable and deadline for the party was tight.
         Finally I sent it for competition without signing that tune myself,
         leaving just MCH as author. I remember Jammer told that title is
         better than tune itself though, it was of course my idea too ;D" (RS)

/MUSICIANS/R/Raf/Test.sid
COMMENT: "My first tune in Goat Tracker. Made just to find out how the editor
         works." (RS)

/MUSICIANS/R/Raf/Zakazany_Owoc.sid
  TITLE: Zakazany Owoc
 ARTIST: Krzysztof Antkowiak

/MUSICIANS/R/Raf/xo_ingame_music.sid
  TITLE: XO [from the Impulse Tracker module]
 ARTIST: Kamil Wolnikowski (Jammer)
COMMENT: "This my own version of Jammer's tune... he made that Impulse
          Tracker module to fit XO game I wrote on PC - I wanted something
          oldskool :) . That was hard to port 16 channels into SID ;)
          Generally not too good tune (very bad instruments). Anyway this
          was my first real attempt to do SID tune! BTW the original is
          awesome." (RS)

### /MUSICIANS/R/Raf/Worktunes ###############################################

/MUSICIANS/R/Raf/Worktunes/Musica_FC2_0.sid
COMMENT: "I can't exactly remeber when was it done , probably around 1998
         (woah.. I was 12 at that time? unbelievable). As you may see I always
         wanted to make music but I always lacked talent :D . At that time
         saving a music from disk only program to tape was a great achivement
         for me especially if you consider that I didn't had any real
         documentation concerning the 64 and actually nobody who I could ask
         for help :) the tune was made on FC 2.0 ++ and recovered got from an
         old tape among various programs I wrote mostly in BASIC up to early
         1999." (RS)

/MUSICIANS/R/Raf/Worktunes/Reksio.sid
  TITLE: Title Theme [from the cartoon series Reksio]
 ARTIST: Zenon Kowalowski

/MUSICIANS/R/Randall/Unintelligible_Disco.sid
COMMENT: "Here's what the ringmod voice is supposed to say, to sing along
         with it:
         CHORUS
         pump it up, oh funk it up, pump it up.
         VERSE
         us, us and them, people dancin'.
         let's estimate our dancin'.
         it's awesome. oh it's awesome.
         I've set up all for this black sound, oh my love.
         PRE-CHORUS
         inside the disco, mama said: eat my ass. I'm off.
         inside the disco, mama said: go!"

### /MUSICIANS/R/Randall/Smalltown_Boy #######################################

  TITLE: Groovejet

COMMENT: "At last, I've done an acceptable conversion. Used in Oxyron's
         'Attitude' diskmag." (comment by Smalltown Boy)

/MUSICIANS/R/Randall/Smalltown_Boy/Captain_Nemo.sid
  TITLE: Najblizszy czas
 ARTIST: Kapitan Nemo
COMMENT: The title translates to English as "Nearest time".

/MUSICIANS/R/Randall/Smalltown_Boy/Downtown_Connection.sid
COMMENT: "Inspired by 70's disco and funk music, which I'm a big fan of.
          Makes heavy use of osc sync effect here and there (to
          emulate a vocoder, but, sadly, without success). Voted 2nd out
          of 43 in audience voting and 5th out of 42 in jury voting in
          SID Compo III." (comment by Smalltown Boy)

/MUSICIANS/R/Randall/Smalltown_Boy/Droga_do_Duplandu.sid
COMMENT: "Written on Yerzmyey's/Hooy Program request, for the C64 version of
          his slightly insane adventure game, entitled, as you may guess,
          'Droga do Duplandu'. As the game is totally crazy (learn Polish and
          check it :>), so is this tune. The beginning is a reworked
          early sidtune of mine, and all detuned sounds are intentional to
          fit the game's atmosphere." (comment by Smalltown Boy)

/MUSICIANS/R/Randall/Smalltown_Boy/Forgotten_Ground.sid
  TITLE: Forgotten Ground [from Zeitgeist]
 ARTIST: The Levellers

/MUSICIANS/R/Rock/Biggles_Remix.sid
  TITLE: Do You Want to be a Hero? [from the movie Biggles]
 ARTIST: Stanislas Syrewicz, performed by Jon Anderson
COMMENT: Covers /MUSICIANS/D/Daglish_Ben/Biggles.sid, Tune #2.
         "As you may know I have been sleeping 25 f*cking years, doing
         nothing.... :) it was just amazing to notice that the memory remains
         and especially this scene c64 still alive and actually seems to be
         boiling ! I want to thank Lemming for updating my c64 HW, and giving
         me a chance to make this happen again. So without Lemming ( and some
         beers ) this would not have never happened. Thanks Lemming!" (SS)

/MUSICIANS/R/Rock/Contest_Demo_part_3.sid
  TITLE: Hot Girl [from Sabrina] (0:00-0:30)
 ARTIST: Sabrina Salerno
COMMENT: "ok, some thing about this music. as you see, it was done by me (fcs)
         and rock..  well, how is that . let me explain !!. for quite long ago,
         rock started one piece with we-music editor. but he didn't finish it..
         A  few weeks ago I found it on rock's work disk, and I decided to
         finish it. so, all the bass melodies were done by rock, and the
         melodies by me, fcs." (FCS)

### /MUSICIANS/R/Rockin_Limited\ #############################################

### /MUSICIANS/R/Rodger_Andrew ###############################################

/MUSICIANS/R/Rodger_Andrew/
COMMENT: All Andrew's own comments indicated by (AR).

/MUSICIANS/R/Rodger_Andrew/Alien_3.sid
COMMENT: "Alien 3 was the most difficult project I worked on - but I loved
         doing it. Probe sent me an audio cassette of the Sega Genesis version
         to convert to the C64. Naturally, I was only allowed the bare minimum
         of free memory, so I had to chuck out all the effects modules in my
         music player to make room for the data (even vibrato had to go). The
         result was some rather flat sounding tunes!" (AR)

/MUSICIANS/R/Rodger_Andrew/Arnie_2.sid
(#1)
  TITLE: Terra Cresta, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Martin Galway
COMMENT: The bassline progression and the general mood of the tune are
         as in Galway's tune.
(#3)
  TITLE: Commando, Tune #3
 ARTIST: Rob Hubbard
COMMENT: The jingle ends in a different way than Hubbard's.
(#4)
  TITLE: Rambo, Tune #2
 ARTIST: Martin Galway

/MUSICIANS/R/Rodger_Andrew/Carnage.sid
(#3)
  TITLE: Led Storm, Tune #7
 ARTIST: Tim Follin

/MUSICIANS/R/Rodger_Andrew/Chickin.sid
  TITLE: The Chicken Song [from Spit in Your Ear] (2:58-3:29)
 ARTIST: Rob Grant & Doug Naylor (lyrics), Philip Pope (music).

/MUSICIANS/R/Rodger_Andrew/Ogre_Logo.sid
COMMENT: Later reused in the re-release of game "Frantic", (C) 1992 Light Disk.

/MUSICIANS/R/Rodger_Andrew/Sky_Runner.sid
COMMENT: "It's called 'Sky Runner' because at the time I loved the magazine
         advertisment artwork for the C64 game of the same name." (AR)

/MUSICIANS/R/Rodger_Andrew/Sleepwalker.sid
COMMENT: "Sleepwalker was my first commercial project, and I was nervous as
         hell - I was sure they would reject it!" (AR)

/MUSICIANS/R/Rodger_Andrew/Spyhunter.sid
  TITLE: Theme from Peter Gunn [from the TV series]
 ARTIST: Henry Mancini

/MUSICIANS/R/Rodger_Andrew/Titanic_Blinky.sid
(#18)
  TITLE: Theme from Peter Gunn [from the TV series]
 ARTIST: Henry Mancini

/MUSICIANS/R/Rowlands_Steve/Retrograde_tapeloader.sid
COMMENT: Tapeloader tune in Retrograde is slightly different from the disk
         version found in /MUSICIANS/R/Rowlands_Steve/Retrograde.sid, Tune #2.
         "The disk version was the original version of this tune. While
         mastering the game, the cassette loader would always hang at the
         "pause" in the music (the point where everything stops for a moment,
         listen for this at 1:31). They tracked this down to the pause in the
         music and thus the cassette loader uses a slightly different tune
         which doesn't stop." (Comment by Andrew Roberts)

/MUSICIANS/R/Rowlands_Steve/Scorpius.sid
COMMENT: Music and soundeffects by both Steve and John Rowlands.
         "Steve had to enter the notes in as hex, using the Action Replay's
         monitor - ahhh, the good ol' days." (Comment by John Rowlands)

### /MUSICIANS/S/SFR\ ########################################################

### /MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave #####################################################

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/
COMMENT: Jan Harries own comments are denoted (JH).
         "The 80's tunes here, are made in 1986-1988, with Soundmonitor and
         Rockmonitor 3. The 90's and 2000's tunes are made with JCH's editor,
         and SID Duzz It" (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/1st_Sphere.sid
COMMENT: "A shitty Rockmon piece I couldn't get any system into. But it has
         some cool things after all." (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/7_Minutes_from_Eternity.sid
  TITLE: Green Beret, Tune #1 (0:00-1:59)
 ARTIST: Martin Galway

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Amiga_Noid.sid
COMMENT: "From my last demo of the same name. I was tired of not being able to
         create some decent drums in Soundmon, I was tired of my C64 and
         generally this can be heard in the tune. Again I try to make some
         melody with my 'synth' violin to compensate for the lack of rhythm."
         (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Apolloguys.sid
COMMENT: "One of my personal favourites, despite the fact that I used it in an
         apology demo to Zetrex 2005. My good friends Wizz & Kaze demanded me
         to do this demo in order to stop the war. To compensate for my loss of
         face, I filled the screen with my name in sprites, dancing around so
         that you only would remember 2 things after having seen the demo: the
         music and the name RAMBONES. :) What a hoax, Kaze got his software
         from me, and me and TSN visited Wizz every weekend. There's some
         really nice filter in this one, so try a C64." (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Arkazoid.sid
  TITLE: Hiscore [from the arcade game Arkanoid - Revenge of Doh]
 ARTIST: Hisayoshi Ogura (OGR/Zuntata)

         to try. I completely forgot the characteristic drums from the
         original. Nothing more to say, the original will always be the best
         (the one by Antony Crowther) :-)" (JH)

         softwarehouse like Jeroen and Charles. I did this while learning how
         to use my Amiga." (JH)

COMMENT: "Should have been a Creeper 2, but got dark in the process" (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Deathpulse.sid
COMMENT: "It's a Martin Walker arpeggio with deep filter. You should try this
         on a real SID and feel the vibrations!" (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Digital_Dream.sid
COMMENT: "Not really a melody, just some of the COOLEST filtereffects you'd
         ever hear. Used for a short contact note. Do try this on a C64." (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Do_the_Mip.sid
COMMENT: "Ha, the joke of my life! Charles Deenen sought musicians who used
         soundmonitor and were into coding. That was me, so I sent him this
         tune, nicely wrapped in an intro. That didn't help any :) By that time
         Noisy Pillars was far over most people's heads anyway." (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Dont_Be_Late.sid
COMMENT: "For what ? Well, the Amiga had given me a 'pop' in the head. This is
         actually a song, but I can't find my text anymore.. damn.." (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Drums_at_Night.sid
COMMENT: "Just trying to see if I can make some 'real' drums... but no.." (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Duke_Doom.sid
COMMENT: "Just trying to sound mysterious" (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Electro_Lolita.sid
COMMENT: This tune won the Silesia 3 SID compo in 2009.

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Equilibrium.sid
COMMENT: "Going for a walk in the forest, and feeling good, experiencing
         nature" (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Fairytales.sid
COMMENT: "Another favourite of mine. This was my attempt to imitate some of Tim
         Follin's style. I didn't succeed at that, but I got a wild melody,
         sort of telling a story - that's why the lead is so variable. Actually
         most of my C64 music has an always developing lead, like there's
         endless things to tell." (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/First_Rockmon.sid
COMMENT: "Just like it says.. my first Rockmon tune. Now I finally had some
         decent drums, leaving a channel free for more effects. The drums plays
         exactly what I could play live on a real drumset :)" (JH)
         Bass by Kaze, rest by rambones.

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Fourteen_Beat.sid
COMMENT: "It has 14 beat, not 16. Trying to be a piano piece, but it's really
         not" (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Freeze_On.sid
COMMENT: "I really wanted to kick the shit out of the drums, but instead I
         fucked it up by getting to melodious. It get's pretty wild at the end,
         overdrive saw and strange sounds. At 3:30 there's some action." (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Global_Warming.sid
COMMENT: "Seeing the world from out of space, it's getting hotter" (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Golem_Clowns.sid
  TITLE: Entry of the Gladiators
 ARTIST: Julius Fucik

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Guitar_Flan.sid
COMMENT: "Get this over into your C64 now! :) I thought that Tim Follin's
         guitar in Led Storm was too good, and wondered how the hell he did it.
         So, after working for hours, I found some good sounds and was lucky
         with the filter. This guitar really sounds like a distorted guitar!
         and no samples." (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Hard_to_Tel.sid
COMMENT: "An experiment with 1/2/4 speed (jerky/funky). Trying to sound a bit
         like Jeroen Tel" (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Heli_Jagd.sid
COMMENT: "Was inspired by Helicopter Jagd by Martin Galway" (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Helsingborg_Uprising.sid
COMMENT: Remix of /MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Electro_Lolita.sid

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/I_Like_Choroid.sid
COMMENT: "That's exactly what I did, and I still do. He made some cool sounds,
         and of course I ripped them. I originally put Martin Galway's 'Game
         Over' drums on this tune, but I couldn't convert the sampleroutine,
         and now I don't care, course it was quite noisy anyway. :-)
         Just to remind you, try looking in your /Dunn_Jonathan/ dir - and load
         'Choroid's Back!'." (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Indian_Walk.sid
COMMENT: "My 2nd or 3rd tune. It's supposed to sound like it's called :) really
         CRAZY sounds, and I like it! It was missing for several years, because
         the disk was broken, but then I found Hagar's old disks, and he had it
         :) Uoh I like these crazy sounds. C64 preferred." (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Inner_Space.sid
(#1)
   NAME: Inner Space
(#2)
   NAME: Journey Complete
  TITLE: Delta, Tune #13
 ARTIST: Rob Hubbard

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Intrusic.sid
COMMENT: "Means: intro-music. :) Not even a melody, just some tap-dancing."
         (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Jarre_Dreams.sid
COMMENT: "Well, not much Jarre here, but that's the way it goes... This is a
         typical 'rambones' synth violin yawn yawn long melody. The (in)famous
         sound I refer to was originally ripped from MAD'69 's 'Mixable' demo
         from Scoop. I got stuck with this sound, probably because I played the
         violin for real, and I just couldn't shake it off. :) Again, I
         compensated in the demo, by splatting my name all over the screen."
         (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Last_Samurai_Suite.sid
  TITLE: The Last Samurai [from the movie]
 ARTIST: Hans Zimmer
COMMENT: Covers 3 different parts of the movie score

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Like_Galway.sid
COMMENT: "Many have tried, and tried, to imitate Martin's wonderful phasing and
         trance sounds, and we have all failed miserably. :) Anyway, this is
         one of my favourites also, It simply has a bit of atmosphere, maybe
         even a touch of Wizball (which was the general idea). This really
         needs filter! At this point, I had splatted my name all over so many
         demos, that people began to think there was a group called 'The
         rambones'... I had to write a looong scrolltext, with this music in
         the background, slaying the 'lamers'. :)" (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Lonely_Forest.sid
COMMENT: "Wanted to be mysterious" (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/MODplayer_Loader.sid
COMMENT: Made in 2009, released in 2014.

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Masagin.sid
  TITLE: <?> [from the PC demo Masagin]
 ARTIST: Leonard Ritter (Paniq of Farbrausch)
COMMENT: Only the intro is covered.

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Maybe_Its_Final.sid
COMMENT: "I was referring to the fact that my Amiga demanded more and more of
         me. So I forgot the melody... The tune sounds sad.." (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Megamipper.sid
COMMENT: "1 channel sample madness. This is a rave!" (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Mixed_Emotions.sid
COMMENT: "That's exactly what my emotions were as I used this tune in my last
         demo, on the last screen. It was the Dexion-party in 1988. I had
         released 'Apolloguys' the same day, and I had bought my Amiga 500 only
         2 weeks before coming to this party. The first screen featured 'Like
         Galway', and me writing a lot of text about who and what 'rambones'
         was. The middle screen was the 'Amiga Noid' screen, with a small
         picture of an Amiga, and a scroll telling that TST would soon rule it.
         The last one, with this music, was a 10 point list of things about the
         C64 that bored the hell out of me. Things like colorbars, sprites
         moving in sinus, Hubbard alike drums/routines, all with the same sound
         and generally everything that was in at that time. For me it was sad
         to see a large variety of composers using more or less the same
         routine, leaving the music in a grey state. I admire the sound of Fred
         Gray, Martin Galway, Rob Hubbard, David Whittaker, Ben Daglish and
         Antony Crowther, and any other programmer that built it all up from
         scratch." (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Multiple_Dreams.sid
COMMENT: "The seed had been planted. After releasing my first music-dedicated
         demo, I had so many new dreams and desires, because now I had finally
         made some music, all by myself. That's kind of the reason for the
         title of this." (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Negative.sid
COMMENT: "I don't know what to say about this... It was just made sometime, and
         never used for anything. Anyway, it has a nice theme I think..." (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Never_Man.sid
COMMENT: "Another attempt to make those pulsedrums work.. but no... :)" (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/No_Mercy_Theme.sid
  TITLE: Mission of Mercy
 ARTIST: Peter Clarke
COMMENT: "A sort of a try to remake a really great tune by Peter Clarke with
         the same name." (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Nu_er_den_sgu_helt_gal.sid
COMMENT: "I just wanted to see if I could make a special kind of music that we
         call 'suppe steg og is' here in Denmark. The kind of music you hear at
         family parties, weddings etc. I used it in a special note/greeting
         demo for my contacts, and wrote that it was a Galway tune.. :)" (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Oceanic.sid
COMMENT: "This needs filter! (C64)... As I saw that Jonathan Dunn continued to
         make music for Ocean, I thought that maybe I had a chance also, so I
         sent this tune to the company. I never got a reply. :) well, I didn't
         really care anyway because I now was using Soundtracker every day, all
         day long. My newfound inspiration: SLL .. :) After having made my
         first few Soundtracker-modules, I sent a demo with some musics and a
         picture to Hewson. They replied: your music is quite good, but we
         cannot accept you as a graphics-artist, the picture lacks all kind of
         inspiration. Arrrghh.... Their music in their games sucked bigtime
         back then...  This is the last tune that I made in 1988." (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Ode_to_Banana_V1.sid
COMMENT: "Everybody old enough knows the 'Ode To Martin' by MC/Dutch USA-Team.
         One of my good contacts, and a very musical one to was Banana/The
         Electronic Knights. He had already made more than 30 tunes when I
         first laid my hands on Soundmon. I didn't know at all how to use this
         program, but I could hear from Chris' and Banana's music that it
         definately was the way to go. So I asked Banana for some help. He sent
         me about 10 handwritten pages, how to type in this bass and use
         the program. So, it was my FIRST tune ever!" (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Ode_to_Banana_V2.sid
COMMENT: "This is much better, I'd even say good. :) The sounds are Banana's
         'Rammax' sounds. Nothing much to say. I love this tune, hope you do
         to." (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Ode_to_Laxity.sid
COMMENT: "Well, I met Laxity the first time when he visited Wizz, to code some
         demos. He was very into using Rob's routine, and slowly doing his own
         player. In a transition period he had doing this, he tried
         Soundmonitor, and, not to my surprise, of course he was much better
         than I. So, what do you do ? Of course, another 'Ode to...' :) I kinda
         like this, as did he, but there's hardly any bass in it, because I try
         (again) to make some drums.,, One more thing: the sounds were made by
         Laxity. :)" (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Offbeat_Loop.sid
COMMENT: "Never tried this style before, so it had to be tried for my SID
         Expander musicdisk" (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Only_My_Heart.sid
COMMENT: "One of my fans said this is very melodramatic. I'd have to agree.
         Didn't think of that though, when I made it." (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Rabies.sid
COMMENT: "It is the first tune that I did after 10 years (1988-1998)" (JH)

 ARTIST: Jerry Goldsmith

COMMENT: "Used in a note to my contacts, to say they should please
          not join F.A.S.T. (Federation Against The Supply Team)" (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Resolute.sid
COMMENT: "We are in the final chapter of my C64 days. I was composing / drawing
         / programming / writing, all alone on my final demo: Zound Muzak #4.
         I had just learned FLD, 8-9 months after everybody else, but at least
         I didn't just rip it. I started on several tunes at the same time, to
         try and get them all to sound as they came from one whole, like Mike
         Oldfield does. This was the first one, but I never finished ZM4, I was
         too bored after all." (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Roses_Are_Red.sid
  TITLE: Roses Are Red [from Aquarium]
 ARTIST: Aqua

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Sad_and_Bad.sid
COMMENT: "It got its name after the final save. :) A bended bass does some
         funny work, but that's about it." (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Satellite.sid
COMMENT: "Used in the first of our 2 Satellite demos, this is a genuine piece
         of early techno style. Not much melody, instead some pumping drums."
         (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Scary_Dreams.sid
COMMENT: "Nothing scary here. I think it got the name because of the
         atmosphere. Do go to a C64 with this! The main force in this tune is
         that I use all 3 voices for melody and no stupid drums. It almost
         sounds as if I designed the tune? No I didn't, almost anything just
         came out by itself." (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Shadows_in_Pain.sid
COMMENT: "The bassline was supposed to set a frame for some sixties style, but
         listen what happens later... :) No no, I think this is just a 10 min.
         worksong." (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Soft_It_Is.sid
COMMENT: "It's sort of inspired from Laxity's style in the lead" (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Sound_Shocker.sid
COMMENT: "A quite quiet and slow tune. this NEEDS filter (C64)!! The sounds and
         the quiet melody is what this is all about. I made it at a visit to
         one of my friends, trying to teach him about using Soundmon. It was
         made in about half an hour, then I had to go on to another friend.
         I was so busy, driving around on my moped, dumping demos/games, and
         then on to the next. Finally, every evening, I would end up at TSN's
         place, and our democoding-session could begin, and last until it was
         time to go to school... :)" (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Space_Alien.sid
COMMENT: "A crazy tune! Used in another WAR demo. :) First screen of 'Who Said
         War ???'. Remember ? The scroll where I slagged Laxity as hard as I
         could, even though I love him for his wonderful music." (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Spank.sid
COMMENT: "Using the 1/2/4 speed again, I wanted this to spank you! Made for the
         Sidcompo #5 by CreaMD" (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Stairways.sid
COMMENT: "Somewhere around 2000 I played this on my synth, in a quest to make
         my fingers do the right stuff. I then just typed it into the SDI
         tracker to make this SID" (JH)

  TITLE: A View to a Kill [from the movie] (0:31-0:53)

 ARTIST: Duran Duran & John Barry

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Trombones.sid
COMMENT: "Well, a typical 'rambones' tune. It has some great waves and echos,
         and one more thing: after 1:10 in comes the trombone - it sounds just
         like a real one, and no samples. A wonderful coincidence made by the
         workings of Soundmonitor. Again, the 'Mixable' sound is here." (JH)

         'Rolling' here. :) Or should I say 'Still Rolling'... Hehe, not much

         only I could have made a more variable bass... But, you learn as you
