/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Who_Said_War.sid
COMMENT: "Undefinable 'rambones' style. Heh... In this demo I totally slagged
         Kaze for being a lousy composer, because he was. Then one day, he made
         'The Force' and his 'New Limits' introtune. Sad that he put that tune
         on an empty screen, when everybody wanted to see the next, the
         unbelievable fullscreen sideborder-scroll with rasters and
         music+samples. Go to /MUSICIANS/K/Kaze/ to listen his tunes." (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/X-Iterations.sid
COMMENT: "I wanted to use this for the compo at X-2004, but it was just too
         short" (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/X-Theme_1.sid
COMMENT: "This melody comes from my Samsung E700 cellphone, named Indy" (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/X-Theme_2.sid
COMMENT: "This is a melody I came up with, after having made the framework for
         the 1st X-theme" (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Z-Force.sid
COMMENT: "I made this tune for my contact Wallie/The Z-Circle in Finland, and
         they used it in a demo. I had a habit of not saving my music that was
         used in demos, so I lost the tune already in 1988. Then one day in
         1998 when I was watching some old demos, suddenly there was my tune
         in a demo from The Z-Circle, and I instantly remembered it! (and
         ripped it) :-)" (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Zaippahload.sid
COMMENT: "The floating lead is clearly inspired from Cybernoid by Jeroen Tel.
         That track just won't ever leave me" (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Zound_Muzak_1.sid
COMMENT: "My first 'music only' dedicated demo. Banana had his IBM Music, and I
         wanted my own series. This was it. I made this in a few hours, and had
         to stop myself. I couldn't stop playing! Because I had just discovered
         the 'record' function in Soundmon. It stayed with me for the rest of
         the C64 days; I played the lead in on my brown keyboard." (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Zound_Muzak_2-Part_1.sid
COMMENT: "Another version of 'Sound Shocker'. Better with filter, much better."
         (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Zound_Muzak_2-Part_2.sid
COMMENT: "It's reverse! - was its first name. Listen and hear why. :) One of my
         favourites. At the time I made this, it was the happiest time of all.
         Playing Delta every day, for one purpose and one purpose only: the
         music! Sure we had ripped it, but it just wasn't the same, it never
         will be. Come back Rob!..." (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Zound_Muzak_3.sid
COMMENT: "Maybe my finest piece. 3 tunes in one module. 2 of them with
         Rockmonitor drums. The tunes somehow fit well together, because they
         use the same sounds. Notice I learned some more bass here. :) And
         banging those drums! The drums in the last tune were kind of snatched
         from a Matt Gray tune... hehe" (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Zound_Muzak_3_intro.sid
  TITLE: Hymn to Yezz [from the Amiga SoundTracker module]
 ARTIST: Karsten Obarski
COMMENT: "I covered one of the first MOD's that Karsten Obarski made" (JH)

/MUSICIANS/S/SIDwave/Zound_Muzak_IV.sid
COMMENT: "This is just the intro tune to a demo that was never finished. I
         stole Kaze's New Limits-bass and tried my way. Strange result I
         think..." (JH)

### /MUSICIANS/S/SLC/ ########################################################

### /MUSICIANS/S/SLC/Sidewinder ##############################################

/MUSICIANS/S/SLC/Sidewinder/
COMMENT: Tom Roger Skauen's own comments are indicated by (TRS).

/MUSICIANS/S/SLC/Sidewinder/A_Covertune.sid
  TITLE: Snik
 ARTIST: Jeroen Soede
COMMENT: The original is /MUSICIANS/S/SoedeSoft/Soede_Jeroen/Snik.sid,
         but before that, it was named Tusker_Intro.sid and placed in
         /DEMOS/UNKNOWN.
         "This was a desperate attempt of doing a cover of the Tusker_Intro
         tune, as I wanted to use it in a demo. But the version I had of it was
         bugged, and fell out of synch when looping. This isn't ANYTHING close
         to the original version, but... the reason why this one didn't get a
         name, is that I at the time didn't know where the tune came from or
         who made it." (TRS)

/MUSICIANS/S/SLC/Sidewinder/Airwolf.sid
  TITLE: Airwolf Theme [from the TV series]
 ARTIST: Sylvester Levay

/MUSICIANS/S/SLC/Sidewinder/Crazy_Labyrinth.sid
COMMENT: "These tunes were originally meant for a game I had in mind, but I
         never got any further than composing the music and I think maybe I had
         the titlescreen of the game coded ;) (whereof the ingame-tune sucks
         and Game Over-tunes and Get Ready-tunes are heavily, HEAVILY inspired
         by other tunes). This tune has never been spread, and it's if I
         remember correctly now, the last C-64 tune I ever made." (TS)
(#1)
   NAME: Ingame
(#2)
   NAME: Main-theme
(#3)
   NAME: Get Ready
(#4)
   NAME: Game Over

/MUSICIANS/S/SLC/Sidewinder/Elite_loader.sid
  TITLE: Living on Video [from Living on Video]
 ARTIST: Trans-X
COMMENT: "This is my first SID-tune ever done. It's never been released, so
         this is the first anyone ever hear of this. I must have been 12 or 13
         years while I did this. (I'm at present day 21), so it's becoming
         quite old :)  Inspired by the Elite-loadertune!" (TS)

/MUSICIANS/S/SLC/Sidewinder/Friends_Forever.sid
COMMENT: "This was infact my first ever released tune, so when Jazzcat got all
         my tunes, I was kinda surprised to find out that he chosed this one
         for 'Album of the Year'." (TRS)

/MUSICIANS/S/SLC/Sidewinder/Great_Escape.sid
  TITLE: Theme from The Great Escape [from the movie]
 ARTIST: Elmer Bernstein

/MUSICIANS/S/SLC/Sidewinder/Love_Sees_No_Color.sid
  TITLE: Living on Video [from Living on Video]
 ARTIST: Trans-X
COMMENT: "Many people may wonder why this tune is named "Love Sees No Color"
         when the tune's name infact is "Living On Video". Well, this is due to
         the fact I didn't know the tune's name... just what it sounded like,
         and TDS / Fluid told me that the name WAS "Love Sees No Color", and I
         ofcourse trusted him. Shouldn't have done that ;)" (TRS)
         There exists an alternate version of U96's Love Sees No Colour called
         Version 2 (to be found on the Maxi Single CD) which is in fact a
         cover version of Trans-X's Living On Video. Hope this solves the
         mystery (info from Stefan 'Pohli' Pohlmann).

/MUSICIANS/S/SLC/Sidewinder/Maniac_Mansion.sid
  TITLE: Maniac Mansion, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Chris Grigg & David Lawrence

/MUSICIANS/S/SLC/Sidewinder/Neverending_Story.sid
  TITLE: NeverEnding Story [from the movie The NeverEnding Story]
 ARTIST: Giorgio Moroder, performed by Limahl

/MUSICIANS/S/SLC/Sidewinder/Skilles_Johanne.sid
  TITLE: Skilles Johanne
 ARTIST: Sputnik
COMMENT: "This is a cover of a tune by a Norwegian artist called Sputnik. He is
         a truck-driver, and sings in his spare-time. And he's actually not
         singing 100% clean, and YET he's been releasing HEAPS of albums.
         Mostly bought by really old people. The title translated to English,
         would be something like "Divorcing Johanne". And not surprisingly, the
         tune is about a man who wants to get divorced ;) I do NOT listen to
         such music, the inspiration came from a techno-version of this made on
         Amiga back in 94 I think. :)" (TRS)

/MUSICIANS/S/SLC/Sidewinder/Top_Gun_Anthem.sid
  TITLE: Top Gun Anthem [from the movie]
 ARTIST: Harold Faltermeyer

 ARTIST: Tony Macaulay
COMMENT: "Cover of 70's hit song called "Ev'ry Little Move She Makes" by Tony
         Macaulay (it is better known in Finland with its Finnish title
         "Elämältä kaiken sain"). Obviously, I was trying to sound something
         like Jeroen Tel." (info from Teemu Maki (SLO))

 ARTIST: Matt Simmonds (4-Mat)

/MUSICIANS/S/Sanden_Peter/Drunken_DJ.sid
COMMENT: "This tune was made at some Defiers' meeting to irritate my
         friends in the crew. I deleted it after the meeting, as it
         was pure crap. 15 years later Jerry/Triad got hold of this
         disk and played around a little, and managed to undelete the
         file I had forgotten over the years that passed. I decided to
         release it just for fun! If it hurts your ears, don't blame
         me, blame Jerry for undeleting it in the first place! :)" (PS)
  TITLE: Funeral March [from Sonate No. 2 in B flat minor Op. 35] (0:00)

### /MUSICIANS/S/Schneider_Markus ############################################

/MUSICIANS/S/Schneider_Markus/
COMMENT: Markus Schneider composed under the alias "Diflex" in his early years
         and then later under his own name.  In addition, he also composed
         under the name "Lords of Sonics", which was a music team consisting of
         Schneider and Jens Blidon.

/MUSICIANS/S/Schneider_Markus/A_New_Temptation_tune_1.sid
COMMENT: Covers the same melody as /MUSICIANS/S/Siebold_Markus/Twice_tune_2.sid

 ARTIST: Andrew Lloyd Webber

         what the customer wanted me to do. (he was really satisfied [on] the
         whole.)" (MS)

         Sweden?) we transferred the music by a 2400 baud modem :):)" (MS)

/MUSICIANS/S/Schneider_Markus/Lethal_Zone.sid
(#8)
  TITLE: Main Title [from all the Star Wars movies]
 ARTIST: John Williams

/MUSICIANS/S/Schneider_Markus/Mad_Springs.sid
COMMENT: "A friend of mine programmed the game and he wanted a disco title
         tune. But the game's main actor had been jumping springs. Have you
         ever seen a jumping spring at a disco ? So I composed a tune where
         everybody could imagine something about springs by listening to the
         music with closed eyes. [Two] days before release date of his game I
         gave him the tunes and he was really angry. But there was no other
         [option so he had to accept] my music, he he he !! I think he's still
         angry about that." (MS)

/MUSICIANS/S/Schneider_Markus/Magic_Demo_Designer_tune_0.sid
COMMENT: Within the original program, this tune falls out of sync at 5:24 due
         to missing music data. This SID has that gap filled with silence.

COMMENT: "This music is normally unplugged and in beta [release]. Only 3 people
         should have this piece, interesting how spreading still works. The
         game was never released by Starbyte, I think. If so, I would still get
         money from them.. (he,he, perhaps some percent of Moorhuhn Sales !)
         This tune lives from FX I tried out a couple of weeks and the final
         version had been really really cool." (MS)

         CP Verlag.  All copies of the game had a bug in the tune so it did not
         loop correctly but this is rectified in the SID. Same as
         /MUSICIANS/S/Schutten_Martijn/Puzzle_Mania.sid, Tune #3.

         Same as /MUSICIANS/S/Shogoon/Twilight_of_the_Gods_part_4.sid
(#13)
   NAME: Final Music

### /MUSICIANS/S/Shroom ######################################################

/MUSICIANS/S/Shroom/
COMMENT: PSW stands for Pseudo-Sound Works. Shroom's own comments (taken from
         the sleeve notes of PSW's CD album "My 64") are denoted (Shroom).

/MUSICIANS/S/Shroom/Coptun.sid
COMMENT: "This song was written for some sort of co-op demo effort, but wasn't
         used as the other people bailed out. We may have released it for some
         other purpose, but we really don't know where." (Shroom)

/MUSICIANS/S/Shroom/Funky.sid
COMMENT: "This song ended up being used in PSW's 4k demo effort, entitled
         'Forky'." (Shroom)

/MUSICIANS/S/Shroom/Hey_Sister.sid
COMMENT: "Music/programming: Darren. A bit of bass-line programming: Robin.
         This song was actually a C64 version of a song that Darren wrote,
         that North & the Sea (a Christian rock band consisting of Darren
         Foulds, Douglas Anderson and Robin Harbron) performed live and also
         included on 'New Material Only'. [...] This C64 version of 'Hey
         Sister' was featured in PSW's debut demo 'Wevealed', which was
         released in mid-1996." (Shroom)

/MUSICIANS/S/Shroom/Spin.sid
COMMENT: "Music/programming: Darren; A bit of bass-line programming: Robin.
         This song has the same story as 'Hey Sister'. It was featured in
         PSW's second demo, also named 'Spin', which was released in early
         1997." (Shroom)

/MUSICIANS/S/Shroom/Test_Pattern.sid
COMMENT: "This song was featured on PSW's third demo, of the same name, which
         was released just a month after 'Spin'. Some people loved this tune,
         some hated it. It's still pretty much Robin's favorite." (Shroom)

/MUSICIANS/S/Shroom/Video.sid
  TITLE: Video Killed The Radio Star [from The Age of Plastic]
 ARTIST: Trevor Horn and Geoffrey Downes, first performed by Bruce Wooley.
COMMENT: Made famous by the remake by The Buggles.

 ARTIST: The Love Commitee

  TITLE: Gwiazdozbior smoka
 ARTIST: Varius Manx

COMMENT: This tune won the Forever 7 music competition.

/MUSICIANS/S/Sidder/Frog_Magic_Woods.sid
  TITLE: Magic Wood Level [from the Amiga game Superfrog]
 ARTIST: Allister Brimble

/MUSICIANS/S/Sidder/Half_Year_Without_Your_Music.sid
COMMENT: "As we were not in the mood for composing anything serious during
         our meeting in December 2003, Sidder had the idea to come up with a
         parody of Murdock's style. It took last place in the Forever 2004
         music compo and I have to say it was quite disappointing - either we
         failed to recreate the style correctly or it's not as attractive as
         we thought :)" (comment by Smalltown Boy)

/MUSICIANS/S/Sidder/Isnt_It_Simple.sid
COMMENT: "I was sort of inspired by Joachim Wijnhoven's music
          for the game 'Forester' at the time of writing this tune. It placed
          4th out of 19 in Forever 2003 music compo." (MR)

/MUSICIANS/S/Sidder/Mr_Pivo.sid
COMMENT: Based on /MUSICIANS/W/Whittaker_David/Mr_Wino.sid, hence the title.
         ("wino"="wine", "pivo"="beer" in Polish.)

/MUSICIANS/S/Sidder/POKEY_wcale_nie_falszuje.sid
  TITLE: Zybex, Tune #1 (0:00-0:23)
 ARTIST: Adam Gilmore
  TITLE: Neunundneunzig (99) Luftballons (0:42-0:52)
 ARTIST: Nena
COMMENT: Roughly translates from Polish as: "POKEY isn't out-of-tune at all",
         referring to the sound chip of the Atari 8-bit computers.

/MUSICIANS/S/Sidder/Srazzler.sid
COMMENT: "The tune is strongly inspired by
         /MUSICIANS/M/Mitch_and_Dane/Dazzler.sid" (MR)

  TITLE: Induljon a banzáj! [from "Induljon a banzáj!"]
 ARTIST: Bonanza Banzai

/MUSICIANS/S/Simon_Laszlo/Big_in_Japan.sid
  TITLE: Big in Japan [from Forever Young]
 ARTIST: Alphaville

/MUSICIANS/S/Simon_Laszlo/Brutal_Child.sid
COMMENT: This SID was made famous by the Nagyon Fatál Error demo. It is a
         mixture of Hungarian and English and is a play on words. "Nagyon"
         means "very" or "very much", while "fatál" (with an accent) means
         "wooden plate" in Hungarian.
  TITLE: Magyar Népmesék (0:00)
 ARTIST: Kaláka
COMMENT: Covers the title theme of a Hungarian animated series which featured
         well-known Hungarian folk tales and was aimed at children. The title
         means "Hungarian Folk Tales". The title theme itself might be based on
         a Hungarian folk song.
  TITLE: Boci, boci tarka (1:13)
 ARTIST: Traditional
COMMENT: A children's song well-known in Hungary.

/MUSICIANS/S/Simon_Laszlo/Brutal_Knight.sid
  TITLE: Knight Rider Theme [from the TV series]
 ARTIST: Glen A. Larson & Stu Phillips

/MUSICIANS/S/Simon_Laszlo/Children.sid
  TITLE: Children (Dream Version) [from Dreamland]
 ARTIST: Robert Miles

/MUSICIANS/S/Simon_Laszlo/Classic.sid
  TITLE: Eine Kleine Nachtmusik
 ARTIST: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart

/MUSICIANS/S/Simon_Laszlo/Cosmos_2.sid
  TITLE: Cosmos [from ...and the beat goes on!]
 ARTIST: Scooter

 ARTIST: <?>
COMMENT: In the 80's this theme and a corresponding stop-motion animation
         preceeded every children's cartoon shown in Hungary at night
         (thus the title "Esti mese", or "a tale for the night").

### /MUSICIANS/S/Smart_Monkey ################################################

/MUSICIANS/S/Smart_Monkey/
COMMENT: "All these tunes were written in 1990 for my design group by a
         friend called Arkadiusz 'Smart Monkey' Zych. They leaked from another
         friend of mine, Pawel 'Polonus' Soltysinski, who received them from
         me in 1991. Polonus was a member of Padua at the time. Neither me nor
         Arkadiusz was informed about them being used in C64 productions.
         Some of those compositions - orginally written for SID - were later
         used by Arkadiusz in his commercial, non-computer related ventures"
         (Silver Dream !)

### /MUSICIANS/S/SoedeSoft/ ##################################################

/MUSICIANS/S/SoedeSoft/
COMMENT: SoedeSoft was Jeroen Soede and Michiel Soede. Comments by Michiel
         Soede are marked (MS).

/MUSICIANS/S/SoedeSoft/Battlestar_Galactica.sid
  TITLE: Battlestar Galactica [from the TV series]
 ARTIST: Stu Phillips & Glen A. Larson
COMMENT: "Another TV-series we liked. There was a game with the same tune, but
         it sounded so bad, that we made another version." (MS)

/MUSICIANS/S/SoedeSoft/Ghostbusters_Tune.sid
  TITLE: Ghostbusters [from the movie]
 ARTIST: Ray Parker, Jr.
COMMENT: "Just a cover from the movie tune. One of the first tunes we made with
         our editor. I think it was used in some demo or so." (MS)

/MUSICIANS/S/SoedeSoft/JT_Intro_Clone.sid
  TITLE: Theme From S-Express [from Original Soundtrack]
 ARTIST: S'Express, written by Mark Moore and Pascal Gabriel
COMMENT: "An exact copy of a JT intro tune (just to show that our music routine
         could imitate every other routine...)." (MS)
         See /MUSICIANS/T/Tel_Jeroen/S-Express.sid for more comments.

/MUSICIANS/S/SoedeSoft/TrailMix.sid
COMMENT: "A mix of various C64 tunes, used in one of our most famous demos."
         (MS)
  TITLE: Quedex, Tune #1 (0:30)
 ARTIST: Matt Gray
  TITLE: Koyaanisqatsi [from the movie] (1:05)
 ARTIST: Philip Glass
COMMENT: Covers Rob Hubbard's C64 version in
         /MUSICIANS/H/Hubbard_Rob/Delta.sid, Tune #12.
  TITLE: Magical Sound Shower [from the arcade game Out Run] (1:20)
 ARTIST: Hiroshi Miyauchi (Hiro/SEGA Sound Team)
COMMENT: Also covered by Jason C. Brooke in "Out Run".
  TITLE: Star Paws, Tune #1 (1:51)
 ARTIST: Rob Hubbard
  TITLE: Forever Tonight [from Escape from Television] (2:05)
 ARTIST: Jan Hammer
  TITLE: Magic Drums (2:39)
 ARTIST: Michiel Soede
  TITLE: The Last Ninja - The Wastelands (3:02)
 ARTIST: Ben Daglish & Anthony Lees
  TITLE: Defender of the Crown (3:17)
 ARTIST: Jim Cuomo
  TITLE: Knucklebusters, Tune #1 (3:39)
 ARTIST: Rob Hubbard
  TITLE: Cybernoid, Tune #1 (4:11)

  TITLE: NeverEnding Story [from the movie The NeverEnding Story] (4:42)

 ARTIST: Rob Hubbard

### /MUSICIANS/S/SoedeSoft/Soede_Jeroen ######################################

COMMENT: Comments by Michiel Soede are marked (MS).

/MUSICIANS/S/SoedeSoft/Soede_Jeroen/7_Runes.sid
COMMENT: "This tune was created for an adventure game called '7 runes', which a
         friend of us was making. Unfortunately the game was never finished."
         (MS)

/MUSICIANS/S/SoedeSoft/Soede_Jeroen/Airwolf_Title.sid
  TITLE: Airwolf Theme [from the TV series]
 ARTIST: Sylvester Levay
COMMENT: "We loved the TV-series 'Airwolf', so this was the first 'c64 cover'
         we made of the title tune. It was used as intro tune for the 'trailmix
         demo'." (MS)

COMMENT: "Music for the game 'Artax' which was spread by the german disk
         magazine 'Magic Disk'. I think it was the first music we actually
         sold." (MS)

COMMENT: "Just a great tune, not used anywhere, I think." (MS)

### /MUSICIANS/S/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben ####################################

/MUSICIANS/S/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/
COMMENT: All comments by Ben Hayes are marked with (BH).

/MUSICIANS/S/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/3_Track_E_P.sid
(#1)
  TITLE: Magical Sound Shower [from the arcade game Out Run]
 ARTIST: Hiroshi Miyauchi (Hiro/SEGA Sound Team)
(#2)
  TITLE: Airwolf Theme [from the TV series]
 ARTIST: Sylvester Levay
(#3)
   NAME: On The Way

/MUSICIANS/S/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Acid_Stomach.sid
COMMENT: "Called 'Acid Stomach' because the sound at the every fourth bar
         sounds a bit like someone vomiting... well, that's what I thought,
         anyway. Again, not exactly what you'd call 'a nice tune' but I was
         just seeing what you could do with a few basic sequences by mixing and
         transposing them. At the time I didn't really like 'acid' music, I was
         more likely to listen to John Cage or Pierre Henry, so I wasn't really
         sure how to write it. SoedeSoft editor again. Horrible drums again,
         the snare being a bit like the one in Thalamusic." (BH)

/MUSICIANS/S/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Aggro_Mix.sid
  TITLE: Never Let Me Down Again (Aggro Mix) [from Music for the Masses]
 ARTIST: Depeche Mode

/MUSICIANS/S/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Bass_Drummed_Out_and_Filter_Frantic.sid
   NAME: Bass Drummed Out and Filter Frantic
COMMENT: "Just another meaningless bit of computer composition - trying out
         different drum and bassline effects, reall, but it's got a bit of
         kick to it. System 6581 editor." (BH)

/MUSICIANS/S/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Behind_the_Wheel.sid
  TITLE: Behind the Wheel [from Music for the Masses]
 ARTIST: Depeche Mode

/MUSICIANS/S/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Bogey_Boogie.sid
COMMENT: "Written at the same time as the Acid... tunes, but used in something
         else. (Quantum Designs' "Music Bars" demo) Again, just an experiment
         in sound, rather than a tune as such. SoedeSoft editor." (BH)

/MUSICIANS/S/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Dig_This.sid
  TITLE: Wild Thing
 ARTIST: Tone Loc

/MUSICIANS/S/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Feedback_Experiment.sid
COMMENT: "This tune does exactly what it says on the box, basically trying to
         get a ring-mod effect that sounded like an electric guitar being left
         leaning on a Marshall amplifier turned up to 11. I was fairly pleased
         with the result, it sounds quite uncomfortable on headphones. The tune
         was written on a SoedeSoft editor, which explains the rather fuzzy
         triggering and messy drum sounds, but gliding and filter control was
         much more versatile than anything else around at the time, I felt, and
         you could sustain notes for about 5 hours. The tune was not written
         especially for the "Acid At The PC Show" demo, having being composed
         around 8 weeks earlier, but Shane (coder) wanted to use them." (BH)

/MUSICIANS/S/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Fly_by_Night.sid
  TITLE: Fly By Night
 ARTIST: Paul Hardcastle
COMMENT: "Oh dear! Let's face it, Neil Baldwin did the best C64 version of this
         ever, and it was foolish to try and emulate it... This was done on
         SoedeSoft (I think) at 5am on the Sunday morning of the 1989 PC Show
         in London (hence the demo title). Has a long ending after a drum solo
         that John Bonham would probably laugh at. I also did a version of this
         tune in Ubiks Music in 1988, which was even worse. I hope that's never
         found!" (BH)

/MUSICIANS/S/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Fly_by_Night_Ubiks_Musik.sid
  TITLE: Fly By Night
 ARTIST: Paul Hardcastle

/MUSICIANS/S/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Galway_Remix.sid
  TITLE: Ocean Loader 1
 ARTIST: Martin Galway
COMMENT: "Just done to test out the System 6581 editor, which I'd just got -
         and this is one of my very favourite C64 tunes ever. It was never
         meant to be released but we ended up sticking in on an SG demo disk
         anyway. Note that one of the arpeggios is a bit wonky, and I couldn't
         be bothered to do the start of the piece, but I felt that it was a
         pretty good sound-a-like." (BH)

/MUSICIANS/S/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Greed_Monster.sid
COMMENT: "Another day, another pointless budget game. Yogi Bear deserved
         better! I can't remember if I composed the tune or if it was a
         conversion of some Atari ST music, written by some bloke who's name I
         can't remember. We used to do a few conversions back then. These were
         great fun to do. The software company would sent Gerard Gourley a copy
         of the original music, usually recorded on a cassette recorder sitting
         by the TV. He'd then play the tune down the telephone to me, and I'd
         record it on another cassette from the telephone's earpiece. The
         resulting hi-fidelity master recording would then be my basis. I
         usually had to guess at the basslines, as they'd become totally
         inaudible on the tape. Then I'd U-U the result back to Gerard within 2
         hours, and if I was lucky I'd get £100 about 6 months later after the
         'middle man' had taken his bit. Or half that if the tune was for
         Ocean." (BH)

/MUSICIANS/S/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/I_Beg_Your_Pardon.sid
  TITLE: I Beg Your Pardon
 ARTIST: Kon Kan

/MUSICIANS/S/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Its_All_About_part_3.sid
  TITLE: Tune 18
 ARTIST: Jouni Ikonen (Mixer)
COMMENT: Edit of /MUSICIANS/M/Mixer/Tune_18.sid with lowered pitch.

/MUSICIANS/S/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Just_Cant_Get_Enough.sid
  TITLE: Just Can't Get Enough [from Speak & Spell]
 ARTIST: Depeche Mode

/MUSICIANS/S/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Mothers_Theme.sid
COMMENT: "Used on SG demo disk and for a Mothers of Invention intro, hence the
         title. 6581 editor. Not a bad tune, I was more pleased with this than
         most of my others. The chords should have been a bit quieter, really."
         (BH)

/MUSICIANS/S/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Nah_Matt_Gray_Doesnt_Work_for_Us.sid
   NAME: Nah, Matt Gray Doesn't Work For Us
COMMENT: "Spot the obvious influences here!! 6581 editor, probably took an hour
         (if that)." (BH)

/MUSICIANS/S/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Pardon.sid
  TITLE: I Beg Your Pardon
 ARTIST: Kon Kan

/MUSICIANS/S/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Platoon_Tune.sid
  TITLE: Platoon, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Jonathan Dunn

/MUSICIANS/S/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Prison_Riot.sid
COMMENT: "Composed for another dodgy budget game, in the old SG editor I think,
         which was written by Andy Lumley. I probably had about 12 hours notice
         to write this... Zzap reviewed it and called it siren 'music', so they
         can't have listened to more than about 10 seconds of it. I quite liked
         it at the time, but more for the effects than the rather scrappy lead
         lines. Tune #4 was totally different in style, for the hiscore table.
         The main tune seems to be bugged near the end - this must have
         happened when the file was inserted into the game, it was OK when it
         left me. To be honest, music for this sort of game was an afterthought
         - and for the money I was getting, I wasn't about to try and write an
         epic!" (BH)
(#1)
COMMENT: This tune falls out of synch at around 4:28. However, the game does
         this also due to a bug in the programmers' code as Ben mentions.

/MUSICIANS/S/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Ruff_and_Reddy.sid
COMMENT: "Er, see the entry for The Greed Monster, it all applies in this case
         as well! Horribly cutesy tune." (BH)

/MUSICIANS/S/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Shake_the_Disease.sid
  TITLE: Shake the Disease [from The Singles 81->85]
 ARTIST: Depeche Mode

/MUSICIANS/S/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Step_On.sid
  TITLE: He's Gonna Step On You Again
 ARTIST: John Kongos
COMMENT: Samples from Happy Mondays' 1990 cover of this song.
         "Step On by Happy Mondays, sampled with a SFX sampler. Quite a long
         mix, this, the looping being fairly accurate. The song was a big hit
         in 1990 at the height of the Madchester/Baggy craze. I got sick of
         it pretty soon, though, after hearing it at every indie disco I went
         to at the time." (BH)

/MUSICIANS/S/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/SuperTed-The_Search_for_Spot.sid
(#1)
COMMENT: "The theme tune to the Super Ted cartoon series, which is Welsh, just
         like me! The tune lasted 20 seconds in original form, so I looped it a
         bit. Some rather primitive sound effects too. Blimey, I've got a
         really impressive body of work, eh? No wonder I never made it as a pop
         star. I mean, Super Ted, for f**k's sake... System 6581 editor, I
         think." (BH)

/MUSICIANS/S/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Test_Thingy.sid
  TITLE: Crosswords
 ARTIST: Thomas Egeskov Petersen (Laxity)
COMMENT: Ben just added digis to Laxity's song, using his own digiroutine for
         the first time.

/MUSICIANS/S/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Told_You_So.sid
  TITLE: Told You So [from Construction Time Again]
 ARTIST: Depeche Mode

/MUSICIANS/S/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Train_Music.sid
  TITLE: Lord Belborough's Song [from the children's TV series Chigley]
 ARTIST: Gordon Murray and Freddie Phillips

/MUSICIANS/S/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Up_to_Date.sid
  TITLE: Up To Date [from the TV series Man About The House]
 ARTIST: John Hawksworth

/MUSICIANS/S/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Wizkid_Music.sid
  TITLE: wiz8 [from the Amiga game Wizkid]
 ARTIST: Richard Joseph

/MUSICIANS/S/Sonic_Graffiti/Hayes_Ben/Wombles.sid
  TITLE: Wombling Free [from the TV series The Wombles]
 ARTIST: Mike Batt
COMMENT: "Woo, top tune! The first thing I did for SG. I'm a bit of a Wombles
         fan, so I could do the tune from memory - although the ending is
         wrong, but I didn't have a copy of the original song to check. I still
         like this one, actually! Written in the old SG editor." (BH)

### /MUSICIANS/S/SounDemoN ###################################################

/MUSICIANS/S/SounDemoN/Arkanoid.sid
  TITLE: Hiscore [from the arcade game Arkanoid - Revenge of Doh]
 ARTIST: Hisayoshi Ogura (OGR/Zuntata)

/MUSICIANS/S/SounDemoN/Bojojoing.sid
(#1)
COMMENT: "Some people claim that everything imaginable has been done on the C64.
         This is true to a certain extent. The typical scenario is indeed that
         you come up with something new just to find out that someone else has
         done it 10 years ago... But sometimes strange things happen and even
         lamers like myself stumble on new stuff. This happened when we were
         working on our 4k intro Pico! for Breakpoint this year. I was coding
         the music player and tried to create some drum sounds when I
         accidentally got some harsh, very distorted sounds. The funny thing
         was that I was using the noise waveform and got something that sounded
         like a synthesized electric guitar!" (SounDemoN)

/MUSICIANS/S/SounDemoN/Church_of_64.sid

### /MUSICIANS/S/String ######################################################

COMMENT: Won first place at the YALP Party in 1997, four years after the song
         was composed.

/MUSICIANS/S/String/Dr_E_Sick.sid
COMMENT: Dedicated to Dr.Kadzija, the coder in String's group. Made while
         Dr.Kadzija was ill.

/MUSICIANS/S/String/Hit_Song.sid
  TITLE: Turn It Up [from the movie Who's That Girl]
 ARTIST: Michael Davidson
COMMENT: Cover of an old Amiga MOD. See /MUSICIANS/J/JCH/Hitsong.sid which
         covers the same music.

  TITLE: Blue Monday
 ARTIST: New Order

/MUSICIANS/S/String/Kling.sid
COMMENT: Dedicated to the band String was in (playing the guitar).

/MUSICIANS/S/String/Kling_Remix.sid
COMMENT: A remix of Kling.sid

/MUSICIANS/S/String/Mini_Mix.sid
  TITLE: Malbrouk s'en va-t-en guerre (0:00)
 ARTIST: Traditional
COMMENT: An Arab tune that was brought to Europe during the crusades and
         became popular during the french revolution, ever sinced spawned
         many songs, including "For He's a Jolly Good Fellow".
  TITLE: One Horse Open Sleigh (1:03)
 ARTIST: James Lord Pierpont

/MUSICIANS/S/String/Po_sumama.sid
  TITLE: Po sumama i gorama
 ARTIST: <?>
COMMENT: Arrangement of a Yugoslavian partisan song from the World War 2.

/MUSICIANS/S/String/Prva_kraj.sid
COMMENT: First tune String made in Music Assembler.

/MUSICIANS/S/String/Prva_muzika.sid
COMMENT: The first tune made by String.

/MUSICIANS/S/String/Ratujem_sam.sid
  TITLE: Ja ratujem sam
 ARTIST: Riblja corba
COMMENT: Cover of a song from a very famous Serbian rock-band.
         "Riblja corba" translates as "Fish Dish".

/MUSICIANS/S/String/Sveti_Sava.sid
  TITLE: Himna Svetom Savi
 ARTIST: <?>
COMMENT: Cover of a Serbian church hymn.

COMMENT: Made for the disc-mag "Propaganda".

  TITLE: Verujem - ne verujem

COMMENT: Cover of a song from a Serbian rock-band.

         original comes straight in like that as well." (JK)

COMMENT: "This one does exactly what it says on the tin; a port (surprise!)
         of a Protracker rendition of the theme into Future Composer 2.1 but
         not completed (the sounds and drum routine haven't been replaced to
         give it a more distinctive sound as with cover of Star)" (JK)

 ARTIST: Chris Hülsbeck
COMMENT: This covers a famous tune from Turrican II. It's based on an XM module
         made by me. I used a program written by me to extract the note
         information from the module in a convenient format. Finally, I linked
         this data to my music routine." (Comment by TSM)

  TITLE: Vieni Avanti, Cretino! [from the movie]
 ARTIST: Fabio Frizzi
COMMENT: Literally means "Come ahead, you cretin!", and it's one of the most
         hilarious movies performed by Italian actor Lino Banfi.

/MUSICIANS/T/TSM/Willow.sid
COMMENT: "This covers an ancient medieval music. It's based on a midi file I
         found somewhere. The midi file was converted to XM, then I used a
         program written by me to extract the note information from the module
         in a convenient format. Finally, I linked this data to my music
         routine." (Comment by TSM)

### /MUSICIANS/T/Tait_Mark ###################################################

/MUSICIANS/T/Tait_Mark/
COMMENT: Comments by Mark Tait himself are denoted (MT).

/MUSICIANS/T/Tait_Mark/1943.sid
COMMENT: "1943 was the first commercial game I wrote the music for, and was
         responsible for me being offered the job at Tiertex. The people who
         wrote 1943 were John Prince and Donald ?????? (sorry can't remember
         his last name). They partnered up and started Tiertex in 1987/8, and
         offered me the job as musician. There were only 5 of us in the company
         at that time, and we were writing only for Capcom/US Gold, working
         mainly on arcade conversions." (MT)
(#1)
  TITLE: Hiscore [from the arcade game 1943 - The Battle of Midway]
 ARTIST: Kumi Yamaga (Jungle Kumi)
(#3)
  TITLE: Main Theme [from the arcade game 1943 - The Battle of Midway]
 ARTIST: Kumi Yamaga (Jungle Kumi)

/MUSICIANS/T/Tait_Mark/Better_Dead_Than_Alien.sid
(#1)
  TITLE: Na Na Hey Hey Kiss Him Goodbye (remix)
 ARTIST: Steam
COMMENT: It is not a straight remix, but it's based on it.
(#5)
  TITLE: Battlestar Galactica [from the TV series]
 ARTIST: Glen A. Larson & Stu Phillips

/MUSICIANS/T/Tait_Mark/Black_Tiger.sid
(#1)
  TITLE: Shop [from the arcade game Black Tiger]
 ARTIST: Tamayo Kawamoto
(#2)
  TITLE: Black Tiger [from the arcade game]
 ARTIST: Tamayo Kawamoto
(#3)
  TITLE: Main Theme [from the arcade game Black Tiger]
 ARTIST: Tamayo Kawamoto

/MUSICIANS/T/Tait_Mark/Call_Me_Psycho.sid
COMMENT: Also used in the demo "Billy Bubbles II".

/MUSICIANS/T/Tait_Mark/Dynasty_Wars.sid
COMMENT: Does not cover the arcade version.

/MUSICIANS/T/Tait_Mark/G_U_M_B_O.sid
COMMENT: Same melody as /MUSICIANS/T/Tait_Mark/Music_Demo_7.sid, Tune #2

/MUSICIANS/T/Tait_Mark/Human_Killing_Machine.sid
(#1)
  TITLE: Comic Bakery, Tune #1
 ARTIST: Martin Galway
COMMENT: The whole music shows a big resemblance to this tune, especially the
         bassline and the arpeggios.
         "I will freely admit to Rob Hubbard and Martin Galway being my biggest
         influences of the time (as far as computer games were concerned), and
         I will not deny at all that their music had a certain influence on me.
         I truly wish however, that no-one thinks that I was ever copying them.
         If any of their sounds or productions in general rubbed off on me, I
         can only hope that they thought of me as a fan, and not as a
         plagarist." (MT)
(#3)
COMMENT: Almost the same as /MUSICIANS/T/Tait_Mark/Music_Demo_7.sid, Tune #3.

/MUSICIANS/T/Tait_Mark/Last_Crusade.sid
COMMENT: "... for the Last Crusade we got the original John Williams
         handwritten score of the main theme from the film. That's what I
         worked from to produce the music for the games (C64 and pc, Amiga, ST
         etc etc etc). [...] I was quite proud of that, if no one else was."
         (MT)
(#1)
  TITLE: The Raiders March [from all the Indiana Jones movies]
 ARTIST: John Williams
(#2)
  TITLE: The Raiders March [from all the Indiana Jones movies]
 ARTIST: John Williams
COMMENT: Short jingle based on the original theme.
(#3)
  TITLE: The Raiders March [from all the Indiana Jones movies]
 ARTIST: John Williams
COMMENT: Short jingle based on the original theme.

/MUSICIANS/T/Tait_Mark/Mix-e-concert.sid
COMMENT: The original demo has a selector where you can change drums,
         bass, and lead voices. Each has four variations, making
         4*4*4=64 possible combinations.

/MUSICIANS/T/Tait_Mark/Music_Demo_7.sid
COMMENT: Later used in the game "Galaxia 7", (C) 1988 The Power House.
         "I cannot remember giving my permission for it to be used in a
         computer game. It was a Compunet demo I uploaded in about 1986/7 which
         I can only assume was ripped [...] but I did not receive any payment
         from any sales of it." (MT)
(#2)
COMMENT: Same melody as /MUSICIANS/T/Tait_Mark/G_U_M_B_O.sid

/MUSICIANS/T/Tait_Mark/Protector.sid
  TITLE: 1943, Tune #4
 ARTIST: Mark Tait
COMMENT: "I do remember the music, just not the permission to use it in a
         game." (MT)

/MUSICIANS/T/Tait_Mark/Spacebike.sid
COMMENT: "I do remember the music, just not the permission to use it in a
         game." (MT)
  TITLE: Trumpet
 ARTIST: Mark Tait

/MUSICIANS/T/Tait_Mark/Strider.sid
COMMENT: The same music was used in the sequel, Strider II. Based on the
         arcade version by Junko Tamitani.
         "I left before Strider II was even ever mentioned (I'm sure howere it
         was given the 'inhouse name of ' TOR, although I honestly cannot
         remember what TOR stood for (although I do remeber proucing a killer
         of a soundtrack which was recorded on an Akai X7000,and was, even by
         my standards, probably the best soundtrack thet was ever produced from
         Tiertex TOR is machine)." (MT)

/MUSICIANS/T/Tait_Mark/Superman.sid
  TITLE: Superman Title Theme [from the movie]
 ARTIST: John Williams

/MUSICIANS/T/Tait_Mark/Thunder_Blade.sid
COMMENT: "Thunder Blades music was produced over night. It was decided that a
         demo of a level would be appearing on the cover of Zzap! 64. The
         actual C64 game was not written by Tiertex (although the other
         versions were), it was a guy called Chris someone. As I remember, he
         credited everyone but me!" (MT) (Chris someone = Chris Butler)

/MUSICIANS/T/Taylor_Stuart/September-The_Computer_Game.sid
(#1)
  TITLE: Final Synth Sample II, Tune #5
 ARTIST: Rob Hubbard
COMMENT: Somewhat inspired.

/MUSICIANS/T/Taylor_Stuart/Sky_Runner.sid
COMMENT: "I had been commissioned by Orpheus Software (ironically the makers of
         Electrosound) to code the music for their game Sky Runner. They sent
         me a work-in-progress version of the game along with a
         sort-of-completed Electrosound composition. They wanted me to
         transpose this to a non-Electrosound version and make it my own - what
         you hear on here is the end result. Unfortunately the MD of Orpheus at
         the time was a complete nightmare to work with - I was young and naive
         at the time but this was my first experience, commercially, of trying
         to get money out of someone. He just wouldn't pay - kept saying cheque
         would be in the post, give it another week or so etc etc....looking at
         Sky Runner for the first time ever (on here) it looks like the
         programmer's deal with Orpheus went pretty sour as well. I see the
         game was published by another software house (Cascade?) and the music
         had gone back to it's original Electrosound composition - obviously I
         had no dealings with Cascade - they probably didn't even know about my
         arrangement!!.... About 1 year later, under new management, Orpheus
         approached me again asking me to do some more music. OK, I said,
         firstly you pay me for Sky Runner and secondly I want the money for
         the new music (I think it was an adaption of some board game involving
         moving buses around London???) up front - they obliged so there was a
         happy ending to this story." (ST)

/MUSICIANS/T/Taylor_Stuart/Stand_by_Me.sid
  TITLE: Stand by Me [from Don't Play That Song!]
 ARTIST: Ben E. King (written by Ben E. King, Jerry Leiber, Mike Stoller)

/MUSICIANS/T/Taylor_Stuart/Thriller.sid
  TITLE: Thriller [from Thriller]
 ARTIST: Michael Jackson

/MUSICIANS/T/Taylor_Stuart/Toccata.sid
  TITLE: Toccata [from Toccata and Fugue in D Minor (BWV 565)]
 ARTIST: Johann Sebastian Bach

/MUSICIANS/T/Taylor_Stuart/Toyota_Sony_Chop.sid
COMMENT: "a version (of Toyota Sony Chop) with my own music routine" (ST)

/MUSICIANS/T/Taylor_Stuart/Toyota_Sony_Chop_V2.sid
COMMENT: "Initially written in good old Electrosound again, The Wolverines
         were keen to get this in their demo ASAP - again it was borderline me
         finishing my music routine and getting Toyota...done via any means.
         Once done (in Electrosound) they wanted it in their demo. Meanwhile I
         rearranged it with my own code.... what you hear on the demo and the
         stand alone "Toyota Sony Chop" file is the Electrosound version." (ST)

/MUSICIANS/T/Taylor_Stuart/Walk_of_Life.sid

 ARTIST: Dire Straits

/MUSICIANS/T/Tel_Jeroen/Bad_Blood.sid
(#2)
  TITLE: Vallåt
 ARTIST: <?>
COMMENT: The tune might be inspired by this piece.
         Q: Is this a cover?
         JT: NO! Worldshocking huh? I could actually compose music in the
         classical traditional sence :) It's all COMPOSED by me. More people
         seemed to be wondering if I *really composed Bad Blood*. The answer is
         yes with a capital Y.
         Charles Deenen said it was the "best music I made on C64" when I
         finished it. (I do NOT agree ofcourse, although I must say it's the
         best "filmscore" soundtrack I've done for a game on the C64. I
         actually got some kind of filmscript for it, that's why I could be
         very specific when composing themes for characters and events in the
         game.

/MUSICIANS/T/Tel_Jeroen/JT_42.sid
  TITLE: Running in the Family [from Running in the Family]
 ARTIST: Level 42
COMMENT: Not a plain cover, it's a remix. "The lead sounds a lot like
         Bjerregaard's 'Shape'." (Comment by DRAX.)

/MUSICIANS/T/Tel_Jeroen/JT_in_Robs.sid
COMMENT: Made in 1987, released in 2006.

/MUSICIANS/T/Tel_Jeroen/KOUD_HE.sid
COMMENT: This tune was the original prototype for the title theme from Savage.
         Jeroen did this first, sampling the Dutch comedian Harry Vermeegen.
         'Koud he' was his catchphrase and translated it means 'Cold eh?'.
         His most notorious use of this was a Dutch TV programme called 'Pisa'
         (filmed from the leaning tower) with Harry saying his 'Koud He?'
         catchphrase to everyone that went by. Probe Software then heard the
         tune and asked Jeroen if he'd change the samples, and lo and behold it
         became the Savage theme.
         "Some background info. The 'KOUD HE' sample is from a Dutch comedian
         called 'Harry Vermeegen'. It was like a hype saying. I found it a nice
         sample to play around with. A spontanious tune I did just 4 fun." (JT)

/MUSICIANS/T/Tel_Jeroen/Kinetix.sid
COMMENT: This game was released under the name of 'Dynamix' in the UK, but
         Kinetix was the original working title.
(#1)
   NAME: Main tune
(#2)
   NAME: Title tune
(#3)
   NAME: High score tune

         Loss & His Orchestra. Sampled in the Jive Bunny And the Mastermixers'
         hit "Let's Party".
         "Cover. NOT from Tim Wright [& Brian Johnston], since this is an
         existing tune from something. (I don't know what exactly though)."
         (JT)

/MUSICIANS/T/Tel_Jeroen/Navy_Moves.sid
(#1)
   NAME: Main tune
COMMENT: Also used in the game "After the War", (C) 1990 Dinamic.
(#2)
   NAME: Hawai-tune
  TITLE: Aloha `Oe
 ARTIST: Queen Lili`uokalani
COMMENT: "It's just that it SOUNDS like a Hawaiian song. I composed it myself
         though! :) The slides up have probably be used in a zillion Hawaiian
         songs." (JT)
         The reason for the Hawaiian style of music in tune #2 is that the
         end sequence displayed your character on a Hawaiian beach type scene
         complete with a bit of text.
         Also used in the game "After the War", (C) 1990 Dinamic.
(#3)
   NAME: Title-tune
COMMENT: Also used in games "Mega Phoenix", (C) 1989 Dinamic and "After
         the War", (C) 1990 Dinamic.
(#4)
COMMENT: Also used in the game "Mega Phoenix", (C) 1989 Dinamic.
(#5)
COMMENT: Also used in the game "Mega Phoenix", (C) 1989 Dinamic.
(#6)
COMMENT: Also used in the game "Mega Phoenix", (C) 1989 Dinamic.
(#7)
COMMENT: Also used in the game "Mega Phoenix", (C) 1989 Dinamic.
(#8)
COMMENT: Also used in the game "Mega Phoenix", (C) 1989 Dinamic.
(#9)
COMMENT: Also used in the game "Mega Phoenix", (C) 1989 Dinamic.

/MUSICIANS/T/Tel_Jeroen/Navy_Moves_alternate_version.sid
COMMENT: Alternate versions of three tunes from Navy Moves.
(#1)
COMMENT: An alternative version of Navy Moves without the digis, but with
         filters added. See /MUSICIANS/T/Tel_Jeroen/Navy_Moves.sid, Tune #1.
(#2)
COMMENT: See /MUSICIANS/T/Tel_Jeroen/Navy_Moves.sid, Tune #2.
(#3)
COMMENT: See /MUSICIANS/T/Tel_Jeroen/Navy_Moves.sid, Tune #3.

/MUSICIANS/T/Tel_Jeroen/Nighthunter.sid
COMMENT: " 'Nighthunter' voice is me. The 'laughing' and the 'Allright!' is ME
         and my BROTHER, just before we're about to hit town. That explain the
         silly 'BURP!' and 'AJIIRK' too. My brother was pushing me to go with
         him, so I asked him to sample some voices real fast. (in this case,
         rather silly ones.) This is probably the most 'rushed' music I've ever
         made. (which shows somehow). I like many of the ideas in it, but I
         just had to meet the deadline. No time for quality checks... just...
         PRODUCE and DELIVER. Too bad somehow. It give us a funny compilation
         of brainactivity though :O
         BTW: If you want to know my brother's name: It's 'Kees Tel' (he's an
         awesome composer and musician. He composes almost any imaginable style
         of music and plays a LOT of instruments.)" (All comments by JT.)

/MUSICIANS/T/Tel_Jeroen/North_and_South.sid
COMMENT: Some of the jingles are covers. #24 is for instance also in Children
         Songs and Frogger.
         Music #1 is clearly a medley of famous confed songs, but it was
         written by Charles Callet for the Amiga version of the game and then
         converted by Jeroen Tel.
         "The tunes were converted by me from the Amiga version. That's all I
         can say." (JT)
(#1)
  TITLE: Dixie Land (1:24-1:55)
 ARTIST: Daniel Emmett
(#8)
  TITLE: Dixie Land
 ARTIST: Daniel Emmett
(#9)
  TITLE: Dixie Land
 ARTIST: Daniel Emmett
(#10)
  TITLE: Yankee Doodle
 ARTIST: Traditional, Dr. Richard Schuckburgh (lyrics)
(#11)
  TITLE: Yankee Doodle
 ARTIST: Traditional, Dr. Richard Schuckburgh (lyrics)
(#20)
  TITLE: U.S. Cavalry Charge signal
 ARTIST: <?>
(#34)
  TITLE: Yankee Doodle
 ARTIST: Traditional, Dr. Richard Schuckburgh (lyrics)

/MUSICIANS/T/Tel_Jeroen/Outrun_Europa.sid
COMMENT: "To make a complex story short: BEFORE I had to make the 'TURBO
         OUTRUN' music, I was asked to do the OUTRUN EUROPE music. OUTRUN
         EUROPE was never finished (at least not the first version). I don't
         know why/when/where/how.
         Then Turbo Outrun was made. (you know the music, etc.) One of the two
         title-tunes (not the 1.2.3. hit-it! one) was actually composed for
         Outrun Europe.
         OUTRUN EUROPA in 1990 is a totally different game from the old
         unfinished, never released game in 1988/1989." (All comments from JT)
(#3)
COMMENT: The original game had a bug which meant the tune fell out of sync.
         That has been fixed in this rip.
(#5)
COMMENT: The original game had a bug which meant the tune fell out of sync.
         That has been fixed in this rip.
(#7)
COMMENT: The original game had a bug which meant the tune fell out of sync.
         That has been fixed in this rip.

/MUSICIANS/T/Tel_Jeroen/Outrun_Europe_levels.sid
COMMENT: These three tunes were prototypes for a US Gold/Probe game 'Outrun
         Europe'. However, the game was never completed and the programming
         team involved went on to do Turbo Outrun instead. This was also a
         different game from Outrun Europa, released in 1991. The first two
         tunes cover the arcade version.
(#1)
  TITLE: Passing Breeze [from the arcade game Out Run]
 ARTIST: Hiroshi Miyauchi (Hiro/SEGA Sound Team)
(#2)
  TITLE: Splash Wave [from the arcade game Out Run]
 ARTIST: Hiroshi Miyauchi (Hiro/SEGA Sound Team)

/MUSICIANS/T/Tel_Jeroen/Turbo_Outrun.sid
COMMENT: Most of the tunes are heavily inspired by the music in the arcade
         game.
         "Turbo Outrun took about a month all together. It was a lot of fun,
         but I recomposed every tune about three times to get it perfect. I
         still think it is one of the best audio tracks I ever did on the C64."
         "One nice, very nice note: 'Turbo Outrun' (the music) has won the:
         'Best music on 8bit computer 1989' award (at the PCW show (now ECTS)
         in London. :D Too bad I had to find out later. US Gold received the
         actual award. Bastards! I wasn't even at the scene when it was
         presented. :( " (JT)
(#1)
   NAME: Intro
  TITLE: Magical Sound Shower [from the arcade game Out Run]
 ARTIST: Hiroshi Miyauchi (Hiro/SEGA Sound Team)
COMMENT: Featuring the sampled voice of Jeroen Tel himself.
         "I'm actually saying: 'one two TREE', 'cause sampling THREE would make
         it sound like 'one two FREE' and that's not what I wanted. ;P" (JT)
(#2)
   NAME: Title
(#3)
   NAME: Opening
  TITLE: Vivacious [from the arcade game Turbo OutRun]
 ARTIST: Yasuhiro Takagi (YAS/SEGA Sound Team)
(#4)
   NAME: Start
(#5)
   NAME: Level 1
  TITLE: Shake The Street [from the arcade game Turbo OutRun]
 ARTIST: Yasuhiro Takagi (YAS/SEGA Sound Team)
(#6)
   NAME: Level 2
  TITLE: Who Are You? [from the arcade game Turbo OutRun]
 ARTIST: Yasuhiro Takagi (YAS/SEGA Sound Team)
(#7)
   NAME: Level 3
  TITLE: Rush a Difficulty [from the arcade game Turbo OutRun]
 ARTIST: Yasuhiro Takagi (YAS/SEGA Sound Team)
(#8)
   NAME: Level 4
  TITLE: Keep Your Heart [from the arcade game Turbo OutRun]
 ARTIST: Yasuhiro Takagi (YAS/SEGA Sound Team)
(#9)
   NAME: Tune Up
  TITLE: Shopping [from the arcade game Fantasy Zone]
 ARTIST: Hiroshi Miyauchi (Hiro/SEGA Sound Team)
COMMENT: Also used in "Hotrod" as tune #8. This is based on a version of the
         tune found in Turbo OutRun, called "A Huge Pile Of Parts".
(#10)
   NAME: End

   NAME: Ending

/MUSICIANS/T/The_Blue_Ninja/Visitors.sid
  TITLE: Návstevníci [from the TV series]
 ARTIST: Karel Svoboda
COMMENT: "The TV series 'Die Besucher' (The visitors) from 1984 is where the
         intro music comes from. This SciFi-Comedy series was a co-production
         between Czechoslovakia and Germany. The music was chosen (and
         exclusively done for us by The Blue Ninja) for the DMAgic intro
         because DMAgic members came from Czech Republik, Slovakia and
         Germany." (ThunderBlade/DMAgic)

/MUSICIANS/T/The_Blue_Ninja/Wings_of_Death.sid
  TITLE: Intro [from the Atari ST/Amiga game Wings of Death]
 ARTIST: Jochen Hippel (Mad Max)
COMMENT: Sounds like it covers Hippel's studio version from the "Give It a Try"
         album.

/MUSICIANS/T/Thierolf_Peter/No_Rain_Song.sid
COMMENT: With this song the author had taken part in the same music competition
         of the German paper magazine 64'er that Chris Hülsbeck won with his
         "Shades". Maybe also interesting, later on the Amiga Peter Thierolf
         programmed the editor for Chris Hülsbeck's music player TFMX (The
         Final Music system eXtended).

  TITLE: Malbrouk s'en va-t-en guerre (0:00-0:28)
 ARTIST: Traditional
COMMENT: An Arab tune that was brought to Europe during the crusades and
         became popular during the french revolution, ever sinced spawned
         many songs, including "For He's a Jolly Good Fellow".
  TITLE: Happy Birthday (0:50)
 ARTIST: Mildred J. Hill

/MUSICIANS/T/Tjelta_Geir/Blue_Mazda_323.sid
COMMENT: "This tune is an ode to Geir's car, I remember he came to pick me up
         with it when we worked on the SDI editor in the military. It had no
         air conditioning and the only music in the car was old tapes of Iron
         Maiden (which wasn't bad at all)." (Comment by Glenn Gallefoss)

COMMENT: Made in 1990 and used without Geir Tjelta permission in 1992.
         "First (unfinished) version was used in the Mentallic demo (end part,
         or just taken and used by Olav, before it was finished). Then a MIDI
         version were done in 1993, and therafter a AHX Amiga version in the
         Abyss editor were I named it Countdown to NIL (NIL from the Amiga
         assembly language)." (Geir Tjelta)

         is not a tune, but just a infernal sound! It is born with this
         porpoise: experiment. But I find the sound amazing: you need the real
         C64 for being captured by the rhythm..." (ST)

### /MUSICIANS/T/Top_Secret ##################################################

/MUSICIANS/T/Top_Secret/
COMMENT: All Rastislav Smutný's comments are denoted (RS).

/MUSICIANS/T/Top_Secret/Another_Fantasy.sid
COMMENT: "The tune was to be used in the game "Panta Rei", but unfortunately
         the project never got finished." (RS)

/MUSICIANS/T/Top_Secret/CCN_Was_Born.sid
COMMENT: "CCN (Czechoslovak Commodore Net) was a bunch of several local C64
         groups. The tune was used in a poor anonymous intro." (RS)

/MUSICIANS/T/Top_Secret/Ecstasy.sid
COMMENT: "The very first tune I have ever composed (hence the name ;-)." (RS)

/MUSICIANS/T/Top_Secret/Fantasy.sid
COMMENT: Later used in the game "Brain Spasm", (C) 1994 Game On/CP Verlag.
         "The tune was to be used in the game "Panta Rei", but unfortunately
         the project never got finished." (RS)

/MUSICIANS/T/Top_Secret/Flyless_Rape.sid
  TITLE: Rape
 ARTIST: Rastislav Smutný (Top Secret)
COMMENT: "It was a game designer's idea to cut off 'buzz' which you may hear
         at the very beginning of the original track (hence the name). After
         all he did not use nor original neither this abridged version." (RS)

/MUSICIANS/T/Top_Secret/High-way.sid
COMMENT: "The tune was used in a Hungarian demo but someone liked the music
         so much that he put his very own credits therein." (RS)

/MUSICIANS/T/Top_Secret/Niagara_Memories.sid
  TITLE: Pendant que les champs brulent [from Religion]
 ARTIST: Niagara
COMMENT: "The original title could be (very roughly) translated as 'While the
         fields burn'. Anyway this is not a cover, the song just inspired me
         so much (hence the name)..." (RS)

/MUSICIANS/T/Top_Secret/Panta_Rei_Theme_Game_Over.sid
COMMENT: "This 'jingle' was to be used in the game "Panta Rei", but
         unfortunately the project never got finished." (RS)

/MUSICIANS/T/Top_Secret/Panta_Rei_Theme_Level_OK.sid
COMMENT: Later used in the game "Brain Spasm", (C) 1994 Game On/CP Verlag.
         "This 'jingle' was to be used in the game "Panta Rei", but
         unfortunately the project never got finished." (RS)

/MUSICIANS/T/Top_Secret/Rush-Hours.sid
COMMENT: Later used in the game "Vision", (C) 1997 64'er/Magna Media.

/MUSICIANS/T/Top_Secret/Sex_Fe_m_ale.sid
  TITLE: Sex: Female
 ARTIST: Rastislav Smutný (Top Secret)
COMMENT: "Probably my most famous composition surely deserved to be rearranged
         and slightly modified one day..." (RS)

/MUSICIANS/T/Top_Secret/Sex_Female.sid
COMMENT: Later used in the game "Vision", (C) 1997 64'er/Magna Media.
         "Also used in the game "Newcomer" (C) 2001 Cinematic Intuitive
         Dynamix." (RS)

/MUSICIANS/T/Top_Secret/Simple_3_2.sid
  TITLE: Simple One
 ARTIST: Rastislav Smutný (Top Secret)
COMMENT: "3 divided by 2 makes 1.5 right? And 1.5 is definitely more than 1.
         Got the picture?" (RS)

/MUSICIANS/T/Top_Secret/Simple_One.sid
COMMENT: Later used in the game "Brain Spasm", (C) 1994 Game On/CP Verlag.

/MUSICIANS/T/Top_Secret/T-Tris_Theme_Game_Music.sid
COMMENT: "The tune was to be used in the game "T-Tris" (Tetris clone), but
         unfortunately the project never got finished (beta preview)." (RS)

/MUSICIANS/T/Top_Secret/T-Tris_Theme_High_Score.sid
COMMENT: "This 'jingle' was to be used in the game "T-Tris" (Tetris clone), but
         unfortunately the project never got finished (beta preview)." (RS)

/MUSICIANS/T/Top_Secret/T-Tris_Theme_Introduction.sid
COMMENT: "This 'jingle' was to be used in the game "T-Tris" (Tetris clone), but
         unfortunately the project never got finished (beta preview)." (RS)

/MUSICIANS/T/Top_Secret/To_You_2.sid
  TITLE: To You
 ARTIST: Rastislav Smutný (Top Secret)
COMMENT: "Just a variation on the original theme..." (RS)

/MUSICIANS/T/Top_Secret/Victims_of_Mix.sid
  TITLE: Victims of (Part 1, Part 2, Part 3)
 ARTIST: Rastislav Smutný (Top Secret)
COMMENT: "The original parts were 'merged' and faintly rearranged." (RS)

 ARTIST: Shaun Southern

/MUSICIANS/T/Trident/Into_Oblivion.sid
COMMENT: Only Trident made this tune, it was falsly credited as a co-op tune
         between Trident and Stellan Andersson (Dane).
         "The reason for his name being in the sid was that the tune was in
         some music competition on a party. Due to their rules the composer had
         to attend the party, and since only Stellan was there, we had to
         pretend that he was a co-composer." (AD)

/MUSICIANS/T/Trident/Phonophobia.sid
  TITLE: Merry Christmas, Mr. Lawrence [from the movie] (2:28)
 ARTIST: Ryuichi Sakamoto
COMMENT: "Named after the famous EP 'Phonophobia' by the Brittish band Extreme
         Noise Terror. This tune does not, however, have any other connection
         to the band." (AD)

/MUSICIANS/T/Trident/Sptest03.sid
COMMENT: This sid has won the music competition at the LCP 2003 party.

### /MUSICIANS/V/ ############################################################

### /MUSICIANS/V/V-12 ########################################################

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/
COMMENT: Pawel Ruczko's own comments are denoted (PR).

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/07d3.sid
COMMENT: "Composed to celebrate newyear 2003. Released on the Devotion C64
         Online Compo, got placed 3th. Done on 23.01.2003 using Future Composer
         v4.0. Tune length 02:48." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/20-02.sid
COMMENT: "Composed to celebrate the new year of 2002. Done on 05.01.2002 using
         Hardtrack Composer and Klax's exclusive instruments. Tune length
         02:18." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/2nd_Debut.sid
COMMENT: "2 years after my last zak I decided to come back to business. So I
         asked Klax for an exclusive instrument, which covers sounds from
         Future Composer. He did that for me and I've started to compose tunes
         once again. Done on 18.11.2001. Tune length 01:16." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/3_Years_Ago.sid
COMMENT: "The first part of this song was composed before Symphony 2003 party.
         After a few months I decided to finish this song and I released it on
         the TUM 2003 party. The tune got placed 4th. The title reminds me of
         what was happening exactly 3 years ago. I like this tune very much.
         Done on 17.12.2003 using Future Composer v4.0. Tune length 02:55."
         (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/4_Rea.sid
COMMENT: "An exclusive tune done for Rea. A speedy tune in Hardcore mood.
         Composed using Data's exclusive instruments on Hardtrack Composer.
         Done on 02.12.2001. Tune length 02:06." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/A_Rainy_Day.sid
COMMENT: "Nice experimental start of the tune. The same story as with the tune
         No Man Army. This song got placed 11th at the SidWine C64 Music
         Competition. Done on 21.03.2002 using Hardtrack Composer and with
         Shapie's exclusive instruments. Tune length 02:40." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Always_Oldskool.sid
COMMENT: "Nice oldskool-sounding tune. I missed 2 patterns in one of the
         channels at the end of the song. Used in the polish discmag Inverse
         #10. Done on 15.05.2002 using Hardtrack Composer and Klax's exclusive
         instruments. Tune length 03:27." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Boring.sid
COMMENT: "The Tune sound boring to me, so hence the name. I thought that this
         tune would be used in the polish discmag Inverse. Done on 25.01.2002
         using Hardtrack Composer and Data's exclusive instruments. Tune length
         02:15." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Butterfly.sid
  TITLE: Butterfly [from Space Flower EP]
 ARTIST: Nu NRG
COMMENT: 1st place in Sample Music Competition at North Party v10.0 in 2006.

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Cascade.sid
COMMENT: "I composed this tune after I joined the group Cascade. I thought that
         it would be used in some of the new releases of that group...
         Done on 29.04.2002 using Hardtrack Composer and with exclusive
         instruments from Shapie. Tune length 03:07." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Co_mi_dasz.sid
  TITLE: Co mi dasz?
 ARTIST: MIG

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Crazy_Sound.sid
  TITLE: Living on Video [from Living on Video]
 ARTIST: Trans-X

         The tune was first published in Tropyx Music 4. It was later used in
         the polish disk mag Inverse #11. Done in 1999 using Touldie's
         instruments on Hardtrack Composer. Tune length 02:13." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Dont_Fuck_with_Me.sid
COMMENT: 1st place in Sample Music Competition at Silesia Party 6 in 2012.

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/End_of_Love_Part_II.sid

         instruments. Tune length 02:48." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Expectation.sid
COMMENT: "I expected something new in my life, but nothing changed at all. Done
         on 29.10.2002 using Future Composer v4.0. Tune length 01:55." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Forever_2002.sid
COMMENT: "This tune was first named Floppy 2002, but I was unable to send in my
         tune in for the competition 'cause of some party rules so I renamed
         the song and released on Forever 2002 party. This song got placed
         30th. The tune contains the same melodies used in 20-02 and with
         Jammin' Jimmy's melody. Done on 20.02.2002 using Hardtrack Composer
         and Klax's exclusive instruments. Tune length 03:25." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Golf_Tune_01.sid
  TITLE: Super Sports Gold [from the TV programme]
 ARTIST: <?>
COMMENT: Covers Reyn Ouwehand's version, to be found in HVSC as
         /MUSICIANS/O/Ouwehand_Reyn/Golf_Tune.sid
         "This is my lame cover done with Hardtrack Composer. I just played
         Reyn's tune on Future Composer and I decided to make my own - longer
         - version. Since that time, I haven't covered any tunes composed by
         other sceners. Released in the polish disk mag Inverse #11. Done on
         24.11.2001. Tune length 01:40." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Goodbye_Inverse.sid
COMMENT: "Done after Jackobe informed me that the 11th issue of the polish
         discmag Inverse will be the last one. Done on 20.09.2002 using
         Hardtrack Composer and Klax's exclusive instruments. Tune length
         01:39." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Half_Year_Without_Your_Smile.sid
COMMENT: "Half a year before I made this song I'd lost contact with the girl I
         was in love with. Done on 18.12.2001 using Hardtrack Composer and
         Data's exclusive instruments. Tune length 02:06." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Hardrave.sid
COMMENT: "Inspired ofcourse by Hardcore music. I've used a few Warlock's
         samples. Done on 08.02.2001. Released in Wave Of No Remorse
         collection. Tune length 01:23." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/I_Care.sid
COMMENT: "Sometimes I care too much... Composed for Symphony 2003, released at
         North Party 8 where the tune got placed 11th. Done on 03.07.2003 using
         Future Composer v4.0. Tune length 02:48." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Intro_Tune.sid
COMMENT: "Simple intro tune. Done on 12.03.2004 using Future Composer v2.1.
         Tune length 01:36." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Intro_Zak_Remix.sid
  TITLE: Intro Zak
 ARTIST: Touldie
COMMENT: Songs 1-4 are remix of /MUSICIANS/T/Touldie/Intro_Zak.sid, song 5 is
         an original Touldie song. "This is the result of first touching
         Hardtrack Composer. I simply doubled, added, deleted etc. some
         patterns to have some different versions of Touldie's original zak.
         I also saved the original tune as tune #5, just for comparing. Done
         in 1999. Tune #3 was first published in Tropyx Music 4. Tune #1 length
         03:52, Tune #2 length 04:46, Tune #3 length 02:32, Tune #4 length
         01:16." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/It_Must_Be_Hard.sid
COMMENT: "I like this tune because the bassline turns into a melody line. The
         drum line is played on two channels. My first real composition on
         Hardtrack Composer. Published in Tropyx Music 4. Done on 14.10.1999.
         Tune length 01:47." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Jammin_Jimmy.sid
  TITLE: <?> [from the TV series Thunder In Paradise] (0:46-0:53)
 ARTIST: Jammin' Jimmy
COMMENT: "I was watching the "Thunder In Paradise" series and in one of the
         parts I heard a nice song performed by Jammin' Jimmy. I used short
         parts of the melody in my tune. The main melody sounds like the melody
         from my 20-02 song. Done on 16.02.2002 using Hardtrack Composer and
         Klax's exclusive instruments. Tune length 01:47." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Joan_Love_and_Sorrow_Part_I.sid
COMMENT: "Composed exclusively for my ex-girlfriend Asia to celebrate her
         name's day. I was in love with her but I suffered because she did not
         act like I would've liked her to... Done on 23.05.2002 using Hardtrack
         Composer and Klax's exclusive instruments. Tune length 02:33." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Just_Cant_Get_Enough.sid
  TITLE: Just Can't Get Enough [from Speak & Spell]
 ARTIST: Depeche Mode
COMMENT: "This time I did a much better cover using, ofcourse, Hardtrack
         Composer. I think that the bassline is too low. Published in Tropyx
         Music 4. Done on 12.10.1999. Tune length 03:21." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Love_Is_an_Ocean.sid
  TITLE: Love Is An Ocean [from The Ultimate Aural Orgasm]
 ARTIST: Scooter
COMMENT: Contain also vocal sample taken from "Love Is An Ocean" from "This
         World Is Yours" by RMB.

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Mix.sid
COMMENT: "This is my second Reflextracker module.The first one was too shitty
         and I've deleted it. I got the inspiration for the title from one
         Hardcore song, but the whole module was done by myself. I used a few
         of Warlock's samples. Done on 14.07.2000. Tune length: 01:28." (PR)

  TITLE: Just Can't Get Enough [from Speak & Spell]
 ARTIST: Depeche Mode

         Depeche Mode songs. Done on 01.11.1997. Tune length 00:16." (PR)

COMMENT: "Done for my first Basic intro on 29.01.1997. Tune length 00:28." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Never_More_Depression.sid
COMMENT: "I composed this module when I was in a great mood after half a year
         of being depressed. Done on 15.06.2001, later released at North Party
         8 in the year 2003 which got placed 5th. Tune length 02:21." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/New_Affection.sid
COMMENT: "I was in a good mood because I had a new affection because of
         meetings with a new girl. Done on 19.05.2002 using Hardtrack Composer
         and Klax's exclusive instruments. Published in Scene World #4 and
         later in World Music #1. Tune length 02:33." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/New_Wave.sid
COMMENT: "I decided to test some different instruments on Hardtrack Composer
         and I asked Shapie for some exclusive ones. He gave some of his
         working tunes to me. Done on 23.02.2002. It was used in the polish
         discmag Inverse #10, but sadly the tune is bugged there. Tune length
         02:07." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Nine_Years_with_My_Commy.sid
COMMENT: "Done to celebrate the 9th birthday of my C64. Composed on Hardtrack
         Composer using some seconds of Klax's exclusive instruments which
         cover sounds from Voicetracker. Composed on 16.03.2002. Tune length
         01:50." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/No_Future.sid
  TITLE: Das Lied vom Angeln [from Terrordrome Vol.3 Welcome To...] (0:00-0:19)
 ARTIST: Borschtsch
COMMENT: "Inspired ofcourse by Hardcore music. I used a few Warlock's samples
         and I did this module in the beginning of the year 2001. Released in
         the Wave Of No Remorse collection. Tune length 01:21." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/No_Idea.sid
COMMENT: "This tune had to be longer, but sadly I've lost the final part of
         this song. After that I loaded the earlier version, did the loop and
         called it No Idea. Done on 07.12.2001 using Hardtrack Composer and
         Klax's exclusive instruments. Used in the note on the bonus side of
         Jeroen Kimmel Music Collection. Tune length 01:32." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/No_Man_Army.sid
COMMENT: "I wanted to release this song at Mekka & Symposium 2002. I sent this
         tune to Fantastic Zool but he forgot to bring my tune to the party. So
         I released this tune in the SidWine C64 Music Competition where the
         tune got placed 12th. Done on 02.03.2002 using Hardtrack Composer and
         Shapie's exclusive instruments. Tune length 01:42." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Old_Domain.sid
  TITLE: Old Domain
 ARTIST: Public Domain

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Pocket_Damage.sid
  TITLE: Pocket Damage
 ARTIST: Eon
COMMENT: 1st place in Sample Music Competition at Silesia Party 2 in 2008.

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Remembrance.sid
COMMENT: "Composed for the Symphony 2002 party, still I don't know which place
         it got. Done on 02.07.2002 using Hardtrack Composer and Shapie's
         exclusive instruments. Tune length 02:10." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Shitty_Tune.sid
COMMENT: "A short work tune with an odd melody. Done on 22.01.2002 using
         Hardtrack Composer and Klax's exclusive instruments. Tune length
         01:09." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Shitty_Tune_2.sid
COMMENT: "Just a simple work tune to test Klax's second set of exclusive
         Voicetracker instruments on the Hardtrack Composer. Done on
         22.03.2002. Tune length 01:16." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Short_Crap.sid
COMMENT: "A short worktune. Done on 25.06.2002 using Hardtrack Composer and
         Klax's exclusive instruments. Tune length 01:26." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Short_Intro_Zak.sid
COMMENT: "Later used in the note for my tool called Sidburners 6 Zak Saver.
         Done on 12.01.2003 using Future Composer v2.1. Tune length 01:16."
         (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Short_Rave.sid
COMMENT: 1st place at Riverwash 2008 Sample Music compo.

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Speedzak.sid
COMMENT: "Nice speed tune inspired by some old zak. Done on 13.12.2002 using
         Future Composer v2.1. Tune length 02:24." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Symphony_2003_Live.sid
COMMENT: "Composed live at Symphony 2003 and played live on concert, together
         with Krzyz-Kros. Done on 05.07.2003 using Hardtrack Composer and
         Phobos's instruments. Tune #1 length 00:10, tunes #2 & #3 are just
         examples of drums. In the middle of playing tune #2, the loudspeakers
         broke." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Ten_Minutes_BASIC.sid
  TITLE: Michael Row The Boat Ashore (0:00-0:06)
 ARTIST: Traditional
COMMENT: "This is my first song made in Basic done in early 1996. The first 6
         seconds are melodies taken from the original user's manual provided
         with the C64 in the shop, the rest is done by myself. Tune length
         00:22." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Terror_Traxxx.sid
COMMENT: "I used some of Randy's instruments and did that horrible melody.
         Published in Tropyx Music 4. Done on 24.08.1999 using Hardtrack
         Composer. Tune length 02:13." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Test_01.sid
COMMENT: "Composed just to test the long melody and Shapie's exclusive
         instruments". Done on 12.05.2002 using Hardtrack Composer. Tune length
         00:30." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Troubled_Moonrise.sid
  TITLE: Moonrise
 ARTIST: Moon Project
COMMENT: Not a simply cover, but contain some samples taken from this song.
         Also contain vocal sample taken from "Troubled" from "This World Is
         Yours" by RMB.

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/True_Future.sid
COMMENT: "This is my first tune made in Future Composer v2.1. I decided to
         change of music editor because I had enough of FC sound imitation
         under Hardtrack Composer, so hence the title. Used without my
         permission in the intro of Almanac by Draco. Done on 27.09.2002. Tune
         length 02:10." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Wasted_Hope.sid
COMMENT: "I was in a bad mood when I composed this tune. It sounds very crappy.
         The title reminds me of wasted hope on a girl. Done on 16.12.2001
         using Hardtrack Composer and Klax's exclusive instruments. Tune length
         02:04." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Welcome_Back.sid
COMMENT: "I composed that tune when I came back from the long depression which
         knocked me down most of the year 2001. Now I know that for doing good
         tunes I need to be in a good mood.  Done on 13.01.2002 using Hardtrack
         Composer and Klax's exclusive instruments. Tune length 02:39." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Welcome_Home.sid
COMMENT: "One of my best tunes, composed for Mini Cat to celebrate him coming
         back from the army. I had to do this song two times because before
         saving there was a power failure.I decided to compose the tune once
         again and I recovered 95% of the original tune from my mind. Later
         released on Sidcompo 3, took 40th place. Done on 28.05.2003 using
         Future Composer v2.1. Tune length 02:40." (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/Weronika.sid
COMMENT: "The name of the song reminds me of my lost friendship with a girl.
         Because of that, my life changed very badly. Released on TUM 2002, got
         placed 5th. Also used in the note for my demo called Time For Torment.
         Done on 15.12.2002 using Future Composer v4.0. Tune length 02:33."
         (PR)

/MUSICIANS/V/V-12/What_I_Love_Is_Only_C64.sid
COMMENT: "What a selfish title... I was angry with my ex-girlfriend because she
         left me. Published in Scene World #10 and later in World Music #2.
         Done on 11.06.2002 using Hardtrack Composer and Klax's exclusive
         instruments. Tune length 02:23." (PR)

  TITLE: It's a Sin [from Actually]
 ARTIST: Pet Shop Boys

/MUSICIANS/V/Vaca_Ramiro/Rock_n_Roll.sid
COMMENT: Despite popular belief, the Amiga version of the tune by Chris
         Hülsbeck is the cover of this C64 original (done by Ramiro), not vice
         versa.
         "There was some tune-swapping going on, as Chris was assigned [to do]
         the music for Circus Attractions while Ramiro had the pleasure of
         doing Rock'n'Roll. Now Chris hated circus music as much as Ramiro
         hated R'n'R. Therefore, Ramiro composed part of the Circus Attractions
         title music [and] Chris at some stage helped Ramiro with the R'n'R
         musics, but it is unclear in what way. [...]" (All info is from Miron
         Schmidt.)
(#1)
 AUTHOR: Chris Hülsbeck
COMMENT: Covers the Amiga version.
(#5)
  TITLE: The Loco-Motion
 ARTIST: Little Eva
COMMENT: Based on the version sung by Kylie Minogue.

/MUSICIANS/V/Vaca_Ramiro/SM_End_Sequence.sid
COMMENT: "SM" is probably short for "Soundmonitor" here. This song was a
         prelimimary version of the Turrican end title, which was then dropped
         in favour of the song he composed in the end (done with TFMX). (Info
         from Miron Schmidt)

/MUSICIANS/V/Vaca_Ramiro/Small_Song.sid
  TITLE: Over de Muur
 ARTIST: Het Klein Orkest
COMMENT: Partial cover of a Dutch song about the now non existant Berlin Wall.

### /MUSICIANS/V/Vessby_Johan ################################################

/MUSICIANS/V/Vessby_Johan/Clean_Up_Service.sid
COMMENT: "The music was composed using a crude melody editor called "JV Music",
         developed just for J. Vessby." (Comment by Karl Hörnell)
(#4)
  TITLE: The St. Louis Rag
 ARTIST: Tom Turpin

          input the data for Flight of the Bumble Bee and the other non-anthem
          classical music selections." (Bob Vieira)

  TITLE: Arte X
 ARTIST: Frédéric Motte (Moby)
COMMENT: "Originally composed by Moby / Sanity on Amiga, later I converted to a
         4 channel PC Chiptune for a musicdisk ( Hi DjKor! :) ). Some weeks
         later I started to convert it to the C64. Released at ÁrokParty2003,
         Ajka." (LV)

 ARTIST: DJ Bobo
